00019    system automatically on every revision of midas.c. It will be
00020    returned by cm_get_revision(), for example in the odbedit "ver"
00021    command */
00022 char *svn_revision = "$Rev: 5256 $";

00052 /********************************************************************/
00053 /* data type sizes */
00054 INT tid_size[] = {
00055    0,                           /* tid == 0 not defined                               */
00056    1,                           /* TID_BYTE      unsigned byte         0       255    */
00057    1,                           /* TID_SBYTE     signed byte         -128      127    */
00058    1,                           /* TID_CHAR      single character      0       255    */
00059    2,                           /* TID_WORD      two bytes             0      65535   */
00060    2,                           /* TID_SHORT     signed word        -32768    32767   */
00061    4,                           /* TID_DWORD     four bytes            0      2^32-1  */
00062    4,                           /* TID_INT       signed dword        -2^31    2^31-1  */
00063    4,                           /* TID_BOOL      four bytes bool       0        1     */
00064    4,                           /* TID_FLOAT     4 Byte float format                  */
00065    8,                           /* TID_DOUBLE    8 Byte float format                  */
00066    1,                           /* TID_BITFIELD  8 Bits Bitfield    00000000 11111111 */
00067    0,                           /* TID_STRING    zero terminated string               */
00068    0,                           /* TID_ARRAY     variable length array of unkown type */
00069    0,                           /* TID_STRUCT    C structure                          */
00070    0,                           /* TID_KEY       key in online database               */
00071    0                            /* TID_LINK      link in online database              */
00072 };
00073

00075 char *tid_name[] = {
00076    "NULL",
00077    "BYTE",
00078    "SBYTE",
00079    "CHAR",
00080    "WORD",
00081    "SHORT",
00082    "DWORD",
00083    "INT",
00084    "BOOL",
00085    "FLOAT",
00086    "DOUBLE",
00087    "BITFIELD",
00088    "STRING",
00089    "ARRAY",
00090    "STRUCT",
00091    "KEY",
00092    "LINK"
00093 };

00152 typedef struct {

00154    INT sequence_number;
00155     INT(*func) (INT, char *);

00176 typedef struct {
00177    INT code;
00178    char *string;
00179 } ERROR_TABLE;
00180 
00181 ERROR_TABLE _error_table[] = {
00182    {CM_WRONG_PASSWORD, "Wrong password"},
00183    {CM_UNDEF_EXP, "Experiment not defined"},
00184    {CM_UNDEF_ENVIRON,
00185     "\"exptab\" file not found and MIDAS_DIR environment variable not defined"},

00187    {0, NULL}

00191 typedef struct {
00192    void *adr;
00193    int size;
00194    char file[80];
00195    int line;
00196 } DBG_MEM_LOC;
00197 
00198 DBG_MEM_LOC *_mem_loc = NULL;
00199 INT _n_mem = 0;
00200 
00201 void *dbg_malloc(unsigned int size, char *file, int line)
00202 {
00203    FILE *f;
00204    void *adr;
00205    int i;
00206 
00207    adr = malloc(size);
00208 
00209    /* search for deleted entry */
00210    for (i = 0; i < _n_mem; i++)
00211       if (_mem_loc[i].adr == NULL)
00212          break;
00213 
00214    if (i == _n_mem) {
00215       _n_mem++;
00216       if (!_mem_loc)
00217          _mem_loc = (DBG_MEM_LOC *) malloc(sizeof(DBG_MEM_LOC));
00218       else
00219          _mem_loc = (DBG_MEM_LOC *) realloc(_mem_loc, sizeof(DBG_MEM_LOC) * _n_mem);
00220    }
00221 
00222    _mem_loc[i].adr = adr;
00223    _mem_loc[i].size = size;
00224    strcpy(_mem_loc[i].file, file);
00225    _mem_loc[i].line = line;
00226 
00227    f = fopen("mem.txt", "w");
00228    for (i = 0; i < _n_mem; i++)
00229       if (_mem_loc[i].adr)
00230          fprintf(f, "%s:%d size=%d adr=%p\n", _mem_loc[i].file, _mem_loc[i].line, _mem_loc[i].size,
00231                  _mem_loc[i].adr);
00232    fclose(f);
00233 
00234    return adr;
00235 }
00236 
00237 void *dbg_calloc(unsigned int size, unsigned int count, char *file, int line)
00238 {
00239    void *adr;
00240 
00241    adr = dbg_malloc(size * count, file, line);
00242    if (adr)
00243       memset(adr, 0, size * count);
00244 
00245    return adr;
00246 }
00247 
00248 void dbg_free(void *adr, char *file, int line)
00249 {
00250    FILE *f;
00251    int i;
00252 
00253    free(adr);
00254 
00255    for (i = 0; i < _n_mem; i++)
00256       if (_mem_loc[i].adr == adr)
00257          break;
00258 
00259    if (i < _n_mem)
00260       _mem_loc[i].adr = NULL;
00261 
00262    f = fopen("mem.txt", "w");
00263    for (i = 0; i < _n_mem; i++)
00264       if (_mem_loc[i].adr)
00265          fprintf(f, "%s:%d %s:%d size=%d adr=%p\n", _mem_loc[i].file, _mem_loc[i].line,
00266                  file, line, _mem_loc[i].size, _mem_loc[i].adr);
00267    fclose(f);
00268 }
00269 
00270 /********************************************************************/
00271 static int resize_net_send_buffer(const char* from, int new_size)
00272 /********************************************************************/
00273 {
00274    if (new_size <= _net_send_buffer_size)
00275       return SUCCESS;
00276 
00277    _net_send_buffer = (char *) realloc(_net_send_buffer, new_size);
00278    if (_net_send_buffer == NULL) {
00279       cm_msg(MERROR, from, "Cannot allocate %d bytes for network buffer", new_size);
00280       return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
00281    }
00282 
00283    //printf("reallocate_net_send_buffer %p size %d->%d from %s\n", _net_send_buffer, _net_send_buffer_size, new_size, from);
00284    _net_send_buffer_size = new_size;
00285    return SUCCESS;
00286 }

00288 /********************************************************************\

00290 *              Common message functions                              *
00291 *                                                                    *
00292 \********************************************************************/

00294 static int (*_message_print) (const char *) = puts;
00295 static INT _message_mask_system = MT_ALL;
00296 static INT _message_mask_user = MT_ALL;

00302 /**dox***************************************************************/
00303 /** @addtogroup msgfunctionc
00304  *
00305  *  @{  */
00306 
00307 /********************************************************************/
00308 /**
00309 Convert error code to string. Used after cm_connect_experiment to print
00310 error string in command line programs or windows programs.
00311 @param code Error code as defined in midas.h
00312 @param string Error string
00313 @return CM_SUCCESS
00314 */
00315 INT cm_get_error(INT code, char *string)
00316 {
00317    INT i;
00318 
00319    for (i = 0; _error_table[i].code; i++)
00320       if (_error_table[i].code == code) {
00321          strcpy(string, _error_table[i].string);
00322          return CM_SUCCESS;
00323       }
00324 
00325    sprintf(string, "Unexpected error #%d", code);
00326    return CM_SUCCESS;
00327 }
00328 
00329 /********************************************************************/
00330 /**
00331 Set message masks. When a message is generated by calling cm_msg(),
00332 it can got to two destinatinons. First a user defined callback routine
00333 and second to the "SYSMSG" buffer.
00334 
00335 A user defined callback receives all messages which satisfy the user_mask.
00336 
00337 \code
00338 int message_print(const char *msg)
00339 {
00340   char str[160];
00341 
00342   memset(str, ' ', 159);
00343   str[159] = 0;
00344   if (msg[0] == '[')
00345     msg = strchr(msg, ']')+2;
00346   memcpy(str, msg, strlen(msg));
00347   ss_printf(0, 20, str);
00348   return 0;
00349 }
00350 ...
00351   cm_set_msg_print(MT_ALL, MT_ALL, message_print);
00352 ...
00353 \endcode
00354 @param system_mask Bit masks for MERROR, MINFO etc. to send system messages.
00355 @param user_mask Bit masks for MERROR, MINFO etc. to send messages to the user callback.
00356 @param func Function which receives all printout. By setting "puts",
00357        messages are just printed to the screen.
00358 @return CM_SUCCESS
00359 */
00360 INT cm_set_msg_print(INT system_mask, INT user_mask, int (*func) (const char *))
00361 {
00362    _message_mask_system = system_mask;
00363    _message_mask_user = user_mask;
00364    _message_print = func;
00365 
00366    return BM_SUCCESS;
00367 }
00368 
00369 /********************************************************************/
00370 /**
00371 Write message to logging file. Called by cm_msg.
00372 @attention May burn your fingers
00373 @param message_type      Message type
00374 @param message          Message string
00375 @return CM_SUCCESS
00376 */
00377 INT cm_msg_log(INT message_type, const char *message)
00378 {
00379    char dir[256];
00380    char filename[256];
00381    char path[256];
00382    char str[256];
00383    INT status, size, fh, semaphore;
00384    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
00385 
00386    if (rpc_is_remote())
00387       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_MSG_LOG, message_type, message);
00388 
00389    if (message_type != MT_DEBUG) {
00390       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
00391 
00392       if (hDB) {
00393 
00394          strcpy(filename, "midas.log");
00395          size = sizeof(filename);
00396          db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Message file", filename, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
00397 
00398          if (strchr(filename, '%')) {
00399             /* replace stings such as midas_%y%m%d.mid with current date */
00400             time_t now;
00401             struct tm *tms;
00402 
00403             tzset();
00404             time(&now);
00405             tms = localtime(&now);
00406 
00407             strftime(str, sizeof(str), filename, tms);
00408             strlcpy(filename, str, sizeof(filename));
00409          }
00410 
00411          if (strchr(filename, DIR_SEPARATOR) == NULL) {
00412             status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", &hKey);
00413             if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
00414                size = sizeof(dir);
00415                memset(dir, 0, size);
00416                db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
00417                if (dir[0] != 0)
00418                   if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
00419                      strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
00420 
00421                strcpy(path, dir);
00422                strcat(path, filename);
00423             } else {
00424                cm_get_path(dir);
00425                if (dir[0] != 0)
00426                   if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
00427                      strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
00428 
00429                strcpy(path, dir);
00430                strcat(path, "midas.log");
00431             }
00432          } else {
00433             strcpy(path, filename);
00434          }
00435       } else
00436          strcpy(path, "midas.log");
00437 
00438       fh = open(path, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_APPEND | O_LARGEFILE, 0644);
00439       if (fh < 0) {
00440          printf("Cannot open message log file %s\n", path);
00441       } else {
00442 
00443          cm_get_experiment_semaphore(NULL, NULL, NULL, &semaphore);
00444          status = ss_semaphore_wait_for(semaphore, 5 * 1000);
00445 
00446          strcpy(str, ss_asctime());
00447          write(fh, str, strlen(str));
00448          write(fh, " ", 1);
00449          write(fh, message, strlen(message));
00450          write(fh, "\n", 1);
00451          close(fh);
00452 
00453          ss_semaphore_release(semaphore);
00454       }
00455    }
00456 
00457    return CM_SUCCESS;
00458 }
00459 
00460 /********************************************************************/
00461 /**
00462 Write message to logging file. Called by cm_msg().
00463 @internal
00464 @param message_type      Message type
00465 @param message          Message string
00466 @param facility         Message facility, filename in which messages will be written
00467 @return CM_SUCCESS
00468 */
00469 INT cm_msg_log1(INT message_type, const char *message, const char *facility)
00470 /********************************************************************\
00471 
00472   Routine: cm_msg_log1
00473 
00474   Purpose: Write message to logging file. Called by cm_msg.
00475            Internal use only
00476 
00477   Input:
00478     INT    message_type      Message type
00479     char   *message          Message string
00480     char   *
00481 
00482   Output:
00483     none
00484 
00485   Function value:
00486     CM_SUCCESS
00487 
00488 \********************************************************************/
00489 {
00490    char dir[256];
00491    char filename[256];
00492    char path[256];
00493    char str[256];
00494    FILE *f;
00495    INT status, size;
00496    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
00497 
00498 
00499    if (rpc_is_remote())
00500       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_MSG_LOG1, message_type, message, facility);
00501 
00502    if (message_type != MT_DEBUG) {
00503       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
00504 
00505       if (hDB) {
00506          strcpy(filename, "midas.log");
00507          size = sizeof(filename);
00508          db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Message file", filename, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
00509 
00510          if (strchr(filename, '%')) {
00511             /* replace stings such as midas_%y%m%d.mid with current date */
00512             time_t now;
00513             struct tm *tms;
00514 
00515             tzset();
00516             time(&now);
00517             tms = localtime(&now);
00518 
00519             strftime(str, sizeof(str), filename, tms);
00520             strlcpy(filename, str, sizeof(filename));
00521          }
00522 
00523          if (strchr(filename, DIR_SEPARATOR) == NULL) {
00524 
00525             status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", &hKey);
00526             if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
00527                size = sizeof(dir);
00528                memset(dir, 0, size);
00529                db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
00530                if (dir[0] != 0)
00531                   if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
00532                      strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
00533 
00534                if (facility[0]) {
00535                   strcpy(filename, facility);
00536                   strcat(filename, ".log");
00537                } else {
00538                   strcpy(filename, "midas.log");
00539                   size = sizeof(filename);
00540                   db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Message file", filename, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
00541 
00542                   if (strchr(filename, '%')) {
00543                      /* replace stings such as midas_%y%m%d.mid with current date */
00544                      time_t now;
00545                      struct tm *tms;
00546 
00547                      tzset();
00548                      time(&now);
00549                      tms = localtime(&now);
00550 
00551                      strftime(str, sizeof(str), filename, tms);
00552                      strlcpy(filename, str, sizeof(filename));
00553                   }
00554                }
00555 
00556                strcpy(path, dir);
00557                strcat(path, filename);
00558             } else {
00559                cm_get_path(dir);
00560                if (dir[0] != 0)
00561                   if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
00562                      strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
00563 
00564                strcpy(path, dir);
00565                if (facility[0]) {
00566                   strcat(path, facility);
00567                   strcat(path, ".log");
00568                } else
00569                   strcat(path, "midas.log");
00570             }
00571          } else {
00572             strcpy(path, filename);
00573             *(strrchr(path, DIR_SEPARATOR) + 1) = 0;
00574             if (facility[0]) {
00575                strcat(path, facility);
00576                strcat(path, ".log");
00577             } else
00578                strcat(path, "midas.log");
00579          }
00580       } else {
00581          if (facility[0]) {
00582             strcpy(path, facility);
00583             strcat(path, ".log");
00584          } else
00585             strcpy(path, "midas.log");
00586       }
00587 
00588       f = fopen(path, "a");
00589       if (f == NULL) {
00590          printf("Cannot open message log file %s\n", path);
00591       } else {
00592          strcpy(str, ss_asctime());
00593          fprintf(f, "%s", str);
00594          fprintf(f, " %s\n", message);
00595          fclose(f);
00596       }
00597    }
00598 
00599    return CM_SUCCESS;
00600 }
00601 
00602 static INT cm_msg_format(char* local_message, int sizeof_local_message, char* send_message, int sizeof_send_message, INT message_type, const char *filename, INT line, const char *routine, const char *format, va_list* argptr)
00603 {
00604    char type_str[256], str[1000], format_cpy[900];
00605    const char *pc;
00606 
00607    /* strip path */
00608    pc = filename + strlen(filename);
00609    while (*pc != '\\' && *pc != '/' && pc != filename)
00610       pc--;
00611    if (pc != filename)
00612       pc++;
00613 
00614    /* convert type to string */
00615    type_str[0] = 0;
00616    if (message_type & MT_ERROR)
00617       strlcat(type_str, MT_ERROR_STR, sizeof(type_str));
00618    if (message_type & MT_INFO)
00619       strlcat(type_str, MT_INFO_STR, sizeof(type_str));
00620    if (message_type & MT_DEBUG)
00621       strlcat(type_str, MT_DEBUG_STR, sizeof(type_str));
00622    if (message_type & MT_USER)
00623       strlcat(type_str, MT_USER_STR, sizeof(type_str));
00624    if (message_type & MT_LOG)
00625       strlcat(type_str, MT_LOG_STR, sizeof(type_str));
00626    if (message_type & MT_TALK)
00627       strlcat(type_str, MT_TALK_STR, sizeof(type_str));
00628 
00629    /* print client name into string */
00630    if (message_type == MT_USER)
00631       sprintf(send_message, "[%s] ", routine);
00632    else {
00633       rpc_get_name(str);
00634       if (str[0])
00635          sprintf(send_message, "[%s,%s] ", str, type_str);
00636       else
00637          send_message[0] = 0;
00638    }
00639 
00640    local_message[0] = 0;
00641 
00642    /* preceed error messages with file and line info */
00643    if (message_type == MT_ERROR) {
00644       sprintf(str, "[%s:%d:%s,%s] ", pc, line, routine, type_str);
00645       strlcat(send_message, str, sizeof_send_message);
00646       strlcat(local_message, str, sizeof_send_message);
00647    } else if (message_type == MT_USER)
00648       sprintf(local_message, "[%s,%s] ", routine, type_str);
00649 
00650    /* limit length of format */
00651    strlcpy(format_cpy, format, sizeof(format_cpy));
00652 
00653    /* print argument list into message */
00654    vsprintf(str, (char *) format, *argptr);
00655 
00656    strlcat(send_message, str, sizeof_send_message);
00657    strlcat(local_message, str, sizeof_local_message);
00658 
00659    return CM_SUCCESS;
00660 }
00661 
00662 static INT cm_msg_send_event(INT ts, INT message_type, const char *send_message)
00663 {
00664    int status;
00665    char event[1000];
00666    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
00667 
00668    //printf("cm_msg_send: ts %d, type %d, message [%s]\n", ts, message_type, send_message);
00669 
00670    /* copy message to event */
00671    pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) event;
00672    strlcpy(event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), send_message, sizeof(event) - sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
00673 
00674    /* send event if not of type MLOG */
00675    if (message_type != MT_LOG) {
00676       /* if no message buffer already opened, do so now */
00677       if (_msg_buffer == 0) {
00678          status = bm_open_buffer(MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME, MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE, &_msg_buffer);
00679          if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED) {
00680             return status;
00681          }
00682       }
00683 
00684       /* setup the event header and send the message */
00685       bm_compose_event(pevent, EVENTID_MESSAGE, (WORD) message_type, strlen(event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) + 1, 0);
00686       pevent->time_stamp = ts;
00687       bm_send_event(_msg_buffer, event, pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
00688    }
00689 
00690    return CM_SUCCESS;
00691 }
00692 
00693 static INT cm_msg_buffer(int ts, int message_type, const char *message)
00694 {
00695    int status;
00696    int len;
00697    char *wp;
00698    void *vp;
00699 
00700    //printf("cm_msg_buffer ts %d, type %d, message [%s]!\n", ts, message_type, message);
00701 
00702    if (!_msg_rb) {
00703       status = rb_create(100*1024, 1024, &_msg_rb);
00704       assert(status==SUCCESS);
00705 
00706       status = ss_mutex_create(&_msg_mutex);
00707       assert(status==SS_SUCCESS || status==SS_CREATED);
00708    }
00709 
00710    len = strlen(message) + 1;
00711 
00712    // lock
00713    status = ss_mutex_wait_for(_msg_mutex, 0);
00714    assert(status == SS_SUCCESS);
00715 
00716    status = rb_get_wp(_msg_rb, &vp, 1000);
00717    wp = (char *)vp;
00718    
00719    if (status != SUCCESS || wp == NULL) {
00720       // unlock
00721       ss_mutex_release(_msg_mutex);
00722       return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00723    }
00724 
00725    *wp++ = 'M';
00726    *wp++ = 'S';
00727    *wp++ = 'G';
00728    *wp++ = '_';
00729    *(int*)wp = ts;
00730    wp += sizeof(int);
00731    *(int*)wp = message_type;
00732    wp += sizeof(int);
00733    *(int*)wp = len;
00734    wp += sizeof(int);
00735    memcpy(wp, message, len);
00736    rb_increment_wp(_msg_rb, 4+3*sizeof(int)+len);
00737 
00738    // unlock
00739    ss_mutex_release(_msg_mutex);
00740 
00741    return CM_SUCCESS;
00742 }
00743 
00744 /********************************************************************/
00745 /**
00746 This routine can be called to process messages buffered by cm_msg(). Normally
00747 it is called from cm_yield() and cm_disconnect_experiment() to make sure
00748 all accumulated messages are processed.
00749 */
00750 INT cm_msg_flush_buffer()
00751 {
00752    int i;
00753 
00754    //printf("cm_msg_flush_buffer!\n");
00755 
00756    if (!_msg_rb)
00757      return CM_SUCCESS;
00758 
00759    for (i=0; i<100; i++) {
00760       int status;
00761       int ts;
00762       int message_type;
00763       char message[1024];
00764       int n_bytes;
00765       char *rp;
00766       void *vp;
00767       int len;
00768 
00769       status = rb_get_buffer_level(_msg_rb, &n_bytes);
00770       
00771       if (status != SUCCESS || n_bytes <= 0)
00772         break;
00773 
00774       // lock
00775       status = ss_mutex_wait_for(_msg_mutex, 0);
00776       assert(status == SS_SUCCESS);
00777       
00778       status = rb_get_rp(_msg_rb, &vp, 0);
00779       rp = (char *)vp;
00780       if (status != SUCCESS || rp == NULL) {
00781          // unlock
00782          ss_mutex_release(_msg_mutex);
00783          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00784       }
00785 
00786       assert(rp);
00787       assert(rp[0]=='M');
00788       assert(rp[1]=='S');
00789       assert(rp[2]=='G');
00790       assert(rp[3]=='_');
00791       rp += 4;
00792 
00793       ts = *(int*)rp;
00794       rp += sizeof(int);
00795 
00796       message_type = *(int*)rp;
00797       rp += sizeof(int);
00798 
00799       len = *(int*)rp;
00800       rp += sizeof(int);
00801 
00802       strlcpy(message, rp, sizeof(message));
00803       
00804       rb_increment_rp(_msg_rb, 4+3*sizeof(int)+len);
00805 
00806       // unlock
00807       ss_mutex_release(_msg_mutex);
00808       
00809       /* log message */
00810       cm_msg_log(message_type, message);
00811 
00812       /* send message to SYSMSG */
00813       status = cm_msg_send_event(ts, message_type, message);
00814       if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
00815          return status;
00816    }
00817 
00818    return CM_SUCCESS;
00819 }
00820 
00821 /********************************************************************/
00822 /**
00823 This routine can be called whenever an internal error occurs
00824 or an informative message is produced. Different message
00825 types can be enabled or disabled by setting the type bits
00826 via cm_set_msg_print().
00827 @attention Do not add the "\n" escape carriage control at the end of the
00828 formated line as it is already added by the client on the receiving side.
00829 \code
00830    ...
00831    cm_msg(MINFO, "my program", "This is a information message only);
00832    cm_msg(MERROR, "my program", "This is an error message with status:%d", my_status);
00833    cm_msg(MTALK, "my_program", My program is Done!");
00834    ...
00835 \endcode
00836 @param message_type (See @ref midas_macro).
00837 @param filename Name of source file where error occured
00838 @param line Line number where error occured
00839 @param routine Routine name.
00840 @param format message to printout, ... Parameters like for printf()
00841 @return CM_SUCCESS
00842 */
00843 INT cm_msg(INT message_type, const char *filename, INT line, const char *routine, const char *format, ...)
00844 {
00845    va_list argptr;
00846    char local_message[1000], send_message[1000];
00847    INT status;
00848    static BOOL in_routine = FALSE;
00849    int ts = ss_time();
00850 
00851    /* avoid recursive calls */
00852    if (in_routine)
00853       return CM_SUCCESS;
00854 
00855    in_routine = TRUE;
00856 
00857    /* print argument list into message */
00858    va_start(argptr, format);
00859    cm_msg_format(local_message, sizeof(local_message), send_message, sizeof(send_message), message_type, filename, line, routine, format, &argptr);
00860    va_end(argptr);
00861 
00862    /* call user function if set via cm_set_msg_print */
00863    if (_message_print != NULL && (message_type & _message_mask_user) != 0)
00864       _message_print(local_message);
00865 
00866    /* return if system mask is not set */
00867    if ((message_type & _message_mask_system) == 0) {
00868       in_routine = FALSE;
00869       return CM_SUCCESS;
00870    }
00871 
00872    status = cm_msg_buffer(ts, message_type, send_message);
00873 
00874    in_routine = FALSE;
00875 
00876    return status;
00877 }
00878 
00879 /********************************************************************/
00880 /**
00881 This routine is similar to @ref cm_msg().
00882 It differs from cm_msg() only by the logging destination being a file
00883 given through the argument list i.e:\b facility
00884 @internal
00885 @attention Do not add the "\n" escape carriage control at the end of the
00886 formated line as it is already added by the client on the receiving side.
00887 The first arg in the following example uses the predefined
00888 macro MINFO which handles automatically the first 3 arguments of the function
00889 (see @ref midas_macro).
00890 \code   ...
00891    cm_msg1(MINFO, "my_log_file", "my_program"," My message status:%d", status);
00892    ...
00893 //----- File my_log_file.log
00894 Thu Nov  8 17:59:28 2001 [my_program] My message status:1
00895 \endcode
00896 @param message_type See @ref midas_macro.
00897 @param filename Name of source file where error occured
00898 @param line Line number where error occured
00899 @param facility Logging file name
00900 @param routine Routine name
00901 @param format message to printout, ... Parameters like for printf()
00902 @return CM_SUCCESS
00903 */
00904 INT cm_msg1(INT message_type, const char *filename, INT line,
00905             const char *facility, const char *routine, const char *format, ...)
00906 {
00907    va_list argptr;
00908    char event[1000], str[256], local_message[256], send_message[256];
00909    const char *pc;
00910    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
00911    INT status;
00912    static BOOL in_routine = FALSE;
00913 
00914    /* avoid recursive calles */
00915    if (in_routine)
00916       return 0;
00917 
00918    in_routine = TRUE;
00919 
00920    /* strip path */
00921    pc = filename + strlen(filename);
00922    while (*pc != '\\' && *pc != '/' && pc != filename)
00923       pc--;
00924    if (pc != filename)
00925       pc++;
00926 
00927    /* print client name into string */
00928    if (message_type == MT_USER)
00929       sprintf(send_message, "[%s] ", routine);
00930    else {
00931       rpc_get_name(str);
00932       if (str[0])
00933          sprintf(send_message, "[%s] ", str);
00934       else
00935          send_message[0] = 0;
00936    }
00937 
00938    local_message[0] = 0;
00939 
00940    /* preceed error messages with file and line info */
00941    if (message_type == MT_ERROR) {
00942       sprintf(str, "[%s:%d:%s] ", pc, line, routine);
00943       strcat(send_message, str);
00944       strcat(local_message, str);
00945    }
00946 
00947    /* print argument list into message */
00948    va_start(argptr, format);
00949    vsprintf(str, (char *) format, argptr);
00950    va_end(argptr);
00951 
00952    if (facility)
00953       sprintf(local_message + strlen(local_message), "{%s} ", facility);
00954 
00955    strcat(send_message, str);
00956    strcat(local_message, str);
00957 
00958    /* call user function if set via cm_set_msg_print */
00959    if (_message_print != NULL && (message_type & _message_mask_user) != 0)
00960       _message_print(local_message);
00961 
00962    /* return if system mask is not set */
00963    if ((message_type & _message_mask_system) == 0) {
00964       in_routine = FALSE;
00965       return CM_SUCCESS;
00966    }
00967 
00968    /* copy message to event */
00969    pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) event;
00970    strcpy(event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), send_message);
00971 
00972    /* send event if not of type MLOG */
00973    if (message_type != MT_LOG) {
00974       /* if no message buffer already opened, do so now */
00975       if (_msg_buffer == 0) {
00976          status = bm_open_buffer(MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME, MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE, &_msg_buffer);
00977          if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED) {
00978             in_routine = FALSE;
00979             return status;
00980          }
00981       }
00982 
00983       /* setup the event header and send the message */
00984       bm_compose_event(pevent, EVENTID_MESSAGE, (WORD) message_type, strlen(event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) + 1, 0);
00985       bm_send_event(_msg_buffer, event, pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
00986    }
00987 
00988    /* log message */
00989    cm_msg_log1(message_type, send_message, facility);
00990 
00991    in_routine = FALSE;
00992 
00993    return CM_SUCCESS;
00994 }
00995 
00996 /********************************************************************/
00997 /**
00998 Register a dispatch function for receiving system messages.
00999 - example code from mlxspeaker.c
01000 \code
01001 void receive_message(HNDLE hBuf, HNDLE id, EVENT_HEADER *header, void *message)
01002 {
01003   char str[256], *pc, *sp;
01004   // print message
01005   printf("%s\n", (char *)(message));
01006 
01007   printf("evID:%x Mask:%x Serial:%i Size:%d\n"
01008                  ,header->event_id
01009                  ,header->trigger_mask
01010                  ,header->serial_number
01011                  ,header->data_size);
01012   pc = strchr((char *)(message),']')+2;
01013   ...
01014   // skip none talking message
01015   if (header->trigger_mask == MT_TALK ||
01016       header->trigger_mask == MT_USER)
01017    ...
01018 }
01019 
01020 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
01021 {
01022   ...
01023   // now connect to server
01024   status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, exp_name, "Speaker", NULL);
01025   if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
01026     return 1;
01027   // Register callback for messages
01028   cm_msg_register(receive_message);
01029   ...
01030 }
01031 \endcode
01032 @param func Dispatch function.
01033 @return CM_SUCCESS or bm_open_buffer and bm_request_event return status
01034 */
01035 INT cm_msg_register(void (*func) (HNDLE, HNDLE, EVENT_HEADER *, void *))
01036 {
01037    INT status, id;
01038 
01039    /* if no message buffer already opened, do so now */
01040    if (_msg_buffer == 0) {
01041       status = bm_open_buffer(MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME, MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE, &_msg_buffer);
01042       if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED)
01043          return status;
01044    }
01045 
01046    _msg_dispatch = func;
01047 
01048    status = bm_request_event(_msg_buffer, EVENTID_ALL, TRIGGER_ALL, GET_NONBLOCKING, &id, func);
01049 
01050    return status;
01051 }
01052 
01053 /* Retrieve message from an individual file. Internal use only */
01054 INT cm_msg_retrieve1(char *filename, INT n_message, char *message, INT buf_size)
01055 {
01056    FILE *f;
01057    INT offset, i, j;
01058    char *p;
01059 
01060    f = fopen(filename, "rb");
01061    if (f == NULL) {
01062       sprintf(message, "Cannot open message log file %s\n", filename);
01063       return -1;
01064    }
01065 
01066    if (buf_size <= 2)
01067       return 0;
01068 
01069    /* position buf_size bytes before the EOF */
01070    fseek(f, -(buf_size - 1), SEEK_END);
01071    offset = ftell(f);
01072    if (offset != 0) {
01073       /* go to end of line */
01074       fgets(message, buf_size - 1, f);
01075       offset = ftell(f) - offset;
01076       buf_size -= offset;
01077    }
01078 
01079    memset(message, 0, buf_size);
01080    fread(message, 1, buf_size - 1, f);
01081    message[buf_size - 1] = 0;
01082    fclose(f);
01083 
01084    p = message + (buf_size - 2);
01085 
01086    /* goto end of buffer */
01087    while (p != message && *p == 0)
01088       p--;
01089 
01090    /* strip line break */
01091    j = 0;
01092    while (p != message && (*p == '\n' || *p == '\r')) {
01093       *(p--) = 0;
01094       j = 1;
01095    }
01096 
01097    /* trim buffer so that last n_messages remain */
01098    for (i = 0; i < n_message; i++) {
01099       while (p != message && *p != '\n')
01100          p--;
01101 
01102       while (p != message && (*p == '\n' || *p == '\r'))
01103          p--;
01104 
01105       if (p == message)
01106          break;
01107 
01108       j++;
01109    }
01110    if (p != message) {
01111       p++;
01112       while (*p == '\n' || *p == '\r')
01113          p++;
01114    }
01115 
01116    buf_size = (buf_size - 1) - (p - message);
01117 
01118    memmove(message, p, buf_size);
01119    message[buf_size] = 0;
01120 
01121    return j;
01122 }
01123 
01124 /********************************************************************/
01125 /**
01126 Retrieve old messages from log file
01127 @param  n_message        Number of messages to retrieve
01128 @param  message          buf_size bytes of messages, separated
01129                          by \n characters. The returned number
01130                          of bytes is normally smaller than the
01131                          initial buf_size, since only full
01132                          lines are returned.
01133 @param *buf_size         Size of message buffer to fill
01134 @return CM_SUCCESS
01135 */
01136 INT cm_msg_retrieve(INT n_message, char *message, INT buf_size)
01137 {
01138    char dir[256];
01139    char filename[256], filename2[256];
01140    char path[256], *message2;
01141    INT status, size, n, i;
01142    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
01143    time_t now;
01144    struct tm *tms;
01145 
01146    if (rpc_is_remote())
01147       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_MSG_RETRIEVE, n_message, message, buf_size);
01148 
01149    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
01150    status = 0;
01151 
01152    if (hDB) {
01153       strcpy(filename, "midas.log");
01154       size = sizeof(filename);
01155       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Message file", filename, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
01156 
01157       strlcpy(filename2, filename, sizeof(filename2));
01158 
01159       if (strchr(filename, '%')) {
01160          /* replace strings such as midas_%y%m%d.mid with current date */
01161          tzset();
01162          time(&now);
01163          tms = localtime(&now);
01164 
01165          strftime(filename2, sizeof(filename2), filename, tms);
01166       }
01167 
01168       if (strchr(filename2, DIR_SEPARATOR) == NULL) {
01169          status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", &hKey);
01170          if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
01171             size = sizeof(dir);
01172             memset(dir, 0, size);
01173             db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
01174             if (dir[0] != 0)
01175                if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01176                   strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01177 
01178             strcpy(path, dir);
01179             strcat(path, filename2);
01180          } else {
01181             cm_get_path(dir);
01182             if (dir[0] != 0)
01183                if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01184                   strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01185 
01186             strcpy(path, dir);
01187             strcat(path, filename2);
01188          }
01189       } else {
01190          strcpy(path, filename2);
01191       }
01192    } else
01193       strcpy(path, "midas.log");
01194 
01195    n = cm_msg_retrieve1(path, n_message, message, buf_size);
01196 
01197    while (n < n_message && strchr(filename, '%')) {
01198       now -= 3600 * 24;         // go one day back 
01199       tms = localtime(&now);
01200 
01201       strftime(filename2, sizeof(filename2), filename, tms);
01202 
01203       if (strchr(filename2, DIR_SEPARATOR) == NULL) {
01204          status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", &hKey);
01205          if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
01206             size = sizeof(dir);
01207             memset(dir, 0, size);
01208             db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
01209             if (dir[0] != 0)
01210                if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01211                   strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01212 
01213             strcpy(path, dir);
01214             strcat(path, filename2);
01215          } else {
01216             cm_get_path(dir);
01217             if (dir[0] != 0)
01218                if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01219                   strcat(dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01220 
01221             strcpy(path, dir);
01222             strcat(path, filename2);
01223          }
01224       } else {
01225          strcpy(path, filename2);
01226       }
01227 
01228       message2 = (char *) malloc(buf_size);
01229 
01230       i = cm_msg_retrieve1(path, n_message - n, message2, buf_size - strlen(message) - 1);
01231       if (i < 0)
01232          break;
01233       strlcat(message2, "\r\n", buf_size);
01234 
01235       memmove(message + strlen(message2), message, strlen(message) + 1);
01236       memcpy(message, message2, strlen(message2));
01237       free(message2);
01238       n += i;
01239    }
01240 
01241    return status;
01242 }
01243 
01244 /**dox***************************************************************/
01245                                                                                                                                /** @} *//* end of msgfunctionc */
01246 
01247 /**dox***************************************************************/
01248 /** @addtogroup cmfunctionc
01249  *
01250  *  @{  */
01251 
01252 /********************************************************************/
01253 /**
01254 Get time from MIDAS server and set local time.
01255 @param    seconds         Time in seconds
01256 @return CM_SUCCESS
01257 */
01258 INT cm_synchronize(DWORD * seconds)
01259 {
01260    INT sec, status;
01261 
01262    /* if connected to server, get time from there */
01263    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
01264       status = rpc_call(RPC_CM_SYNCHRONIZE, &sec);
01265 
01266       /* set local time */
01267       if (status == CM_SUCCESS)
01268          ss_settime(sec);
01269    }
01270 
01271    /* return time to caller */
01272    if (seconds != NULL) {
01273       *seconds = ss_time();
01274    }
01275 
01276    return CM_SUCCESS;
01277 }
01278 
01279 /********************************************************************/
01280 /**
01281 Get time from MIDAS server and set local time.
01282 @param    str            return time string
01283 @param    buf_size       Maximum size of str
01284 @return   CM_SUCCESS
01285 */
01286 INT cm_asctime(char *str, INT buf_size)
01287 {
01288    /* if connected to server, get time from there */
01289    if (rpc_is_remote())
01290       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_ASCTIME, str, buf_size);
01291 
01292    /* return local time */
01293    strcpy(str, ss_asctime());
01294 
01295    return CM_SUCCESS;
01296 }
01297 
01298 /********************************************************************/
01299 /**
01300 Get time from ss_time on server.
01301 @param    t string
01302 @return   CM_SUCCESS
01303 */
01304 INT cm_time(DWORD * t)
01305 {
01306    /* if connected to server, get time from there */
01307    if (rpc_is_remote())
01308       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_TIME, t);
01309 
01310    /* return local time */
01311    *t = ss_time();
01312 
01313    return CM_SUCCESS;
01314 }
01315 
01316 /**dox***************************************************************/
01317                                                                                                                                /** @} *//* end of cmfunctionc */
01318 
01319 /********************************************************************\
01320 *                                                                    *
01321 *           cm_xxx  -  Common Functions to buffer & database         *
01322 *                                                                    *
01323 \********************************************************************/
01324 
01325 /* Globals */
01326 
01327 static HNDLE _hKeyClient = 0;   /* key handle for client in ODB */
01328 static HNDLE _hDB = 0;          /* Database handle */
01329 static char _experiment_name[NAME_LENGTH];
01330 static char _client_name[NAME_LENGTH];
01331 static char _path_name[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
01332 static INT _call_watchdog = TRUE;
01333 static INT _watchdog_timeout = DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT;
01334 INT _semaphore_alarm, _semaphore_elog, _semaphore_history, _semaphore_msg;
01335 
01336 /**dox***************************************************************/
01337 /** @addtogroup cmfunctionc
01338  *
01339  *  @{  */
01340 
01341 /**
01342 Return version number of current MIDAS library as a string
01343 @return version number
01344 */
01345 char *cm_get_version()
01346 {
01347    return MIDAS_VERSION;
01348 }
01349 
01350 /**
01351 Return svn revision number of current MIDAS library as a string
01352 @return revision number
01353 */
01354 int cm_get_revision()
01355 {
01356    return atoi(svn_revision + 6);
01357 }
01358 
01359 /********************************************************************/
01360 /**
01361 Set path to actual experiment. This function gets called
01362 by cm_connect_experiment if the connection is established
01363 to a local experiment (not through the TCP/IP server).
01364 The path is then used for all shared memory routines.
01365 @param  path             Pathname
01366 @return CM_SUCCESS
01367 */
01368 INT cm_set_path(const char *path)
01369 {
01370    strlcpy(_path_name, path, sizeof(_path_name));
01371 
01372    /* check for trailing directory seperator */
01373    if (strlen(_path_name) > 0 && _path_name[strlen(_path_name) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01374       strcat(_path_name, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01375 
01376    return CM_SUCCESS;
01377 }
01378 
01379 /********************************************************************/
01380 /**
01381 Return the path name previously set with cm_set_path.
01382 @param  path             Pathname
01383 @return CM_SUCCESS
01384 */
01385 INT cm_get_path(char *path)
01386 {
01387    strcpy(path, _path_name);
01388 
01389    return CM_SUCCESS;
01390 }
01391 
01392 INT cm_get_path1(char *path, int path_size)
01393 {
01394    strlcpy(path, _path_name, path_size);
01395 
01396    return CM_SUCCESS;
01397 }
01398 
01399 /********************************************************************/
01400 /**
01401 Set name of the experiment
01402 @param  name             Experiment name
01403 @return CM_SUCCESS
01404 */
01405 INT cm_set_experiment_name(const char *name)
01406 {
01407    strlcpy(_experiment_name, name, sizeof(_experiment_name));
01408    return CM_SUCCESS;
01409 }
01410 
01411 /********************************************************************/
01412 /**
01413 Return the experiment name
01414 @param  name             Pointer to user string, size should be at least NAME_LENGTH
01415 @param  name_size        Size of user string
01416 @return CM_SUCCESS
01417 */
01418 INT cm_get_experiment_name(char *name, int name_length)
01419 {
01420    strlcpy(name, _experiment_name, name_length);
01421 
01422    return CM_SUCCESS;
01423 }
01424 
01425 /**dox***************************************************************/
01426                                                                                                                                /** @} *//* end of cmfunctionc */
01427 
01428 /**dox***************************************************************/
01429 /** @addtogroup cmfunctionc
01430  *
01431  *  @{  */
01432 
01433 /**dox***************************************************************/
01434 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
01435 
01436 typedef struct {
01437    char name[NAME_LENGTH];
01438    char directory[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
01439    char user[NAME_LENGTH];
01440 } experiment_table;
01441 
01442 static experiment_table exptab[MAX_EXPERIMENT];
01443 
01444 /**dox***************************************************************/
01445 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
01446 
01447 /**
01448 Scan the "exptab" file for MIDAS experiment names and save them
01449 for later use by rpc_server_accept(). The file is first searched
01450 under $MIDAS/exptab if present, then the directory from argv[0] is probed.
01451 @return CM_SUCCESS<br>
01452         CM_UNDEF_EXP exptab not found and MIDAS_DIR not set
01453 */
01454 INT cm_scan_experiments(void)
01455 {
01456    INT i;
01457    FILE *f;
01458    char str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH], alt_str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH], *pdir;
01459 
01460    for (i = 0; i < MAX_EXPERIMENT; i++)
01461       exptab[i].name[0] = 0;
01462 
01463    /* MIDAS_DIR overrides exptab */
01464    if (getenv("MIDAS_DIR")) {
01465       strlcpy(str, getenv("MIDAS_DIR"), sizeof(str));
01466 
01467       strcpy(exptab[0].name, "Default");
01468       strlcpy(exptab[0].directory, getenv("MIDAS_DIR"), sizeof(exptab[0].directory));
01469       exptab[0].user[0] = 0;
01470 
01471       return CM_SUCCESS;
01472    }
01473 
01474    /* default directory for different OSes */
01475 #if defined (OS_WINNT)
01476    if (getenv("SystemRoot"))
01477       strlcpy(str, getenv("SystemRoot"), sizeof(str));
01478    else if (getenv("windir"))
01479       strlcpy(str, getenv("windir"), sizeof(str));
01480    else
01481       strcpy(str, "");
01482 
01483    strcpy(alt_str, str);
01484    strcat(str, "\\system32\\exptab");
01485    strcat(alt_str, "\\system\\exptab");
01486 #elif defined (OS_UNIX)
01487    strcpy(str, "/etc/exptab");
01488    strcpy(alt_str, "/exptab");
01489 #else
01490    strcpy(str, "exptab");
01491    strcpy(alt_str, "exptab");
01492 #endif
01493 
01494    /* MIDAS_EXPTAB overrides default directory */
01495    if (getenv("MIDAS_EXPTAB")) {
01496       strlcpy(str, getenv("MIDAS_EXPTAB"), sizeof(str));
01497       strlcpy(alt_str, getenv("MIDAS_EXPTAB"), sizeof(alt_str));
01498    }
01499 
01500    /* read list of available experiments */
01501    f = fopen(str, "r");
01502    if (f == NULL) {
01503       f = fopen(alt_str, "r");
01504       if (f == NULL)
01505          return CM_UNDEF_ENVIRON;
01506    }
01507 
01508    i = 0;
01509    if (f != NULL) {
01510       do {
01511          str[0] = 0;
01512          if (fgets(str, 100, f) == NULL)
01513             break;
01514          if (str[0] && str[0] != '#' && str[0] != ' ' && str[0] != '\t'
01515              && (strchr(str, ' ') || strchr(str, '\t'))) {
01516             sscanf(str, "%s %s %s", exptab[i].name, exptab[i].directory, exptab[i].user);
01517 
01518             /* check for trailing directory separator */
01519             pdir = exptab[i].directory;
01520             if (pdir[strlen(pdir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
01521                strcat(pdir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
01522 
01523             i++;
01524          }
01525       } while (!feof(f));
01526       fclose(f);
01527    }
01528 
01529    /*
01530       for (j=0 ; j<i ; j++)
01531       {
01532       sprintf(str, "Scanned experiment %s", exptab[j].name);
01533       cm_msg(MINFO, str);
01534       }
01535     */
01536 
01537    return CM_SUCCESS;
01538 }
01539 
01540 /********************************************************************/
01541 /**
01542 Delete client info from database
01543 @param hDB               Database handle
01544 @param pid               PID of entry to delete, zero for this process.
01545 @return CM_SUCCESS
01546 */
01547 INT cm_delete_client_info(HNDLE hDB, INT pid)
01548 {
01549 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01550 
01551    /* only do it if local */
01552    if (!rpc_is_remote()) {
01553       INT status;
01554       HNDLE hKey;
01555       char str[256];
01556 
01557       if (!pid)
01558          pid = ss_getpid();
01559 
01560       /* don't delete info from a closed database */
01561       if (_database_entries == 0)
01562          return CM_SUCCESS;
01563 
01564       /* make operation atomic by locking database */
01565       db_lock_database(hDB);
01566 
01567       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d", pid);
01568       status = db_find_key1(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
01569 
01570       if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
01571          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01572          return DB_SUCCESS;
01573       }
01574 
01575       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
01576          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01577          return status;
01578       }
01579 
01580       /* unlock client entry and delete it without locking DB */
01581       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, 2);
01582       db_delete_key1(hDB, hKey, 1, TRUE);
01583 
01584       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01585 
01586       /* touch notify key to inform others */
01587       status = 0;
01588       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/System/Client Notify", &status, sizeof(status), 1, TID_INT);
01589    }
01590 #endif                          /*LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01591 
01592    return CM_SUCCESS;
01593 }
01594 
01595 /********************************************************************/
01596 /**
01597 Check if a client with a /system/client/xxx entry has
01598 a valid entry in the ODB client table. If not, remove
01599 that client from the /system/client tree.
01600 @param   hDB               Handle to online database
01601 @param   hKeyClient        Handle to client key
01602 @return  CM_SUCCESS, CM_NO_CLIENT
01603 */
01604 INT cm_check_client(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyClient)
01605 {
01606    if (rpc_is_remote())
01607       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_CHECK_CLIENT, hDB, hKeyClient);
01608 
01609 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01610    {
01611       KEY key;
01612       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01613       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01614       INT i, client_pid, status, dead = 0, found = 0;
01615       char name[NAME_LENGTH];
01616 
01617       db_lock_database(hDB);
01618 
01619       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKeyClient, &key);
01620       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
01621          return CM_NO_CLIENT;
01622 
01623       client_pid = atoi(key.name);
01624 
01625       name[0] = 0;
01626       i = sizeof(name);
01627       status = db_get_value(hDB, hKeyClient, "Name", name, &i, TID_STRING, FALSE);
01628 
01629       //fprintf(stderr, "cm_check_client: hkey %d, status %d, pid %d, name \'%s\', my name %s\n", hKeyClient, status, client_pid, name, _client_name);
01630 
01631       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
01632          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01633          return CM_NO_CLIENT;
01634       }
01635 
01636       if (_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
01637          pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01638          pclient = pheader->client;
01639 
01640          /* loop through clients */
01641          for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pclient++)
01642             if (pclient->pid == client_pid) {
01643                found = 1;
01644                break;
01645             }
01646 
01647 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01648 #ifdef ESRCH
01649          if (found) {           /* check that the client is still running: PID still exists */
01650             /* Only enable this for systems that define ESRCH and hope that they also support kill(pid,0) */
01651             errno = 0;
01652             kill(client_pid, 0);
01653             if (errno == ESRCH) {
01654                dead = 1;
01655             }
01656          }
01657 #endif
01658 #endif
01659 
01660          if (!found || dead) {
01661             /* client not found : delete ODB stucture */
01662 
01663             status = cm_delete_client_info(hDB, client_pid);
01664 
01665             if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
01666                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_check_client",
01667                       "Cannot delete client info for client \'%s\', pid %d, cm_delete_client_info() status %d", name, client_pid, status);
01668             else if (!found)
01669                cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_check_client",
01670                       "Deleted entry \'/System/Clients/%d\' for client \'%s\' because it is not connected to ODB", client_pid, name);
01671             else if (dead)
01672                cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_check_client",
01673                       "Deleted entry \'/System/Clients/%d\' for client \'%s\' because process pid %d does not exists", client_pid, name, client_pid);
01674 
01675             db_unlock_database(hDB);
01676 
01677             return CM_NO_CLIENT;
01678          }
01679       }
01680 
01681       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01682    }
01683 #endif                          /*LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01684 
01685    return CM_SUCCESS;
01686 }
01687 
01688 /********************************************************************/
01689 /**
01690 Set client information in online database and return handle
01691 @param  hDB              Handle to online database
01692 @param  hKeyClient       returned key
01693 @param  host_name        server name
01694 @param  client_name      Name of this program as it will be seen
01695                          by other clients.
01696 @param  hw_type          Type of byte order
01697 @param  password         MIDAS password
01698 @param  watchdog_timeout Default watchdog timeout, can be overwritten
01699                          by ODB setting /programs/<name>/Watchdog timeout
01700 @return   CM_SUCCESS
01701 */
01702 INT cm_set_client_info(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE * hKeyClient, char *host_name,
01703                        char *client_name, INT hw_type, char *password, DWORD watchdog_timeout)
01704 {
01705    if (rpc_is_remote())
01706       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_SET_CLIENT_INFO, hDB, hKeyClient,
01707                       host_name, client_name, hw_type, password, watchdog_timeout);
01708 
01709 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01710    {
01711       INT status, pid, data, i, idx, size;
01712       HNDLE hKey, hSubkey;
01713       char str[256], name[NAME_LENGTH], orig_name[NAME_LENGTH], pwd[NAME_LENGTH];
01714       BOOL call_watchdog, allow;
01715       PROGRAM_INFO_STR(program_info_str);
01716 
01717       /* check security if password is present */
01718       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Security/Password", &hKey);
01719       if (hKey) {
01720          /* get password */
01721          size = sizeof(pwd);
01722          db_get_data(hDB, hKey, pwd, &size, TID_STRING);
01723 
01724          /* first check allowed hosts list */
01725          allow = FALSE;
01726          db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Security/Allowed hosts", &hKey);
01727          if (hKey && db_find_key(hDB, hKey, host_name, &hKey) == DB_SUCCESS)
01728             allow = TRUE;
01729 
01730          /* check allowed programs list */
01731          db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Security/Allowed programs", &hKey);
01732          if (hKey && db_find_key(hDB, hKey, client_name, &hKey) == DB_SUCCESS)
01733             allow = TRUE;
01734 
01735          /* now check password */
01736          if (!allow && strcmp(password, pwd) != 0) {
01737             if (password[0])
01738                cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_set_client_info", "Wrong password for host %s", host_name);
01739             db_close_all_databases();
01740             bm_close_all_buffers();
01741             _msg_buffer = 0;
01742             return CM_WRONG_PASSWORD;
01743          }
01744       }
01745 
01746       /* make following operation atomic by locking database */
01747       db_lock_database(hDB);
01748 
01749       /* check if entry with this pid exists already */
01750       pid = ss_getpid();
01751 
01752       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d", pid);
01753       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
01754       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
01755          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, TRUE);
01756          db_delete_key(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
01757       }
01758 
01759       if (strlen(client_name) >= NAME_LENGTH)
01760          client_name[NAME_LENGTH] = 0;
01761 
01762       strcpy(name, client_name);
01763       strcpy(orig_name, client_name);
01764 
01765       /* check if client name already exists */
01766       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hKey);
01767 
01768       for (idx = 1; status != DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS; idx++) {
01769          for (i = 0;; i++) {
01770             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
01771             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
01772                break;
01773 
01774             if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
01775                size = sizeof(str);
01776                status = db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", str, &size, TID_STRING, FALSE);
01777                if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
01778                   continue;
01779             }
01780 
01781             /* check if client is living */
01782             if (cm_check_client(hDB, hSubkey) == CM_NO_CLIENT)
01783                continue;
01784 
01785             if (equal_ustring(str, name)) {
01786                sprintf(name, "%s%d", client_name, idx);
01787                break;
01788             }
01789          }
01790       }
01791 
01792       /* set name */
01793       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d/Name", pid);
01794       status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, str, name, NAME_LENGTH, 1, TID_STRING);
01795       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
01796          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01797          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_set_client_info", "cannot set client name");
01798          return status;
01799       }
01800 
01801       /* copy new client name */
01802       strcpy(client_name, name);
01803       db_set_client_name(hDB, client_name);
01804 
01805       /* set also as rpc name */
01806       rpc_set_name(client_name);
01807 
01808       /* use /system/clients/PID as root */
01809       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d", pid);
01810       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
01811 
01812       /* set host name */
01813       status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Host", host_name, HOST_NAME_LENGTH, 1, TID_STRING);
01814       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
01815          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01816          return status;
01817       }
01818 
01819       /* set computer id */
01820       status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Hardware type", &hw_type, sizeof(hw_type), 1, TID_INT);
01821       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
01822          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01823          return status;
01824       }
01825 
01826       /* set server port */
01827       data = 0;
01828       status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Server Port", &data, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
01829       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
01830          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01831          return status;
01832       }
01833 
01834       /* lock client entry */
01835       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
01836 
01837       /* get (set) default watchdog timeout */
01838       size = sizeof(watchdog_timeout);
01839       sprintf(str, "/Programs/%s/Watchdog Timeout", orig_name);
01840       db_get_value(hDB, 0, str, &watchdog_timeout, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
01841 
01842       /* define /programs entry */
01843       sprintf(str, "/Programs/%s", orig_name);
01844       db_create_record(hDB, 0, str, strcomb(program_info_str));
01845 
01846       /* save handle for ODB and client */
01847       rpc_set_server_option(RPC_ODB_HANDLE, hDB);
01848       rpc_set_server_option(RPC_CLIENT_HANDLE, hKey);
01849 
01850       /* save watchdog timeout */
01851       cm_get_watchdog_params(&call_watchdog, NULL);
01852       cm_set_watchdog_params(call_watchdog, watchdog_timeout);
01853       if (call_watchdog)
01854          ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
01855 
01856       /* end of atomic operations */
01857       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01858 
01859       /* touch notify key to inform others */
01860       data = 0;
01861       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/System/Client Notify", &data, sizeof(data), 1, TID_INT);
01862 
01863       *hKeyClient = hKey;
01864    }
01865 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01866 
01867    return CM_SUCCESS;
01868 }
01869 
01870 /********************************************************************/
01871 /**
01872 Get info about the current client
01873 @param  *client_name       Client name.
01874 @return   CM_SUCCESS, CM_UNDEF_EXP
01875 */
01876 INT cm_get_client_info(char *client_name)
01877 {
01878    INT status, length;
01879    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
01880 
01881    /* get root key of client */
01882    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
01883    if (!hDB) {
01884       client_name[0] = 0;
01885       return CM_UNDEF_EXP;
01886    }
01887 
01888    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, "Name", &hKey);
01889    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
01890       return status;
01891 
01892    length = NAME_LENGTH;
01893    status = db_get_data(hDB, hKey, client_name, &length, TID_STRING);
01894    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
01895       return status;
01896 
01897    return CM_SUCCESS;
01898 }
01899 
01900 /********************************************************************/
01901 /**
01902 Returns MIDAS environment variables.
01903 @attention This function can be used to evaluate the standard MIDAS
01904            environment variables before connecting to an experiment
01905            (see @ref Environment_variables).
01906            The usual way is that the host name and experiment name are first derived
01907            from the environment variables MIDAS_SERVER_HOST and MIDAS_EXPT_NAME.
01908            They can then be superseded by command line parameters with -h and -e flags.
01909 \code
01910 #include <stdio.h>
01911 #include <midas.h>
01912 main(int argc, char *argv[])
01913 {
01914   INT  status, i;
01915   char host_name[256],exp_name[32];
01916 
01917   // get default values from environment
01918   cm_get_environment(host_name, exp_name);
01919 
01920   // parse command line parameters
01921   for (i=1 ; i<argc ; i++)
01922     {
01923     if (argv[i][0] == '-')
01924       {
01925       if (i+1 >= argc || argv[i+1][0] == '-')
01926         goto usage;
01927       if (argv[i][1] == 'e')
01928         strcpy(exp_name, argv[++i]);
01929       else if (argv[i][1] == 'h')
01930         strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
01931       else
01932         {
01933 usage:
01934         printf("usage: test [-h Hostname] [-e Experiment]\n\n");
01935         return 1;
01936         }
01937       }
01938     }
01939   status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, exp_name, "Test", NULL);
01940   if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
01941     return 1;
01942     ...do anyting...
01943   cm_disconnect_experiment();
01944 }
01945 \endcode
01946 @param host_name           Contents of MIDAS_SERVER_HOST environment variable.
01947 @param host_name_size     string length
01948 @param exp_name           Contents of MIDAS_EXPT_NAME environment variable.
01949 @param exp_name_size      string length
01950 @return CM_SUCCESS
01951 */
01952 INT cm_get_environment(char *host_name, int host_name_size, char *exp_name, int exp_name_size)
01953 {
01954    host_name[0] = exp_name[0] = 0;
01955 
01956    if (getenv("MIDAS_SERVER_HOST"))
01957       strlcpy(host_name, getenv("MIDAS_SERVER_HOST"), host_name_size);
01958 
01959    if (getenv("MIDAS_EXPT_NAME"))
01960       strlcpy(exp_name, getenv("MIDAS_EXPT_NAME"), exp_name_size);
01961 
01962    return CM_SUCCESS;
01963 }
01964 
01965 
01966 /**dox***************************************************************/
01967 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
01968 
01969 /********************************************************************/
01970 void cm_check_connect(void)
01971 {
01972    if (_hKeyClient) {
01973       cm_msg(MERROR, "", "cm_disconnect_experiment not called at end of program");
01974       cm_msg_flush_buffer();
01975    }
01976 }
01977 
01978 /**dox***************************************************************/
01979 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
01980 
01981 /********************************************************************/
01982 /**
01983 This function connects to an existing MIDAS experiment.
01984 This must be the first call in a MIDAS application.
01985 It opens three TCP connection to the remote host (one for RPC calls,
01986 one to send events and one for hot-link notifications from the remote host)
01987 and writes client information into the ODB under /System/Clients.
01988 @attention All MIDAS applications should evaluate the MIDAS_SERVER_HOST
01989 and MIDAS_EXPT_NAME environment variables as defaults to the host name and
01990 experiment name (see @ref Environment_variables).
01991 For that purpose, the function cm_get_environment()
01992 should be called prior to cm_connect_experiment(). If command line
01993 parameters -h and -e are used, the evaluation should be done between
01994 cm_get_environment() and cm_connect_experiment(). The function
01995 cm_disconnect_experiment() must be called before a MIDAS application exits.
01996 \code
01997 #include <stdio.h>
01998 #include <midas.h>
01999 main(int argc, char *argv[])
02000 {
02001   INT  status, i;
02002   char host_name[256],exp_name[32];
02003 
02004   // get default values from environment
02005   cm_get_environment(host_name, exp_name);
02006 
02007   // parse command line parameters
02008   for (i=1 ; i<argc ; i++)
02009     {
02010     if (argv[i][0] == '-')
02011       {
02012       if (i+1 >= argc || argv[i+1][0] == '-')
02013         goto usage;
02014       if (argv[i][1] == 'e')
02015         strcpy(exp_name, argv[++i]);
02016       else if (argv[i][1] == 'h')
02017         strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
02018       else
02019         {
02020 usage:
02021         printf("usage: test [-h Hostname] [-e Experiment]\n\n");
02022         return 1;
02023         }
02024       }
02025     }
02026   status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, exp_name, "Test", NULL);
02027   if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02028     return 1;
02029   ...do operations...
02030   cm_disconnect_experiment();
02031 }
02032 \endcode
02033 @param host_name Specifies host to connect to. Must be a valid IP host name.
02034   The string can be empty ("") if to connect to the local computer.
02035 @param exp_name Specifies the experiment to connect to.
02036   If this string is empty, the number of defined experiments in exptab is checked.
02037   If only one experiment is defined, the function automatically connects to this
02038   one. If more than one experiment is defined, a list is presented and the user
02039   can interactively select one experiment.
02040 @param client_name Client name of the calling program as it can be seen by
02041   others (like the scl command in ODBEdit).
02042 @param func Callback function to read in a password if security has
02043   been enabled. In all command line applications this function is NULL which
02044   invokes an internal ss_gets() function to read in a password.
02045   In windows environments (MS Windows, X Windows) a function can be supplied to
02046   open a dialog box and read in the password. The argument of this function must
02047   be the returned password.
02048 @return CM_SUCCESS, CM_UNDEF_EXP, CM_SET_ERROR, RPC_NET_ERROR <br>
02049 CM_VERSION_MISMATCH MIDAS library version different on local and remote computer
02050 */
02051 INT cm_connect_experiment(const char *host_name, const char *exp_name, const char *client_name, void (*func) (char *))
02052 {
02053    INT status;
02054    char str[256];
02055 
02056    status =
02057        cm_connect_experiment1(host_name, exp_name, client_name, func, DEFAULT_ODB_SIZE,
02058                               DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT);
02059    cm_msg_flush_buffer();
02060    if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
02061       cm_get_error(status, str);
02062       puts(str);
02063    }
02064 
02065    return status;
02066 }
02067 
02068 /********************************************************************/
02069 /**
02070 Connect to a MIDAS experiment (to the online database) on
02071            a specific host.
02072 @internal
02073 */
02074 INT cm_connect_experiment1(const char *host_name, const char *exp_name,
02075                            const char *client_name, void (*func) (char *), INT odb_size, DWORD watchdog_timeout)
02076 {
02077    INT status, i, semaphore_elog, semaphore_alarm, semaphore_history, semaphore_msg, size;
02078    char local_host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
02079    char client_name1[NAME_LENGTH];
02080    char password[NAME_LENGTH], str[256], exp_name1[NAME_LENGTH];
02081    HNDLE hDB, hKeyClient;
02082    BOOL call_watchdog;
02083    RUNINFO_STR(runinfo_str);
02084 
02085    if (_hKeyClient)
02086       cm_disconnect_experiment();
02087 
02088    rpc_set_name(client_name);
02089 
02090    /* check for local host */
02091    if (equal_ustring(host_name, "local"))
02092       host_name = NULL;
02093 
02094 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02095    {
02096       WSADATA WSAData;
02097 
02098       /* Start windows sockets */
02099       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
02100          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02101    }
02102 #endif
02103 
02104    /* search for experiment name in exptab */
02105    if (exp_name == NULL)
02106       exp_name = "";
02107 
02108    strcpy(exp_name1, exp_name);
02109    if (exp_name1[0] == 0) {
02110       status = cm_select_experiment(host_name, exp_name1);
02111       if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02112          return status;
02113    }
02114 
02115    /* connect to MIDAS server */
02116    if (host_name && host_name[0]) {
02117       status = rpc_server_connect(host_name, exp_name1);
02118       if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
02119          return status;
02120 
02121       /* register MIDAS library functions */
02122       status = rpc_register_functions(rpc_get_internal_list(1), NULL);
02123       if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
02124          return status;
02125    } else {
02126       /* lookup path for *SHM files and save it */
02127       status = cm_scan_experiments();
02128       if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02129          return status;
02130 
02131       for (i = 0; i < MAX_EXPERIMENT && exptab[i].name[0]; i++)
02132          if (equal_ustring(exp_name1, exptab[i].name))
02133             break;
02134 
02135       /* return if experiment not defined */
02136       if (i == MAX_EXPERIMENT || exptab[i].name[0] == 0) {
02137          /* message should be displayed by application
02138             sprintf(str, "Experiment %s not defined in exptab\r", exp_name1);
02139             cm_msg(MERROR, str);
02140           */
02141          return CM_UNDEF_EXP;
02142       }
02143 
02144       cm_set_experiment_name(exptab[i].name);
02145       cm_set_path(exptab[i].directory);
02146 
02147       /* create alarm and elog semaphores */
02148       status = ss_semaphore_create("ALARM", &semaphore_alarm);
02149       if (status != SS_CREATED && status != SS_SUCCESS) {
02150          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment", "Cannot create alarm semaphore");
02151          return status;
02152       }
02153       status = ss_semaphore_create("ELOG", &semaphore_elog);
02154       if (status != SS_CREATED && status != SS_SUCCESS) {
02155          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment", "Cannot create elog semaphore");
02156          return status;
02157       }
02158       status = ss_semaphore_create("HISTORY", &semaphore_history);
02159       if (status != SS_CREATED && status != SS_SUCCESS) {
02160          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment", "Cannot create history semaphore");
02161          return status;
02162       }
02163       status = ss_semaphore_create("MSG", &semaphore_msg);
02164       if (status != SS_CREATED && status != SS_SUCCESS) {
02165          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment", "Cannot create message semaphore");
02166          return status;
02167       }
02168 
02169       cm_set_experiment_semaphore(semaphore_alarm, semaphore_elog, semaphore_history, semaphore_msg);
02170    }
02171 
02172    /* open ODB */
02173    if (odb_size == 0)
02174       odb_size = DEFAULT_ODB_SIZE;
02175 
02176    status = db_open_database("ODB", odb_size, &hDB, client_name);
02177    if (status != DB_SUCCESS && status != DB_CREATED) {
02178       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment1", "cannot open database");
02179       return status;
02180    }
02181 
02182    /* now setup client info */
02183    gethostname(local_host_name, sizeof(local_host_name));
02184 
02185    /* check watchdog timeout */
02186    if (watchdog_timeout == 0)
02187       watchdog_timeout = DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT;
02188 
02189    strcpy(client_name1, client_name);
02190    password[0] = 0;
02191    status = cm_set_client_info(hDB, &hKeyClient, local_host_name,
02192                                client_name1, rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE), password, watchdog_timeout);
02193 
02194    if (status == CM_WRONG_PASSWORD) {
02195       if (func == NULL)
02196          strcpy(str, ss_getpass("Password: "));
02197       else
02198          func(str);
02199 
02200       /* re-open database */
02201       status = db_open_database("ODB", odb_size, &hDB, client_name);
02202       if (status != DB_SUCCESS && status != DB_CREATED) {
02203          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment1", "cannot open database");
02204          return status;
02205       }
02206 
02207       strcpy(password, ss_crypt(str, "mi"));
02208       status = cm_set_client_info(hDB, &hKeyClient, local_host_name,
02209                                   client_name1, rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE), password, watchdog_timeout);
02210       if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
02211          /* disconnect */
02212          if (rpc_is_remote())
02213             rpc_server_disconnect();
02214 
02215          return status;
02216       }
02217    }
02218 
02219    cm_set_experiment_database(hDB, hKeyClient);
02220 
02221    /* set experiment name in ODB */
02222    db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Name", exp_name1, NAME_LENGTH, 1, TID_STRING);
02223 
02224    /* set data dir in ODB */
02225    cm_get_path(str);
02226    size = sizeof(str);
02227    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
02228 
02229    /* check /runinfo structure */
02230    status = db_check_record(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo", strcomb(runinfo_str), TRUE);
02231    if (status == DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH) {
02232       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_connect_experiment1", "Aborting on mismatching /Runinfo structure");
02233       cm_disconnect_experiment();
02234       abort();
02235    }
02236 
02237    /* register server to be able to be called by other clients */
02238    status = cm_register_server();
02239    if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02240       return status;
02241 
02242    /* set watchdog timeout */
02243    cm_get_watchdog_params(&call_watchdog, &watchdog_timeout);
02244    size = sizeof(watchdog_timeout);
02245    sprintf(str, "/Programs/%s/Watchdog Timeout", client_name);
02246    db_get_value(hDB, 0, str, &watchdog_timeout, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
02247    cm_set_watchdog_params(call_watchdog, watchdog_timeout);
02248 
02249    /* send startup notification */
02250    if (strchr(local_host_name, '.'))
02251       *strchr(local_host_name, '.') = 0;
02252 
02253    /* startup message is not displayed */
02254    _message_print = NULL;
02255 
02256    cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_connect_experiment", "Program %s on host %s started", client_name, local_host_name);
02257 
02258    /* enable system and user messages to stdout as default */
02259    cm_set_msg_print(MT_ALL, MT_ALL, puts);
02260 
02261    /* call cm_check_connect when exiting */
02262    atexit((void (*)(void)) cm_check_connect);
02263 
02264    /* register ctrl-c handler */
02265    ss_ctrlc_handler(cm_ctrlc_handler);
02266 
02267    return CM_SUCCESS;
02268 }
02269 
02270 /********************************************************************/
02271 /**
02272 Connect to a MIDAS server and return all defined
02273            experiments in *exp_name[MAX_EXPERIMENTS]
02274 @param  host_name         Internet host name.
02275 @param  exp_name          list of experiment names
02276 @return CM_SUCCESS, RPC_NET_ERROR
02277 */
02278 INT cm_list_experiments(const char *host_name, char exp_name[MAX_EXPERIMENT][NAME_LENGTH])
02279 {
02280    INT i, status;
02281    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
02282    INT sock;
02283    char str[MAX_EXPERIMENT * NAME_LENGTH];
02284    struct hostent *phe;
02285    int port = MIDAS_TCP_PORT;
02286    char hname[256];
02287    char *s;
02288 
02289    if (host_name == NULL || host_name[0] == 0 || equal_ustring(host_name, "local")) {
02290       status = cm_scan_experiments();
02291       if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02292          return status;
02293 
02294       for (i = 0; i < MAX_EXPERIMENT; i++)
02295          strcpy(exp_name[i], exptab[i].name);
02296 
02297       return CM_SUCCESS;
02298    }
02299 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02300    {
02301       WSADATA WSAData;
02302 
02303       /* Start windows sockets */
02304       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
02305          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02306    }
02307 #endif
02308 
02309    /* create a new socket for connecting to remote server */
02310    sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
02311    if (sock == -1) {
02312       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_list_experiments", "cannot create socket");
02313       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02314    }
02315 
02316    /* extract port number from host_name */
02317    strlcpy(hname, host_name, sizeof(hname));
02318    s = strchr(hname, ':');
02319    if (s) {
02320       *s = 0;
02321       port = strtoul(s + 1, NULL, 0);
02322    }
02323 
02324    /* connect to remote node */
02325    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
02326    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
02327    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
02328    bind_addr.sin_port = htons(port);
02329 
02330 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02331    {
02332       INT host_addr;
02333 
02334       host_addr = hostGetByName(hname);
02335       memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), &host_addr, 4);
02336    }
02337 #else
02338    phe = gethostbyname(hname);
02339    if (phe == NULL) {
02340       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_list_experiments", "cannot resolve host name \'%s\'", hname);
02341       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02342    }
02343    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
02344 #endif
02345 
02346 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02347    do {
02348       status = connect(sock, (void *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
02349 
02350       /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
02351    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
02352 #else
