02353    status = connect(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
02354 #endif
02355 
02356    if (status != 0) {
02357 /*    cm_msg(MERROR, "cannot connect"); message should be displayed by application */
02358       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02359    }
02360 
02361    /* request experiment list */
02362    send(sock, "I", 2, 0);
02363 
02364    for (i = 0; i < MAX_EXPERIMENT; i++) {
02365       exp_name[i][0] = 0;
02366       status = recv_string(sock, str, sizeof(str), _rpc_connect_timeout);
02367 
02368       if (status < 0)
02369          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
02370 
02371       if (status == 0)
02372          break;
02373 
02374       strcpy(exp_name[i], str);
02375    }
02376 
02377    exp_name[i][0] = 0;
02378    closesocket(sock);
02379 
02380    return CM_SUCCESS;
02381 }
02382 
02383 /********************************************************************/
02384 /**
02385 Connect to a MIDAS server and select an experiment
02386            from the experiments available on this server
02387 @internal
02388 @param  host_name         Internet host name.
02389 @param  exp_name          list of experiment names
02390 @return CM_SUCCESS, RPC_NET_ERROR
02391 */
02392 INT cm_select_experiment(const char *host_name, char *exp_name)
02393 {
02394    INT status, i;
02395    char expts[MAX_EXPERIMENT][NAME_LENGTH];
02396    char str[32];
02397 
02398    /* retrieve list of experiments and make selection */
02399    status = cm_list_experiments(host_name, expts);
02400    if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
02401       return status;
02402 
02403    if (expts[1][0]) {
02404       if (host_name[0])
02405          printf("Available experiments on server %s:\n", host_name);
02406       else
02407          printf("Available experiments on local computer:\n");
02408 
02409       for (i = 0; expts[i][0]; i++)
02410          printf("%d : %s\n", i, expts[i]);
02411       printf("Select number: ");
02412       ss_gets(str, 32);
02413       i = atoi(str);
02414       strcpy(exp_name, expts[i]);
02415    } else
02416       strcpy(exp_name, expts[0]);
02417 
02418    return CM_SUCCESS;
02419 }
02420 
02421 /********************************************************************/
02422 /**
02423 Connect to a MIDAS client of the current experiment
02424 @internal
02425 @param  client_name       Name of client to connect to. This name
02426                             is set by the other client via the
02427                             cm_connect_experiment call.
02428 @param  hConn            Connection handle
02429 @return CM_SUCCESS, CM_NO_CLIENT
02430 */
02431 INT cm_connect_client(char *client_name, HNDLE * hConn)
02432 {
02433    HNDLE hDB, hKeyRoot, hSubkey, hKey;
02434    INT status, i, length, port;
02435    char name[NAME_LENGTH], host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
02436 
02437    /* find client entry in ODB */
02438    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
02439 
02440    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hKeyRoot);
02441    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02442       return status;
02443 
02444    i = 0;
02445    do {
02446       /* search for client with specific name */
02447       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, i++, &hSubkey);
02448       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
02449          return CM_NO_CLIENT;
02450 
02451       status = db_find_key(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", &hKey);
02452       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02453          return status;
02454 
02455       length = NAME_LENGTH;
02456       status = db_get_data(hDB, hKey, name, &length, TID_STRING);
02457       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02458          return status;
02459 
02460       if (equal_ustring(name, client_name)) {
02461          status = db_find_key(hDB, hSubkey, "Server Port", &hKey);
02462          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02463             return status;
02464 
02465          length = sizeof(INT);
02466          status = db_get_data(hDB, hKey, &port, &length, TID_INT);
02467          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02468             return status;
02469 
02470          status = db_find_key(hDB, hSubkey, "Host", &hKey);
02471          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02472             return status;
02473 
02474          length = sizeof(host_name);
02475          status = db_get_data(hDB, hKey, host_name, &length, TID_STRING);
02476          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02477             return status;
02478 
02479          /* client found -> connect to its server port */
02480          return rpc_client_connect(host_name, port, client_name, hConn);
02481       }
02482 
02483 
02484    } while (TRUE);
02485 }
02486 
02487 /********************************************************************/
02488 /**
02489 Disconnect from a MIDAS client
02490 @param   hConn             Connection handle obtained via
02491                              cm_connect_client()
02492 @param   bShutdown         If TRUE, disconnect from client and
02493                              shut it down (exit the client program)
02494                              by sending a RPC_SHUTDOWN message
02495 @return   see rpc_client_disconnect()
02496 */
02497 INT cm_disconnect_client(HNDLE hConn, BOOL bShutdown)
02498 {
02499    return rpc_client_disconnect(hConn, bShutdown);
02500 }
02501 
02502 /********************************************************************/
02503 /**
02504 Disconnect from a MIDAS experiment.
02505 @attention Should be the last call to a MIDAS library function in an
02506 application before it exits. This function removes the client information
02507 from the ODB, disconnects all TCP connections and frees all internal
02508 allocated memory. See cm_connect_experiment() for example.
02509 @return CM_SUCCESS
02510 */
02511 INT cm_disconnect_experiment(void)
02512 {
02513    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
02514    char local_host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH], client_name[80];
02515 
02516    /* send shutdown notification */
02517    rpc_get_name(client_name);
02518    gethostname(local_host_name, sizeof(local_host_name));
02519    if (strchr(local_host_name, '.'))
02520       *strchr(local_host_name, '.') = 0;
02521 
02522    /* disconnect message not displayed */
02523    _message_print = NULL;
02524 
02525    cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_disconnect_experiment", "Program %s on host %s stopped", client_name, local_host_name);
02526 
02527    cm_msg_flush_buffer();
02528 
02529    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
02530       /* close open records */
02531       db_close_all_records();
02532 
02533       rpc_client_disconnect(-1, FALSE);
02534       rpc_server_disconnect();
02535    } else {
02536       rpc_client_disconnect(-1, FALSE);
02537 
02538 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02539       ss_alarm(0, cm_watchdog);
02540       _watchdog_last_called = 0;
02541 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02542 
02543       /* delete client info */
02544       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
02545 
02546       if (hDB)
02547          cm_delete_client_info(hDB, 0);
02548 
02549       bm_close_all_buffers();
02550       db_close_all_databases();
02551    }
02552 
02553    if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_REMOTE)
02554       rpc_server_shutdown();
02555 
02556    /* free RPC list */
02557    rpc_deregister_functions();
02558 
02559    cm_set_experiment_database(0, 0);
02560 
02561    if (_msg_mutex)
02562       ss_mutex_delete(_msg_mutex);
02563    _msg_mutex = 0;
02564    if (_msg_rb)
02565       rb_delete(_msg_rb);
02566    _msg_rb = 0;
02567 
02568    _msg_buffer = 0;
02569 
02570    /* free memory buffers */
02571    if (_event_buffer_size > 0) {
02572       M_FREE(_event_buffer);
02573       _event_buffer_size = 0;
02574    }
02575 
02576    if (_net_recv_buffer_size > 0) {
02577       M_FREE(_net_recv_buffer);
02578       _net_recv_buffer_size = 0;
02579       _net_recv_buffer_size_odb = 0;
02580    }
02581 
02582    if (_net_send_buffer_size > 0) {
02583       M_FREE(_net_send_buffer);
02584       _net_send_buffer_size = 0;
02585    }
02586 
02587    if (_tcp_buffer != NULL) {
02588       M_FREE(_tcp_buffer);
02589       _tcp_buffer = NULL;
02590    }
02591 
02592    return CM_SUCCESS;
02593 }
02594 
02595 /********************************************************************/
02596 /**
02597 Set the handle to the ODB for the currently connected experiment
02598 @param hDB              Database handle
02599 @param hKeyClient       Key handle of client structure
02600 @return CM_SUCCESS
02601 */
02602 INT cm_set_experiment_database(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyClient)
02603 {
02604    _hDB = hDB;
02605    _hKeyClient = hKeyClient;
02606 
02607    return CM_SUCCESS;
02608 }
02609 
02610 
02611 
02612 /**dox***************************************************************/
02613 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02614 
02615 /********************************************************************/
02616 INT cm_set_experiment_semaphore(INT semaphore_alarm, INT semaphore_elog, INT semaphore_history, INT semaphore_msg)
02617 /********************************************************************\
02618 
02619   Routine: cm_set_experiment_semaphore
02620 
02621   Purpose: Set the handle to the experiment wide semaphorees
02622 
02623   Input:
02624     INT    semaphore_alarm      Alarm semaphore
02625     INT    semaphore_elog       Elog semaphore
02626     INT    semaphore_history    History semaphore
02627     INT    semaphore_msg        Message semaphore
02628 
02629   Output:
02630     none
02631 
02632   Function value:
02633     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02634 
02635 \********************************************************************/
02636 {
02637    _semaphore_alarm = semaphore_alarm;
02638    _semaphore_elog = semaphore_elog;
02639    _semaphore_history = semaphore_history;
02640    _semaphore_msg = semaphore_msg;
02641 
02642    return CM_SUCCESS;
02643 }
02644 
02645 /**dox***************************************************************/
02646 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
02647 
02648 /********************************************************************/
02649 /**
02650 Get the handle to the ODB from the currently connected experiment.
02651 
02652 @attention This function returns the handle of the online database (ODB) which
02653 can be used in future db_xxx() calls. The hkeyclient key handle can be used
02654 to access the client information in the ODB. If the client key handle is not needed,
02655 the parameter can be NULL.
02656 \code
02657 HNDLE hDB, hkeyclient;
02658  char  name[32];
02659  int   size;
02660  db_get_experiment_database(&hdb, &hkeyclient);
02661  size = sizeof(name);
02662  db_get_value(hdb, hkeyclient, "Name", name, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
02663  printf("My name is %s\n", name);
02664 \endcode
02665 @param hDB Database handle.
02666 @param hKeyClient Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
02667 @return CM_SUCCESS
02668 */
02669 INT cm_get_experiment_database(HNDLE * hDB, HNDLE * hKeyClient)
02670 {
02671    if (_hDB) {
02672       if (hDB != NULL)
02673          *hDB = _hDB;
02674       if (hKeyClient != NULL)
02675          *hKeyClient = _hKeyClient;
02676    } else {
02677       if (hDB != NULL)
02678          *hDB = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_ODB_HANDLE);
02679       if (hKeyClient != NULL)
02680          *hKeyClient = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CLIENT_HANDLE);
02681    }
02682 
02683    return CM_SUCCESS;
02684 }
02685 
02686 /**dox***************************************************************/
02687 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02688 
02689 /********************************************************************/
02690 INT cm_get_experiment_semaphore(INT * semaphore_alarm, INT * semaphore_elog, INT * semaphore_history, INT * semaphore_msg)
02691 /********************************************************************\
02692 
02693   Routine: cm_get_experiment_semaphore
02694 
02695   Purpose: Get the handle to the experiment wide semaphores
02696 
02697   Input:
02698     none
02699 
02700   Output:
02701     INT    semaphore_alarm      Alarm semaphore
02702     INT    semaphore_elog       Elog semaphore
02703     INT    semaphore_history    History semaphore
02704     INT    semaphore_msg        Message semaphore
02705 
02706   Function value:
02707     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02708 
02709 \********************************************************************/
02710 {
02711    if (semaphore_alarm)
02712       *semaphore_alarm = _semaphore_alarm;
02713    if (semaphore_elog)
02714       *semaphore_elog = _semaphore_elog;
02715    if (semaphore_history)
02716       *semaphore_history = _semaphore_history;
02717    if (semaphore_msg)
02718       *semaphore_msg = _semaphore_msg;
02719 
02720    return CM_SUCCESS;
02721 }
02722 
02723 /**dox***************************************************************/
02724 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
02725 
02726 static int bm_validate_client_index(const BUFFER * buf, BOOL abort_if_invalid)
02727 {
02728    static int prevent_recursion = 1;
02729    int badindex = 0;
02730    BUFFER_CLIENT *bcl = buf->buffer_header->client;
02731 
02732    if (buf->client_index < 0)
02733       badindex = 1;
02734    else if (buf->client_index > buf->buffer_header->max_client_index)
02735       badindex = 1;
02736    else {
02737       bcl = &(buf->buffer_header->client[buf->client_index]);
02738       if (bcl->name[0] == 0)
02739          badindex = 1;
02740       else if (bcl->pid != ss_getpid())
02741          badindex = 1;
02742    }
02743 
02744 #if 0
02745    printf
02746        ("bm_validate_client_index: badindex=%d, buf=%p, client_index=%d, max_client_index=%d, client_name=\'%s\', client_pid=%d, pid=%d\n",
02747         badindex, buf, buf->client_index, buf->buffer_header->max_client_index,
02748         buf->buffer_header->client[buf->client_index].name, buf->buffer_header->client[buf->client_index].pid,
02749         ss_getpid());
02750 #endif
02751 
02752    if (badindex) {
02753 
02754       if (!abort_if_invalid)
02755          return -1;
02756 
02757       if (prevent_recursion) {
02758          prevent_recursion = 0;
02759          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_validate_client_index",
02760                 "My client index %d in buffer \'%s\' is invalid: client name \'%s\', pid %d should be my pid %d",
02761                 buf->client_index, buf->buffer_header->name, bcl->name, bcl->pid, ss_getpid());
02762          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_validate_client_index",
02763                 "Maybe this client was removed by a timeout. Cannot continue, aborting...");
02764       }
02765 
02766       abort();
02767       exit(1);
02768    }
02769 
02770    return buf->client_index;
02771 }
02772 
02773 /********************************************************************/
02774 /**
02775 Sets the internal watchdog flags and the own timeout.
02776 If call_watchdog is TRUE, the cm_watchdog routine is called
02777 periodically from the system to show other clients that
02778 this application is "alive". On UNIX systems, the
02779 alarm() timer is used which is then not available for
02780 user purposes.
02781 
02782 The timeout specifies the time, after which the calling
02783 application should be considered "dead" by other clients.
02784 Normally, the cm_watchdog() routines is called periodically.
02785 If a client crashes, this does not occur any more. Then
02786 other clients can detect this and clear all buffer and
02787 database entries of this application so they are not
02788 blocked any more. If this application should not checked
02789 by others, the timeout can be specified as zero.
02790 It might be useful for debugging purposes to do so,
02791 because if a debugger comes to a breakpoint and stops
02792 the application, the periodic call of cm_watchdog
02793 is disabled and the client looks like dead.
02794 
02795 If the timeout is not zero, but the watchdog is not
02796 called (call_watchdog == FALSE), the user must ensure
02797 to call cm_watchdog periodically with a period of
02798 WATCHDOG_INTERVAL milliseconds or less.
02799 
02800 An application which calles system routines which block
02801 the alarm signal for some time, might increase the
02802 timeout to the maximum expected blocking time before
02803 issuing the calls. One example is the logger doing
02804 Exabyte tape IO, which can take up to one minute.
02805 @param    call_watchdog   Call the cm_watchdog routine periodically
02806 @param    timeout         Timeout for this application in ms
02807 @return   CM_SUCCESS
02808 */
02809 INT cm_set_watchdog_params(BOOL call_watchdog, DWORD timeout)
02810 {
02811    INT i;
02812 
02813    /* set also local timeout to requested value (needed by cm_enable_watchdog()) */
02814    _watchdog_timeout = timeout;
02815 
02816    if (rpc_is_remote())
02817       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_SET_WATCHDOG_PARAMS, call_watchdog, timeout);
02818 
02819 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02820 
02821    if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE) {
02822       HNDLE hDB, hKey;
02823 
02824       rpc_set_server_option(RPC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT, timeout);
02825 
02826       /* write timeout value to client enty in ODB */
02827       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
02828 
02829       if (hDB) {
02830          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
02831          db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Link timeout", &timeout, sizeof(timeout), 1, TID_INT);
02832          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
02833       }
02834    } else {
02835       _call_watchdog = call_watchdog;
02836       _watchdog_timeout = timeout;
02837 
02838       /* set watchdog flag of all open buffers */
02839       for (i = _buffer_entries; i > 0; i--) {
02840          BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
02841          BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
02842          INT idx;
02843          
02844          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE
02845              && _buffer[i - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception())
02846             continue;
02847 
02848          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE && _buffer[i - 1].index != ss_gettid())
02849             continue;
02850 
02851          if (!_buffer[i - 1].attached)
02852             continue;
02853 
02854          idx = bm_validate_client_index(&_buffer[i - 1], TRUE);
02855          pheader = _buffer[i - 1].buffer_header;
02856          pclient = &pheader->client[idx];
02857 
02858          /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
02859          pclient->watchdog_timeout = timeout;
02860 
02861          /* show activity */
02862          pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
02863       }
02864 
02865       /* set watchdog flag of all open databases */
02866       for (i = _database_entries; i > 0; i--) {
02867          DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02868          DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
02869          INT idx;
02870 
02871          db_lock_database(i);
02872 
02873          idx = _database[i - 1].client_index;
02874          pheader = _database[i - 1].database_header;
02875          pclient = &pheader->client[idx];
02876 
02877          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
02878              _database[i - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception()) {
02879             db_unlock_database(i);
02880             continue;
02881          }
02882 
02883          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE && _database[i - 1].index != ss_gettid()) {
02884             db_unlock_database(i);
02885             continue;
02886          }
02887 
02888          if (!_database[i - 1].attached) {
02889             db_unlock_database(i);
02890             continue;
02891          }
02892 
02893          /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
02894          pclient->watchdog_timeout = timeout;
02895 
02896          /* show activity */
02897          pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
02898 
02899          db_unlock_database(i);
02900       }
02901 
02902       if (call_watchdog)
02903          /* restart watchdog */
02904          ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
02905       else
02906          /* kill current timer */
02907          ss_alarm(0, cm_watchdog);
02908    }
02909 
02910 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02911 
02912    return CM_SUCCESS;
02913 }
02914 
02915 /********************************************************************/
02916 /**
02917 Return the current watchdog parameters
02918 @param call_watchdog   Call the cm_watchdog routine periodically
02919 @param timeout         Timeout for this application in seconds
02920 @return   CM_SUCCESS
02921 */
02922 INT cm_get_watchdog_params(BOOL * call_watchdog, DWORD * timeout)
02923 {
02924    if (call_watchdog)
02925       *call_watchdog = _call_watchdog;
02926    if (timeout)
02927       *timeout = _watchdog_timeout;
02928 
02929    return CM_SUCCESS;
02930 }
02931 
02932 /********************************************************************/
02933 /**
02934 Return watchdog information about specific client
02935 @param    hDB              ODB handle
02936 @param    client_name     ODB client name
02937 @param    timeout         Timeout for this application in seconds
02938 @param    last            Last time watchdog was called in msec
02939 @return   CM_SUCCESS, CM_NO_CLIENT, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
02940 */
02941 
02942 INT cm_get_watchdog_info(HNDLE hDB, char *client_name, DWORD * timeout, DWORD * last)
02943 {
02944    if (rpc_is_remote())
02945       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_GET_WATCHDOG_INFO, hDB, client_name, timeout, last);
02946 
02947 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02948    {
02949       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02950       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
02951       INT i;
02952 
02953       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02954          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_get_watchdog_info", "invalid database handle");
02955          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02956       }
02957 
02958       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02959          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_get_watchdog_info", "invalid database handle");
02960          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02961       }
02962 
02963       /* lock database */
02964       db_lock_database(hDB);
02965 
02966       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02967       pclient = pheader->client;
02968 
02969       /* find client */
02970       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pclient++)
02971          if (pclient->pid && equal_ustring(pclient->name, client_name)) {
02972             *timeout = pclient->watchdog_timeout;
02973             *last = ss_millitime() - pclient->last_activity;
02974             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02975             return CM_SUCCESS;
02976          }
02977 
02978       *timeout = *last = 0;
02979 
02980       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02981 
02982       return CM_NO_CLIENT;
02983    }
02984 #else                           /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02985    return CM_SUCCESS;
02986 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02987 }
02988 
02989 
02990 /**dox***************************************************************/
02991 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02992 
02993 /********************************************************************/
02994 INT cm_register_server(void)
02995 /********************************************************************\
02996 
02997   Routine: cm_register_server
02998 
02999   Purpose: Register a server which can be called from other clients
03000            of a specific experiment.
03001 
03002   Input:
03003     none
03004 
03005   Output:
03006     none
03007 
03008   Function value:
03009     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03010 
03011 \********************************************************************/
03012 {
03013    INT status, port;
03014    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
03015 
03016    if (!_server_registered) {
03017       port = 0;
03018       status = rpc_register_server(ST_REMOTE, NULL, &port, NULL);
03019       if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
03020          return status;
03021       _server_registered = TRUE;
03022 
03023       /* register MIDAS library functions */
03024       rpc_register_functions(rpc_get_internal_list(1), NULL);
03025 
03026       /* store port number in ODB */
03027       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
03028 
03029       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, "Server Port", &hKey);
03030       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03031          return status;
03032 
03033       /* unlock database */
03034       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
03035 
03036       /* set value */
03037       status = db_set_data(hDB, hKey, &port, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03038       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03039          return status;
03040 
03041       /* lock database */
03042       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
03043    }
03044 
03045    return CM_SUCCESS;
03046 }
03047 
03048 /**dox***************************************************************/
03049 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
03050 
03051 /********************************************************************/
03052 /**
03053 Registers a callback function for run transitions.
03054 This function internally registers the transition callback
03055 function and publishes its request for transition notification by writing
03056 a transition request to /System/Clients/<pid>/Transition XXX.
03057 Other clients making a transition scan the transition requests of all clients
03058 and call their transition callbacks via RPC.
03059 
03060 Clients can register for transitions (Start/Stop/Pause/Resume) in a given
03061 sequence. All sequence numbers given in the registration are sorted on
03062 a transition and the clients are contacted in ascending order. By default,
03063 all programs register with a sequence number of 500. The logger however
03064 uses 200 for start, so that it can open files before the other clients
03065 are contacted, and 800 for stop, so that the files get closed when all
03066 other clients have gone already through the stop trantition.
03067 
03068 The callback function returns CM_SUCCESS if it can perform the transition or
03069 a value larger than one in case of error. An error string can be copied
03070 into the error variable.
03071 @attention The callback function will be called on transitions from inside the
03072     cm_yield() function which therefore must be contained in the main program loop.
03073 \code
03074 INT start(INT run_number, char *error)
03075 {
03076   if (<not ok>)
03077     {
03078     strcpy(error, "Cannot start because ...");
03079     return 2;
03080     }
03081   printf("Starting run %d\n", run_number);
03082   return CM_SUCCESS;
03083 }
03084 main()
03085 {
03086   ...
03087   cm_register_transition(TR_START, start, 500);
03088   do
03089     {
03090     status = cm_yield(1000);
03091     } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN &&
03092              status != SS_ABORT);
03093   ...
03094 }
03095 \endcode
03096 @param transition Transition to register for (see @ref state_transition)
03097 @param func Callback function.
03098 @param sequence_number Sequence number for that transition (1..1000)
03099 @return CM_SUCCESS
03100 */
03101 INT cm_register_transition(INT transition, INT(*func) (INT, char *), INT sequence_number)
03102 {
03103    INT status, i;
03104    HNDLE hDB, hKey, hKeyTrans;
03105    KEY key;
03106    char str[256];
03107 
03108    /* check for valid transition */
03109    if (transition != TR_START && transition != TR_STOP && transition != TR_PAUSE && transition != TR_RESUME
03110        && transition != TR_STARTABORT) {
03111       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_register_transition", "Invalid transition request \"%d\"", transition);
03112       return CM_INVALID_TRANSITION;
03113    }
03114 
03115    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
03116 
03117    rpc_register_function(RPC_RC_TRANSITION, rpc_transition_dispatch);
03118 
03119    /* register new transition request */
03120 
03121    /* find empty slot */
03122    for (i = 0; i < MAX_TRANSITIONS; i++)
03123       if (!_trans_table[i].transition)
03124          break;
03125 
03126    if (i == MAX_TRANSITIONS) {
03127       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_register_transition",
03128              "To many transition registrations. Please increase MAX_TRANSITIONS and recompile");
03129       return CM_TOO_MANY_REQUESTS;
03130    }
03131 
03132    _trans_table[i].transition = transition;
03133    _trans_table[i].func = func;
03134    _trans_table[i].sequence_number = sequence_number;
03135 
03136    for (i = 0;; i++)
03137       if (trans_name[i].name[0] == 0 || trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03138          break;
03139 
03140    sprintf(str, "Transition %s", trans_name[i].name);
03141 
03142    /* unlock database */
03143    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, TRUE);
03144 
03145    /* set value */
03146    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, str, &hKeyTrans);
03147    if (!hKeyTrans) {
03148       status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, str, &sequence_number, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03149       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03150          return status;
03151    } else {
03152       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKeyTrans, &key);
03153       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03154          return status;
03155       status = db_set_data_index(hDB, hKeyTrans, &sequence_number, sizeof(INT), key.num_values, TID_INT);
03156       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03157          return status;
03158    }
03159 
03160    /* re-lock database */
03161    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
03162 
03163    return CM_SUCCESS;
03164 }
03165 
03166 INT cm_deregister_transition(INT transition)
03167 {
03168    INT status, i;
03169    HNDLE hDB, hKey, hKeyTrans;
03170    char str[256];
03171 
03172    /* check for valid transition */
03173    if (transition != TR_START && transition != TR_STOP && transition != TR_PAUSE && transition != TR_RESUME) {
03174       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_deregister_transition", "Invalid transition request \"%d\"", transition);
03175       return CM_INVALID_TRANSITION;
03176    }
03177 
03178    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
03179 
03180    /* remove existing transition request */
03181    for (i = 0; i < MAX_TRANSITIONS; i++)
03182       if (_trans_table[i].transition == transition)
03183          break;
03184 
03185    if (i == MAX_TRANSITIONS) {
03186       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_register_transition",
03187              "Cannot de-register transition registration, request not found");
03188       return CM_INVALID_TRANSITION;
03189    }
03190 
03191    _trans_table[i].transition = 0;
03192    _trans_table[i].func = NULL;
03193    _trans_table[i].sequence_number = 0;
03194 
03195    for (i = 0;; i++)
03196       if (trans_name[i].name[0] == 0 || trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03197          break;
03198 
03199    sprintf(str, "Transition %s", trans_name[i].name);
03200 
03201    /* unlock database */
03202    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, TRUE);
03203 
03204    /* set value */
03205    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, str, &hKeyTrans);
03206    if (hKeyTrans) {
03207       status = db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTrans, FALSE);
03208       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03209          return status;
03210    }
03211 
03212    /* re-lock database */
03213    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
03214 
03215    return CM_SUCCESS;
03216 }
03217 
03218 /********************************************************************/
03219 /**
03220 Change the transition sequence for the calling program.
03221 @param transition TR_START, TR_PAUSE, TR_RESUME or TR_STOP.
03222 @param sequence_number New sequence number, should be between 1 and 1000
03223 @return     CM_SUCCESS
03224 */
03225 INT cm_set_transition_sequence(INT transition, INT sequence_number)
03226 {
03227    INT status, i;
03228    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
03229    char str[256];
03230 
03231    /* check for valid transition */
03232    if (transition != TR_START && transition != TR_STOP && transition != TR_PAUSE && transition != TR_RESUME) {
03233       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_set_transition_sequence", "Invalid transition request \"%d\"", transition);
03234       return CM_INVALID_TRANSITION;
03235    }
03236 
03237    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
03238 
03239    /* Find the transition type from the list */
03240    for (i = 0;; i++)
03241       if (trans_name[i].name[0] == 0 || trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03242          break;
03243    sprintf(str, "Transition %s", trans_name[i].name);
03244 
03245    /* Change local sequence number for this transition type */
03246    for (i = 0; i < MAX_TRANSITIONS; i++)
03247       if (_trans_table[i].transition == transition) {
03248          _trans_table[i].sequence_number = sequence_number;
03249          break;
03250       }
03251 
03252    /* unlock database */
03253    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
03254 
03255    /* set value */
03256    status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, str, &sequence_number, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03257    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03258       return status;
03259 
03260    /* re-lock database */
03261    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
03262 
03263    return CM_SUCCESS;
03264 
03265 }
03266 
03267 /**dox***************************************************************/
03268 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
03269 
03270 static INT _requested_transition;
03271 static DWORD _deferred_transition_mask;
03272 
03273 /**dox***************************************************************/
03274 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
03275 
03276 /********************************************************************/
03277 /**
03278 Register a deferred transition handler. If a client is
03279 registered as a deferred transition handler, it may defer
03280 a requested transition by returning FALSE until a certain
03281 condition (like a motor reaches its end position) is
03282 reached.
03283 @param transition      One of TR_xxx
03284 @param (*func)         Function which gets called whenever
03285                        a transition is requested. If it returns
03286                        FALSE, the transition is not performed.
03287 @return CM_SUCCESS,    <error> Error from ODB access
03288 */
03289 INT cm_register_deferred_transition(INT transition, BOOL(*func) (INT, BOOL))
03290 {
03291    INT status, i, size;
03292    char tr_key_name[256];
03293    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
03294 
03295    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
03296 
03297    for (i = 0; _deferred_trans_table[i].transition; i++)
03298       if (_deferred_trans_table[i].transition == transition)
03299          _deferred_trans_table[i].func = (int (*)(int, char *)) func;
03300 
03301    /* set new transition mask */
03302    _deferred_transition_mask |= transition;
03303 
03304    for (i = 0;; i++)
03305       if (trans_name[i].name[0] == 0 || trans_name[i].transition == transition)
03306          break;
03307 
03308    sprintf(tr_key_name, "Transition %s DEFERRED", trans_name[i].name);
03309 
03310    /* unlock database */
03311    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
03312 
03313    /* set value */
03314    i = 0;
03315    status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, tr_key_name, &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03316    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03317       return status;
03318 
03319    /* re-lock database */
03320    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
03321 
03322    /* hot link requested transition */
03323    size = sizeof(_requested_transition);
03324    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Requested Transition", &_requested_transition, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03325    db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Requested Transition", &hKey);
03326    status = db_open_record(hDB, hKey, &_requested_transition, sizeof(INT), MODE_READ, NULL, NULL);
03327    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03328       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_register_deferred_transition", "Cannot hotlink /Runinfo/Requested Transition");
03329       return status;
03330    }
03331 
03332    return CM_SUCCESS;
03333 }
03334 
03335 /********************************************************************/
03336 /**
03337 Check for any deferred transition. If a deferred transition
03338 handler has been registered via the
03339 cm_register_deferred_transition function, this routine
03340 should be called regularly. It checks if a transition
03341 request is pending. If so, it calld the registered handler
03342 if the transition should be done and then actually does
03343 the transition.
03344 @return     CM_SUCCESS, <error>  Error from cm_transition()
03345 */
03346 INT cm_check_deferred_transition()
03347 {
03348    INT i, status;
03349    char str[256];
03350    static BOOL first;
03351 
03352    if (_requested_transition == 0)
03353       first = TRUE;
03354 
03355    if (_requested_transition & _deferred_transition_mask) {
03356       for (i = 0; _deferred_trans_table[i].transition; i++)
03357          if (_deferred_trans_table[i].transition == _requested_transition)
03358             break;
03359 
03360       if (_deferred_trans_table[i].transition == _requested_transition) {
03361          if (((BOOL(*)(INT, BOOL)) _deferred_trans_table[i].func) (_requested_transition, first)) {
03362             status = cm_transition(_requested_transition | TR_DEFERRED, 0, str, sizeof(str), SYNC, FALSE);
03363             if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
03364                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_check_deferred_transition", "Cannot perform deferred transition: %s", str);
03365 
03366             /* bypass hotlink and set _requested_transition directly to zero */
03367             _requested_transition = 0;
03368 
03369             return status;
03370          }
03371          first = FALSE;
03372       }
03373    }
03374 
03375    return SUCCESS;
03376 }
03377 
03378 
03379 /**dox***************************************************************/
03380 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
03381 
03382 /********************************************************************/
03383 
03384 /**dox***************************************************************/
03385 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
03386 
03387 typedef struct {
03388    int sequence_number;
03389    char host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
03390    char client_name[NAME_LENGTH];
03391    int port;
03392 } TR_CLIENT;
03393 
03394 int tr_compare(const void *arg1, const void *arg2)
03395 {
03396    return ((TR_CLIENT *) arg1)->sequence_number - ((TR_CLIENT *) arg2)->sequence_number;
03397 }
03398 
03399 /********************************************************************/
03400 /**
03401 Performs a run transition (Start/Stop/Pause/Resume).
03402 
03403 Synchronous/Asynchronous flag.
03404 If set to ASYNC, the transition is done
03405 asynchronously, meaning that clients are connected and told to execute their
03406 callback routine, but no result is awaited. The return value is
03407 specified by the transition callback function on the remote clients. If all callbacks
03408 can perform the transition, CM_SUCCESS is returned. If one callback cannot
03409 perform the transition, the return value of this callback is returned from
03410 cm_transition().
03411 The async_flag is usually FALSE so that transition callbacks can block a
03412 run transition in case of problems and return an error string. The only exception are
03413 situations where a run transition is performed automatically by a program which
03414 cannot block in a transition. For example the logger can cause a run stop when a
03415 disk is nearly full but it cannot block in the cm_transition() function since it
03416 has its own run stop callback which must flush buffers and close disk files and
03417 tapes.
03418 \code
03419 ...
03420     i = 1;
03421     db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Transition in progress", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03422 
03423       status = cm_transition(TR_START, new_run_number, str, sizeof(str), SYNC, debug_flag);
03424       if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
03425       {
03426         // in case of error
03427         printf("Error: %s\n", str);
03428       }
03429     ...
03430 \endcode
03431 @param transition TR_START, TR_PAUSE, TR_RESUME or TR_STOP.
03432 @param run_number New run number. If zero, use current run number plus one.
03433 @param errstr returned error string.
03434 @param errstr_size Size of error string.
03435 @param async_flag SYNC: synchronization flag (SYNC:wait completion, ASYNC: retun immediately)
03436 @param debug_flag If 1 output debugging information, if 2 output via cm_msg().
03437 @return CM_SUCCESS, <error> error code from remote client
03438 */
03439 INT cm_transition1(INT transition, INT run_number, char *errstr, INT errstr_size, INT async_flag,
03440                    INT debug_flag)
03441 {
03442    INT i, j, status, idx, size, sequence_number, port, state, old_timeout, n_tr_clients;
03443    HNDLE hDB, hRootKey, hSubkey, hKey, hKeylocal, hConn, hKeyTrans;
03444    DWORD seconds;
03445    char host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH], client_name[NAME_LENGTH], str[256], error[256], tr_key_name[256];
03446    char *trname = "unknown";
03447    KEY key;
03448    BOOL deferred;
03449    PROGRAM_INFO program_info;
03450    TR_CLIENT *tr_client;
03451    int connect_timeout = 10000;
03452    int timeout = 120000;
03453    int t0, t1;
03454 
03455    deferred = (transition & TR_DEFERRED) > 0;
03456    transition &= ~TR_DEFERRED;
03457 
03458    /* check for valid transition */
03459    if (transition != TR_START && transition != TR_STOP && transition != TR_PAUSE && transition != TR_RESUME
03460        && transition != TR_STARTABORT) {
03461       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Invalid transition request \"%d\"", transition);
03462       if (errstr != NULL)
03463          strlcpy(errstr, "Invalid transition request", errstr_size);
03464       return CM_INVALID_TRANSITION;
03465    }
03466 
03467    /* get key of local client */
03468    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKeylocal);
03469 
03470    if (errstr != NULL)
03471       strlcpy(errstr, "Unknown error", errstr_size);
03472 
03473    if (debug_flag == 0) {
03474       size = sizeof(i);
03475       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Transition debug flag", &debug_flag, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03476    }
03477 
03478    /* do detached transition via mtransition tool */
03479    if (async_flag == DETACH) {
03480       char *args[100], path[256];
03481       int iarg = 0;
03482       char debug_arg[256];
03483       char start_arg[256];
03484       char expt_name[256];
03485       extern RPC_SERVER_CONNECTION _server_connection;
03486 
03487       path[0] = 0;
03488       if (getenv("MIDASSYS")) {
03489          strlcpy(path, getenv("MIDASSYS"), sizeof(path));
03490          strlcat(path, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR, sizeof(path));
03491 #ifdef OS_LINUX
03492 #ifdef OS_DARWIN
03493          strlcat(path, "darwin/bin/", sizeof(path));
03494 #else
03495          strlcat(path, "linux/bin/", sizeof(path));
03496 #endif
03497 #else
03498 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03499          strlcat(path, "nt/bin/", sizeof(path));
03500 #endif
03501 #endif         
03502       }
03503       strlcat(path, "mtransition", sizeof(path));
03504               
03505       args[iarg++] = path;
03506 
03507       if (_server_connection.send_sock) {
03508          /* if connected to mserver, pass connection info to mtransition */
03509          args[iarg++] = "-h";
03510          args[iarg++] = _server_connection.host_name;
03511          args[iarg++] = "-e";
03512          args[iarg++] = _server_connection.exp_name;
03513       } else {
03514          /* get experiment name from ODB */
03515          size = sizeof(expt_name);
03516          db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Name", expt_name, &size, TID_STRING, FALSE);
03517 
03518          args[iarg++] = "-e";
03519          args[iarg++] = expt_name;
03520       }
03521 
03522       if (debug_flag) {
03523          args[iarg++] = "-d";
03524 
03525          sprintf(debug_arg, "%d", debug_flag);
03526          args[iarg++] = debug_arg;
03527       }
03528 
03529       if (transition == TR_STOP)
03530          args[iarg++] = "STOP";
03531       else if (transition == TR_PAUSE)
03532          args[iarg++] = "PAUSE";
03533       else if (transition == TR_RESUME)
03534          args[iarg++] = "RESUME";
03535       else if (transition == TR_START) {
03536          args[iarg++] = "START";
03537 
03538          sprintf(start_arg, "%d", run_number);
03539          args[iarg++] = start_arg;
03540       }
03541 
03542       args[iarg++] = NULL;
03543 
03544       if (0)
03545          for (iarg = 0; args[iarg] != NULL; iarg++)
03546             printf("arg[%d] [%s]\n", iarg, args[iarg]);
03547 
03548       status = ss_spawnv(P_DETACH, args[0], args);
03549 
03550       if (status != SUCCESS) {
03551          if (errstr != NULL)
03552             sprintf(errstr, "Cannot execute mtransition, ss_spawnvp() returned %d", status);
03553          return CM_SET_ERROR;
03554       }
03555 
03556       return CM_SUCCESS;
03557    }
03558 
03559    /* if no run number is given, get it from DB */
03560    if (run_number == 0) {
03561       size = sizeof(run_number);
03562       status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Run number", &run_number, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03563       assert(status == SUCCESS);
03564    }
03565 
03566    if (run_number <= 0) {
03567       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "aborting on attempt to use invalid run number %d", run_number);
03568       abort();
03569    }
03570 
03571    /* check if transition in progress */
03572    if (!deferred) {
03573       i = 0;
03574       size = sizeof(i);
03575       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Transition in progress", &i, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03576       if (i == 1) {
03577          sprintf(errstr, "Start/Stop transition %d already in progress, please try again later\n", i);
03578          strlcat(errstr, "or set \"/Runinfo/Transition in progress\" manually to zero.\n", errstr_size);
03579          return CM_TRANSITION_IN_PROGRESS;
03580       }
03581    }
03582 
03583    /* get transition timeout for rpc connect */
03584    size = sizeof(timeout);
03585    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Transition connect timeout", &connect_timeout, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03586 
03587    if (connect_timeout < 1000)
03588       connect_timeout = 1000;
03589 
03590    /* get transition timeout */
03591    size = sizeof(timeout);
03592    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Transition timeout", &timeout, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03593 
03594    if (timeout < 1000)
03595       timeout = 1000;
03596 
03597    /* indicate transition in progress */
03598    i = transition;
03599    db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Transition in progress", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03600 
03601    /* clear run abort flag */
03602    i = 0;
03603    db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Start abort", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03604 
03605    /* Set new run number in ODB */
03606    if (transition == TR_START) {
03607       if (debug_flag == 1)
03608          printf("Setting run number %d in ODB\n", run_number);
03609       if (debug_flag == 2)
03610          cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: Setting run number %d in ODB", run_number);
03611 
03612       status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Run number", &run_number, sizeof(run_number), 1, TID_INT);
03613       assert(status == SUCCESS);
03614       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03615          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot set Runinfo/Run number in database");
03616    }
03617 
03618    if (deferred) {
03619       /* remove transition request */
03620       i = 0;
03621       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Requested transition", &i, sizeof(int), 1, TID_INT);
03622    } else {
03623       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hRootKey);
03624       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03625          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot find System/Clients entry in database");
03626          if (errstr != NULL)
03627             strlcpy(errstr, "Cannot find /System/Clients in ODB", errstr_size);
03628          return status;
03629       }
03630 
03631       /* check if deferred transition already in progress */
03632       size = sizeof(i);
03633       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Requested transition", &i, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03634       if (i) {
03635          if (errstr != NULL)
03636             strlcpy(errstr, "Deferred transition already in progress", errstr_size);
03637          return CM_TRANSITION_IN_PROGRESS;
03638       }
03639 
03640       for (i = 0; trans_name[i].name[0] != 0; i++)
03641          if (trans_name[i].transition == transition) {
03642             trname = trans_name[i].name;
03643             break;
03644          }
03645 
03646       sprintf(tr_key_name, "Transition %s DEFERRED", trname);
03647 
03648       /* search database for clients with deferred transition request */
03649       for (i = 0, status = 0;; i++) {
03650          status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hSubkey);
03651          if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
03652             break;
03653 
03654          if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
03655             size = sizeof(sequence_number);
03656             status = db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, tr_key_name, &sequence_number, &size, TID_INT, FALSE);
03657 
03658             /* if registered for deferred transition, set flag in ODB and return */
03659             if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
03660                size = NAME_LENGTH;
03661                db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03662                db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Requested transition", &transition, sizeof(int), 1, TID_INT);
03663 
03664                if (debug_flag == 1)
03665                   printf("---- Transition %s deferred by client \"%s\" ----\n", trname, str);
03666                if (debug_flag == 2)
03667                   cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition",
03668                          "cm_transition: ---- Transition %s deferred by client \"%s\" ----", trname, str);
03669 
03670                if (errstr)
03671                   sprintf(errstr, "Transition %s deferred by client \"%s\"", trname, str);
03672 
03673                return CM_DEFERRED_TRANSITION;
03674             }
03675          }
03676       }
03677    }
03678 
03679    /* execute programs on start */
03680    if (transition == TR_START) {
03681       str[0] = 0;
03682       size = sizeof(str);
03683       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Programs/Execute on start run", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03684       if (str[0])
03685          ss_system(str);
03686 
03687       db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Programs", &hRootKey);
03688       if (hRootKey) {
03689          for (i = 0;; i++) {
03690             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hKey);
03691             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
03692                break;
03693 
03694             db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
03695 
03696             /* don't check "execute on xxx" */
03697             if (key.type != TID_KEY)
03698                continue;
03699 
03700             size = sizeof(program_info);
03701             status = db_get_record(hDB, hKey, &program_info, &size, 0);
03702             if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03703                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Cannot get program info record");
03704                continue;
03705             }
03706 
03707             if (program_info.auto_start && program_info.start_command[0])
03708                ss_system(program_info.start_command);
03709          }
03710       }
03711    }
03712 
03713    /* set new start time in database */
03714    if (transition == TR_START) {
03715       /* ASCII format */
03716       cm_asctime(str, sizeof(str));
03717       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Start Time", str, 32, 1, TID_STRING);
03718 
03719       /* reset stop time */
03720       seconds = 0;
03721       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Stop Time binary", &seconds, sizeof(seconds), 1, TID_DWORD);
03722 
03723       /* Seconds since 1.1.1970 */
03724       cm_time(&seconds);
03725       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Start Time binary", &seconds, sizeof(seconds), 1, TID_DWORD);
03726    }
03727 
03728    /* set stop time in database */
03729    if (transition == TR_STOP) {
03730       size = sizeof(state);
03731       status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/State", &state, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03732       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03733          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot get Runinfo/State in database");
03734 
03735       if (state != STATE_STOPPED) {
03736          /* stop time binary */
03737          cm_time(&seconds);
03738          status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Stop Time binary", &seconds, sizeof(seconds), 1, TID_DWORD);
03739          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03740             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot set \"Runinfo/Stop Time binary\" in database");
03741 
03742          /* stop time ascii */
03743          cm_asctime(str, sizeof(str));
03744          status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/Stop Time", str, 32, 1, TID_STRING);
03745          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03746             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot set \"Runinfo/Stop Time\" in database");
03747       }
03748    }
03749 
03750    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hRootKey);
03751    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03752       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot find System/Clients entry in database");
03753       if (errstr)
03754          strlcpy(errstr, "Cannot find /System/Clients in ODB", errstr_size);
03755       return status;
03756    }
03757 
03758    for (i = 0; trans_name[i].name[0] != 0; i++)
03759       if (trans_name[i].transition == transition) {
03760          trname = trans_name[i].name;
03761          break;
03762       }
03763 
03764    /* check that all transition clients are alive */
03765    for (i = 0;;) {
03766       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hSubkey);
03767       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03768          break;
03769 
03770       status = cm_check_client(hDB, hSubkey);
03771 
03772       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
03773          /* this client is alive. Check next one! */
03774          i++;
03775          continue;
03776       }
03777 
03778       assert(status == CM_NO_CLIENT);
03779 
03780       /* start from scratch: removing odb entries as we iterate over them
03781        * does strange things to db_enum_key() */
03782       i = 0;
03783    }
03784 
03785    if (debug_flag == 1)
03786       printf("---- Transition %s started ----\n", trname);
03787    if (debug_flag == 2)
03788       cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: ---- Transition %s started ----", trname);
03789 
03790    sprintf(tr_key_name, "Transition %s", trname);
03791 
03792    /* search database for clients which registered for transition */
03793    n_tr_clients = 0;
03794    tr_client = NULL;
03795 
03796    for (i = 0, status = 0;; i++) {
03797       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hSubkey);
03798       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
03799          break;
03800 
03801       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
03802          status = db_find_key(hDB, hSubkey, tr_key_name, &hKeyTrans);
03803 
03804          if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
03805 
03806             db_get_key(hDB, hKeyTrans, &key);
03807 
03808             for (j = 0; j < key.num_values; j++) {
03809                size = sizeof(sequence_number);
03810                status = db_get_data_index(hDB, hKeyTrans, &sequence_number, &size, j, TID_INT);
03811                assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
03812 
03813                if (tr_client == NULL)
03814                   tr_client = (TR_CLIENT *) malloc(sizeof(TR_CLIENT));
03815                else
03816                   tr_client = (TR_CLIENT *) realloc(tr_client, sizeof(TR_CLIENT) * (n_tr_clients + 1));
03817                assert(tr_client);
03818 
03819                tr_client[n_tr_clients].sequence_number = sequence_number;
03820 
03821                if (hSubkey == hKeylocal) {
03822                   /* remember own client */
03823                   tr_client[n_tr_clients].port = 0;
03824                } else {
03825                   /* get client info */
03826                   size = sizeof(client_name);
03827                   db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", client_name, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03828                   strcpy(tr_client[n_tr_clients].client_name, client_name);
03829 
03830                   size = sizeof(port);
03831                   db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Server Port", &port, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03832                   tr_client[n_tr_clients].port = port;
03833 
03834                   size = sizeof(host_name);
03835                   db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Host", host_name, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03836                   strcpy(tr_client[n_tr_clients].host_name, host_name);
03837                }
03838 
03839                n_tr_clients++;
03840             }
03841          }
03842       }
03843    }
03844 
03845    /* sort clients according to sequence number */
03846    if (n_tr_clients > 1)
03847       qsort(tr_client, n_tr_clients, sizeof(TR_CLIENT), tr_compare);
03848 
03849    /* contact ordered clients for transition */
03850    for (idx = 0; idx < n_tr_clients; idx++) {
03851       /* erase error string */
03852       error[0] = 0;
03853 
03854       if (debug_flag == 1)
03855          printf("\n==== Found client \"%s\" with sequence number %d\n",
03856                 tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].sequence_number);
03857       if (debug_flag == 2)
03858          cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition",
03859                 "cm_transition: ==== Found client \"%s\" with sequence number %d",
03860                 tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].sequence_number);
03861 
03862       /* if own client call transition callback directly */
03863       if (tr_client[idx].port == 0) {
03864          for (i = 0; _trans_table[i].transition; i++)
03865             if (_trans_table[i].transition == transition)
03866                break;
03867 
03868          /* call registered function */
03869          if (_trans_table[i].transition == transition && _trans_table[i].func) {
03870             if (debug_flag == 1)
03871                printf("Calling local transition callback\n");
03872             if (debug_flag == 2)
03873                cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: Calling local transition callback");
03874 
03875             status = _trans_table[i].func(run_number, error);
03876 
03877             if (debug_flag == 1)
03878                printf("Local transition callback finished\n");
03879             if (debug_flag == 2)
03880                cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: Local transition callback finished");
03881          } else
03882             status = CM_SUCCESS;
03883 
03884          if (errstr != NULL)
03885             memcpy(errstr, error,
03886                    (INT) strlen(error) + 1 < errstr_size ? (INT) strlen(error) + 1 : errstr_size);
03887 
03888          if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
03889             /* indicate abort */
03890             i = 1;
03891             db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Start abort", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03892             i = 0;
03893             db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Transition in progress", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03894 
03895             free(tr_client);
03896             return status;
03897          }
03898 
03899       } else {
03900 
03901          /* contact client if transition mask set */
03902          if (debug_flag == 1)
03903             printf("Connecting to client \"%s\" on host %s...\n", tr_client[idx].client_name,
03904                    tr_client[idx].host_name);
03905          if (debug_flag == 2)
03906             cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition",
03907                    "cm_transition: Connecting to client \"%s\" on host %s...",
03908                    tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].host_name);
03909 
03910          /* set our timeout for rpc_client_connect() */
03911          old_timeout = rpc_get_option(-2, RPC_OTIMEOUT);
03912          rpc_set_option(-2, RPC_OTIMEOUT, connect_timeout);
03913 
03914          /* client found -> connect to its server port */
03915          status =
03916              rpc_client_connect(tr_client[idx].host_name, tr_client[idx].port, tr_client[idx].client_name,
03917                                 &hConn);
03918 
03919          rpc_set_option(-2, RPC_OTIMEOUT, old_timeout);
03920 
03921          if (status != RPC_SUCCESS) {
03922             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition",
03923                    "cannot connect to client \"%s\" on host %s, port %d, status %d",
03924                    tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].host_name, tr_client[idx].port, status);
03925             if (errstr != NULL) {
03926                strlcpy(errstr, "Cannot connect to client \'", errstr_size);
03927                strlcat(errstr, tr_client[idx].client_name, errstr_size);
03928                strlcat(errstr, "\'", errstr_size);
03929             }
03930 
03931             /* clients that do not respond to transitions are dead or defective, get rid of them. K.O. */
03932             cm_shutdown(tr_client[idx].client_name, TRUE);
03933             cm_cleanup(tr_client[idx].client_name, TRUE);
03934 
03935             if (transition != TR_STOP) {
03936                /* indicate abort */
03937                i = 1;
03938                db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Start abort", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03939                i = 0;
03940                db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Transition in progress", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
03941 
03942                free(tr_client);
03943                return status;
03944             }
03945 
03946             continue;
03947          }
03948 
03949          if (debug_flag == 1)
03950             printf("Connection established to client \"%s\" on host %s\n",
03951                    tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].host_name);
03952          if (debug_flag == 2)
03953             cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition",
03954                    "cm_transition: Connection established to client \"%s\" on host %s",
03955                    tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].host_name);
03956 
03957          /* call RC_TRANSITION on remote client with increased timeout */
03958          old_timeout = rpc_get_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT);
03959          rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT, timeout);
03960 
03961          /* set FTPC protocol if in async mode */
03962          if (async_flag == ASYNC)
03963             rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
03964 
03965          if (debug_flag == 1)
03966             printf("Executing RPC transition client \"%s\" on host %s...\n",
03967                    tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].host_name);
03968          if (debug_flag == 2)
03969             cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition",
03970                    "cm_transition: Executing RPC transition client \"%s\" on host %s...",
03971                    tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].host_name);
03972 
03973          t0 = ss_millitime();
03974 
03975          status = rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_RC_TRANSITION, transition,
03976                                   run_number, error, errstr_size, tr_client[idx].sequence_number);
03977 
03978          t1 = ss_millitime();
03979 
03980          /* reset timeout */
03981          rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT, old_timeout);
03982 
03983          /* reset protocol */
03984          if (async_flag == ASYNC)
03985             rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_TCP);
03986 
03987          if (debug_flag == 1)
03988             printf("RPC transition finished client \"%s\" on host %s in %d ms with status %d\n",
03989                    tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].host_name, t1 - t0, status);
03990          if (debug_flag == 2)
03991             cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition",
03992                    "cm_transition: RPC transition finished client \"%s\" on host %s in %d ms with status %d",
03993                    tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].host_name, t1 - t0, status);
03994 
03995          if (errstr != NULL) {
03996             if (strlen(error) < 2)
03997                sprintf(errstr, "Unknown error %d from client \'%s\' on host %s", status,
03998                        tr_client[idx].client_name, tr_client[idx].host_name);
03999             else
04000                memcpy(errstr, error,
04001                       (INT) strlen(error) + 1 < (INT) errstr_size ? (INT) strlen(error) + 1 : errstr_size);
04002          }
04003 
04004          if (transition != TR_STOP && status != CM_SUCCESS) {
04005             /* indicate abort */
04006             i = 1;
04007             db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Start abort", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
04008             i = 0;
04009             db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Transition in progress", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
04010 
04011             free(tr_client);
04012             return status;
04013          }
04014       }
04015    }
04016 
04017    if (tr_client)
04018       free(tr_client);
04019 
04020    if (debug_flag == 1)
04021       printf("\n---- Transition %s finished ----\n", trname);
04022    if (debug_flag == 2)
04023       cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition", "cm_transition: ---- Transition %s finished ----", trname);
04024 
04025    /* set new run state in database */
04026    if (transition == TR_START || transition == TR_RESUME)
04027       state = STATE_RUNNING;
04028 
04029    if (transition == TR_PAUSE)
04030       state = STATE_PAUSED;
04031 
04032    if (transition == TR_STOP)
04033       state = STATE_STOPPED;
04034 
04035    if (transition == TR_STARTABORT)
04036       state = STATE_STOPPED;
04037 
04038    size = sizeof(state);
04039    status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/State", &state, size, 1, TID_INT);
04040    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
04041       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot set Runinfo/State in database");
04042 
04043    /* send notification message */
04044    str[0] = 0;
04045    if (transition == TR_START)
04046       sprintf(str, "Run #%d started", run_number);
04047    if (transition == TR_STOP)
04048       sprintf(str, "Run #%d stopped", run_number);
04049    if (transition == TR_PAUSE)
04050       sprintf(str, "Run #%d paused", run_number);
04051    if (transition == TR_RESUME)
04052       sprintf(str, "Run #%d resumed", run_number);
04053    if (transition == TR_STARTABORT)
04054       sprintf(str, "Run #%d start aborted", run_number);
04055 
04056    if (str[0])
04057       cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition", str);
04058 
04059    /* lock/unlock ODB values if present */
04060    db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Lock when running", &hKey);
04061    if (hKey) {
04062       if (state == STATE_STOPPED)
04063          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, TRUE);
04064       else
04065          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
04066    }
04067 
04068    /* flush online database */
04069    if (transition == TR_STOP)
04070       db_flush_database(hDB);
04071 
04072    /* execute/stop programs on stop */
04073    if (transition == TR_STOP) {
04074       str[0] = 0;
04075       size = sizeof(str);
04076       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Programs/Execute on stop run", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
04077       if (str[0])
04078          ss_system(str);
04079 
04080       db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Programs", &hRootKey);
04081       if (hRootKey) {
04082          for (i = 0;; i++) {
04083             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hKey);
04084             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
04085                break;
04086 
04087             db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
04088 
04089             /* don't check "execute on xxx" */
04090             if (key.type != TID_KEY)
04091                continue;
04092 
04093             size = sizeof(program_info);
04094             status = db_get_record(hDB, hKey, &program_info, &size, 0);
04095             if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
04096                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Cannot get program info record");
04097                continue;
04098             }
04099 
04100             if (program_info.auto_stop)
04101                cm_shutdown(key.name, FALSE);
04102          }
04103       }
04104    }
04105 
04106 
04107    /* indicate success */
04108    i = 0;
04109    db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Transition in progress", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
04110 
04111    if (errstr != NULL)
04112       strlcpy(errstr, "Success", errstr_size);
04113 
04114    return CM_SUCCESS;
04115 }
04116 
04117 INT cm_transition(INT transition, INT run_number, char *errstr, INT errstr_size, INT async_flag,
04118                   INT debug_flag)
04119 {
04120    int status;
04121 
04122    status = cm_transition1(transition, run_number, errstr, errstr_size, async_flag, debug_flag);
04123 
04124    if (transition == TR_START && status != CM_SUCCESS) {
04125       cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Could not start a run: cm_transition() status %d, message \'%s\'",
04126              status, errstr);
04127       cm_transition1(TR_STARTABORT, run_number, NULL, 0, async_flag, debug_flag);
04128    }
04129 
04130    return status;
04131 }
04132 
04133 
04134 
04135 /**dox***************************************************************/
04136 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
04137 
04138 /********************************************************************/
04139 INT cm_dispatch_ipc(char *message, int s)
04140 /********************************************************************\
04141 
04142   Routine: cm_dispatch_ipc
04143 
04144   Purpose: Called from ss_suspend if an IPC message arrives
04145 
04146   Input:
04147     INT   msg               IPC message we got, MSG_ODB/MSG_BM
04148     INT   p1, p2            Optional parameters
04149     int   s                 Optional server socket
04150 
04151   Output:
04152     none
04153 
04154   Function value:
04155     CM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04156 
04157 \********************************************************************/
04158 {
04159    if (message[0] == 'O') {
04160       HNDLE hDB, hKey;
04161       sscanf(message + 2, "%d %d", &hDB, &hKey);
04162       return db_update_record(hDB, hKey, s);
04163    }
04164 
04165    /* message == "B  " means "resume event sender" */
04166    if (message[0] == 'B' && message[2] != ' ') {
04167       char str[80];
04168 
04169       strcpy(str, message + 2);
04170       if (strchr(str, ' '))
04171          *strchr(str, ' ') = 0;
04172 
04173       if (s)
04174          return bm_notify_client(str, s);
04175       else
04176          return bm_push_event(str);
04177    }
04178 
04179    return CM_SUCCESS;
04180 }
04181 
04182 /********************************************************************/
04183 static BOOL _ctrlc_pressed = FALSE;
04184 
04185 void cm_ctrlc_handler(int sig)
04186 {
04187    int i;
04188 
04189    i = sig;                     /* avoid compiler warning */
04190 
04191    if (_ctrlc_pressed) {
04192       printf("Received 2nd break. Hard abort.\n");
04193       exit(0);
04194    }
04195    printf("Received break. Aborting...\n");
04196    _ctrlc_pressed = TRUE;
04197 
04198    ss_ctrlc_handler(cm_ctrlc_handler);
04199 }
04200 
04201 BOOL cm_is_ctrlc_pressed()
04202 {
04203    return _ctrlc_pressed;
04204 }
04205 
04206 void cm_ack_ctrlc_pressed()
04207 {
04208    _ctrlc_pressed = FALSE;
04209 }
04210 
04211 
04212 /**dox***************************************************************/
04213 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
04214 
04215 /********************************************************************/
04216 /**
04217 Central yield functions for clients. This routine should
04218 be called in an infinite loop by a client in order to
04219 give the MIDAS system the opportunity to receive commands
04220 over RPC channels, update database records and receive
04221 events.
04222 @param millisec         Timeout in millisec. If no message is
04223                         received during the specified timeout,
04224                         the routine returns. If millisec=-1,
04225                         it only returns when receiving an
04226                         RPC_SHUTDOWN message.
04227 @return CM_SUCCESS, RPC_SHUTDOWN
04228 */
04229 INT cm_yield(INT millisec)
04230 {
04231    INT status;
04232    BOOL bMore;
04233    static DWORD last_checked = 0;
04234 
04235    /* check for ctrl-c */
04236    if (_ctrlc_pressed)
04237       return RPC_SHUTDOWN;
04238 
04239    /* flush the cm_msg buffer */
04240    cm_msg_flush_buffer();
04241 
04242    /* check for available events */
04243    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
04244       bMore = bm_poll_event(TRUE);
04245       if (bMore)
04246          status = ss_suspend(0, 0);
04247       else
04248          status = ss_suspend(millisec, 0);
04249 
04250       return status;
04251    }
04252 
04253    /* check alarms once every 10 seconds */
04254    if (!rpc_is_remote() && ss_time() - last_checked > 10) {
04255       al_check();
04256       last_checked = ss_time();
04257    }
04258 
04259    bMore = bm_check_buffers();
04260 
04261    if (bMore) {
04262       /* if events available, quickly check other IPC channels */
04263       status = ss_suspend(0, 0);
04264    } else {
04265       /* mark event buffers for ready-to-receive */
04266       bm_mark_read_waiting(TRUE);
04267 
04268       status = ss_suspend(millisec, 0);
04269 
04270       /* unmark event buffers for ready-to-receive */
04271       bm_mark_read_waiting(FALSE);
04272    }
04273 
04274    /* flush the cm_msg buffer */
04275    cm_msg_flush_buffer();
04276 
04277    return status;
04278 }
04279 
04280 /********************************************************************/
04281 /**
04282 Executes command via system() call
04283 @param    command          Command string to execute
04284 @param    result           stdout of command
04285 @param    bufsize          string size in byte
04286 @return   CM_SUCCESS
04287 */
04288 INT cm_execute(const char *command, char *result, INT bufsize)
04289 {
04290    char str[256];
04291    INT n;
04292    int fh;
04293 
04294    if (rpc_is_remote())
04295       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_EXECUTE, command, result, bufsize);
04296 
04297    if (bufsize > 0) {
04298       strcpy(str, command);
04299       sprintf(str, "%s > %d.tmp", command, ss_getpid());
04300 
04301       system(str);
04302 
04303       sprintf(str, "%d.tmp", ss_getpid());
04304       fh = open(str, O_RDONLY, 0644);
04305       result[0] = 0;
04306       if (fh) {
04307          n = read(fh, result, bufsize - 1);
04308          result[MAX(0, n)] = 0;
04309          close(fh);
04310       }
04311       remove(str);
04312    } else
04313       system(command);
04314 
04315    return CM_SUCCESS;
04316 }
04317 
04318 
04319 
04320 /**dox***************************************************************/
04321 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
04322 
04323 /********************************************************************/
04324 INT cm_register_function(INT id, INT(*func) (INT, void **))
04325 /********************************************************************\
04326 
04327   Routine: cm_register_function
04328 
04329   Purpose: Call rpc_register_function and publish the registered
04330            function under system/clients/<pid>/RPC
04331 
04332   Input:
04333     INT      id             RPC ID
04334     INT      *func          New dispatch function
04335 
04336   Output:
04337    <implicit: func gets copied to rpc_list>
04338 
04339   Function value:
04340    CM_SUCCESS               Successful completion
04341    RPC_INVALID_ID           RPC ID not found
04342 
04343 \********************************************************************/
04344 {
04345    HNDLE hDB, hKey;
04346    INT status;
04347    char str[80];
04348 
04349    status = rpc_register_function(id, func);
04350    if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
04351       return status;
04352 
04353    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
04354 
04355    /* create new key for this id */
04356    status = 1;
04357    sprintf(str, "RPC/%d", id);
04358 
04359    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE, TRUE);
04360    status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, str, &status, sizeof(BOOL), 1, TID_BOOL);
04361    db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
04362 
04363    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
04364       return status;
04365 
04366    return CM_SUCCESS;
04367 }
04368 
04369 
04370 /**dox***************************************************************/
04371 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
04372 
04373 /**dox***************************************************************/
04374                                                                                                                                /** @} *//* end of cmfunctionc */
04375 
04376 /**dox***************************************************************/
04377 /** @addtogroup bmfunctionc
04378  *
04379  *  @{  */
04380 
04381 /********************************************************************\
04382 *                                                                    *
04383 *                 bm_xxx  -  Buffer Manager Functions                *
04384 *                                                                    *
04385 \********************************************************************/
04386 
04387 /********************************************************************/
04388 /**
04389 Check if an event matches a given event request by the
04390 event id and trigger mask
04391 @param event_id      Event ID of request
04392 @param trigger_mask  Trigger mask of request
04393 @param pevent    Pointer to event to check
04394 @return TRUE      if event matches request
04395 */
04396 INT bm_match_event(short int event_id, short int trigger_mask, EVENT_HEADER * pevent)
04397 {
04398    if ((pevent->event_id & 0xF000) == EVENTID_FRAG1 || (pevent->event_id & 0xF000) == EVENTID_FRAG)
04399       /* fragmented event */
04400       return ((event_id == EVENTID_ALL ||
04401                event_id == (pevent->event_id & 0x0FFF)) &&
04402               (trigger_mask == TRIGGER_ALL || (trigger_mask & pevent->trigger_mask)));
04403 
04404    return ((event_id == EVENTID_ALL ||
04405             event_id == pevent->event_id) && (trigger_mask == TRIGGER_ALL
04406                                               || (trigger_mask & pevent->trigger_mask)));
04407 }
04408 
04409 /********************************************************************/
04410 /**
04411 Called to forcibly disconnect given client from a data buffer
04412 */
04413 void bm_remove_client_locked(BUFFER_HEADER * pheader, int j)
04414 {
04415    int k, nc;
04416    BUFFER_CLIENT *pbctmp;
04417 
04418    /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
04419    memset(&(pheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(BUFFER_CLIENT));
04420 
04421    /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
04422    for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
04423       if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
04424          break;
04425    pheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
04426 
04427    /* count new number of clients */
04428    for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
04429       if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
04430          nc++;
04431    pheader->num_clients = nc;
04432 
04433    /* check if anyone is waiting and wake him up */
04434    pbctmp = pheader->client;
04435 
04436    for (k = 0; k < pheader->max_client_index; k++, pbctmp++)
04437       if (pbctmp->pid && (pbctmp->write_wait || pbctmp->read_wait))
04438          ss_resume(pbctmp->port, "B  ");
04439 }
04440 
04441 /********************************************************************/
04442 /**
04443 Check all clients on buffer, remove invalid clients
04444 */
04445 static void bm_cleanup_buffer_locked(int i, const char *who, DWORD actual_time)
04446 {
04447    BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
04448    BUFFER_CLIENT *pbclient;
04449    int j;
04450
