04451    pheader = _buffer[i].buffer_header;
04452    pbclient = pheader->client;
04453 
04454    /* now check other clients */
04455    for (j = 0; j < pheader->max_client_index; j++, pbclient++) {
04456       
04457 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04458 #ifdef ESRCH
04459       if (pbclient->pid) {
04460          errno = 0;
04461          kill(pbclient->pid, 0);
04462          if (errno == ESRCH) {
04463             cm_msg(MINFO, "bm_cleanup", "Client \'%s\' on buffer \'%s\' removed by %s because process pid %d does not exist", pbclient->name, pheader->name, who, pbclient->pid);
04464             
04465             bm_remove_client_locked(pheader, j);
04466             continue;
04467          }
04468       }
04469 #endif
04470 #endif
04471       
04472       /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
04473       if (pbclient->pid && pbclient->watchdog_timeout > 0 &&
04474           actual_time > pbclient->last_activity &&
04475           actual_time - pbclient->last_activity > pbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
04476          
04477          /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
04478          actual_time = ss_millitime();
04479          if (pbclient->pid && pbclient->watchdog_timeout > 0 &&
04480              actual_time > pbclient->last_activity &&
04481              actual_time - pbclient->last_activity > pbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
04482             
04483             cm_msg(MINFO, "bm_cleanup", "Client \'%s\' on buffer \'%s\' removed by %s (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
04484                    pbclient->name, pheader->name, who,
04485                    (actual_time - pbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
04486                    pbclient->watchdog_timeout / 1000.0);
04487             
04488             bm_remove_client_locked(pheader, j);
04489          }
04490       }
04491    }
04492 }
04493 
04494 /**
04495 Update last activity time
04496 */
04497 static void cm_update_last_activity(DWORD actual_time)
04498 {
04499    int i, idx;
04500 
04501    /* check buffers */
04502    for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
04503       if (_buffer[i].attached) {
04504          idx = bm_validate_client_index(&_buffer[i], FALSE);
04505          if (idx >= 0) {
04506             _buffer[i].buffer_header->client[idx].last_activity = actual_time;
04507          }
04508       }
04509 
04510    /* check online databases */
04511    for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
04512       if (_database[i].attached) {
04513          /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
04514          _database[i].database_header->client[_database[i].client_index].last_activity = actual_time;
04515       }
04516 }
04517 
04518 /**
04519 Check all clients on all buffers, remove invalid clients
04520 */
04521 static void bm_cleanup(const char *who, DWORD actual_time, BOOL wrong_interval)
04522 {
04523    BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
04524    BUFFER_CLIENT *pbclient;
04525    int i, idx;
04526 
04527    /* check buffers */
04528    for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
04529       if (_buffer[i].attached) {
04530          /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
04531 
04532          bm_lock_buffer(i+1);
04533 
04534          pheader = _buffer[i].buffer_header;
04535          pbclient = pheader->client;
04536          idx = bm_validate_client_index(&_buffer[i], TRUE);
04537          pbclient[idx].last_activity = actual_time;
04538 
04539          /* don't check other clients if interval is strange */
04540          if (!wrong_interval)
04541            bm_cleanup_buffer_locked(i, who, actual_time);
04542 
04543          bm_unlock_buffer(i+1);
04544       }
04545 }
04546 
04547 /********************************************************************/
04548 /**
04549 Open an event buffer.
04550 Two default buffers are created by the system.
04551 The "SYSTEM" buffer is used to
04552 exchange events and the "SYSMSG" buffer is used to exchange system messages.
04553 The name and size of the event buffers is defined in midas.h as
04554 EVENT_BUFFER_NAME and 2*MAX_EVENT_SIZE.
04555 Following example opens the "SYSTEM" buffer, requests events with ID 1 and
04556 enters a main loop. Events are then received in process_event()
04557 \code
04558 #include <stdio.h>
04559 #include "midas.h"
04560 void process_event(HNDLE hbuf, HNDLE request_id,
04561            EVENT_HEADER *pheader, void *pevent)
04562 {
04563   printf("Received event #%d\r",
04564   pheader->serial_number);
04565 }
04566 main()
04567 {
04568   INT status, request_id;
04569   HNDLE hbuf;
04570   status = cm_connect_experiment("pc810", "Sample", "Simple Analyzer", NULL);
04571   if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
04572   return 1;
04573   bm_open_buffer(EVENT_BUFFER_NAME, 2*MAX_EVENT_SIZE, &hbuf);
04574   bm_request_event(hbuf, 1, TRIGGER_ALL, GET_ALL, request_id, process_event);
04575 
04576   do
04577   {
04578    status = cm_yield(1000);
04579   } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN && status != SS_ABORT);
04580   cm_disconnect_experiment();
04581   return 0;
04582 }
04583 \endcode
04584 @param buffer_name Name of buffer
04585 @param buffer_size Default size of buffer in bytes. Can by overwritten with ODB value
04586 @param buffer_handle Buffer handle returned by function
04587 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_CREATED <br>
04588 BM_NO_SHM Shared memory cannot be created <br>
04589 BM_NO_SEMAPHORE Semaphore cannot be created <br>
04590 BM_NO_MEMORY Not enough memory to create buffer descriptor <br>
04591 BM_MEMSIZE_MISMATCH Buffer size conflicts with an existing buffer of
04592 different size <br>
04593 BM_INVALID_PARAM Invalid parameter
04594 */
04595 INT bm_open_buffer(char *buffer_name, INT buffer_size, INT * buffer_handle)
04596 {
04597    INT status;
04598 
04599    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
04600       status = rpc_call(RPC_BM_OPEN_BUFFER, buffer_name, buffer_size, buffer_handle);
04601       bm_mark_read_waiting(TRUE);
04602       return status;
04603    }
04604 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04605    {
04606       INT i, handle, size;
04607       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
04608       BOOL shm_created;
04609       HNDLE shm_handle;
04610       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
04611       HNDLE hDB, odb_key;
04612       char odb_path[256];
04613       void *p;
04614 
04615       bm_cleanup("bm_open_buffer", ss_millitime(), FALSE);
04616 
04617       if (!buffer_name || !buffer_name[0]) {
04618          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_open_buffer", "cannot open buffer with zero name");
04619          return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
04620       }
04621 
04622       status = cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &odb_key);
04623 
04624       if (status != SUCCESS || hDB == 0) {
04625          //cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_open_buffer", "cannot open buffer \'%s\' - not connected to ODB", buffer_name);
04626          return BM_NO_SHM;
04627       }
04628 
04629       /* get buffer size from ODB, user parameter as default if not present in ODB */
04630       strlcpy(odb_path, "/Experiment/Buffer sizes/", sizeof(odb_path));
04631       strlcat(odb_path, buffer_name, sizeof(odb_path));
04632 
04633       size = sizeof(INT);
04634       status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, odb_path, &buffer_size, &size, TID_DWORD, TRUE);
04635 
04636       if (buffer_size <= 0 || buffer_size > 1 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024) {
04637          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_open_buffer", "cannot open buffer \'%s\' - invalid buffer size %d", buffer_name, buffer_size);
04638          return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
04639       }
04640 
04641       /* allocate new space for the new buffer descriptor */
04642       if (_buffer_entries == 0) {
04643          _buffer = (BUFFER *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(BUFFER));
04644          memset(_buffer, 0, sizeof(BUFFER));
04645          if (_buffer == NULL) {
04646             *buffer_handle = 0;
04647             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
04648          }
04649 
04650          _buffer_entries = 1;
04651          i = 0;
04652       } else {
04653          /* check if buffer alreay is open */
04654          for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
04655             if (_buffer[i].attached && equal_ustring(_buffer[i].buffer_header->name, buffer_name)) {
04656                if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
04657                    _buffer[i].index != rpc_get_server_acception())
04658                   continue;
04659 
04660                if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE && _buffer[i].index != ss_gettid())
04661                   continue;
04662 
04663                *buffer_handle = i + 1;
04664                return BM_SUCCESS;
04665             }
04666 
04667          /* check for a deleted entry */
04668          for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
04669             if (!_buffer[i].attached)
04670                break;
04671 
04672          /* if not found, create new one */
04673          if (i == _buffer_entries) {
04674             _buffer = (BUFFER *) realloc(_buffer, sizeof(BUFFER) * (_buffer_entries + 1));
04675             memset(&_buffer[_buffer_entries], 0, sizeof(BUFFER));
04676 
04677             _buffer_entries++;
04678             if (_buffer == NULL) {
04679                _buffer_entries--;
04680                *buffer_handle = 0;
04681                return BM_NO_MEMORY;
04682             }
04683          }
04684       }
04685 
04686       handle = i;
04687 
04688       if (strlen(buffer_name) >= NAME_LENGTH)
04689          buffer_name[NAME_LENGTH] = 0;
04690 
04691       /* reduce buffer size is larger than maximum */
04692 #ifdef MAX_SHM_SIZE
04693       if (buffer_size + sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER) > MAX_SHM_SIZE)
04694          buffer_size = MAX_SHM_SIZE - sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER);
04695 #endif
04696 
04697       /* open shared memory region */
04698       //status = ss_shm_open(buffer_name, sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER) + buffer_size,
04699       //               (void **) &(_buffer[handle].buffer_header), &shm_handle, FALSE);
04700       status = ss_shm_open(buffer_name, sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER) + buffer_size, &p, &shm_handle, FALSE);
04701       _buffer[handle].buffer_header = (BUFFER_HEADER *) p;
04702 
04703       if (status != SS_SUCCESS && status != SS_CREATED) {
04704          *buffer_handle = 0;
04705          _buffer_entries--;
04706          return BM_NO_SHM;
04707       }
04708 
04709       pheader = _buffer[handle].buffer_header;
04710 
04711       shm_created = (status == SS_CREATED);
04712 
04713       if (shm_created) {
04714          /* setup header info if buffer was created */
04715          memset(pheader, 0, sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER) + buffer_size);
04716 
04717          strcpy(pheader->name, buffer_name);
04718          pheader->size = buffer_size;
04719       } else {
04720          /* check if buffer size is identical */
04721          if (pheader->size != buffer_size) {
04722             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_open_buffer", "Requested buffer size (%d) differs from existing size (%d)",
04723                    buffer_size, pheader->size);
04724             *buffer_handle = 0;
04725             _buffer_entries--;
04726             return BM_MEMSIZE_MISMATCH;
04727          }
04728       }
04729 
04730       /* create semaphore for the buffer */
04731       status = ss_semaphore_create(buffer_name, &(_buffer[handle].semaphore));
04732       if (status != SS_CREATED && status != SS_SUCCESS) {
04733          *buffer_handle = 0;
04734          _buffer_entries--;
04735          return BM_NO_SEMAPHORE;
04736       }
04737 
04738       /* first lock buffer */
04739       bm_lock_buffer(handle + 1);
04740 
04741       bm_cleanup_buffer_locked(handle, "bm_open_buffer", ss_millitime());
04742 
04743       /*
04744          Now we have a BUFFER_HEADER, so let's setup a CLIENT
04745          structure in that buffer. The information there can also
04746          be seen by other processes.
04747        */
04748 
04749       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++)
04750          if (pheader->client[i].pid == 0)
04751             break;
04752 
04753       if (i == MAX_CLIENTS) {
04754          bm_unlock_buffer(handle + 1);
04755          *buffer_handle = 0;
04756          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_open_buffer", "buffer \'%s\' maximum number of clients exceeded", buffer_name);
04757          return BM_NO_SLOT;
04758       }
04759 
04760       /* store slot index in _buffer structure */
04761       _buffer[handle].client_index = i;
04762 
04763       /*
04764          Save the index of the last client of that buffer so that later only
04765          the clients 0..max_client_index-1 have to be searched through.
04766        */
04767       pheader->num_clients++;
04768       if (i + 1 > pheader->max_client_index)
04769          pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
04770 
04771       /* setup buffer header and client structure */
04772       pclient = &pheader->client[i];
04773 
04774       memset(pclient, 0, sizeof(BUFFER_CLIENT));
04775       /* use client name previously set by bm_set_name */
04776       cm_get_client_info(pclient->name);
04777       if (pclient->name[0] == 0)
04778          strcpy(pclient->name, "unknown");
04779       pclient->pid = ss_getpid();
04780 
04781       ss_suspend_get_port(&pclient->port);
04782 
04783       pclient->read_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
04784       pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
04785 
04786       cm_get_watchdog_params(NULL, &pclient->watchdog_timeout);
04787 
04788       bm_unlock_buffer(handle + 1);
04789 
04790       /* setup _buffer entry */
04791       _buffer[handle].buffer_data = _buffer[handle].buffer_header + 1;
04792       _buffer[handle].attached = TRUE;
04793       _buffer[handle].shm_handle = shm_handle;
04794       _buffer[handle].callback = FALSE;
04795 
04796       /* remember to which connection acutal buffer belongs */
04797       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE)
04798          _buffer[handle].index = rpc_get_server_acception();
04799       else
04800          _buffer[handle].index = ss_gettid();
04801 
04802       *buffer_handle = (handle + 1);
04803 
04804       /* initialize buffer counters */
04805       bm_init_buffer_counters(handle + 1);
04806 
04807       /* setup dispatcher for receive events */
04808       ss_suspend_set_dispatch(CH_IPC, 0, (int (*)(void)) cm_dispatch_ipc);
04809 
04810       bm_cleanup("bm_open_buffer", ss_millitime(), FALSE);
04811 
04812       if (shm_created)
04813          return BM_CREATED;
04814    }
04815 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04816 
04817    return BM_SUCCESS;
04818 }
04819 
04820 /********************************************************************/
04821 /**
04822 Closes an event buffer previously opened with bm_open_buffer().
04823 @param buffer_handle buffer handle
04824 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE
04825 */
04826 INT bm_close_buffer(INT buffer_handle)
04827 {
04828    if (rpc_is_remote())
04829       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_CLOSE_BUFFER, buffer_handle);
04830 
04831 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04832    {
04833       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
04834       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
04835       INT i, j, idx, destroy_flag;
04836 
04837       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
04838          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_close_buffer", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
04839          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
04840       }
04841 
04842       /* check if buffer got already closed */
04843       if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
04844          return BM_SUCCESS;
04845       }
04846 
04847       /*
04848          Check if buffer was opened by current thread. This is necessary
04849          in the server process where one thread may not close the buffer
04850          of other threads.
04851        */
04852 
04853       idx = bm_validate_client_index(&_buffer[buffer_handle - 1], FALSE);
04854       pheader = _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header;
04855 
04856       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
04857           _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception()) {
04858          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
04859       }
04860 
04861       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE
04862           && _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].index != ss_gettid()) {
04863          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
04864       }
04865 
04866       if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
04867          /* don't produce error, since bm_close_all_buffers() might want to close an
04868             already closed buffer */
04869          return BM_SUCCESS;
04870       }
04871 
04872       /* delete all requests for this buffer */
04873       for (i = 0; i < _request_list_entries; i++)
04874          if (_request_list[i].buffer_handle == buffer_handle)
04875             bm_delete_request(i);
04876 
04877       /* first lock buffer */
04878       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
04879 
04880       /* mark entry in _buffer as empty */
04881       _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached = FALSE;
04882 
04883       if (idx >= 0) {
04884          /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
04885          memset(&(pheader->client[idx]), 0, sizeof(BUFFER_CLIENT));
04886       }
04887 
04888       /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
04889       for (i = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; i >= 0; i--)
04890          if (pheader->client[i].pid != 0)
04891             break;
04892       pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
04893 
04894       /* count new number of clients */
04895       for (i = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, j = 0; i >= 0; i--)
04896          if (pheader->client[i].pid != 0)
04897             j++;
04898       pheader->num_clients = j;
04899 
04900       destroy_flag = (pheader->num_clients == 0);
04901 
04902       /* free cache */
04903       if (_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].read_cache_size > 0)
04904          M_FREE(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].read_cache);
04905       if (_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].write_cache_size > 0)
04906          M_FREE(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].write_cache);
04907 
04908       /* check if anyone is waiting and wake him up */
04909       pclient = pheader->client;
04910 
04911       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pclient++)
04912          if (pclient->pid && (pclient->write_wait || pclient->read_wait))
04913             ss_resume(pclient->port, "B  ");
04914 
04915       /* unmap shared memory, delete it if we are the last */
04916       ss_shm_close(pheader->name, _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header,
04917                    _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].shm_handle, destroy_flag);
04918 
04919       /* unlock buffer */
04920       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
04921 
04922       /* delete semaphore */
04923       ss_semaphore_delete(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].semaphore, destroy_flag);
04924 
04925       /* update _buffer_entries */
04926       if (buffer_handle == _buffer_entries)
04927          _buffer_entries--;
04928 
04929       if (_buffer_entries > 0)
04930          _buffer = (BUFFER *) realloc(_buffer, sizeof(BUFFER) * (_buffer_entries));
04931       else {
04932          M_FREE(_buffer);
04933          _buffer = NULL;
04934       }
04935    }
04936 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04937 
04938    return BM_SUCCESS;
04939 }
04940 
04941 /********************************************************************/
04942 /**
04943 Close all open buffers
04944 @return BM_SUCCESS
04945 */
04946 INT bm_close_all_buffers(void)
04947 {
04948    if (rpc_is_remote())
04949       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_CLOSE_ALL_BUFFERS);
04950 
04951 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04952    {
04953       INT i;
04954 
04955       for (i = _buffer_entries; i > 0; i--)
04956          bm_close_buffer(i);
04957    }
04958 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04959 
04960    return BM_SUCCESS;
04961 }
04962 
04963 /**dox***************************************************************/
04964                                                                                                                                /** @} *//* end of bmfunctionc */
04965 
04966 /**dox***************************************************************/
04967 /** @addtogroup cmfunctionc
04968  *
04969  *  @{  */
04970 
04971 /*-- Watchdog routines ---------------------------------------------*/
04972 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04973 
04974 /********************************************************************/
04975 /**
04976 Called at periodic intervals, checks if all clients are
04977 alive. If one process died, its client entries are cleaned up.
04978 @param dummy unused!
04979 */
04980 void cm_watchdog(int dummy)
04981 {
04982    DATABASE_HEADER *pdbheader;
04983    DATABASE_CLIENT *pdbclient;
04984    KEY *pkey;
04985    DWORD actual_time, interval;
04986    INT client_pid;
04987    INT i, j, k, nc, status;
04988    BOOL time_changed, wrong_interval;
04989 
04990    i = dummy;                   /* avoid compiler warning */
04991 
04992    /* return immediately if watchdog has been disabled in meantime */
04993    if (!_call_watchdog)
04994       return;
04995 
04996 #if 0
04997    actual_time = ss_millitime();
04998 
04999    cm_update_last_activity(actual_time);
05000 
05001    if ((actual_time > _watchdog_last_called) && (actual_time - _watchdog_last_called < 10000)) {
05002 
05003       /* Schedule next watchdog call */
05004       if (_call_watchdog)
05005          ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
05006       
05007       return;
05008    }
05009 #endif
05010 
05011    /* prevent deadlock between ODB and SYSMSG by skipping watchdog tests if odb is locked by us */
05012    if (1) {
05013       int count = -1;
05014       HNDLE hDB;
05015 
05016       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
05017 
05018       if (hDB)
05019          count = db_get_lock_cnt(hDB);
05020 
05021       if (count) {
05022          //cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_watchdog", "Called with ODB lock count %d!", count);
05023 
05024          cm_update_last_activity(ss_millitime());
05025 
05026          /* Schedule next watchdog call */
05027          if (_call_watchdog)
05028             ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
05029          
05030          return;
05031       }
05032    }
05033 
05034    /* extra check on watchdog interval */
05035    if (0) {
05036       static time_t last = 0;
05037       time_t now = time(NULL);
05038       fprintf(stderr, "cm_watchdog interval %d\n", (int)(now - last));
05039       last = now;
05040    }
05041 
05042    /* tell system services that we are in async mode ... */
05043    ss_set_async_flag(TRUE);
05044 
05045    /* Calculate the time since last watchdog call. Kill clients if they
05046       are inactive for more than the timeout they specified */
05047    actual_time = ss_millitime();
05048    if (_watchdog_last_called == 0)
05049       _watchdog_last_called = actual_time - WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
05050    interval = actual_time - _watchdog_last_called;
05051 
05052    /* check if system time has been changed more than 10 min */
05053    time_changed = interval > 600000;
05054    wrong_interval = interval < 0.8 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL || interval > 1.2 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
05055 
05056    if (time_changed)
05057       cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_watchdog",
05058              "System time has been changed! last:%dms  now:%dms  delta:%dms",
05059              _watchdog_last_called, actual_time, interval);
05060 
05061    bm_cleanup("cm_watchdog", actual_time, wrong_interval);
05062 
05063    /* check online databases */
05064    for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
05065       if (_database[i].attached) {
05066          /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
05067          pdbheader = _database[i].database_header;
05068          pdbclient = pdbheader->client;
05069          pdbclient[_database[i].client_index].last_activity = actual_time;
05070 
05071          /* don't check other clients if interval is stange */
05072          if (wrong_interval)
05073             continue;
05074 
05075          /* now check other clients */
05076          for (j = 0; j < pdbheader->max_client_index; j++, pdbclient++)
05077             /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
05078             if (pdbclient->pid && pdbclient->watchdog_timeout > 0 &&
05079                 actual_time - pdbclient->last_activity > pdbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
05080                client_pid = pdbclient->pid;
05081 
05082                db_lock_database(i + 1);
05083 
05084                /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
05085                actual_time = ss_millitime();
05086                if (pdbclient->pid && pdbclient->watchdog_timeout &&
05087                    actual_time > pdbclient->last_activity &&
05088                    actual_time - pdbclient->last_activity > pdbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
05089 
05090                   cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_watchdog", "Client \'%s\' (PID %d) on database \'%s\' removed by cm_watchdog (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
05091                          pdbclient->name, client_pid, pdbheader->name,
05092                          (actual_time - pdbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
05093                          pdbclient->watchdog_timeout / 1000.0);
05094 
05095                   /* decrement notify_count for open records and clear exclusive mode */
05096                   for (k = 0; k < pdbclient->max_index; k++)
05097                      if (pdbclient->open_record[k].handle) {
05098                         pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pdbheader + pdbclient->open_record[k].handle);
05099                         if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
05100                            pkey->notify_count--;
05101 
05102                         if (pdbclient->open_record[k].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
05103                            db_set_mode(i + 1, pdbclient->open_record[k].handle, (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
05104                      }
05105 
05106                   status = cm_delete_client_info(i + 1, client_pid);
05107                   if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
05108                      cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_watchdog", "Cannot delete client info for client \'%s\', pid %d from database \'%s\', status %d", pdbclient->name, client_pid, pdbheader->name, status);
05109 
05110                   /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
05111                   memset(&(pdbheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
05112 
05113                   /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
05114                   for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
05115                      if (pdbheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05116                         break;
05117                   pdbheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
05118 
05119                   /* count new number of clients */
05120                   for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
05121                      if (pdbheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05122                         nc++;
05123                   pdbheader->num_clients = nc;
05124                }
05125 
05126                db_unlock_database(i + 1);
05127             }
05128       }
05129 
05130    _watchdog_last_called = actual_time;
05131 
05132    ss_set_async_flag(FALSE);
05133 
05134    /* Schedule next watchdog call */
05135    if (_call_watchdog)
05136       ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
05137 }
05138 
05139 /********************************************************************/
05140 /**
05141 Temporarily disable watchdog calling. Used for tape IO
05142 not to interrupt lengthy operations like mount.
05143 @param flag FALSE for disable, TRUE for re-enable
05144 @return CM_SUCCESS
05145 */
05146 INT cm_enable_watchdog(BOOL flag)
05147 {
05148    static INT timeout = DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT;
05149    static BOOL call_flag = FALSE;
05150 
05151    if (flag) {
05152       if (call_flag)
05153          cm_set_watchdog_params(TRUE, timeout);
05154    } else {
05155       call_flag = _call_watchdog;
05156       timeout = _watchdog_timeout;
05157       if (call_flag)
05158          cm_set_watchdog_params(FALSE, 0);
05159    }
05160 
05161    return CM_SUCCESS;
05162 }
05163 
05164 #endif                          /* local routines */
05165 
05166 /********************************************************************/
05167 /**
05168 Shutdown (exit) other MIDAS client
05169 @param name           Client name or "all" for all clients
05170 @param bUnique        If true, look for the exact client name.
05171                       If false, look for namexxx where xxx is
05172                       a any number.
05173 
05174 @return CM_SUCCESS, CM_NO_CLIENT, DB_NO_KEY
05175 */
05176 INT cm_shutdown(const char *name, BOOL bUnique)
05177 {
05178    INT status, return_status, i, size;
05179    HNDLE hDB, hKeyClient, hKey, hSubkey, hKeyTmp, hConn;
05180    KEY key;
05181    char client_name[NAME_LENGTH], remote_host[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
05182    INT port;
05183    DWORD start_time;
05184 
05185    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKeyClient);
05186 
05187    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hKey);
05188    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
05189       return DB_NO_KEY;
05190 
05191    return_status = CM_NO_CLIENT;
05192 
05193    /* loop over all clients */
05194    for (i = 0;; i++) {
05195       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
05196       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
05197          break;
05198 
05199       /* don't shutdown ourselves */
05200       if (hSubkey == hKeyClient)
05201          continue;
05202 
05203       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
05204          db_get_key(hDB, hSubkey, &key);
05205 
05206          /* contact client */
05207          size = sizeof(client_name);
05208          status = db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", client_name, &size, TID_STRING, FALSE);
05209          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
05210             continue;
05211 
05212          if (!bUnique)
05213             client_name[strlen(name)] = 0;      /* strip number */
05214 
05215          /* check if individual client */
05216          if (!equal_ustring("all", name) && !equal_ustring(client_name, name))
05217             continue;
05218 
05219          size = sizeof(port);
05220          db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Server Port", &port, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
05221 
05222          size = sizeof(remote_host);
05223          db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Host", remote_host, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
05224 
05225          /* client found -> connect to its server port */
05226          status = rpc_client_connect(remote_host, port, client_name, &hConn);
05227          if (status != RPC_SUCCESS) {
05228             int client_pid = atoi(key.name);
05229             return_status = CM_NO_CLIENT;
05230             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_shutdown", "Cannot connect to client \'%s\' on host \'%s\', port %d",
05231                    client_name, remote_host, port);
05232 #ifdef SIGKILL
05233             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_shutdown", "Killing and Deleting client \'%s\' pid %d", client_name,
05234                    client_pid);
05235             kill(client_pid, SIGKILL);
05236             status = cm_delete_client_info(hDB, client_pid);
05237             if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
05238                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_shutdown", "Cannot delete client info for client \'%s\', pid %d, status %d",
05239                       name, client_pid, status);
05240 #endif
05241          } else {
05242             /* call disconnect with shutdown=TRUE */
05243             rpc_client_disconnect(hConn, TRUE);
05244 
05245             /* wait until client has shut down */
05246             start_time = ss_millitime();
05247             do {
05248                ss_sleep(100);
05249                status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, key.name, &hKeyTmp);
05250             } while (status == DB_SUCCESS && (ss_millitime() - start_time < 5000));
05251 
05252             if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
05253                int client_pid = atoi(key.name);
05254                return_status = CM_NO_CLIENT;
05255                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_shutdown", "Client \'%s\' not responding to shutdown command", client_name);
05256 #ifdef SIGKILL
05257                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_shutdown", "Killing and Deleting client \'%s\' pid %d", client_name,
05258                       client_pid);
05259                kill(client_pid, SIGKILL);
05260                status = cm_delete_client_info(hDB, client_pid);
05261                if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
05262                   cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_shutdown",
05263                          "Cannot delete client info for client \'%s\', pid %d, status %d", name, client_pid,
05264                          status);
05265 #endif
05266                return_status = CM_NO_CLIENT;
05267             } else {
05268                return_status = CM_SUCCESS;
05269                i--;
05270             }
05271          }
05272       }
05273 
05274       /* display any message created during each shutdown */
05275       cm_msg_flush_buffer();
05276    }
05277 
05278    return return_status;
05279 }
05280 
05281 /********************************************************************/
05282 /**
05283 Check if a MIDAS client exists in current experiment
05284 @param    name            Client name
05285 @param    bUnique         If true, look for the exact client name.
05286                           If false, look for namexxx where xxx is
05287                           a any number
05288 @return   CM_SUCCESS, CM_NO_CLIENT
05289 */
05290 INT cm_exist(const char *name, BOOL bUnique)
05291 {
05292    INT status, i, size;
05293    HNDLE hDB, hKeyClient, hKey, hSubkey;
05294    char client_name[NAME_LENGTH];
05295 
05296    if (rpc_is_remote())
05297       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_EXIST, name, bUnique);
05298 
05299    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKeyClient);
05300 
05301    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hKey);
05302    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
05303       return DB_NO_KEY;
05304 
05305    db_lock_database(hDB);
05306 
05307    /* loop over all clients */
05308    for (i = 0;; i++) {
05309       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
05310       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
05311          break;
05312 
05313       if (hSubkey == hKeyClient)
05314          continue;
05315 
05316       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
05317          /* get client name */
05318          size = sizeof(client_name);
05319          status = db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", client_name, &size, TID_STRING, FALSE);
05320 
05321          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
05322             //fprintf(stderr, "cm_exist: name %s, i=%d, hSubkey=%d, status %d, client_name %s, my name %s\n", name, i, hSubkey, status, client_name, _client_name);
05323             continue;
05324          }
05325 
05326          if (equal_ustring(client_name, name)) {
05327             db_unlock_database(hDB);
05328             return CM_SUCCESS;
05329          }
05330 
05331          if (!bUnique) {
05332             client_name[strlen(name)] = 0;      /* strip number */
05333             if (equal_ustring(client_name, name)) {
05334                db_unlock_database(hDB);
05335                return CM_SUCCESS;
05336             }
05337          }
05338       }
05339    }
05340 
05341    db_unlock_database(hDB);
05342 
05343    return CM_NO_CLIENT;
05344 }
05345 
05346 /********************************************************************/
05347 /**
05348 Remove hanging clients independent of their watchdog
05349            timeout.
05350 
05351 Since this function does not obey the client watchdog
05352 timeout, it should be only called to remove clients which
05353 have their watchdog checking turned off or which are
05354 known to be dead. The normal client removement is done
05355 via cm_watchdog().
05356 
05357 Currently (Sept. 02) there are two applications for that:
05358 -# The ODBEdit command "cleanup", which can be used to
05359 remove clients which have their watchdog checking off,
05360 like the analyzer started with the "-d" flag for a
05361 debugging session.
05362 -# The frontend init code to remove previous frontends.
05363 This can be helpful if a frontend dies. Normally,
05364 one would have to wait 60 sec. for a crashed frontend
05365 to be removed. Only then one can start again the
05366 frontend. Since the frontend init code contains a
05367 call to cm_cleanup(<frontend_name>), one can restart
05368 a frontend immediately.
05369 
05370 Added ignore_timeout on Nov.03. A logger might have an
05371 increased tiemout of up to 60 sec. because of tape
05372 operations. If ignore_timeout is FALSE, the logger is
05373 then not killed if its inactivity is less than 60 sec.,
05374 while in the previous implementation it was always
05375 killed after 2*WATCHDOG_INTERVAL.
05376 @param    client_name      Client name, if zero check all clients
05377 @param    ignore_timeout   If TRUE, ignore a possible increased
05378                            timeout defined by each client.
05379 @return   CM_SUCCESS
05380 */
05381 INT cm_cleanup(const char *client_name, BOOL ignore_timeout)
05382 {
05383    if (rpc_is_remote())
05384       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_CLEANUP, client_name);
05385 
05386 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05387    {
05388       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader = NULL;
05389       BUFFER_CLIENT *pbclient;
05390       DATABASE_HEADER *pdbheader;
05391       DATABASE_CLIENT *pdbclient;
05392       KEY *pkey;
05393       INT client_pid;
05394       INT i, j, k, status, nc;
05395       BOOL bDeleted;
05396       char str[256];
05397       DWORD interval;
05398       DWORD now = ss_millitime();
05399 
05400       /* check buffers */
05401       for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
05402          if (_buffer[i].attached) {
05403             int idx;
05404             /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
05405             pheader = _buffer[i].buffer_header;
05406             pbclient = pheader->client;
05407             idx = bm_validate_client_index(&_buffer[i], FALSE);
05408             if (idx >= 0)
05409                pbclient[idx].last_activity = ss_millitime();
05410 
05411             /* now check other clients */
05412             for (j = 0; j < pheader->max_client_index; j++, pbclient++)
05413                if (j != _buffer[i].client_index && pbclient->pid &&
05414                    (client_name == NULL || client_name[0] == 0
05415                     || strncmp(pbclient->name, client_name, strlen(client_name)) == 0)) {
05416                   if (ignore_timeout)
05417                      interval = 2 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
05418                   else
05419                      interval = pbclient->watchdog_timeout;
05420 
05421                   /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
05422                   if (interval > 0
05423                       && now > pbclient->last_activity && now - pbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05424 
05425                      bm_lock_buffer(i + 1);
05426 
05427                      str[0] = 0;
05428 
05429                      /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
05430                      if (interval > 0
05431                          && now > pbclient->last_activity && now - pbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05432                         sprintf(str,
05433                                 "Client \'%s\' on \'%s\' removed by cm_cleanup (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
05434                                 pbclient->name, pheader->name,
05435                                 (ss_millitime() - pbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0, interval / 1000.0);
05436 
05437                         bm_remove_client_locked(pheader, j);
05438                      }
05439 
05440                      bm_unlock_buffer(i + 1);
05441 
05442                      /* display info message after unlocking buffer */
05443                      if (str[0])
05444                         cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_cleanup", str);
05445 
05446                      /* go again through whole list */
05447                      j = 0;
05448                   }
05449                }
05450          }
05451 
05452       /* check online databases */
05453       for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
05454          if (_database[i].attached) {
05455             /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
05456 
05457             db_lock_database(i + 1);
05458 
05459             pdbheader = _database[i].database_header;
05460             pdbclient = pdbheader->client;
05461             pdbclient[_database[i].client_index].last_activity = ss_millitime();
05462 
05463             /* now check other clients */
05464             for (j = 0; j < pdbheader->max_client_index; j++, pdbclient++)
05465                if (j != _database[i].client_index && pdbclient->pid &&
05466                    (client_name == NULL || client_name[0] == 0
05467                     || strncmp(pdbclient->name, client_name, strlen(client_name)) == 0)) {
05468                   client_pid = pdbclient->pid;
05469                   if (ignore_timeout)
05470                      interval = 2 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
05471                   else
05472                      interval = pdbclient->watchdog_timeout;
05473 
05474                   /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
05475 
05476                   if (interval > 0 && ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05477                      bDeleted = FALSE;
05478 
05479                      /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
05480                      if (interval > 0 && ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05481                         cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_cleanup", "Client \'%s\' on \'%s\' removed by cm_cleanup (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
05482                                pdbclient->name, pdbheader->name,
05483                                (ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0, interval / 1000.0);
05484 
05485                         /* decrement notify_count for open records and clear exclusive mode */
05486                         for (k = 0; k < pdbclient->max_index; k++)
05487                            if (pdbclient->open_record[k].handle) {
05488                               pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pdbheader + pdbclient->open_record[k].handle);
05489                               if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
05490                                  pkey->notify_count--;
05491 
05492                               if (pdbclient->open_record[k].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
05493                                  db_set_mode(i + 1, pdbclient->open_record[k].handle, (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
05494                            }
05495 
05496                         /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
05497                         memset(&(pdbheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
05498 
05499                         /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
05500                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
05501                            if (pdbheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05502                               break;
05503                         pdbheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
05504 
05505                         /* count new number of clients */
05506                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
05507                            if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05508                               nc++;
05509                         pdbheader->num_clients = nc;
05510 
05511                         bDeleted = TRUE;
05512                      }
05513 
05514 
05515                      /* delete client entry after unlocking db */
05516                      if (bDeleted) {
05517 
05518                         status = cm_delete_client_info(i + 1, client_pid);
05519                         if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
05520                            cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_cleanup", "cannot delete client info, status %d", status);
05521 
05522                         pdbheader = _database[i].database_header;
05523                         pdbclient = pdbheader->client;
05524 
05525                         /* go again though whole list */
05526                         j = 0;
05527                      }
05528                   }
05529                }
05530 
05531             db_unlock_database(i + 1);
05532          }
05533 
05534    }
05535 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05536 
05537    return CM_SUCCESS;
05538 }
05539 
05540 /**dox***************************************************************/
05541 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
05542 
05543 /********************************************************************/
05544 INT bm_get_buffer_info(INT buffer_handle, BUFFER_HEADER * buffer_header)
05545 /********************************************************************\
05546 
05547   Routine: bm_buffer_info
05548 
05549   Purpose: Copies the current buffer header referenced by buffer_handle
05550            into the *buffer_header structure which must be supplied
05551            by the calling routine.
05552 
05553   Input:
05554     INT buffer_handle       Handle of the buffer to get the header from
05555 
05556   Output:
05557     BUFFER_HEADER *buffer_header   Destination address which gets a copy
05558                                    of the buffer header structure.
05559 
05560   Function value:
05561     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05562     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05563     RPC_NET_ERROR           Network error
05564 
05565 \********************************************************************/
05566 {
05567    if (rpc_is_remote())
05568       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_GET_BUFFER_INFO, buffer_handle, buffer_header);
05569 
05570 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05571 
05572    if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05573       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_get_buffer_info", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05574       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05575    }
05576 
05577    if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
05578       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_get_buffer_info", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05579       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05580    }
05581 
05582    bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05583 
05584    memcpy(buffer_header, _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header, sizeof(BUFFER_HEADER));
05585 
05586    bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05587 
05588 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05589 
05590    return BM_SUCCESS;
05591 }
05592 
05593 /********************************************************************/
05594 INT bm_get_buffer_level(INT buffer_handle, INT * n_bytes)
05595 /********************************************************************\
05596 
05597   Routine: bm_get_buffer_level
05598 
05599   Purpose: Return number of bytes in buffer or in cache
05600 
05601   Input:
05602     INT buffer_handle       Handle of the buffer to get the info
05603 
05604   Output:
05605     INT *n_bytes              Number of bytes in buffer
05606 
05607   Function value:
05608     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05609     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05610     RPC_NET_ERROR           Network error
05611 
05612 \********************************************************************/
05613 {
05614    if (rpc_is_remote())
05615       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_GET_BUFFER_LEVEL, buffer_handle, n_bytes);
05616 
05617 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05618    {
05619       BUFFER *pbuf;
05620       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
05621       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
05622 
05623       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05624          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_get_buffer_level", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05625          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05626       }
05627 
05628       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
05629       pheader = pbuf->buffer_header;
05630 
05631       if (!pbuf->attached) {
05632          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_get_buffer_level", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05633          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05634       }
05635 
05636       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05637 
05638       pclient = &(pheader->client[bm_validate_client_index(pbuf, TRUE)]);
05639 
05640       *n_bytes = pheader->write_pointer - pclient->read_pointer;
05641       if (*n_bytes < 0)
05642          *n_bytes += pheader->size;
05643 
05644       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05645 
05646       /* add bytes in cache */
05647       if (pbuf->read_cache_wp > pbuf->read_cache_rp)
05648          *n_bytes += pbuf->read_cache_wp - pbuf->read_cache_rp;
05649    }
05650 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05651 
05652    return BM_SUCCESS;
05653 }
05654 
05655 
05656 
05657 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05658 
05659 /********************************************************************/
05660 INT bm_lock_buffer(INT buffer_handle)
05661 /********************************************************************\
05662 
05663   Routine: bm_lock_buffer
05664 
05665   Purpose: Lock a buffer for exclusive access via system semaphore calls.
05666 
05667   Input:
05668     INT    bufer_handle     Handle to the buffer to lock
05669   Output:
05670     none
05671 
05672   Function value:
05673     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05674     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05675 
05676 \********************************************************************/
05677 {
05678    int status;
05679 
05680    if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05681       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_lock_buffer", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05682       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05683    }
05684 
05685    status = ss_semaphore_wait_for(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].semaphore, 5 * 60 * 1000);
05686 
05687    if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
05688       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_lock_buffer",
05689              "Cannot lock buffer handle %d, ss_semaphore_wait_for() status %d, aborting...", buffer_handle, status);
05690       abort();
05691       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05692    }
05693 
05694    return BM_SUCCESS;
05695 }
05696 
05697 /********************************************************************/
05698 INT bm_unlock_buffer(INT buffer_handle)
05699 /********************************************************************\
05700 
05701   Routine: bm_unlock_buffer
05702 
05703   Purpose: Unlock a buffer via system semaphore calls.
05704 
05705   Input:
05706     INT    bufer_handle     Handle to the buffer to lock
05707   Output:
05708     none
05709 
05710   Function value:
05711     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05712     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05713 
05714 \********************************************************************/
05715 {
05716    if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05717       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_unlock_buffer", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05718       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05719    }
05720 
05721    ss_semaphore_release(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].semaphore);
05722    return BM_SUCCESS;
05723 }
05724 
05725 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05726 
05727 /********************************************************************/
05728 INT bm_init_buffer_counters(INT buffer_handle)
05729 /********************************************************************\
05730 
05731   Routine: bm_init_event_counters
05732 
05733   Purpose: Initialize counters for a specific buffer. This routine
05734            should be called at the beginning of a run.
05735 
05736   Input:
05737     INT    buffer_handle    Handle to the buffer to be
05738                             initialized.
05739   Output:
05740     none
05741 
05742   Function value:
05743     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05744     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05745 
05746 \********************************************************************/
05747 {
05748    if (rpc_is_remote())
05749       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_INIT_BUFFER_COUNTERS, buffer_handle);
05750 
05751 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05752 
05753    if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05754       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_init_buffer_counters", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05755       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05756    }
05757 
05758    if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
05759       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_init_buffer_counters", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05760       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05761    }
05762 
05763    _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header->num_in_events = 0;
05764    _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header->num_out_events = 0;
05765 
05766 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05767 
05768    return BM_SUCCESS;
05769 }
05770 
05771 /**dox***************************************************************/
05772 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
05773 
05774 /**dox***************************************************************/
05775                                                                                                                                /** @} *//* end of cmfunctionc */
05776 
05777 /**dox***************************************************************/
05778 /** @addtogroup bmfunctionc
05779  *
05780  *  @{  */
05781 
05782 /********************************************************************/
05783 /**
05784 Modifies buffer cache size.
05785 Without a buffer cache, events are copied to/from the shared
05786 memory event by event.
05787 
05788 To protect processed from accessing the shared memory simultaneously,
05789 semaphores are used. Since semaphore operations are CPU consuming (typically
05790 50-100us) this can slow down the data transfer especially for small events.
05791 By using a cache the number of semaphore operations is reduced dramatically.
05792 Instead writing directly to the shared memory, the events are copied to a
05793 local cache buffer. When this buffer is full, it is copied to the shared
05794 memory in one operation. The same technique can be used when receiving events.
05795 
05796 The drawback of this method is that the events have to be copied twice, once to the
05797 cache and once from the cache to the shared memory. Therefore it can happen that the
05798 usage of a cache even slows down data throughput on a given environment (computer
05799 type, OS type, event size).
05800 The cache size has therefore be optimized manually to maximize data throughput.
05801 @param buffer_handle buffer handle obtained via bm_open_buffer()
05802 @param read_size cache size for reading events in bytes, zero for no cache
05803 @param write_size cache size for writing events in bytes, zero for no cache
05804 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE, BM_NO_MEMORY, BM_INVALID_PARAM
05805 */
05806 INT bm_set_cache_size(INT buffer_handle, INT read_size, INT write_size)
05807 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05808 {
05809    if (rpc_is_remote())
05810       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_SET_CACHE_SIZE, buffer_handle, read_size, write_size);
05811 
05812 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05813    {
05814       BUFFER *pbuf;
05815 
05816       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05817          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05818          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05819       }
05820 
05821       if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
05822          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05823          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05824       }
05825 
05826       if (read_size < 0 || read_size > 1E6) {
05827          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid read chache size");
05828          return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
05829       }
05830 
05831       if (write_size < 0 || write_size > 1E6) {
05832          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid write chache size");
05833          return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
05834       }
05835 
05836       /* manage read cache */
05837       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
05838 
05839       if (pbuf->read_cache_size > 0)
05840          M_FREE(pbuf->read_cache);
05841 
05842       if (read_size > 0) {
05843          pbuf->read_cache = (char *) M_MALLOC(read_size);
05844          if (pbuf->read_cache == NULL) {
05845             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "not enough memory to allocate cache buffer");
05846             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
05847          }
05848       }
05849 
05850       pbuf->read_cache_size = read_size;
05851       pbuf->read_cache_rp = pbuf->read_cache_wp = 0;
05852 
05853       /* manage write cache */
05854       if (pbuf->write_cache_size > 0)
05855          M_FREE(pbuf->write_cache);
05856 
05857       if (write_size > 0) {
05858          pbuf->write_cache = (char *) M_MALLOC(write_size);
05859          if (pbuf->write_cache == NULL) {
05860             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "not enough memory to allocate cache buffer");
05861             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
05862          }
05863       }
05864 
05865       pbuf->write_cache_size = write_size;
05866       pbuf->write_cache_rp = pbuf->write_cache_wp = 0;
05867 
05868    }
05869 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05870 
05871    return BM_SUCCESS;
05872 }
05873 
05874 /********************************************************************/
05875 /**
05876 Compose a Midas event header.
05877 An event header can usually be set-up manually or
05878 through this routine. If the data size of the event is not known when
05879 the header is composed, it can be set later with event_header->data-size = <...>
05880 Following structure is created at the beginning of an event
05881 \code
05882 typedef struct {
05883  short int     event_id;
05884  short int     trigger_mask;
05885  DWORD         serial_number;
05886  DWORD         time_stamp;
05887  DWORD         data_size;
05888 } EVENT_HEADER;
05889 
05890 char event[1000];
05891  bm_compose_event((EVENT_HEADER *)event, 1, 0, 100, 1);
05892  *(event+sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) = <...>
05893 \endcode
05894 @param event_header pointer to the event header
05895 @param event_id event ID of the event
05896 @param trigger_mask trigger mask of the event
05897 @param size size if the data part of the event in bytes
05898 @param serial serial number
05899 @return BM_SUCCESS
05900 */
05901 INT bm_compose_event(EVENT_HEADER * event_header, short int event_id, short int trigger_mask, DWORD size,
05902                      DWORD serial)
05903 {
05904    event_header->event_id = event_id;
05905    event_header->trigger_mask = trigger_mask;
05906    event_header->data_size = size;
05907    event_header->time_stamp = ss_time();
05908    event_header->serial_number = serial;
05909 
05910    return BM_SUCCESS;
05911 }
05912 
05913 
05914 /**dox***************************************************************/
05915 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
05916 
05917 /********************************************************************/
05918 INT bm_add_event_request(INT buffer_handle, short int event_id,
05919                          short int trigger_mask,
05920                          INT sampling_type, void (*func) (HNDLE, HNDLE, EVENT_HEADER *, void *),
05921                          INT request_id)
05922 /********************************************************************\
05923 
05924   Routine:  bm_add_event_request
05925 
05926   Purpose:  Place a request for a specific event type in the client
05927             structure of the buffer refereced by buffer_handle.
05928 
05929   Input:
05930     INT          buffer_handle  Handle to the buffer where the re-
05931                                 quest should be placed in
05932 
05933     short int    event_id       Event ID      \
05934     short int    trigger_mask   Trigger mask  / Event specification
05935 
05936     INT          sampling_type  One of GET_ALL, GET_NONBLOCKING or GET_RECENT
05937 
05938 
05939                  Note: to request all types of events, use
05940                    event_id = 0 (all others should be !=0 !)
05941                    trigger_mask = TRIGGER_ALL
05942                    sampling_typ = GET_ALL
05943 
05944 
05945     void         *func          Callback function
05946     INT          request_id     Request id (unique number assigned
05947                                 by bm_request_event)
05948 
05949   Output:
05950     none
05951 
05952   Function value:
05953     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05954     BM_NO_MEMORY            Too much request. MAX_EVENT_REQUESTS in
05955                             MIDAS.H should be increased.
05956     BM_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
05957     BM_INVALID_PARAM        GET_RECENT is used with non-zero cache size
05958     RPC_NET_ERROR           Network error
05959 
05960 \********************************************************************/
05961 {
05962    if (rpc_is_remote())
05963       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_ADD_EVENT_REQUEST, buffer_handle, event_id,
05964                       trigger_mask, sampling_type, (INT) (POINTER_T) func, request_id);
05965 
05966 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05967    {
05968       INT i;
05969       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
05970 
05971       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
05972          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_add_event_request", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05973          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05974       }
05975 
05976       if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
05977          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_add_event_request", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05978          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05979       }
05980 
05981       /* avoid callback/non callback requests */
05982       if (func == NULL && _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].callback) {
05983          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_add_event_request", "mixing callback/non callback requests not possible");
05984          return BM_INVALID_MIXING;
05985       }
05986 
05987       /* do not allow GET_RECENT with nonzero cache size */
05988       if (sampling_type == GET_RECENT && _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].read_cache_size > 0)
05989          return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
05990 
05991       /* lock buffer */
05992       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
05993 
05994       /* get a pointer to the proper client structure */
05995       pclient = &(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header->
05996                   client[bm_validate_client_index(&_buffer[buffer_handle - 1], TRUE)]);
05997 
05998       /* look for a empty request entry */
05999       for (i = 0; i < MAX_EVENT_REQUESTS; i++)
06000          if (!pclient->event_request[i].valid)
06001             break;
06002 
06003       if (i == MAX_EVENT_REQUESTS) {
06004          bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06005          return BM_NO_MEMORY;
06006       }
06007 
06008       /* setup event_request structure */
06009       pclient->event_request[i].id = request_id;
06010       pclient->event_request[i].valid = TRUE;
06011       pclient->event_request[i].event_id = event_id;
06012       pclient->event_request[i].trigger_mask = trigger_mask;
06013       pclient->event_request[i].sampling_type = sampling_type;
06014 
06015       pclient->all_flag = pclient->all_flag || (sampling_type & GET_ALL);
06016 
06017       /* set callback flag in buffer structure */
06018       if (func != NULL)
06019          _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].callback = TRUE;
06020 
06021       /*
06022          Save the index of the last request in the list so that later only the
06023          requests 0..max_request_index-1 have to be searched through.
06024        */
06025 
06026       if (i + 1 > pclient->max_request_index)
06027          pclient->max_request_index = i + 1;
06028 
06029       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06030    }
06031 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06032 
06033    return BM_SUCCESS;
06034 }
06035 
06036 /**dox***************************************************************/
06037 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
06038 
06039 /********************************************************************/
06040 /**
06041 Place an event request based on certain characteristics.
06042 Multiple event requests can be placed for each buffer, which
06043 are later identified by their request ID. They can contain different callback
06044 routines. Example see bm_open_buffer() and bm_receive_event()
06045 @param buffer_handle buffer handle obtained via bm_open_buffer()
06046 @param event_id event ID for requested events. Use EVENTID_ALL
06047 to receive events with any ID.
06048 @param trigger_mask trigger mask for requested events.
06049 The requested events must have at least one bit in its
06050 trigger mask common with the requested trigger mask. Use TRIGGER_ALL to
06051 receive events with any trigger mask.
06052 @param sampling_type specifies how many events to receive.
06053 A value of GET_ALL receives all events which
06054 match the specified event ID and trigger mask. If the events are consumed slower
06055 than produced, the producer is automatically slowed down. A value of GET_NONBLOCKING
06056 receives as much events as possible without slowing down the producer. GET_ALL is
06057 typically used by the logger, while GET_NONBLOCKING is typically used by analyzers.
06058 @param request_id request ID returned by the function.
06059 This ID is passed to the callback routine and must
06060 be used in the bm_delete_request() routine.
06061 @param func allback routine which gets called when an event of the
06062 specified type is received.
06063 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE <br>
06064 BM_NO_MEMORY  too many requests. The value MAX_EVENT_REQUESTS in midas.h
06065 should be increased.
06066 */
06067 INT bm_request_event(HNDLE buffer_handle, short int event_id,
06068                      short int trigger_mask,
06069                      INT sampling_type, HNDLE * request_id, void (*func) (HNDLE, HNDLE, EVENT_HEADER *,
06070                                                                           void *))
06071 {
06072    INT idx, status;
06073 
06074    /* allocate new space for the local request list */
06075    if (_request_list_entries == 0) {
06076       _request_list = (REQUEST_LIST *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(REQUEST_LIST));
06077       memset(_request_list, 0, sizeof(REQUEST_LIST));
06078       if (_request_list == NULL) {
06079          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_request_event", "not enough memory to allocate request list buffer");
06080          return BM_NO_MEMORY;
06081       }
06082 
06083       _request_list_entries = 1;
06084       idx = 0;
06085    } else {
06086       /* check for a deleted entry */
06087       for (idx = 0; idx < _request_list_entries; idx++)
06088          if (!_request_list[idx].buffer_handle)
06089             break;
06090 
06091       /* if not found, create new one */
06092       if (idx == _request_list_entries) {
06093          _request_list =
06094              (REQUEST_LIST *) realloc(_request_list, sizeof(REQUEST_LIST) * (_request_list_entries + 1));
06095          if (_request_list == NULL) {
06096             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_request_event", "not enough memory to allocate request list buffer");
06097             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
06098          }
06099 
06100          memset(&_request_list[_request_list_entries], 0, sizeof(REQUEST_LIST));
06101 
06102          _request_list_entries++;
06103       }
06104    }
06105 
06106    /* initialize request list */
06107    _request_list[idx].buffer_handle = buffer_handle;
06108    _request_list[idx].event_id = event_id;
06109    _request_list[idx].trigger_mask = trigger_mask;
06110    _request_list[idx].dispatcher = func;
06111 
06112    *request_id = idx;
06113 
06114    /* add request in buffer structure */
06115    status = bm_add_event_request(buffer_handle, event_id, trigger_mask, sampling_type, func, idx);
06116    if (status != BM_SUCCESS)
06117       return status;
06118 
06119    return BM_SUCCESS;
06120 }
06121 
06122 /********************************************************************/
06123 /**
06124 Delete a previously placed request for a specific event
06125 type in the client structure of the buffer refereced by buffer_handle.
06126 @param buffer_handle  Handle to the buffer where the re-
06127                                 quest should be placed in
06128 @param request_id     Request id returned by bm_request_event
06129 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE, BM_NOT_FOUND, RPC_NET_ERROR
06130 */
06131 INT bm_remove_event_request(INT buffer_handle, INT request_id)
06132 {
06133    if (rpc_is_remote())
06134       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_REMOVE_EVENT_REQUEST, buffer_handle, request_id);
06135 
06136 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06137    {
06138       INT i, deleted;
06139       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
06140 
06141       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
06142          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_remove_event_request", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
06143          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06144       }
06145 
06146       if (!_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].attached) {
06147          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_remove_event_request", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
06148          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06149       }
06150 
06151       /* lock buffer */
06152       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06153 
06154       /* get a pointer to the proper client structure */
06155       pclient = &(_buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header->
06156                   client[bm_validate_client_index(&_buffer[buffer_handle - 1], TRUE)]);
06157 
06158       /* check all requests and set to zero if matching */
06159       for (i = 0, deleted = 0; i < pclient->max_request_index; i++)
06160          if (pclient->event_request[i].valid && pclient->event_request[i].id == request_id) {
06161             memset(&pclient->event_request[i], 0, sizeof(EVENT_REQUEST));
06162             deleted++;
06163          }
06164 
06165       /* calculate new max_request_index entry */
06166       for (i = MAX_EVENT_REQUESTS - 1; i >= 0; i--)
06167          if (pclient->event_request[i].valid)
06168             break;
06169 
06170       pclient->max_request_index = i + 1;
06171 
06172       /* caluclate new all_flag */
06173       pclient->all_flag = FALSE;
06174 
06175       for (i = 0; i < pclient->max_request_index; i++)
06176          if (pclient->event_request[i].valid && (pclient->event_request[i].sampling_type & GET_ALL)) {
06177             pclient->all_flag = TRUE;
06178             break;
06179          }
06180 
06181       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06182 
06183       if (!deleted)
06184          return BM_NOT_FOUND;
06185    }
06186 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06187 
06188    return BM_SUCCESS;
06189 }
06190 
06191 /********************************************************************/
06192 /**
06193 Deletes an event request previously done with bm_request_event().
06194 When an event request gets deleted, events of that requested type are
06195 not received any more. When a buffer is closed via bm_close_buffer(), all
06196 event requests from that buffer are deleted automatically
06197 @param request_id request identifier given by bm_request_event()
06198 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE
06199 */
06200 INT bm_delete_request(INT request_id)
06201 {
06202    if (request_id < 0 || request_id >= _request_list_entries)
06203       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06204 
06205    /* remove request entry from buffer */
06206    bm_remove_event_request(_request_list[request_id].buffer_handle, request_id);
06207 
06208    memset(&_request_list[request_id], 0, sizeof(REQUEST_LIST));
06209 
06210    return BM_SUCCESS;
06211 }
06212 
06213 #if 0                           // currently not used
06214 static void bm_show_pointers(const BUFFER_HEADER * pheader)
06215 {
06216    int i;
06217    const BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
06218 
06219    pclient = pheader->client;
06220 
06221    printf("buffer \'%s\', rptr: %d, wptr: %d, size: %d\n", pheader->name, pheader->read_pointer,
06222           pheader->write_pointer, pheader->size);
06223    for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++)
06224       if (pclient[i].pid) {
06225          printf("pointers: client %d \'%s\', rptr %d\n", i, pclient[i].name, pclient[i].read_pointer);
06226       }
06227 
06228    printf("done\n");
06229 }
06230 #endif
06231 
06232 static void bm_validate_client_pointers(BUFFER_HEADER * pheader, BUFFER_CLIENT * pclient)
06233 {
06234    assert(pheader->read_pointer >= 0 && pheader->read_pointer <= pheader->size);
06235    assert(pclient->read_pointer >= 0 && pclient->read_pointer <= pheader->size);
06236 
06237    if (pheader->read_pointer <= pheader->write_pointer) {
06238 
06239       if (pclient->read_pointer < pheader->read_pointer) {
06240          cm_msg(MINFO, "bm_validate_client_pointers",
06241                 "Corrected read pointer for client \'%s\' on buffer \'%s\' from %d to %d", pclient->name,
06242                 pheader->name, pclient->read_pointer, pheader->read_pointer);
06243 
06244          pclient->read_pointer = pheader->read_pointer;
06245       }
06246 
06247       if (pclient->read_pointer > pheader->write_pointer) {
06248          cm_msg(MINFO, "bm_validate_client_pointers",
06249                 "Corrected read pointer for client \'%s\' on buffer \'%s\' from %d to %d", pclient->name,
06250                 pheader->name, pclient->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer);
06251 
06252          pclient->read_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
06253       }
06254 
06255    } else {
06256 
06257       if (pclient->read_pointer < 0) {
06258          cm_msg(MINFO, "bm_validate_client_pointers",
06259                 "Corrected read pointer for client \'%s\' on buffer \'%s\' from %d to %d", pclient->name,
06260                 pheader->name, pclient->read_pointer, pheader->read_pointer);
06261 
06262          pclient->read_pointer = pheader->read_pointer;
06263       }
06264 
06265       if (pclient->read_pointer >= pheader->size) {
06266          cm_msg(MINFO, "bm_validate_client_pointers",
06267                 "Corrected read pointer for client \'%s\' on buffer \'%s\' from %d to %d", pclient->name,
06268                 pheader->name, pclient->read_pointer, pheader->read_pointer);
06269 
06270          pclient->read_pointer = pheader->read_pointer;
06271       }
06272 
06273       if (pclient->read_pointer > pheader->write_pointer && pclient->read_pointer < pheader->read_pointer) {
06274          cm_msg(MINFO, "bm_validate_client_pointers",
06275                 "Corrected read pointer for client \'%s\' on buffer \'%s\' from %d to %d", pclient->name,
06276                 pheader->name, pclient->read_pointer, pheader->read_pointer);
06277 
06278          pclient->read_pointer = pheader->read_pointer;
06279       }
06280    }
06281 }
06282 
06283 #if 0                           // currently not used
06284 static void bm_validate_pointers(BUFFER_HEADER * pheader)
06285 {
06286    BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient = pheader->client;
06287    int i;
06288 
06289    for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++)
06290       if (pclient[i].pid) {
06291          bm_validate_client_pointers(pheader, &pclient[i]);
06292       }
06293 }
06294 #endif
06295 
06296 static BOOL bm_update_read_pointer(const char *caller_name, BUFFER_HEADER * pheader)
06297 {
06298    BOOL did_move;
06299    int i;
06300    int min_rp;
06301    BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
06302 
06303    assert(caller_name);
06304    pclient = pheader->client;
06305 
06306    /* calculate global read pointer as "minimum" of client read pointers */
06307    min_rp = pheader->write_pointer;
06308 
06309    for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++)
06310       if (pclient[i].pid) {
06311 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06312          cm_msg(MDEBUG, caller_name, "bm_update_read_pointer: client %d rp=%d", i, pclient[i].read_pointer);
06313 #endif
06314          bm_validate_client_pointers(pheader, &pclient[i]);
06315 
06316          if (pheader->read_pointer <= pheader->write_pointer) {
06317             if (pclient[i].read_pointer < min_rp)
06318                min_rp = pclient[i].read_pointer;
06319          } else {
06320             if (pclient[i].read_pointer <= pheader->write_pointer) {
06321                if (pclient[i].read_pointer < min_rp)
06322                   min_rp = pclient[i].read_pointer;
06323             } else {
06324                int xptr = pclient[i].read_pointer - pheader->size;
06325                if (xptr < min_rp)
06326                   min_rp = xptr;
06327             }
06328          }
06329       }
06330 
06331    if (min_rp < 0)
06332       min_rp += pheader->size;
06333 
06334    assert(min_rp >= 0);
06335    assert(min_rp < pheader->size);
06336 
06337 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06338    if (min_rp == pheader->read_pointer)
06339       cm_msg(MDEBUG, caller_name, "bm_update_read_pointer -> wp=%d", pheader->write_pointer);
06340    else
06341       cm_msg(MDEBUG, caller_name, "bm_update_read_pointer -> wp=%d, rp %d -> %d, size=%d",
06342              pheader->write_pointer, pheader->read_pointer, min_rp, pheader->size);
06343 #endif
06344 
06345    did_move = (pheader->read_pointer != min_rp);
06346 
06347    pheader->read_pointer = min_rp;
06348 
06349    return did_move;
06350 }
06351 
06352 static void bm_wakeup_producers(const BUFFER_HEADER * pheader, const BUFFER_CLIENT * pc)
06353 {
06354    int i;
06355    int size;
06356    const BUFFER_CLIENT *pctmp = pheader->client;
06357 
06358    /*
06359       If read pointer has been changed, it may have freed up some space
06360       for waiting producers. So check if free space is now more than 50%
06361       of the buffer size and wake waiting producers.
06362     */
06363 
06364    size = pc->read_pointer - pheader->write_pointer;
06365    if (size <= 0)
06366       size += pheader->size;
06367 
06368    if (size >= pheader->size * 0.5)
06369       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pctmp++)
06370         if (pctmp->pid)
06371            if (pctmp->write_wait < size) {
06372 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06373             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Receive wake: rp=%d, wp=%d, level=%1.1lf",
06374                    pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer, 100 - 100.0 * size / pheader->size);
06375 #endif
06376             ss_resume(pctmp->port, "B  ");
06377             }
06378 }
06379 
06380 static void bm_dispatch_event(int buffer_handle, EVENT_HEADER * pevent)
06381 {
06382    int i;
06383 
06384    /* call dispatcher */
06385    for (i = 0; i < _request_list_entries; i++)
06386       if (_request_list[i].buffer_handle == buffer_handle &&
06387           bm_match_event(_request_list[i].event_id, _request_list[i].trigger_mask, pevent)) {
06388          /* if event is fragmented, call defragmenter */
06389          if ((pevent->event_id & 0xF000) == EVENTID_FRAG1 || (pevent->event_id & 0xF000) == EVENTID_FRAG)
06390             bm_defragment_event(buffer_handle, i, pevent, (void *) (pevent + 1), _request_list[i].dispatcher);
06391          else
06392             _request_list[i].dispatcher(buffer_handle, i, pevent, (void *) (pevent + 1));
06393       }
06394 }
06395 
06396 static void bm_dispatch_from_cache(BUFFER * pbuf, int buffer_handle)
06397 {
06398    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
06399    int size;
06400 
06401    pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_rp);
06402    size = pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
06403 
06404    /* correct size for DWORD boundary */
06405    size = ALIGN8(size);
06406 
06407    /* increment read pointer */
06408    pbuf->read_cache_rp += size;
06409 
06410    if (pbuf->read_cache_rp == pbuf->read_cache_wp)
06411       pbuf->read_cache_rp = pbuf->read_cache_wp = 0;
06412 
06413    bm_dispatch_event(buffer_handle, pevent);
06414 }
06415 
06416 static void bm_convert_event_header(EVENT_HEADER * pevent, int convert_flags)
06417 {
06418    /* now convert event header */
06419    if (convert_flags) {
