06420       rpc_convert_single(&pevent->event_id, TID_SHORT, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
06421       rpc_convert_single(&pevent->trigger_mask, TID_SHORT, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
06422       rpc_convert_single(&pevent->serial_number, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
06423       rpc_convert_single(&pevent->time_stamp, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
06424       rpc_convert_single(&pevent->data_size, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
06425    }
06426 }
06427 
06428 static int bm_copy_from_cache(BUFFER * pbuf, void *destination, int max_size, int *buf_size,
06429                               int convert_flags)
06430 {
06431    int status;
06432    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
06433    int size;
06434 
06435    pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_rp);
06436    size = pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
06437 
06438    if (size > max_size) {
06439       memcpy(destination, pevent, max_size);
06440       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_receive_event", "event size %d larger than buffer size %d", size, max_size);
06441       *buf_size = max_size;
06442       status = BM_TRUNCATED;
06443    } else {
06444       memcpy(destination, pevent, size);
06445       *buf_size = size;
06446       status = BM_SUCCESS;
06447    }
06448 
06449    bm_convert_event_header((EVENT_HEADER *) destination, convert_flags);
06450 
06451    /* correct size for DWORD boundary */
06452    size = ALIGN8(size);
06453 
06454    pbuf->read_cache_rp += size;
06455 
06456    if (pbuf->read_cache_rp == pbuf->read_cache_wp)
06457       pbuf->read_cache_rp = pbuf->read_cache_wp = 0;
06458 
06459    return status;
06460 }
06461 
06462 static int bm_read_cache_has_events(const BUFFER * pbuf)
06463 {
06464    if (pbuf->read_cache_size == 0)
06465       return 0;
06466 
06467    if (pbuf->read_cache_rp == pbuf->read_cache_wp)
06468       return 0;
06469 
06470    return 1;
06471 }
06472 
06473 static int bm_wait_for_free_space(int buffer_handle, BUFFER * pbuf, int async_flag, int requested_space)
06474 {
06475    int status;
06476    BUFFER_HEADER *pheader = pbuf->buffer_header;
06477    char *pdata = (char *) (pheader + 1);
06478 
06479    /* make sure the buffer never completely full:
06480     * read pointer and write pointer would coincide
06481     * and the code cannot tell if it means the
06482     * buffer is 100% full or 100% empty. It will explode
06483     * or lose events */
06484    requested_space += 100;
06485 
06486    if (requested_space >= pheader->size)
06487       return BM_NO_MEMORY;
06488 
06489    while (1) {
06490 
06491       BUFFER_CLIENT *pc;
06492       int n_blocking;
06493       int i;
06494       int size;
06495       int idx;
06496 
06497       /* check if enough space in buffer */
06498 
06499       size = pheader->read_pointer - pheader->write_pointer;
06500       if (size <= 0)
06501          size += pheader->size;
06502 
06503 #if 0
06504       printf
06505           ("bm_send_event: buffer pointers: read: %d, write: %d, free space: %d, bufsize: %d, event size: %d\n",
06506            pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer, size, pheader->size, requested_space);
06507 #endif
06508 
06509       if (requested_space < size)       /* note the '<' to avoid 100% filling */
06510          return BM_SUCCESS;
06511 
06512       /* if not enough space, find out who's blocking */
06513       n_blocking = 0;
06514 
06515       for (i = 0, pc = pheader->client; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pc++)
06516          if (pc->pid) {
06517             if (pc->read_pointer == pheader->read_pointer) {
06518                /*
06519                   First assume that the client with the "minimum" read pointer
06520                   is not really blocking due to a GET_ALL request.
06521                 */
06522                BOOL blocking = FALSE;
06523                int blocking_request_id = 0;
06524                int j;
06525 
06526                /* check if this request blocks */
06527 
06528                EVENT_REQUEST *prequest = pc->event_request;
06529                EVENT_HEADER *pevent_test = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pdata + pc->read_pointer);
06530 
06531                assert(pc->read_pointer >= 0);
06532                assert(pc->read_pointer <= pheader->size);
06533 
06534                for (j = 0; j < pc->max_request_index; j++, prequest++)
06535                   if (prequest->valid
06536                       && bm_match_event(prequest->event_id, prequest->trigger_mask, pevent_test)) {
06537                      if (prequest->sampling_type & GET_ALL) {
06538                         blocking = TRUE;
06539                         blocking_request_id = prequest->id;
06540                         break;
06541                      }
06542                   }
06543 
06544                if (blocking) {
06545                   n_blocking++;
06546 
06547                   if (pc->read_wait) {
06548                      char str[80];
06549 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06550                      cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Send wake: rp=%d, wp=%d", pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer);
06551 #endif
06552                      sprintf(str, "B %s %d", pheader->name, blocking_request_id);
06553                      ss_resume(pc->port, str);
06554                   }
06555 
06556                } else {
06557                   /*
06558                      The blocking guy has no GET_ALL request for this event
06559                      -> shift its read pointer.
06560                    */
06561 
06562                   int new_read_pointer;
06563                   int increment =
06564                       sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + ((EVENT_HEADER *) (pdata + pc->read_pointer))->data_size;
06565 
06566                   /* correct increment for DWORD boundary */
06567                   increment = ALIGN8(increment);
06568 
06569                   assert(increment > 0);
06570                   assert(increment <= pheader->size);
06571 
06572                   new_read_pointer = (pc->read_pointer + increment) % pheader->size;
06573 
06574                   if (new_read_pointer > pheader->size - (int) sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))
06575                      new_read_pointer = 0;
06576 
06577                   pc->read_pointer = new_read_pointer;
06578                }
06579             }
06580          }
06581       /* client loop */
06582       if (n_blocking == 0) {
06583 
06584          BOOL moved;
06585          /*
06586             calculate new global read pointer as "minimum" of
06587             client read pointers
06588           */
06589 
06590          moved = bm_update_read_pointer("bm_send_event", pheader);
06591 
06592          if (!moved) {
06593             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_wait_for_free_space",
06594                    "BUG: read pointer did not move while waiting for %d bytes, bytes available: %d, buffer size: %d",
06595                    requested_space, size, pheader->size);
06596             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
06597          }
06598 
06599          continue;
06600       }
06601 
06602       /* at least one client is blocking */
06603 
06604       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06605 
06606       /* return now in ASYNC mode */
06607       if (async_flag)
06608          return BM_ASYNC_RETURN;
06609 
06610 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06611       cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Send sleep: rp=%d, wp=%d, level=%1.1lf",
06612              pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer, 100 - 100.0 * size / pheader->size);
06613 #endif
06614 
06615       /* signal other clients wait mode */
06616       idx = bm_validate_client_index(pbuf, FALSE);
06617       if (idx >= 0)
06618          pheader->client[idx].write_wait = requested_space;
06619 
06620       bm_cleanup("bm_wait_for_free_space", ss_millitime(), FALSE);
06621 
06622       status = ss_suspend(1000, MSG_BM);
06623 
06624       /* make sure we do sleep in this loop:
06625        * if we are the mserver receiving data on the event
06626        * socket and the data buffer is full, ss_suspend() will
06627        * never sleep: it will detect data on the event channel,
06628        * call rpc_server_receive() (recursively, we already *are* in
06629        * rpc_server_receive()) and return without sleeping. Result
06630        * is a busy loop waiting for free space in data buffer */
06631       if (status != SS_TIMEOUT)
06632          ss_sleep(10);
06633 
06634       /* validate client index: we could have been removed from the buffer */
06635       idx = bm_validate_client_index(pbuf, FALSE);
06636       if (idx >= 0)
06637          pheader->client[idx].write_wait = 0;
06638       else {
06639          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_wait_for_free_space", "our client index is no longer valid, exiting...");
06640          status = SS_ABORT;
06641       }
06642 
06643       /* return if TCP connection broken */
06644       if (status == SS_ABORT)
06645          return SS_ABORT;
06646 
06647 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06648       cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Send woke up: rp=%d, wp=%d, level=%1.1lf",
06649              pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer, 100 - 100.0 * size / pheader->size);
06650 #endif
06651 
06652       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06653    }
06654 }
06655 
06656 /********************************************************************/
06657 /**
06658 Sends an event to a buffer.
06659 This function check if the buffer has enough space for the
06660 event, then copies the event to the buffer in shared memory.
06661 If clients have requests for the event, they are notified via an UDP packet.
06662 \code
06663 char event[1000];
06664 // create event with ID 1, trigger mask 0, size 100 bytes and serial number 1
06665 bm_compose_event((EVENT_HEADER *) event, 1, 0, 100, 1);
06666 
06667 // set first byte of event
06668 *(event+sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) = <...>
06669 #include <stdio.h>
06670 #include "midas.h"
06671 main()
06672 {
06673  INT status, i;
06674  HNDLE hbuf;
06675  char event[1000];
06676  status = cm_connect_experiment("", "Sample", "Producer", NULL);
06677  if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
06678  return 1;
06679  bm_open_buffer(EVENT_BUFFER_NAME, 2*MAX_EVENT_SIZE, &hbuf);
06680 
06681  // create event with ID 1, trigger mask 0, size 100 bytes and serial number 1
06682  bm_compose_event((EVENT_HEADER *) event, 1, 0, 100, 1);
06683 
06684  // set event data
06685  for (i=0 ; i<100 ; i++)
06686  *(event+sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)+i) = i;
06687  // send event
06688  bm_send_event(hbuf, event, 100+sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
06689  cm_disconnect_experiment();
06690  return 0;
06691 }
06692 \endcode
06693 @param buffer_handle Buffer handle obtained via bm_open_buffer()
06694 @param source Address of event buffer
06695 @param buf_size Size of event including event header in bytes
06696 @param async_flag Synchronous/asynchronous flag. If FALSE, the function
06697 blocks if the buffer has not enough free space to receive the event.
06698 If TRUE, the function returns immediately with a
06699 value of BM_ASYNC_RETURN without writing the event to the buffer
06700 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE, BM_INVALID_PARAM<br>
06701 BM_ASYNC_RETURN Routine called with async_flag == TRUE and
06702 buffer has not enough space to receive event<br>
06703 BM_NO_MEMORY   Event is too large for network buffer or event buffer.
06704 One has to increase MAX_EVENT_SIZE in midas.h and
06705 recompile.
06706 */
06707 INT bm_send_event(INT buffer_handle, void *source, INT buf_size, INT async_flag)
06708 {
06709    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
06710 
06711    /* check if event size is invalid */
06712    if (buf_size < sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) {
06713       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_send_event", "event size (%d) it too small", buf_size);
06714       return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
06715    }
06716 
06717    /* check if event size defined in header matches buf_size */
06718    if (ALIGN8(buf_size) != (INT) ALIGN8(((EVENT_HEADER *) source)->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))) {
06719       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_send_event", "event size (%d) mismatch in header (%d)",
06720              ALIGN8(buf_size), (INT) ALIGN8(((EVENT_HEADER *) source)->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)));
06721       return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
06722    }
06723 
06724    if (rpc_is_remote())
06725       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_SEND_EVENT, buffer_handle, source, buf_size, async_flag);
06726 
06727 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06728    {
06729       BUFFER *pbuf;
06730       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
06731       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
06732       EVENT_REQUEST *prequest;
06733       INT i, j, size, total_size, status;
06734       INT my_client_index;
06735       INT old_write_pointer;
06736       INT num_requests_client;
06737       char *pdata;
06738       INT request_id;
06739 
06740       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
06741 
06742       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
06743          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_send_event", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
06744          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06745       }
06746 
06747       if (!pbuf->attached) {
06748          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_send_event", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
06749          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06750       }
06751 
06752       pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) source;
06753       total_size = buf_size;
06754 
06755       /* round up total_size to next DWORD boundary */
06756       total_size = ALIGN8(total_size);
06757 
06758       /* look if there is space in the cache */
06759       if (pbuf->write_cache_size) {
06760          status = BM_SUCCESS;
06761 
06762          if (pbuf->write_cache_size - pbuf->write_cache_wp < total_size)
06763             status = bm_flush_cache(buffer_handle, async_flag);
06764 
06765          if (status != BM_SUCCESS)
06766             return status;
06767 
06768          if (total_size < pbuf->write_cache_size) {
06769             memcpy(pbuf->write_cache + pbuf->write_cache_wp, source, total_size);
06770 
06771             pbuf->write_cache_wp += total_size;
06772             return BM_SUCCESS;
06773          }
06774       }
06775 
06776       /* we come here only for events that are too big to fit into the cache */
06777 
06778       /* lock the buffer */
06779       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06780 
06781       /* calculate some shorthands */
06782       pheader = pbuf->buffer_header;
06783       pdata = (char *) (pheader + 1);
06784       my_client_index = bm_validate_client_index(pbuf, TRUE);
06785       pclient = pheader->client;
06786 
06787       /* check if buffer is large enough */
06788       if (total_size >= pheader->size) {
06789          bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06790          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_send_event",
06791                 "total event size (%d) larger than size (%d) of buffer \'%s\'", total_size, pheader->size, pheader->name);
06792          return BM_NO_MEMORY;
06793       }
06794 
06795       status = bm_wait_for_free_space(buffer_handle, pbuf, async_flag, total_size);
06796       if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
06797          bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06798          return status;
06799       }
06800 
06801       /* we have space, so let's copy the event */
06802       old_write_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
06803 
06804       if (pheader->write_pointer + total_size <= pheader->size) {
06805          memcpy(pdata + pheader->write_pointer, pevent, total_size);
06806          pheader->write_pointer = (pheader->write_pointer + total_size) % pheader->size;
06807          if (pheader->write_pointer > pheader->size - (int) sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))
06808             pheader->write_pointer = 0;
06809       } else {
06810          /* split event */
06811          size = pheader->size - pheader->write_pointer;
06812 
06813          memcpy(pdata + pheader->write_pointer, pevent, size);
06814          memcpy(pdata, (char *) pevent + size, total_size - size);
06815 
06816          pheader->write_pointer = total_size - size;
06817       }
06818 
06819       /* write pointer was incremented, but there should
06820        * always be some free space in the buffer and the
06821        * write pointer should never cacth up to the read pointer:
06822        * the rest of the code gets confused this happens (buffer 100% full)
06823        * as it is write_pointer == read_pointer can be either
06824        * 100% full or 100% empty. My solution: never fill
06825        * the buffer to 100% */
06826       assert(pheader->write_pointer != pheader->read_pointer);
06827 
06828       /* check which clients have a request for this event */
06829       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++)
06830          if (pclient[i].pid) {
06831             prequest = pclient[i].event_request;
06832             num_requests_client = 0;
06833             request_id = -1;
06834 
06835             for (j = 0; j < pclient[i].max_request_index; j++, prequest++)
06836                if (prequest->valid && bm_match_event(prequest->event_id, prequest->trigger_mask, pevent)) {
06837                   if (prequest->sampling_type & GET_ALL)
06838                      pclient[i].num_waiting_events++;
06839 
06840                   num_requests_client++;
06841                   request_id = prequest->id;
06842                }
06843 
06844             /* if that client has a request and is suspended, wake it up */
06845             if (num_requests_client && pclient[i].read_wait) {
06846                char str[80];
06847 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06848                cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Send wake: rp=%d, wp=%d", pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer);
06849 #endif
06850                sprintf(str, "B %s %d", pheader->name, request_id);
06851                ss_resume(pclient[i].port, str);
06852             }
06853 
06854             /* if that client has no request, shift its read pointer */
06855             if (num_requests_client == 0 && pclient[i].read_pointer == old_write_pointer)
06856                pclient[i].read_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
06857          }
06858 
06859       /* shift read pointer of own client */
06860       if (pclient[my_client_index].read_pointer == old_write_pointer)
06861          pclient[my_client_index].read_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
06862 
06863       /* calculate global read pointer as "minimum" of client read pointers */
06864 
06865       bm_update_read_pointer("bm_send_event", pheader);
06866 
06867       /* update statistics */
06868       pheader->num_in_events++;
06869 
06870       /* unlock the buffer */
06871       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06872    }
06873 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06874 
06875    return BM_SUCCESS;
06876 }
06877 
06878 /********************************************************************/
06879 /**
06880 Empty write cache.
06881 This function should be used if events in the write cache
06882 should be visible to the consumers immediately. It should be called at the
06883 end of each run, otherwise events could be kept in the write buffer and will
06884 flow to the data of the next run.
06885 @param buffer_handle Buffer handle obtained via bm_open_buffer()
06886 @param async_flag Synchronous/asynchronous flag.
06887 If FALSE, the function blocks if the buffer has not
06888 enough free space to receive the full cache. If TRUE, the function returns
06889 immediately with a value of BM_ASYNC_RETURN without writing the cache.
06890 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE<br>
06891 BM_ASYNC_RETURN Routine called with async_flag == TRUE
06892 and buffer has not enough space to receive cache<br>
06893 BM_NO_MEMORY Event is too large for network buffer or event buffer.
06894 One has to increase MAX_EVENT_SIZE in midas.h
06895 and recompile.
06896 */
06897 INT bm_flush_cache(INT buffer_handle, INT async_flag)
06898 {
06899    if (rpc_is_remote())
06900       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_FLUSH_CACHE, buffer_handle, async_flag);
06901 
06902 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06903    {
06904       BUFFER *pbuf;
06905       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
06906       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
06907       EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
06908       INT i, size, total_size, status;
06909       INT my_client_index;
06910       INT old_write_pointer;
06911       char *pdata;
06912 
06913       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
06914 
06915       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
06916          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_flush_cache", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
06917          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06918       }
06919 
06920       if (!pbuf->attached) {
06921          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_flush_cache", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
06922          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06923       }
06924 
06925       if (pbuf->write_cache_size == 0)
06926          return BM_SUCCESS;
06927 
06928       /* check if anything needs to be flushed */
06929       if (pbuf->write_cache_rp == pbuf->write_cache_wp)
06930          return BM_SUCCESS;
06931 
06932       /* lock the buffer */
06933       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06934 
06935       /* calculate some shorthands */
06936       pheader = _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header;
06937       pdata = (char *) (pheader + 1);
06938       my_client_index = bm_validate_client_index(pbuf, TRUE);
06939       pclient = pheader->client;
06940       pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pbuf->write_cache + pbuf->write_cache_rp);
06941 
06942 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06943       cm_msg(MDEBUG, "bm_flush_cache initial: rp=%d, wp=%d", pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer);
06944 #endif
06945 
06946       status = bm_wait_for_free_space(buffer_handle, pbuf, async_flag, pbuf->write_cache_wp);
06947       if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
06948          bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06949          return status;
06950       }
06951 
06952       /* we have space, so let's copy the event */
06953       old_write_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
06954 
06955 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06956       cm_msg(MDEBUG, "bm_flush_cache: found space rp=%d, wp=%d", pheader->read_pointer,
06957              pheader->write_pointer);
06958 #endif
06959 
06960       while (pbuf->write_cache_rp < pbuf->write_cache_wp) {
06961          /* loop over all events in cache */
06962 
06963          assert(pbuf->write_cache_rp >= 0);
06964          assert(pbuf->write_cache_rp < pbuf->write_cache_size);
06965 
06966          pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pbuf->write_cache + pbuf->write_cache_rp);
06967          total_size = pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
06968 
06969          assert(total_size > 0);
06970          assert(total_size <= pheader->size);
06971 
06972          /* correct size for DWORD boundary */
06973          total_size = ALIGN8(total_size);
06974 
06975          if (pheader->write_pointer + total_size <= pheader->size) {
06976             memcpy(pdata + pheader->write_pointer, pevent, total_size);
06977             pheader->write_pointer = (pheader->write_pointer + total_size) % pheader->size;
06978             if (pheader->write_pointer > pheader->size - (int) sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))
06979                pheader->write_pointer = 0;
06980          } else {
06981             /* split event */
06982             size = pheader->size - pheader->write_pointer;
06983 
06984             memcpy(pdata + pheader->write_pointer, pevent, size);
06985             memcpy(pdata, (char *) pevent + size, total_size - size);
06986 
06987             pheader->write_pointer = total_size - size;
06988          }
06989 
06990          /* see comment for the same code in bm_send_event().
06991           * We make sure the buffer is nevere 100% full */
06992          assert(pheader->write_pointer != pheader->read_pointer);
06993 
06994          /* this loop does not loop forever because write_cache_rp
06995           * is monotonously incremented here. write_cache_wp does
06996           * not change */
06997 
06998          pbuf->write_cache_rp += total_size;
06999       }
07000 
07001       pbuf->write_cache_rp = pbuf->write_cache_wp = 0;
07002 
07003       /* check which clients are waiting */
07004       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++)
07005          if (pclient[i].pid && pclient[i].read_wait) {
07006             char str[80];
07007 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
07008             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Send wake: rp=%d, wp=%d", pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer);
07009 #endif
07010             sprintf(str, "B %s %d", pheader->name, -1);
07011             ss_resume(pclient[i].port, str);
07012          }
07013 
07014       /* shift read pointer of own client */
07015       if (pclient[my_client_index].read_pointer == old_write_pointer)
07016          pclient[my_client_index].read_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
07017 
07018       /* calculate global read pointer as "minimum" of client read pointers */
07019 
07020       bm_update_read_pointer("bm_flush_cache", pheader);
07021 
07022       /* update statistics */
07023       pheader->num_in_events++;
07024 
07025       /* unlock the buffer */
07026       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07027    }
07028 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07029 
07030    return BM_SUCCESS;
07031 }
07032 
07033 /********************************************************************/
07034 /**
07035 Receives events directly.
07036 This function is an alternative way to receive events without
07037 a main loop.
07038 
07039 It can be used in analysis systems which actively receive events,
07040 rather than using callbacks. A analysis package could for example contain its own
07041 command line interface. A command
07042 like "receive 1000 events" could make it necessary to call bm_receive_event()
07043 1000 times in a row to receive these events and then return back to the
07044 command line prompt.
07045 The according bm_request_event() call contains NULL as the
07046 callback routine to indicate that bm_receive_event() is called to receive
07047 events.
07048 \code
07049 #include <stdio.h>
07050 #include "midas.h"
07051 void process_event(EVENT_HEADER *pheader)
07052 {
07053  printf("Received event #%d\r",
07054  pheader->serial_number);
07055 }
07056 main()
07057 {
07058   INT status, request_id;
07059   HNDLE hbuf;
07060   char event_buffer[1000];
07061   status = cm_connect_experiment("", "Sample",
07062   "Simple Analyzer", NULL);
07063   if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
07064    return 1;
07065   bm_open_buffer(EVENT_BUFFER_NAME, 2*MAX_EVENT_SIZE, &hbuf);
07066   bm_request_event(hbuf, 1, TRIGGER_ALL, GET_ALL, request_id, NULL);
07067 
07068   do
07069   {
07070    size = sizeof(event_buffer);
07071    status = bm_receive_event(hbuf, event_buffer, &size, ASYNC);
07072   if (status == CM_SUCCESS)
07073    process_event((EVENT_HEADER *) event_buffer);
07074    <...do something else...>
07075    status = cm_yield(0);
07076   } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN &&
07077   status != SS_ABORT);
07078   cm_disconnect_experiment();
07079   return 0;
07080 }
07081 \endcode
07082 @param buffer_handle buffer handle
07083 @param destination destination address where event is written to
07084 @param buf_size size of destination buffer on input, size of event plus
07085 header on return.
07086 @param async_flag Synchronous/asynchronous flag. If FALSE, the function
07087 blocks if no event is available. If TRUE, the function returns immediately
07088 with a value of BM_ASYNC_RETURN without receiving any event.
07089 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE <br>
07090 BM_TRUNCATED   The event is larger than the destination buffer and was
07091                therefore truncated <br>
07092 BM_ASYNC_RETURN No event available
07093 */
07094 INT bm_receive_event(INT buffer_handle, void *destination, INT * buf_size, INT async_flag)
07095 {
07096    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
07097       int status, old_timeout = 0;
07098 
07099       status = resize_net_send_buffer("bm_receive_event", *buf_size);
07100       if (status != SUCCESS)
07101          return status;  
07102 
07103       if (!async_flag) {
07104          old_timeout = rpc_get_option(-1, RPC_OTIMEOUT);
07105          rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTIMEOUT, 0);
07106       }
07107 
07108       status = rpc_call(RPC_BM_RECEIVE_EVENT, buffer_handle, destination, buf_size, async_flag);
07109 
07110       if (!async_flag) {
07111          rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTIMEOUT, old_timeout);
07112       }
07113 
07114       return status;
07115    }
07116 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07117    {
07118       BUFFER *pbuf;
07119       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
07120       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient, *pc;
07121       char *pdata;
07122       INT convert_flags;
07123       INT i, size, max_size;
07124       INT status = 0;
07125       INT my_client_index;
07126       BOOL cache_is_full = FALSE;
07127       BOOL use_event_buffer = FALSE;
07128       int cycle = 0;
07129 
07130       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
07131 
07132       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
07133          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_receive_event", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
07134          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
07135       }
07136 
07137       if (!pbuf->attached) {
07138          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_receive_event", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
07139          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
07140       }
07141 
07142       max_size = *buf_size;
07143       *buf_size = 0;
07144 
07145       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
07146          convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
07147       else
07148          convert_flags = 0;
07149 
07150       /* look if there is anything in the cache */
07151       if (bm_read_cache_has_events(pbuf))
07152          return bm_copy_from_cache(pbuf, destination, max_size, buf_size, convert_flags);
07153 
07154     LOOP:
07155       /* make sure we do bm_validate_client_index() after sleeping */
07156 
07157       /* calculate some shorthands */
07158       pheader = pbuf->buffer_header;
07159       pdata = (char *) (pheader + 1);
07160       my_client_index = bm_validate_client_index(pbuf, TRUE);
07161       pclient = pheader->client;
07162       pc = pheader->client + my_client_index;
07163 
07164       /* first do a quick check without locking the buffer */
07165       if (async_flag == ASYNC && pheader->write_pointer == pc->read_pointer)
07166          return BM_ASYNC_RETURN;
07167 
07168       /* lock the buffer */
07169       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07170 
07171       while (pheader->write_pointer == pc->read_pointer) {
07172 
07173          bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07174 
07175          /* return now in ASYNC mode */
07176          if (async_flag == ASYNC)
07177             return BM_ASYNC_RETURN;
07178 
07179          pc->read_wait = TRUE;
07180 
07181          /* check again pointers (may have moved in between) */
07182          if (pheader->write_pointer == pc->read_pointer) {
07183 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
07184             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Receive sleep: grp=%d, rp=%d wp=%d",
07185                    pheader->read_pointer, pc->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer);
07186 #endif
07187 
07188             status = ss_suspend(1000, MSG_BM);
07189 
07190 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
07191             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Receive woke up: rp=%d, wp=%d", pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer);
07192 #endif
07193 
07194             /* return if TCP connection broken */
07195             if (status == SS_ABORT)
07196                return SS_ABORT;
07197          }
07198 
07199          pc->read_wait = FALSE;
07200 
07201          /* validate client_index: somebody may have disconnected us from the buffer */
07202          bm_validate_client_index(pbuf, TRUE);
07203 
07204          bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07205       }
07206 
07207       /* check if event at current read pointer matches a request */
07208 
07209       do {
07210          int new_read_pointer;
07211          int total_size;        /* size of the event */
07212          EVENT_REQUEST *prequest;
07213          EVENT_HEADER *pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pdata + pc->read_pointer);
07214 
07215          assert(pc->read_pointer >= 0);
07216          assert(pc->read_pointer <= pheader->size);
07217 
07218          total_size = pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
07219          total_size = ALIGN8(total_size);
07220 
07221          assert(total_size > 0);
07222          assert(total_size <= pheader->size);
07223 
07224          prequest = pc->event_request;
07225 
07226          /* loop over all requests: if this event matches a request,
07227           * copy it to the read cache */
07228 
07229          for (i = 0; i < pc->max_request_index; i++, prequest++)
07230             if (prequest->valid && bm_match_event(prequest->event_id, prequest->trigger_mask, pevent)) {
07231 
07232                /* we found a request for this event, so copy it */
07233 
07234                if (pbuf->read_cache_size > 0 && total_size < pbuf->read_cache_size) {
07235 
07236                   /* copy event to cache, if there is room */
07237 
07238                   if (pbuf->read_cache_wp + total_size >= pbuf->read_cache_size) {
07239                      cache_is_full = TRUE;
07240                      break;     /* exit loop over requests */
07241                   }
07242 
07243                   if (pc->read_pointer + total_size <= pheader->size) {
07244                      /* copy event to cache */
07245                      memcpy(pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_wp, pevent, total_size);
07246                   } else {
07247                      /* event is splitted */
07248                      size = pheader->size - pc->read_pointer;
07249                      memcpy(pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_wp, pevent, size);
07250                      memcpy((char *) pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_wp + size, pdata, total_size - size);
07251                   }
07252 
07253                   pbuf->read_cache_wp += total_size;
07254 
07255                } else {
07256                   int copy_size = total_size;
07257 
07258                   /* if there are events in the read cache,
07259                    * we should dispatch them before we
07260                    * despatch this oversize event */
07261 
07262                   if (bm_read_cache_has_events(pbuf)) {
07263                      cache_is_full = TRUE;
07264                      break;     /* exit loop over requests */
07265                   }
07266 
07267                   use_event_buffer = TRUE;
07268 
07269                   status = BM_SUCCESS;
07270                   if (copy_size > max_size) {
07271                      copy_size = max_size;
07272                      cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_receive_event",
07273                             "event size %d larger than buffer size %d", total_size, max_size);
07274                      status = BM_TRUNCATED;
07275                   }
07276 
07277                   if (pc->read_pointer + total_size <= pheader->size) {
07278                      /* event is not splitted */
07279                      memcpy(destination, pevent, copy_size);
07280                   } else {
07281                      /* event is splitted */
07282                      size = pheader->size - pc->read_pointer;
07283 
07284                      if (size > max_size)
07285                         memcpy(destination, pevent, max_size);
07286                      else
07287                         memcpy(destination, pevent, size);
07288 
07289                      if (total_size > max_size) {
07290                         if (size <= max_size)
07291                            memcpy((char *) destination + size, pdata, max_size - size);
07292                      } else
07293                         memcpy((char *) destination + size, pdata, total_size - size);
07294                   }
07295 
07296                   *buf_size = copy_size;
07297 
07298                   bm_convert_event_header((EVENT_HEADER *) destination, convert_flags);
07299                }
07300 
07301                /* update statistics */
07302                pheader->num_out_events++;
07303                break;           /* stop looping over requests */
07304             }
07305 
07306          if (cache_is_full)
07307             break;              /* exit from loop over events in data buffer, leaving the current event untouched */
07308 
07309          /* shift read pointer */
07310 
07311          assert(total_size > 0);
07312          assert(total_size <= pheader->size);
07313 
07314          new_read_pointer = pc->read_pointer + total_size;
07315          if (new_read_pointer >= pheader->size) {
07316             new_read_pointer = new_read_pointer % pheader->size;
07317 
07318             /* make sure we loop over the data buffer no more than once */
07319             cycle++;
07320             assert(cycle < 2);
07321          }
07322 
07323          /* make sure we do not split the event header at the end of the buffer */
07324          if (new_read_pointer > pheader->size - (int) sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))
07325             new_read_pointer = 0;
07326 
07327 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
07328          cm_msg(MDEBUG, "bm_receive_event -> wp=%d, rp %d -> %d (found=%d,size=%d)",
07329                 pheader->write_pointer, pc->read_pointer, new_read_pointer, found, total_size);
07330 #endif
07331 
07332          pc->read_pointer = new_read_pointer;
07333 
07334          if (use_event_buffer)
07335             break;              /* exit from loop over events in data buffer */
07336 
07337       } while (pheader->write_pointer != pc->read_pointer);
07338 
07339       /* calculate global read pointer as "minimum" of client read pointers */
07340 
07341       bm_update_read_pointer("bm_receive_event", pheader);
07342 
07343       /*
07344          If read pointer has been changed, it may have freed up some space
07345          for waiting producers. So check if free space is now more than 50%
07346          of the buffer size and wake waiting producers.
07347        */
07348 
07349       bm_wakeup_producers(pheader, pc);
07350 
07351       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07352 
07353       if (bm_read_cache_has_events(pbuf)) {
07354          assert(!use_event_buffer);     /* events only go into the _event_buffer when read cache is empty */
07355          return bm_copy_from_cache(pbuf, destination, max_size, buf_size, convert_flags);
07356       }
07357 
07358       if (use_event_buffer)
07359          return status;
07360 
07361       goto LOOP;
07362    }
07363 #else                           /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07364 
07365    return SS_SUCCESS;
07366 #endif
07367 }
07368 
07369 /********************************************************************/
07370 /**
07371 Skip all events in current buffer.
07372 
07373 Useful for single event displays to see the newest events
07374 @param buffer_handle      Handle of the buffer. Must be obtained
07375                           via bm_open_buffer.
07376 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE, RPC_NET_ERROR
07377 */
07378 INT bm_skip_event(INT buffer_handle)
07379 {
07380    if (rpc_is_remote())
07381       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_SKIP_EVENT, buffer_handle);
07382 
07383 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07384    {
07385       BUFFER *pbuf;
07386       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
07387       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
07388 
07389       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
07390          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_skip_event", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
07391          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
07392       }
07393 
07394       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
07395       pheader = pbuf->buffer_header;
07396 
07397       if (!pbuf->attached) {
07398          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_skip_event", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
07399          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
07400       }
07401 
07402       /* clear cache */
07403       if (pbuf->read_cache_wp > pbuf->read_cache_rp)
07404          pbuf->read_cache_rp = pbuf->read_cache_wp = 0;
07405 
07406       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07407 
07408       /* forward read pointer to global write pointer */
07409       pclient = pheader->client + bm_validate_client_index(pbuf, TRUE);
07410       pclient->read_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
07411 
07412       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07413    }
07414 #endif
07415 
07416    return BM_SUCCESS;
07417 }
07418 
07419 /********************************************************************/
07420 /**
07421 Check a buffer if an event is available and call the dispatch function if found.
07422 @param buffer_name       Name of buffer
07423 @return BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE, BM_TRUNCATED, BM_ASYNC_RETURN,
07424                     RPC_NET_ERROR
07425 */
07426 INT bm_push_event(char *buffer_name)
07427 {
07428 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07429    {
07430       BUFFER *pbuf;
07431       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
07432       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient, *pc;
07433       char *pdata;
07434       INT i, size, buffer_handle;
07435       INT my_client_index;
07436       BOOL use_event_buffer = 0;
07437       BOOL cache_is_full = 0;
07438       int cycle = 0;
07439 
07440       for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
07441          if (strcmp(buffer_name, _buffer[i].buffer_header->name) == 0)
07442             break;
07443       if (i == _buffer_entries)
07444          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
07445 
07446       buffer_handle = i + 1;
07447       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
07448 
07449       if (!pbuf->attached)
07450          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
07451 
07452       /* return immediately if no callback routine is defined */
07453       if (!pbuf->callback)
07454          return BM_SUCCESS;
07455 
07456       if (_event_buffer_size == 0) {
07457          _event_buffer = (EVENT_HEADER *) M_MALLOC(1000);
07458          if (_event_buffer == NULL) {
07459             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_push_event", "not enough memory to allocate cache buffer");
07460             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
07461          }
07462          _event_buffer_size = 1000;
07463       }
07464 
07465       /* look if there is anything in the cache */
07466       if (bm_read_cache_has_events(pbuf)) {
07467          bm_dispatch_from_cache(pbuf, buffer_handle);
07468          return BM_MORE_EVENTS;
07469       }
07470 
07471       /* calculate some shorthands */
07472       pheader = pbuf->buffer_header;
07473       pdata = (char *) (pheader + 1);
07474       my_client_index = bm_validate_client_index(pbuf, TRUE);
07475       pclient = pheader->client;
07476       pc = pheader->client + my_client_index;
07477 
07478       /* first do a quick check without locking the buffer */
07479       if (pheader->write_pointer == pc->read_pointer)
07480          return BM_SUCCESS;
07481 
07482       /* lock the buffer */
07483       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07484 
07485       if (pheader->write_pointer == pc->read_pointer) {
07486 
07487          bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07488 
07489          /* return if no event available */
07490          return BM_SUCCESS;
07491       }
07492 
07493       /* loop over all events in the buffer */
07494 
07495       do {
07496          int new_read_pointer;
07497          int total_size;        /* size of the event */
07498          EVENT_REQUEST *prequest;
07499          EVENT_HEADER *pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pdata + pc->read_pointer);
07500 
07501          assert(pc->read_pointer >= 0);
07502          assert(pc->read_pointer <= pheader->size);
07503 
07504          total_size = pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
07505          total_size = ALIGN8(total_size);
07506 
07507          assert(total_size > 0);
07508          assert(total_size <= pheader->size);
07509 
07510          prequest = pc->event_request;
07511 
07512          /* loop over all requests: if this event matches a request,
07513           * copy it to the read cache */
07514 
07515          for (i = 0; i < pc->max_request_index; i++, prequest++)
07516             if (prequest->valid && bm_match_event(prequest->event_id, prequest->trigger_mask, pevent)) {
07517 
07518                /* check if this is a recent event */
07519                if (prequest->sampling_type == GET_RECENT) {
07520                   if (ss_time() - pevent->time_stamp > 1) {
07521                      /* skip that event */
07522                      continue;
07523                   }
07524 
07525                   printf("now: %d, event: %d\n", ss_time(), pevent->time_stamp);
07526                }
07527 
07528                /* we found a request for this event, so copy it */
07529 
07530                if (pbuf->read_cache_size > 0 && total_size < pbuf->read_cache_size) {
07531 
07532                   /* copy event to cache, if there is room */
07533 
07534                   if (pbuf->read_cache_wp + total_size >= pbuf->read_cache_size) {
07535                      cache_is_full = TRUE;
07536                      break;     /* exit loop over requests */
07537                   }
07538 
07539                   if (pc->read_pointer + total_size <= pheader->size) {
07540                      /* copy event to cache */
07541                      memcpy(pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_wp, pevent, total_size);
07542                   } else {
07543                      /* event is splitted */
07544                      size = pheader->size - pc->read_pointer;
07545                      memcpy(pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_wp, pevent, size);
07546                      memcpy((char *) pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_wp + size, pdata, total_size - size);
07547                   }
07548 
07549                   pbuf->read_cache_wp += total_size;
07550 
07551                } else {
07552                   /* copy event to copy buffer */
07553 
07554                   /* if there are events in the read cache,
07555                    * we should dispatch them before we
07556                    * despatch this oversize event */
07557 
07558                   if (bm_read_cache_has_events(pbuf)) {
07559                      cache_is_full = TRUE;
07560                      break;     /* exit loop over requests */
07561                   }
07562 
07563                   use_event_buffer = TRUE;
07564 
07565                   if (total_size > _event_buffer_size) {
07566                      //printf("realloc event buffer %d -> %d\n", _event_buffer_size, total_size);
07567                      _event_buffer = (EVENT_HEADER *) realloc(_event_buffer, total_size);
07568                      _event_buffer_size = total_size;
07569                   }
07570 
07571                   if (pc->read_pointer + total_size <= pheader->size) {
07572                      memcpy(_event_buffer, pevent, total_size);
07573                   } else {
07574                      /* event is splitted */
07575                      size = pheader->size - pc->read_pointer;
07576 
07577                      memcpy(_event_buffer, pevent, size);
07578                      memcpy((char *) _event_buffer + size, pdata, total_size - size);
07579                   }
07580                }
07581 
07582                /* update statistics */
07583                pheader->num_out_events++;
07584                break;           /* exit loop over event requests */
07585 
07586             }
07587          /* end of loop over event requests */
07588          if (cache_is_full)
07589             break;              /* exit from loop over events in data buffer, leaving the current event untouched */
07590 
07591          /* shift read pointer */
07592 
07593          assert(total_size > 0);
07594          assert(total_size <= pheader->size);
07595 
07596          new_read_pointer = pc->read_pointer + total_size;
07597          if (new_read_pointer >= pheader->size) {
07598             new_read_pointer = new_read_pointer % pheader->size;
07599 
07600             /* make sure we loop over the data buffer no more than once */
07601             cycle++;
07602             assert(cycle < 2);
07603          }
07604 
07605          /* make sure we do not split the event header at the end of the buffer */
07606          if (new_read_pointer > pheader->size - (int) sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))
07607             new_read_pointer = 0;
07608 
07609 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
07610          cm_msg(MDEBUG, "bm_push_event -> wp=%d, rp %d -> %d (found=%d,size=%d)",
07611                 pheader->write_pointer, pc->read_pointer, new_read_pointer, found, total_size);
07612 #endif
07613 
07614          pc->read_pointer = new_read_pointer;
07615 
07616          if (use_event_buffer)
07617             break;              /* exit from loop over events in data buffer */
07618 
07619       } while (pheader->write_pointer != pc->read_pointer);
07620 
07621       /* calculate global read pointer as "minimum" of client read pointers */
07622 
07623       bm_update_read_pointer("bm_push_event", pheader);
07624 
07625       /*
07626          If read pointer has been changed, it may have freed up some space
07627          for waiting producers. So check if free space is now more than 50%
07628          of the buffer size and wake waiting producers.
07629        */
07630 
07631       bm_wakeup_producers(pheader, pc);
07632 
07633       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07634 
07635       if (bm_read_cache_has_events(pbuf)) {
07636          assert(!use_event_buffer);     /* events only go into the _event_buffer when read cache is empty */
07637          bm_dispatch_from_cache(pbuf, buffer_handle);
07638          return BM_MORE_EVENTS;
07639       }
07640 
07641       if (use_event_buffer) {
07642          bm_dispatch_event(buffer_handle, _event_buffer);
07643          return BM_MORE_EVENTS;
07644       }
07645 
07646       return BM_SUCCESS;
07647    }
07648 #else                           /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07649 
07650    return BM_SUCCESS;
07651 #endif
07652 }
07653 
07654 /********************************************************************/
07655 /**
07656 Check if any requested event is waiting in a buffer
07657 @return TRUE             More events are waiting<br>
07658         FALSE            No more events are waiting
07659 */
07660 INT bm_check_buffers()
07661 {
07662 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07663    {
07664       INT idx, status = 0;
07665       INT server_type, server_conn, tid;
07666       BOOL bMore;
07667       DWORD start_time;
07668 
07669       server_type = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE);
07670       server_conn = rpc_get_server_acception();
07671       tid = ss_gettid();
07672 
07673       /* if running as a server, buffer checking is done by client
07674          via ASYNC bm_receive_event */
07675       if (server_type == ST_SUBPROCESS || server_type == ST_MTHREAD)
07676          return FALSE;
07677 
07678       bMore = FALSE;
07679       start_time = ss_millitime();
07680 
07681       /* go through all buffers */
07682       for (idx = 0; idx < _buffer_entries; idx++) {
07683          if (server_type == ST_SINGLE && _buffer[idx].index != server_conn)
07684             continue;
07685 
07686          if (server_type != ST_SINGLE && _buffer[idx].index != tid)
07687             continue;
07688 
07689          if (!_buffer[idx].attached)
07690             continue;
07691 
07692          do {
07693 
07694             /* one bm_push_event could cause a run stop and a buffer close, which
07695                would crash the next call to bm_push_event(). So check for valid
07696                buffer on each call */
07697             if (idx < _buffer_entries && _buffer[idx].buffer_header->name != NULL)
07698                status = bm_push_event(_buffer[idx].buffer_header->name);
07699 
07700             if (status != BM_MORE_EVENTS)
07701                break;
07702 
07703             /* stop after one second */
07704             if (ss_millitime() - start_time > 1000) {
07705                bMore = TRUE;
07706                break;
07707             }
07708 
07709          } while (TRUE);
07710       }
07711 
07712       return bMore;
07713 
07714    }
07715 #else                           /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07716 
07717    return FALSE;
07718 
07719 #endif
07720 }
07721 
07722 /**dox***************************************************************/
07723 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
07724 
07725 /********************************************************************/
07726 INT bm_mark_read_waiting(BOOL flag)
07727 /********************************************************************\
07728 
07729   Routine: bm_mark_read_waiting
07730 
07731   Purpose: Mark all open buffers ready for receiving events.
07732            Called internally by ss_suspend
07733 
07734 
07735   Input:
07736     BOOL flag               TRUE for waiting, FALSE for not waiting
07737 
07738   Output:
07739     none
07740 
07741   Function value:
07742     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
07743 
07744 \********************************************************************/
07745 {
07746    if (rpc_is_remote())
07747       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_MARK_READ_WAITING, flag);
07748 
07749 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07750    {
07751       INT i;
07752       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
07753       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
07754 
07755       /* Mark all buffer for read waiting */
07756       for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++) {
07757          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE
07758              && _buffer[i].index != rpc_get_server_acception())
07759             continue;
07760 
07761          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE && _buffer[i].index != ss_gettid())
07762             continue;
07763 
07764          if (!_buffer[i].attached)
07765             continue;
07766 
07767          pheader = _buffer[i].buffer_header;
07768          pclient = pheader->client + bm_validate_client_index(&_buffer[i], TRUE);
07769          pclient->read_wait = flag;
07770       }
07771    }
07772 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07773 
07774    return BM_SUCCESS;
07775 }
07776 
07777 /********************************************************************/
07778 INT bm_notify_client(char *buffer_name, int s)
07779 /********************************************************************\
07780 
07781   Routine: bm_notify_client
07782 
07783   Purpose: Called by cm_dispatch_ipc. Send an event notification to
07784            the connected client
07785 
07786   Input:
07787     char  *buffer_name      Name of buffer
07788     int   s                 Network socket to client
07789 
07790   Output:
07791     none
07792 
07793   Function value:
07794     BM_SUCCESS              Successful completion
07795 
07796 \********************************************************************/
07797 {
07798    char buffer[32];
07799    NET_COMMAND *nc;
07800    INT i, convert_flags;
07801    static DWORD last_time = 0;
07802 
07803    for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
07804       if (strcmp(buffer_name, _buffer[i].buffer_header->name) == 0)
07805          break;
07806    if (i == _buffer_entries)
07807       return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
07808 
07809    /* don't send notification if client has no callback defined
07810       to receive events -> client calls bm_receive_event manually */
07811    if (!_buffer[i].callback)
07812       return DB_SUCCESS;
07813 
07814    convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
07815 
07816    /* only send notification once each 500ms */
07817    if (ss_millitime() - last_time < 500 && !(convert_flags & CF_ASCII))
07818       return DB_SUCCESS;
07819 
07820    last_time = ss_millitime();
07821 
07822    if (convert_flags & CF_ASCII) {
07823       sprintf(buffer, "MSG_BM&%s", buffer_name);
07824       send_tcp(s, buffer, strlen(buffer) + 1, 0);
07825    } else {
07826       nc = (NET_COMMAND *) buffer;
07827 
07828       nc->header.routine_id = MSG_BM;
07829       nc->header.param_size = 0;
07830 
07831       if (convert_flags) {
07832          rpc_convert_single(&nc->header.routine_id, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
07833          rpc_convert_single(&nc->header.param_size, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
07834       }
07835 
07836       /* send the update notification to the client */
07837       send_tcp(s, (char *) buffer, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), 0);
07838    }
07839 
07840    return BM_SUCCESS;
07841 }
07842 
07843 /********************************************************************/
07844 INT bm_poll_event(INT flag)
07845 /********************************************************************\
07846 
07847   Routine: bm_poll_event
07848 
07849   Purpose: Poll an event from a remote server. Gets called by
07850            rpc_client_dispatch
07851 
07852   Input:
07853     INT flag         TRUE if called from cm_yield
07854 
07855   Output:
07856     none
07857 
07858   Function value:
07859     TRUE             More events are waiting
07860     FALSE            No more events are waiting
07861     SS_ABORT         Network connection broken
07862 
07863 \********************************************************************/
07864 {
07865    INT status, size, i, request_id;
07866    DWORD start_time;
07867    BOOL bMore;
07868    static BOOL bMoreLast = FALSE;
07869 
07870    if (_event_buffer_size == 0) {
07871       HNDLE hDB, odb_key;
07872       int max_event_size = MAX_EVENT_SIZE;
07873 
07874       /* get max event size from ODB */
07875       status = cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &odb_key);
07876       assert(status == SUCCESS);
07877       size = sizeof(INT);
07878       status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/MAX_EVENT_SIZE", &max_event_size, &size, TID_DWORD, TRUE);
07879 
07880       size = max_event_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
07881       //printf("alloc event buffer %d\n", size);
07882       _event_buffer = (EVENT_HEADER *) M_MALLOC(size);
07883       if (!_event_buffer) {
07884          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_poll_event", "not enough memory to allocate event buffer of size %d", size);
07885          return SS_ABORT;
07886       }
07887       _event_buffer_size = size;
07888    }
07889 
07890    start_time = ss_millitime();
07891 
07892    /* if we got event notification, turn off read_wait */
07893    if (!flag)
07894       bm_mark_read_waiting(FALSE);
07895 
07896    /* if called from yield, return if no more events */
07897    if (flag) {
07898       if (!bMoreLast)
07899          return FALSE;
07900    }
07901 
07902    bMore = FALSE;
07903 
07904    /* loop over all requests */
07905    for (request_id = 0; request_id < _request_list_entries; request_id++) {
07906       /* continue if no dispatcher set (manual bm_receive_event) */
07907       if (_request_list[request_id].dispatcher == NULL)
07908          continue;
07909 
07910       do {
07911          /* receive event */
07912          size = _event_buffer_size;
07913          status = bm_receive_event(_request_list[request_id].buffer_handle, _event_buffer, &size, ASYNC);
07914          //printf("receive_event buf %d, event %d, status %d\n", _event_buffer_size, size, status);
07915 
07916          /* call user function if successful */
07917          if (status == BM_SUCCESS)
07918             /* search proper request for this event */
07919             for (i = 0; i < _request_list_entries; i++)
07920                if ((_request_list[i].buffer_handle ==
07921                     _request_list[request_id].buffer_handle) &&
07922                    bm_match_event(_request_list[i].event_id, _request_list[i].trigger_mask, _event_buffer)) {
07923                   if ((_event_buffer->event_id & 0xF000) == EVENTID_FRAG1 ||
07924                       (_event_buffer->event_id & 0xF000) == EVENTID_FRAG)
07925                      bm_defragment_event(_request_list[i].buffer_handle, i, _event_buffer,
07926                                          (void *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) _event_buffer) + 1),
07927                                          _request_list[i].dispatcher);
07928                   else
07929                      _request_list[i].dispatcher(_request_list[i].buffer_handle, i,
07930                                                  _event_buffer,
07931                                                  (void *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) _event_buffer) + 1));
07932                }
07933 
07934          /* break if no more events */
07935          if (status == BM_ASYNC_RETURN)
07936             break;
07937 
07938          /* break if server died */
07939          if (status == RPC_NET_ERROR)
07940             return SS_ABORT;
07941 
07942          /* stop after one second */
07943          if (ss_millitime() - start_time > 1000) {
07944             bMore = TRUE;
07945             break;
07946          }
07947 
07948       } while (TRUE);
07949    }
07950 
07951    if (!bMore)
07952       bm_mark_read_waiting(TRUE);
07953 
07954    bMoreLast = bMore;
07955 
07956    return bMore;
07957 }
07958 
07959 /**dox***************************************************************/
07960 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
07961 
07962 /********************************************************************/
07963 /**
07964 Clears event buffer and cache.
07965 If an event buffer is large and a consumer is slow in analyzing
07966 events, events are usually received some time after they are produced.
07967 This effect is even more experienced if a read cache is used
07968 (via bm_set_cache_size()).
07969 When changes to the hardware are made in the experience, the consumer will then
07970 still analyze old events before any new event which reflects the hardware change.
07971 Users can be fooled by looking at histograms which reflect the hardware change
07972 many seconds after they have been made.
07973 
07974 To overcome this potential problem, the analyzer can call
07975 bm_empty_buffers() just after the hardware change has been made which
07976 skips all old events contained in event buffers and read caches.
07977 Technically this is done by forwarding the read pointer of the client.
07978 No events are really deleted, they are still visible to other clients like
07979 the logger.
07980 
07981 Note that the front-end also contains write buffers which can delay the
07982 delivery of events.
07983 The standard front-end framework mfe.c reduces this effect by flushing
07984 all buffers once every second.
07985 @return BM_SUCCESS
07986 */
07987 INT bm_empty_buffers()
07988 {
07989    if (rpc_is_remote())
07990       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_EMPTY_BUFFERS);
07991 
07992 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07993    {
07994       INT idx, server_type, server_conn, tid;
07995       BUFFER *pbuf;
07996       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient;
07997 
07998       server_type = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE);
07999       server_conn = rpc_get_server_acception();
08000       tid = ss_gettid();
08001 
08002       /* go through all buffers */
08003       for (idx = 0; idx < _buffer_entries; idx++) {
08004          if (server_type == ST_SINGLE && _buffer[idx].index != server_conn)
08005             continue;
08006 
08007          if (server_type != ST_SINGLE && _buffer[idx].index != tid)
08008             continue;
08009 
08010          if (!_buffer[idx].attached)
08011             continue;
08012 
08013          pbuf = &_buffer[idx];
08014 
08015          /* empty cache */
08016          pbuf->read_cache_rp = pbuf->read_cache_wp = 0;
08017 
08018          bm_lock_buffer(idx + 1);
08019 
08020          /* set read pointer to write pointer */
08021          pclient = (pbuf->buffer_header)->client + bm_validate_client_index(pbuf, TRUE);
08022          pclient->read_pointer = (pbuf->buffer_header)->write_pointer;
08023 
08024          bm_unlock_buffer(idx + 1);
08025       }
08026 
08027    }
08028 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
08029 
08030    return BM_SUCCESS;
08031 }
08032 
08033 /**dox***************************************************************/
08034 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
08035 
08036 #define MAX_DEFRAG_EVENTS 10
08037 
08038 typedef struct {
08039    WORD event_id;
08040    DWORD data_size;
08041    DWORD received;
08042    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
08043 } EVENT_DEFRAG_BUFFER;
08044 
08045 EVENT_DEFRAG_BUFFER defrag_buffer[MAX_DEFRAG_EVENTS];
08046 
08047 /********************************************************************/
08048 void bm_defragment_event(HNDLE buffer_handle, HNDLE request_id,
08049                          EVENT_HEADER * pevent, void *pdata, void (*dispatcher) (HNDLE, HNDLE, EVENT_HEADER *,
08050                                                                                  void *))
08051 /********************************************************************\
08052 
08053   Routine: bm_defragment_event
08054 
08055   Purpose: Called internally from the event receiving routines
08056            bm_push_event and bm_poll_event to recombine event
08057            fragments and call the user callback routine upon
08058            completion.
08059 
08060   Input:
08061     HNDLE buffer_handle  Handle for the buffer containing event
08062     HNDLE request_id     Handle for event request
08063     EVENT_HEADER *pevent Pointer to event header
08064     void *pata           Pointer to event data
08065     dispatcher()         User callback routine
08066 
08067   Output:
08068     <calls dispatcher() after successfull recombination of event>
08069 
08070   Function value:
08071     void
08072 
08073 \********************************************************************/
08074 {
08075    INT i;
08076    static int j = -1;
08077 
08078    if ((pevent->event_id & 0xF000) == EVENTID_FRAG1) {
08079       /*---- start new event ----*/
08080 
08081       //printf("First Frag detected : Ser#:%d ID=0x%x \n", pevent->serial_number, pevent->event_id);
08082 
08083       /* check if fragments already stored */
08084       for (i = 0; i < MAX_DEFRAG_EVENTS; i++)
08085          if (defrag_buffer[i].event_id == (pevent->event_id & 0x0FFF))
08086             break;
08087 
08088       if (i < MAX_DEFRAG_EVENTS) {
08089          free(defrag_buffer[i].pevent);
08090          memset(&defrag_buffer[i].event_id, 0, sizeof(EVENT_DEFRAG_BUFFER));
08091          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_defragement_event",
08092                 "Received new event with ID %d while old fragments were not completed",
08093                 (pevent->event_id & 0x0FFF));
08094       }
08095 
08096       /* search new slot */
08097       for (i = 0; i < MAX_DEFRAG_EVENTS; i++)
08098          if (defrag_buffer[i].event_id == 0)
08099             break;
08100 
08101       if (i == MAX_DEFRAG_EVENTS) {
08102          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_defragment_event",
08103                 "Not enough defragment buffers, please increase MAX_DEFRAG_EVENTS and recompile");
08104          return;
08105       }
08106 
08107       /* check event size */
08108       if (pevent->data_size != sizeof(DWORD)) {
08109          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_defragment_event",
08110                 "Received first event fragment with %s bytes instead of %d bytes, event ignored",
08111                 pevent->data_size, sizeof(DWORD));
08112          return;
08113       }
08114 
08115       /* setup defragment buffer */
08116       defrag_buffer[i].event_id = (pevent->event_id & 0x0FFF);
08117       defrag_buffer[i].data_size = *(DWORD *) pdata;
08118       defrag_buffer[i].received = 0;
08119       defrag_buffer[i].pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) malloc(sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + defrag_buffer[i].data_size);
08120 
08121       if (defrag_buffer[i].pevent == NULL) {
08122          memset(&defrag_buffer[i].event_id, 0, sizeof(EVENT_DEFRAG_BUFFER));
08123          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_defragement_event", "Not enough memory to allocate event defragment buffer");
08124          return;
08125       }
08126 
08127       memcpy(defrag_buffer[i].pevent, pevent, sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
08128       defrag_buffer[i].pevent->event_id = defrag_buffer[i].event_id;
08129       defrag_buffer[i].pevent->data_size = defrag_buffer[i].data_size;
08130 
08131       // printf("First frag[%d] (ID %d) Ser#:%d sz:%d\n", i, defrag_buffer[i].event_id,
08132       //       pevent->serial_number, defrag_buffer[i].data_size);
08133 
08134       j = 0;
08135 
08136       return;
08137    }
08138 
08139    /* search buffer for that event */
08140    for (i = 0; i < MAX_DEFRAG_EVENTS; i++)
08141       if (defrag_buffer[i].event_id == (pevent->event_id & 0xFFF))
08142          break;
08143 
08144    if (i == MAX_DEFRAG_EVENTS) {
08145       /* no buffer available -> no first fragment received */
08146       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_defragement_event",
08147              "Received fragment without first fragment (ID %d) Ser#:%d",
08148              pevent->event_id & 0x0FFF, pevent->serial_number);
08149       return;
08150    }
08151 
08152    /* add fragment to buffer */
08153    if (pevent->data_size + defrag_buffer[i].received > defrag_buffer[i].data_size) {
08154       free(defrag_buffer[i].pevent);
08155       memset(&defrag_buffer[i].event_id, 0, sizeof(EVENT_DEFRAG_BUFFER));
08156       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_defragement_event",
08157              "Received fragments with more data (%d) than event size (%d)",
08158              pevent->data_size + defrag_buffer[i].received, defrag_buffer[i].data_size);
08159       return;
08160    }
08161 
08162    memcpy(((char *) defrag_buffer[i].pevent) + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) +
08163           defrag_buffer[i].received, pdata, pevent->data_size);
08164 
08165    defrag_buffer[i].received += pevent->data_size;
08166 
08167    //printf("Other frag[%d][%d] (ID %d) Ser#:%d sz:%d\n", i, j++,
08168    //       defrag_buffer[i].event_id, pevent->serial_number, pevent->data_size);
08169 
08170    if (defrag_buffer[i].received == defrag_buffer[i].data_size) {
08171       /* event complete */
08172       dispatcher(buffer_handle, request_id, defrag_buffer[i].pevent, defrag_buffer[i].pevent + 1);
08173       free(defrag_buffer[i].pevent);
08174       memset(&defrag_buffer[i].event_id, 0, sizeof(EVENT_DEFRAG_BUFFER));
08175    }
08176 }
08177 
08178 /**dox***************************************************************/
08179 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
08180 
08181 /**dox***************************************************************/
08182                                                                                                                                /** @} *//* end of bmfunctionc */
08183 
08184 /**dox***************************************************************/
08185 /** @addtogroup rpcfunctionc
08186  *
08187  *  @{  */
08188 
08189 /**dox***************************************************************/
08190 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
08191 
08192 /********************************************************************\
08193 *                                                                    *
08194 *                         RPC functions                              *
08195 *                                                                    *
08196 \********************************************************************/
08197 
08198 /* globals */
08199 
08200 RPC_CLIENT_CONNECTION _client_connection[MAX_RPC_CONNECTION];
08201 RPC_SERVER_CONNECTION _server_connection;
08202 
08203 static int _lsock;
08204 RPC_SERVER_ACCEPTION _server_acception[MAX_RPC_CONNECTION];
08205 static INT _server_acception_index = 0;
08206 static INT _server_type;
08207 static char _server_name[256];
08208 
08209 static RPC_LIST *rpc_list = NULL;
08210 
08211 int _opt_tcp_size = OPT_TCP_SIZE;
08212 
08213 
08214 /********************************************************************\
08215 *                       conversion functions                         *
08216 \********************************************************************/
08217 
08218 void rpc_calc_convert_flags(INT hw_type, INT remote_hw_type, INT * convert_flags)
08219 {
08220    *convert_flags = 0;
08221 
08222    /* big/little endian conversion */
08223    if (((remote_hw_type & DRI_BIG_ENDIAN) &&
08224         (hw_type & DRI_LITTLE_ENDIAN)) || ((remote_hw_type & DRI_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
08225                                            && (hw_type & DRI_BIG_ENDIAN)))
08226       *convert_flags |= CF_ENDIAN;
08227 
08228    /* float conversion between IEEE and VAX G */
08229    if ((remote_hw_type & DRF_G_FLOAT) && (hw_type & DRF_IEEE))
08230       *convert_flags |= CF_VAX2IEEE;
08231 
08232    /* float conversion between VAX G and IEEE */
08233    if ((remote_hw_type & DRF_IEEE) && (hw_type & DRF_G_FLOAT))
08234       *convert_flags |= CF_IEEE2VAX;
08235 
08236    /* ASCII format */
08237    if (remote_hw_type & DR_ASCII)
08238       *convert_flags |= CF_ASCII;
08239 }
08240 
08241 /********************************************************************/
08242 void rpc_get_convert_flags(INT * convert_flags)
08243 {
08244    rpc_calc_convert_flags(rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE), _server_connection.remote_hw_type, convert_flags);
08245 }
08246 
08247 /********************************************************************/
08248 void rpc_ieee2vax_float(float *var)
08249 {
08250    unsigned short int lo, hi;
08251 
08252    /* swap hi and lo word */
08253    lo = *((short int *) (var) + 1);
08254    hi = *((short int *) (var));
08255 
08256    /* correct exponent */
08257    if (lo != 0)
08258       lo += 0x100;
08259 
08260    *((short int *) (var) + 1) = hi;
08261    *((short int *) (var)) = lo;
08262 }
08263 
08264 void rpc_vax2ieee_float(float *var)
08265 {
08266    unsigned short int lo, hi;
08267 
08268    /* swap hi and lo word */
08269    lo = *((short int *) (var) + 1);
08270    hi = *((short int *) (var));
08271 
08272    /* correct exponent */
08273    if (hi != 0)
08274       hi -= 0x100;
08275 
08276    *((short int *) (var) + 1) = hi;
08277    *((short int *) (var)) = lo;
08278 
08279 }
08280 
08281 void rpc_vax2ieee_double(double *var)
08282 {
08283    unsigned short int i1, i2, i3, i4;
08284 
08285    /* swap words */
08286    i1 = *((short int *) (var) + 3);
08287    i2 = *((short int *) (var) + 2);
08288    i3 = *((short int *) (var) + 1);
08289    i4 = *((short int *) (var));
08290 
08291    /* correct exponent */
08292    if (i4 != 0)
08293       i4 -= 0x20;
08294 
08295    *((short int *) (var) + 3) = i4;
08296    *((short int *) (var) + 2) = i3;
08297    *((short int *) (var) + 1) = i2;
08298    *((short int *) (var)) = i1;
08299 }
08300 
08301 void rpc_ieee2vax_double(double *var)
08302 {
08303    unsigned short int i1, i2, i3, i4;
08304 
08305    /* swap words */
08306    i1 = *((short int *) (var) + 3);
08307    i2 = *((short int *) (var) + 2);
08308    i3 = *((short int *) (var) + 1);
08309    i4 = *((short int *) (var));
08310 
08311    /* correct exponent */
08312    if (i1 != 0)
08313       i1 += 0x20;
08314 
08315    *((short int *) (var) + 3) = i4;
08316    *((short int *) (var) + 2) = i3;
08317    *((short int *) (var) + 1) = i2;
08318    *((short int *) (var)) = i1;
08319 }
08320 
08321 /********************************************************************/
08322 void rpc_convert_single(void *data, INT tid, INT flags, INT convert_flags)
08323 {
08324 
08325    if (convert_flags & CF_ENDIAN) {
08326       if (tid == TID_WORD || tid == TID_SHORT)
08327          WORD_SWAP(data);
08328       if (tid == TID_DWORD || tid == TID_INT || tid == TID_BOOL || tid == TID_FLOAT)
08329          DWORD_SWAP(data);
08330       if (tid == TID_DOUBLE)
08331          QWORD_SWAP(data);
08332    }
08333 
08334    if (((convert_flags & CF_IEEE2VAX) && !(flags & RPC_OUTGOING)) ||
08335        ((convert_flags & CF_VAX2IEEE) && (flags & RPC_OUTGOING))) {
08336       if (tid == TID_FLOAT)
08337          rpc_ieee2vax_float((float *) data);
08338       if (tid == TID_DOUBLE)
08339          rpc_ieee2vax_double((double *) data);
08340    }
08341 
08342    if (((convert_flags & CF_IEEE2VAX) && (flags & RPC_OUTGOING)) ||
08343        ((convert_flags & CF_VAX2IEEE) && !(flags & RPC_OUTGOING))) {
08344       if (tid == TID_FLOAT)
08345          rpc_vax2ieee_float((float *) data);
08346       if (tid == TID_DOUBLE)
08347          rpc_vax2ieee_double((double *) data);
08348    }
08349 }
08350 
08351 void rpc_convert_data(void *data, INT tid, INT flags, INT total_size, INT convert_flags)
08352 /********************************************************************\
08353 
08354   Routine: rpc_convert_data
08355 
08356   Purpose: Convert data format between differenct computers
08357 
08358   Input:
08359     void   *data            Pointer to data
08360     INT    tid              Type ID of data, one of TID_xxx
08361     INT    flags            Combination of following flags:
08362                               RPC_IN: data is input parameter
08363                               RPC_OUT: data is output variable
08364                               RPC_FIXARRAY, RPC_VARARRAY: data is array
08365                                 of "size" bytes (see next param.)
08366                               RPC_OUTGOING: data is outgoing
08367     INT    total_size       Size of bytes of data. Used for variable
08368                             length arrays.
08369     INT    convert_flags    Flags for data conversion
08370 
08371   Output:
08372     void   *data            Is converted according to _convert_flag
08373                             value
08374 
08375   Function value:
08376     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
08377 
08378 \********************************************************************/
08379 {
08380    INT i, n, single_size;
08381    char *p;
08382 
08383    /* convert array */
08384    if (flags & (RPC_FIXARRAY | RPC_VARARRAY)) {
08385       single_size = tid_size[tid];
08386       /* don't convert TID_ARRAY & TID_STRUCT */
08387       if (single_size == 0)
08388          return;
08389 
08390       n = total_size / single_size;
08391 
08392       for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
08393          p = (char *) data + (i * single_size);
08394          rpc_convert_single(p, tid, flags, convert_flags);
08395       }
08396    } else {
08397       rpc_convert_single(data, tid, flags, convert_flags);
08398    }
08399 }
08400 
08401 /********************************************************************\
08402 *                       type ID functions                            *
08403 \********************************************************************/
08404 
08405 INT rpc_tid_size(INT id)
08406 {
08407    if (id >= 0 && id < TID_LAST)
08408       return tid_size[id];
08409 
08410    return 0;
08411 }
08412 
08413 char *rpc_tid_name(INT id)
08414 {
08415    if (id >= 0 && id < TID_LAST)
08416       return tid_name[id];
08417    else
08418       return "<unknown>";
08419 }
08420 
08421 
08422 /**dox***************************************************************/
08423 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
08424 
08425 /********************************************************************\
08426 *                        client functions                            *
08427 \********************************************************************/
08428 
08429 /********************************************************************/
08430 /**
08431 Register RPC client for standalone mode (without standard
08432            midas server)
08433 @param list           Array of RPC_LIST structures containing
08434                             function IDs and parameter definitions.
08435                             The end of the list must be indicated by
08436                             a function ID of zero.
08437 @param name          Name of this client
08438 @return RPC_SUCCESS
08439 */
08440 INT rpc_register_client(const char *name, RPC_LIST * list)
08441 {
08442    rpc_set_name(name);
08443    rpc_register_functions(rpc_get_internal_list(0), NULL);
08444    rpc_register_functions(list, NULL);
08445 
08446    return RPC_SUCCESS;
08447 }
08448 
08449 /********************************************************************/
08450 /**
08451 Register a set of RPC functions (both as clients or servers)
08452 @param new_list       Array of RPC_LIST structures containing
08453                             function IDs and parameter definitions.
