08454                             The end of the list must be indicated by
08455                             a function ID of zero.
08456 @param func          Default dispatch function
08457 
08458 @return RPC_SUCCESS, RPC_NO_MEMORY, RPC_DOUBLE_DEFINED
08459 */
08460 INT rpc_register_functions(const RPC_LIST * new_list, INT(*func) (INT, void **))
08461 {
08462    INT i, j, iold, inew;
08463 
08464    /* count number of new functions */
08465    for (i = 0; new_list[i].id != 0; i++) {
08466       /* check double defined functions */
08467       for (j = 0; rpc_list != NULL && rpc_list[j].id != 0; j++)
08468          if (rpc_list[j].id == new_list[i].id)
08469             return RPC_DOUBLE_DEFINED;
08470    }
08471    inew = i;
08472 
08473    /* count number of existing functions */
08474    for (i = 0; rpc_list != NULL && rpc_list[i].id != 0; i++);
08475    iold = i;
08476 
08477    /* allocate new memory for rpc_list */
08478    if (rpc_list == NULL)
08479       rpc_list = (RPC_LIST *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(RPC_LIST) * (inew + 1));
08480    else
08481       rpc_list = (RPC_LIST *) realloc(rpc_list, sizeof(RPC_LIST) * (iold + inew + 1));
08482 
08483    if (rpc_list == NULL) {
08484       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_register_functions", "out of memory");
08485       return RPC_NO_MEMORY;
08486    }
08487 
08488    /* append new functions */
08489    for (i = iold; i < iold + inew; i++) {
08490       memcpy(rpc_list + i, new_list + i - iold, sizeof(RPC_LIST));
08491 
08492       /* set default dispatcher */
08493       if (rpc_list[i].dispatch == NULL)
08494          rpc_list[i].dispatch = func;
08495 
08496       /* check valid ID for user functions */
08497       if (new_list != rpc_get_internal_list(0) &&
08498           new_list != rpc_get_internal_list(1) && (rpc_list[i].id < RPC_MIN_ID
08499                                                    || rpc_list[i].id > RPC_MAX_ID))
08500          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_register_functions", "registered RPC function with invalid ID");
08501    }
08502 
08503    /* mark end of list */
08504    rpc_list[i].id = 0;
08505 
08506    return RPC_SUCCESS;
08507 }
08508 
08509 
08510 
08511 /**dox***************************************************************/
08512 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
08513 
08514 /********************************************************************/
08515 INT rpc_deregister_functions()
08516 /********************************************************************\
08517 
08518   Routine: rpc_deregister_functions
08519 
08520   Purpose: Free memory of previously registered functions
08521 
08522   Input:
08523     none
08524 
08525   Output:
08526     none
08527 
08528   Function value:
08529     RPC_SUCCESS              Successful completion
08530 
08531 \********************************************************************/
08532 {
08533    if (rpc_list)
08534       M_FREE(rpc_list);
08535    rpc_list = NULL;
08536 
08537    return RPC_SUCCESS;
08538 }
08539 
08540 
08541 /********************************************************************/
08542 INT rpc_register_function(INT id, INT(*func) (INT, void **))
08543 /********************************************************************\
08544 
08545   Routine: rpc_register_function
08546 
08547   Purpose: Replace a dispatch function for a specific rpc routine
08548 
08549   Input:
08550     INT      id             RPC ID
08551     INT      *func          New dispatch function
08552 
08553   Output:
08554    <implicit: func gets copied to rpc_list>
08555 
08556   Function value:
08557    RPC_SUCCESS              Successful completion
08558    RPC_INVALID_ID           RPC ID not found
08559 
08560 \********************************************************************/
08561 {
08562    INT i;
08563 
08564    for (i = 0; rpc_list != NULL && rpc_list[i].id != 0; i++)
08565       if (rpc_list[i].id == id)
08566          break;
08567 
08568    if (rpc_list[i].id == id)
08569       rpc_list[i].dispatch = func;
08570    else
08571       return RPC_INVALID_ID;
08572 
08573    return RPC_SUCCESS;
08574 }
08575 
08576 
08577 /********************************************************************/
08578 INT rpc_client_dispatch(int sock)
08579 /********************************************************************\
08580 
08581   Routine: rpc_client_dispatch
08582 
08583   Purpose: Gets called whenever a client receives data from the
08584            server. Get set via rpc_connect. Internal use only.
08585 
08586 \********************************************************************/
08587 {
08588    INT hDB, hKey, n;
08589    NET_COMMAND *nc;
08590    INT status = 0;
08591    char net_buffer[256];
08592 
08593    nc = (NET_COMMAND *) net_buffer;
08594 
08595    n = recv_tcp(sock, net_buffer, sizeof(net_buffer), 0);
08596    if (n <= 0)
08597       return SS_ABORT;
08598 
08599    if (nc->header.routine_id == MSG_ODB) {
08600       /* update a changed record */
08601       hDB = *((INT *) nc->param);
08602       hKey = *((INT *) nc->param + 1);
08603       status = db_update_record(hDB, hKey, 0);
08604    }
08605 
08606    else if (nc->header.routine_id == MSG_WATCHDOG) {
08607       nc->header.routine_id = 1;
08608       nc->header.param_size = 0;
08609       send_tcp(sock, net_buffer, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), 0);
08610       status = RPC_SUCCESS;
08611    }
08612 
08613    else if (nc->header.routine_id == MSG_BM) {
08614       fd_set readfds;
08615       struct timeval timeout;
08616 
08617       /* receive further messages to empty TCP queue */
08618       do {
08619          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
08620          FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
08621 
08622          timeout.tv_sec = 0;
08623          timeout.tv_usec = 0;
08624 
08625          select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
08626 
08627          if (FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
08628             n = recv_tcp(sock, net_buffer, sizeof(net_buffer), 0);
08629             if (n <= 0)
08630                return SS_ABORT;
08631 
08632             if (nc->header.routine_id == MSG_ODB) {
08633                /* update a changed record */
08634                hDB = *((INT *) nc->param);
08635                hKey = *((INT *) nc->param + 1);
08636                status = db_update_record(hDB, hKey, 0);
08637             }
08638 
08639             else if (nc->header.routine_id == MSG_WATCHDOG) {
08640                nc->header.routine_id = 1;
08641                nc->header.param_size = 0;
08642                send_tcp(sock, net_buffer, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), 0);
08643                status = RPC_SUCCESS;
08644             }
08645          }
08646 
08647       } while (FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds));
08648 
08649       /* poll event from server */
08650       status = bm_poll_event(FALSE);
08651    }
08652 
08653    return status;
08654 }
08655 
08656 
08657 /********************************************************************/
08658 INT rpc_client_connect(const char *host_name, INT port, const char *client_name, HNDLE * hConnection)
08659 /********************************************************************\
08660 
08661   Routine: rpc_client_connect
08662 
08663   Purpose: Establish a network connection to a remote client
08664 
08665   Input:
08666     char *host_name          IP address of host to connect to.
08667     INT  port                TPC port to connect to.
08668     char *clinet_name        Client program name
08669 
08670   Output:
08671     HNDLE *hConnection       Handle for new connection which can be used
08672                              in future rpc_call(hConnection....) calls
08673 
08674   Function value:
08675     RPC_SUCCESS              Successful completion
08676     RPC_NET_ERROR            Error in socket call
08677     RPC_NO_CONNECTION        Maximum number of connections reached
08678     RPC_NOT_REGISTERED       cm_connect_experiment was not called properly
08679 
08680 \********************************************************************/
08681 {
08682    INT i, status, idx;
08683    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
08684    INT sock;
08685    INT remote_hw_type, hw_type;
08686    char str[200];
08687    char version[32], v1[32];
08688    char local_prog_name[NAME_LENGTH];
08689    char local_host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
08690    struct hostent *phe;
08691 
08692 #ifdef OS_WINNT
08693    {
08694       WSADATA WSAData;
08695 
08696       /* Start windows sockets */
08697       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
08698          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
08699    }
08700 #endif
08701 
08702    /* check if cm_connect_experiment was called */
08703    if (_client_name[0] == 0) {
08704       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_connect", "cm_connect_experiment/rpc_set_name not called");
08705       return RPC_NOT_REGISTERED;
08706    }
08707 
08708    /* check for broken connections */
08709    rpc_client_check();
08710 
08711    /* check if connection already exists */
08712    for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++)
08713       if (_client_connection[i].send_sock != 0 &&
08714           strcmp(_client_connection[i].host_name, host_name) == 0 && _client_connection[i].port == port) {
08715          *hConnection = i + 1;
08716          return RPC_SUCCESS;
08717       }
08718 
08719    /* search for free entry */
08720    for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++)
08721       if (_client_connection[i].send_sock == 0)
08722          break;
08723 
08724    /* open new network connection */
08725    if (i == MAX_RPC_CONNECTION) {
08726       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_connect", "maximum number of connections exceeded");
08727       return RPC_NO_CONNECTION;
08728    }
08729 
08730    /* create a new socket for connecting to remote server */
08731    sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
08732    if (sock == -1) {
08733       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_connect", "cannot create socket");
08734       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
08735    }
08736 
08737    idx = i;
08738    strcpy(_client_connection[idx].host_name, host_name);
08739    strcpy(_client_connection[idx].client_name, client_name);
08740    _client_connection[idx].port = port;
08741    _client_connection[idx].exp_name[0] = 0;
08742    _client_connection[idx].transport = RPC_TCP;
08743    _client_connection[idx].rpc_timeout = DEFAULT_RPC_TIMEOUT;
08744    _client_connection[idx].rpc_timeout = DEFAULT_RPC_TIMEOUT;
08745 
08746    /* connect to remote node */
08747    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
08748    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
08749    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
08750    bind_addr.sin_port = htons((short) port);
08751 
08752 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
08753    {
08754       INT host_addr;
08755 
08756       host_addr = hostGetByName(host_name);
08757       memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), &host_addr, 4);
08758    }
08759 #else
08760    phe = gethostbyname(host_name);
08761    if (phe == NULL) {
08762       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_connect", "cannot lookup host name \'%s\'", host_name);
08763       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
08764    }
08765    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
08766 #endif
08767 
08768 #ifdef OS_UNIX
08769    do {
08770       status = connect(sock, (void *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
08771 
08772       /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
08773    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
08774 #else
08775    status = connect(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
08776 #endif
08777 
08778    if (status != 0) {
08779       /* cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_connect", "cannot connect");
08780          message should be displayed by application */
08781       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
08782    }
08783 
08784    /* set TCP_NODELAY option for better performance */
08785    i = 1;
08786    setsockopt(sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char *) &i, sizeof(i));
08787 
08788    /* send local computer info */
08789    rpc_get_name(local_prog_name);
08790    gethostname(local_host_name, sizeof(local_host_name));
08791 
08792    hw_type = rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE);
08793    sprintf(str, "%d %s %s %s", hw_type, cm_get_version(), local_prog_name, local_host_name);
08794 
08795    send(sock, str, strlen(str) + 1, 0);
08796 
08797    /* receive remote computer info */
08798    i = recv_string(sock, str, sizeof(str), _rpc_connect_timeout);
08799    if (i <= 0) {
08800       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_connect", "timeout on receive remote computer info: %s", str);
08801       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
08802    }
08803 
08804    remote_hw_type = version[0] = 0;
08805    sscanf(str, "%d %s", &remote_hw_type, version);
08806    _client_connection[idx].remote_hw_type = remote_hw_type;
08807    _client_connection[idx].send_sock = sock;
08808 
08809    /* print warning if version patch level doesn't agree */
08810    strcpy(v1, version);
08811    if (strchr(v1, '.'))
08812       if (strchr(strchr(v1, '.') + 1, '.'))
08813          *strchr(strchr(v1, '.') + 1, '.') = 0;
08814 
08815    strcpy(str, cm_get_version());
08816    if (strchr(str, '.'))
08817       if (strchr(strchr(str, '.') + 1, '.'))
08818          *strchr(strchr(str, '.') + 1, '.') = 0;
08819 
08820    if (strcmp(v1, str) != 0) {
08821       sprintf(str, "remote MIDAS version \'%s\' differs from local version \'%s\'", version, cm_get_version());
08822       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_connect", str);
08823    }
08824 
08825    *hConnection = idx + 1;
08826 
08827    return RPC_SUCCESS;
08828 }
08829 
08830 /********************************************************************/
08831 void rpc_client_check()
08832 /********************************************************************\
08833 
08834   Routine: rpc_client_check
08835 
08836   Purpose: Check all client connections if remote client closed link
08837 
08838   Function value:
08839     RPC_SUCCESS              Successful completion
08840     RPC_NET_ERROR            Error in socket call
08841     RPC_NO_CONNECTION        Maximum number of connections reached
08842     RPC_NOT_REGISTERED       cm_connect_experiment was not called properly
08843 
08844 \********************************************************************/
08845 {
08846    INT i, status;
08847 
08848    /* check for broken connections */
08849    for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++)
08850       if (_client_connection[i].send_sock != 0) {
08851          int sock;
08852          fd_set readfds;
08853          struct timeval timeout;
08854          char buffer[64];
08855 
08856          sock = _client_connection[i].send_sock;
08857          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
08858          FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
08859 
08860          timeout.tv_sec = 0;
08861          timeout.tv_usec = 0;
08862 
08863          do {
08864             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
08865          } while (status == -1);        /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
08866 
08867          if (FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
08868             status = recv(sock, (char *) buffer, sizeof(buffer), 0);
08869 
08870             if (equal_ustring(buffer, "EXIT")) {
08871                /* normal exit */
08872                closesocket(sock);
08873                memset(&_client_connection[i], 0, sizeof(RPC_CLIENT_CONNECTION));
08874             }
08875 
08876             if (status <= 0) {
08877                cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_check",
08878                       "Connection broken to \"%s\" on host %s",
08879                       _client_connection[i].client_name, _client_connection[i].host_name);
08880 
08881                /* connection broken -> reset */
08882                closesocket(sock);
08883                memset(&_client_connection[i], 0, sizeof(RPC_CLIENT_CONNECTION));
08884             }
08885          }
08886       }
08887 }
08888 
08889 
08890 /********************************************************************/
08891 INT rpc_server_connect(const char *host_name, const char *exp_name)
08892 /********************************************************************\
08893 
08894   Routine: rpc_server_connect
08895 
08896   Purpose: Extablish a network connection to a remote MIDAS
08897            server using a callback scheme.
08898 
08899   Input:
08900     char *host_name         IP address of host to connect to.
08901 
08902     INT  port               TPC port to connect to.
08903 
08904     char *exp_name          Name of experiment to connect to. By using
08905                             this name, several experiments (e.g. online
08906                             DAQ and offline analysis) can run simultan-
08907                             eously on the same host.
08908 
08909   Output:
08910     none
08911 
08912   Function value:
08913     RPC_SUCCESS              Successful completion
08914     RPC_NET_ERROR            Error in socket call
08915     RPC_NOT_REGISTERED       cm_connect_experiment was not called properly
08916     CM_UNDEF_EXP             Undefined experiment on server
08917 
08918 \********************************************************************/
08919 {
08920    INT i, status, flag;
08921    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
08922    INT sock, lsock1, lsock2, lsock3;
08923    INT listen_port1, listen_port2, listen_port3;
08924    INT remote_hw_type, hw_type;
08925    unsigned int size;
08926    char str[200], version[32], v1[32];
08927    char local_prog_name[NAME_LENGTH];
08928    struct hostent *phe;
08929    fd_set readfds;
08930    struct timeval timeout;
08931    int port = MIDAS_TCP_PORT;
08932    char *s;
08933 
08934 #ifdef OS_WINNT
08935    {
08936       WSADATA WSAData;
08937 
08938       /* Start windows sockets */
08939       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
08940          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
08941    }
08942 #endif
08943 
08944    /* check if local connection */
08945    if (host_name[0] == 0)
08946       return RPC_SUCCESS;
08947 
08948    /* register system functions */
08949    rpc_register_functions(rpc_get_internal_list(0), NULL);
08950 
08951    /* check if cm_connect_experiment was called */
08952    if (_client_name[0] == 0) {
08953       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "cm_connect_experiment/rpc_set_name not called");
08954       return RPC_NOT_REGISTERED;
08955    }
08956 
08957    /* check if connection already exists */
08958    if (_server_connection.send_sock != 0)
08959       return RPC_SUCCESS;
08960 
08961    strcpy(_server_connection.host_name, host_name);
08962    strcpy(_server_connection.exp_name, exp_name);
08963    _server_connection.transport = RPC_TCP;
08964    _server_connection.rpc_timeout = DEFAULT_RPC_TIMEOUT;
08965 
08966    /* create new TCP sockets for listening */
08967    lsock1 = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
08968    lsock2 = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
08969    lsock3 = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
08970    if (lsock3 == -1) {
08971       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "cannot create socket");
08972       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
08973    }
08974 
08975    flag = 1;
08976    setsockopt(lsock1, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char *) &flag, sizeof(INT));
08977    setsockopt(lsock2, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char *) &flag, sizeof(INT));
08978    setsockopt(lsock3, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char *) &flag, sizeof(INT));
08979 
08980    /* let OS choose any port number */
08981    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
08982    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
08983    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
08984    bind_addr.sin_port = 0;
08985 
08986    status = bind(lsock1, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
08987    bind_addr.sin_port = 0;
08988    status = bind(lsock2, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
08989    bind_addr.sin_port = 0;
08990    status = bind(lsock3, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
08991    if (status < 0) {
08992       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "cannot bind");
08993       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
08994    }
08995 
08996    /* listen for connection */
08997    status = listen(lsock1, 1);
08998    status = listen(lsock2, 1);
08999    status = listen(lsock3, 1);
09000    if (status < 0) {
09001       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "cannot listen");
09002       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09003    }
09004 
09005    /* find out which port OS has chosen */
09006    size = sizeof(bind_addr);
09007 #ifdef OS_WINNT
09008    getsockname(lsock1, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, (int *) &size);
09009    listen_port1 = ntohs(bind_addr.sin_port);
09010    getsockname(lsock2, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, (int *) &size);
09011    listen_port2 = ntohs(bind_addr.sin_port);
09012    getsockname(lsock3, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, (int *) &size);
09013    listen_port3 = ntohs(bind_addr.sin_port);
09014 #else
09015    getsockname(lsock1, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, &size);
09016    listen_port1 = ntohs(bind_addr.sin_port);
09017    getsockname(lsock2, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, &size);
09018    listen_port2 = ntohs(bind_addr.sin_port);
09019    getsockname(lsock3, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, &size);
09020    listen_port3 = ntohs(bind_addr.sin_port);
09021 #endif
09022 
09023    /* create a new socket for connecting to remote server */
09024    sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
09025    if (sock == -1) {
09026       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "cannot create socket");
09027       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09028    }
09029 
09030    /* extract port number from host_name */
09031    strlcpy(str, host_name, sizeof(str));
09032    s = strchr(str, ':');
09033    if (s) {
09034       *s = 0;
09035       port = strtoul(s + 1, NULL, 0);
09036    }
09037 
09038    /* connect to remote node */
09039    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
09040    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
09041    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
09042    bind_addr.sin_port = htons(port);
09043 
09044 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
09045    {
09046       INT host_addr;
09047 
09048       host_addr = hostGetByName(str);
09049       memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), &host_addr, 4);
09050    }
09051 #else
09052    phe = gethostbyname(str);
09053    if (phe == NULL) {
09054       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "cannot resolve host name \'%s\'", str);
09055       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09056    }
09057    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
09058 #endif
09059 
09060 #ifdef OS_UNIX
09061    do {
09062       status = connect(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
09063 
09064       /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
09065    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
09066 #else
09067    status = connect(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
09068 #endif
09069 
09070    if (status != 0) {
09071 /*    cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "cannot connect"); message should be displayed by application */
09072       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09073    }
09074 
09075    /* connect to experiment */
09076    if (exp_name[0] == 0)
09077       sprintf(str, "C %d %d %d %s Default", listen_port1, listen_port2, listen_port3, cm_get_version());
09078    else
09079       sprintf(str, "C %d %d %d %s %s", listen_port1, listen_port2, listen_port3, cm_get_version(), exp_name);
09080 
09081    send(sock, str, strlen(str) + 1, 0);
09082    i = recv_string(sock, str, sizeof(str), _rpc_connect_timeout);
09083    closesocket(sock);
09084    if (i <= 0) {
09085       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "timeout on receive status from server");
09086       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09087    }
09088 
09089    status = version[0] = 0;
09090    sscanf(str, "%d %s", &status, version);
09091 
09092    if (status == 2) {
09093 /*  message "undefined experiment" should be displayed by application */
09094       return CM_UNDEF_EXP;
09095    }
09096 
09097    /* print warning if version patch level doesn't agree */
09098    strcpy(v1, version);
09099    if (strchr(v1, '.'))
09100       if (strchr(strchr(v1, '.') + 1, '.'))
09101          *strchr(strchr(v1, '.') + 1, '.') = 0;
09102 
09103    strcpy(str, cm_get_version());
09104    if (strchr(str, '.'))
09105       if (strchr(strchr(str, '.') + 1, '.'))
09106          *strchr(strchr(str, '.') + 1, '.') = 0;
09107 
09108    if (strcmp(v1, str) != 0) {
09109       sprintf(str, "remote MIDAS version \'%s\' differs from local version \'%s\'", version, cm_get_version());
09110       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", str);
09111    }
09112 
09113    /* wait for callback on send and recv socket with timeout */
09114    FD_ZERO(&readfds);
09115    FD_SET(lsock1, &readfds);
09116    FD_SET(lsock2, &readfds);
09117    FD_SET(lsock3, &readfds);
09118 
09119    timeout.tv_sec = _rpc_connect_timeout / 1000;
09120    timeout.tv_usec = 0;
09121 
09122    do {
09123       status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
09124 
09125       /* if an alarm signal was cought, restart select with reduced timeout */
09126       if (status == -1 && timeout.tv_sec >= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000)
09127          timeout.tv_sec -= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000;
09128 
09129    } while (status == -1);      /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
09130 
09131    if (!FD_ISSET(lsock1, &readfds)) {
09132       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "mserver subprocess could not be started (check path)");
09133       closesocket(lsock1);
09134       closesocket(lsock2);
09135       closesocket(lsock3);
09136       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09137    }
09138 
09139    size = sizeof(bind_addr);
09140 
09141 #ifdef OS_WINNT
09142    _server_connection.send_sock = accept(lsock1, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, (int *) &size);
09143    _server_connection.recv_sock = accept(lsock2, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, (int *) &size);
09144    _server_connection.event_sock = accept(lsock3, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, (int *) &size);
09145 #else
09146    _server_connection.send_sock = accept(lsock1, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, &size);
09147    _server_connection.recv_sock = accept(lsock2, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, &size);
09148    _server_connection.event_sock = accept(lsock3, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, &size);
09149 #endif
09150 
09151    if (_server_connection.send_sock == -1 || _server_connection.recv_sock == -1
09152        || _server_connection.event_sock == -1) {
09153       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "accept() failed");
09154       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09155    }
09156 
09157    closesocket(lsock1);
09158    closesocket(lsock2);
09159    closesocket(lsock3);
09160 
09161    /* set TCP_NODELAY option for better performance */
09162    flag = 1;
09163    setsockopt(_server_connection.send_sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char *) &flag, sizeof(flag));
09164    setsockopt(_server_connection.event_sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char *) &flag, sizeof(flag));
09165 
09166    /* increase send buffer size to 2 Mbytes, on Linux also limited by sysctl net.ipv4.tcp_rmem and net.ipv4.tcp_wmem */
09167    flag = 2 * 1024 * 1024;
09168    status = setsockopt(_server_connection.event_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (char *) &flag, sizeof(flag));
09169    if (status != 0)
09170       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "cannot setsockopt(SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF), errno %d (%s)", errno,
09171              strerror(errno));
09172 
09173    /* send local computer info */
09174    rpc_get_name(local_prog_name);
09175    hw_type = rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE);
09176    sprintf(str, "%d %s", hw_type, local_prog_name);
09177 
09178    send(_server_connection.send_sock, str, strlen(str) + 1, 0);
09179 
09180    /* receive remote computer info */
09181    i = recv_string(_server_connection.send_sock, str, sizeof(str), _rpc_connect_timeout);
09182    if (i <= 0) {
09183       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_connect", "timeout on receive remote computer info");
09184       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09185    }
09186 
09187    sscanf(str, "%d", &remote_hw_type);
09188    _server_connection.remote_hw_type = remote_hw_type;
09189 
09190    /* set dispatcher which receives database updates */
09191    ss_suspend_set_dispatch(CH_CLIENT, &_server_connection, (int (*)(void)) rpc_client_dispatch);
09192 
09193    return RPC_SUCCESS;
09194 }
09195 
09196 /********************************************************************/
09197 INT rpc_client_disconnect(HNDLE hConn, BOOL bShutdown)
09198 /********************************************************************\
09199 
09200   Routine: rpc_client_disconnect
09201 
09202   Purpose: Close a rpc connection to a MIDAS client
09203 
09204   Input:
09205     HNDLE  hConn           Handle of connection
09206     BOOL   bShutdown       Shut down remote server if TRUE
09207 
09208   Output:
09209     none
09210 
09211   Function value:
09212    RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
09213 
09214 \********************************************************************/
09215 {
09216    INT i;
09217 
09218    if (hConn == -1) {
09219       /* close all open connections */
09220       for (i = MAX_RPC_CONNECTION - 1; i >= 0; i--)
09221          if (_client_connection[i].send_sock != 0)
09222             rpc_client_disconnect(i + 1, FALSE);
09223 
09224       /* close server connection from other clients */
09225       for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++)
09226          if (_server_acception[i].recv_sock) {
09227             send(_server_acception[i].recv_sock, "EXIT", 5, 0);
09228             closesocket(_server_acception[i].recv_sock);
09229          }
09230    } else {
09231       /* notify server about exit */
09232 
09233       /* set FTCP mode (helps for rebooted VxWorks nodes) */
09234       rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
09235       rpc_client_call(hConn, bShutdown ? RPC_ID_SHUTDOWN : RPC_ID_EXIT);
09236 
09237       /* close socket */
09238       if (_client_connection[hConn - 1].send_sock)
09239          closesocket(_client_connection[hConn - 1].send_sock);
09240 
09241       memset(&_client_connection[hConn - 1], 0, sizeof(RPC_CLIENT_CONNECTION));
09242    }
09243 
09244    return RPC_SUCCESS;
09245 }
09246 
09247 
09248 /********************************************************************/
09249 INT rpc_server_disconnect()
09250 /********************************************************************\
09251 
09252   Routine: rpc_server_disconnect
09253 
09254   Purpose: Close a rpc connection to a MIDAS server and close all
09255            server connections from other clients
09256 
09257   Input:
09258     none
09259 
09260   Output:
09261     none
09262 
09263   Function value:
09264    RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
09265    RPC_NET_ERROR           Error in socket call
09266    RPC_NO_CONNECTION       Maximum number of connections reached
09267 
09268 \********************************************************************/
09269 {
09270    static int rpc_server_disconnect_recursion_level = 0;
09271 
09272    if (rpc_server_disconnect_recursion_level)
09273       return RPC_SUCCESS;
09274 
09275    rpc_server_disconnect_recursion_level = 1;
09276 
09277    /* flush remaining events */
09278    rpc_flush_event();
09279 
09280    /* notify server about exit */
09281    rpc_call(RPC_ID_EXIT);
09282 
09283    /* close sockets */
09284    closesocket(_server_connection.send_sock);
09285    closesocket(_server_connection.recv_sock);
09286    closesocket(_server_connection.event_sock);
09287 
09288    memset(&_server_connection, 0, sizeof(RPC_SERVER_CONNECTION));
09289 
09290    /* remove semaphore */
09291    if (_mutex_rpc)
09292       ss_mutex_delete(_mutex_rpc);
09293 
09294    rpc_server_disconnect_recursion_level = 0;
09295    return RPC_SUCCESS;
09296 }
09297 
09298 
09299 /********************************************************************/
09300 INT rpc_is_remote(void)
09301 /********************************************************************\
09302 
09303   Routine: rpc_is_remote
09304 
09305   Purpose: Return true if program is connected to a remote server
09306 
09307   Input:
09308    none
09309 
09310   Output:
09311     none
09312 
09313   Function value:
09314     INT    RPC connection index
09315 
09316 \********************************************************************/
09317 {
09318    return _server_connection.send_sock != 0;
09319 }
09320 
09321 
09322 /********************************************************************/
09323 INT rpc_get_server_acception(void)
09324 /********************************************************************\
09325 
09326   Routine: rpc_get_server_acception
09327 
09328   Purpose: Return actual RPC server connection index
09329 
09330   Input:
09331    none
09332 
09333   Output:
09334     none
09335 
09336   Function value:
09337     INT    RPC server connection index
09338 
09339 \********************************************************************/
09340 {
09341    return _server_acception_index;
09342 }
09343 
09344 
09345 /********************************************************************/
09346 INT rpc_set_server_acception(INT idx)
09347 /********************************************************************\
09348 
09349   Routine: rpc_set_server_acception
09350 
09351   Purpose: Set actual RPC server connection index
09352 
09353   Input:
09354     INT  idx                Server index
09355 
09356   Output:
09357     none
09358 
09359   Function value:
09360     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
09361 
09362 \********************************************************************/
09363 {
09364    _server_acception_index = idx;
09365    return RPC_SUCCESS;
09366 }
09367 
09368 
09369 /********************************************************************/
09370 INT rpc_get_option(HNDLE hConn, INT item)
09371 /********************************************************************\
09372 
09373   Routine: rpc_get_option
09374 
09375   Purpose: Get actual RPC option
09376 
09377   Input:
09378     HNDLE hConn             RPC connection handle, -1 for server connection, -2 for rpc connect timeout
09379 
09380     INT   item              One of RPC_Oxxx
09381 
09382   Output:
09383     none
09384 
09385   Function value:
09386     INT                     Actual option
09387 
09388 \********************************************************************/
09389 {
09390    switch (item) {
09391    case RPC_OTIMEOUT:
09392       if (hConn == -1)
09393          return _server_connection.rpc_timeout;
09394       if (hConn == -2)
09395          return _rpc_connect_timeout;
09396       return _client_connection[hConn - 1].rpc_timeout;
09397 
09398    case RPC_OTRANSPORT:
09399       if (hConn == -1)
09400          return _server_connection.transport;
09401       return _client_connection[hConn - 1].transport;
09402 
09403    case RPC_OHW_TYPE:
09404       {
09405          INT tmp_type, size;
09406          DWORD dummy;
09407          unsigned char *p;
09408          float f;
09409          double d;
09410 
09411          tmp_type = 0;
09412 
09413          /* test pointer size */
09414          size = sizeof(p);
09415          if (size == 2)
09416             tmp_type |= DRI_16;
09417          if (size == 4)
09418             tmp_type |= DRI_32;
09419          if (size == 8)
09420             tmp_type |= DRI_64;
09421 
09422          /* test if little or big endian machine */
09423          dummy = 0x12345678;
09424          p = (unsigned char *) &dummy;
09425          if (*p == 0x78)
09426             tmp_type |= DRI_LITTLE_ENDIAN;
09427          else if (*p == 0x12)
09428             tmp_type |= DRI_BIG_ENDIAN;
09429          else
09430             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_get_option", "unknown byte order format");
09431 
09432          /* floating point format */
09433          f = (float) 1.2345;
09434          dummy = 0;
09435          memcpy(&dummy, &f, sizeof(f));
09436          if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x19 &&
09437              ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0x04 && ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0x9E
09438              && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0x3F)
09439             tmp_type |= DRF_IEEE;
09440          else if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x9E &&
09441                   ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0x40 && ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0x19
09442                   && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0x04)
09443             tmp_type |= DRF_G_FLOAT;
09444          else
09445             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_get_option", "unknown floating point format");
09446 
09447          d = (double) 1.2345;
09448          dummy = 0;
09449          memcpy(&dummy, &d, sizeof(f));
09450          if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x8D &&  /* little endian */
09451              ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0x97 && ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0x6E
09452              && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0x12)
09453             tmp_type |= DRF_IEEE;
09454          else if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x83 &&     /* big endian */
09455                   ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0xC0 && ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0xF3
09456                   && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0x3F)
09457             tmp_type |= DRF_IEEE;
09458          else if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x13 &&
09459                   ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0x40 && ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0x83
09460                   && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0xC0)
09461             tmp_type |= DRF_G_FLOAT;
09462          else if ((dummy & 0xFF) == 0x9E &&
09463                   ((dummy >> 8) & 0xFF) == 0x40 && ((dummy >> 16) & 0xFF) == 0x18
09464                   && ((dummy >> 24) & 0xFF) == 0x04)
09465             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_get_option",
09466                    "MIDAS cannot handle VAX D FLOAT format. Please compile with the /g_float flag");
09467          else
09468             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_get_option", "unknown floating point format");
09469 
09470          return tmp_type;
09471       }
09472 
09473    default:
09474       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_get_option", "invalid argument");
09475       break;
09476    }
09477 
09478    return 0;
09479 }
09480 
09481 /**dox***************************************************************/
09482 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
09483 
09484 /********************************************************************/
09485 /**
09486 Set RPC option
09487 @param hConn              RPC connection handle, -1 for server connection, -2 for rpc connect timeout
09488 @param item               One of RPC_Oxxx
09489 @param value              Value to set
09490 @return RPC_SUCCESS
09491 */
09492 INT rpc_set_option(HNDLE hConn, INT item, INT value)
09493 {
09494    switch (item) {
09495    case RPC_OTIMEOUT:
09496       if (hConn == -1)
09497          _server_connection.rpc_timeout = value;
09498       else if (hConn == -2)
09499          _rpc_connect_timeout = value;
09500       else
09501          _client_connection[hConn - 1].rpc_timeout = value;
09502       break;
09503 
09504    case RPC_OTRANSPORT:
09505       if (hConn == -1)
09506          _server_connection.transport = value;
09507       else
09508          _client_connection[hConn - 1].transport = value;
09509       break;
09510 
09511    case RPC_NODELAY:
09512       if (hConn == -1)
09513          setsockopt(_server_connection.send_sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char *) &value, sizeof(value));
09514       else
09515          setsockopt(_client_connection[hConn - 1].send_sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char *) &value,
09516                     sizeof(value));
09517       break;
09518 
09519    default:
09520       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_set_option", "invalid argument");
09521       break;
09522    }
09523 
09524    return 0;
09525 }
09526 
09527 
09528 /**dox***************************************************************/
09529 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
09530 
09531 /********************************************************************/
09532 POINTER_T rpc_get_server_option(INT item)
09533 /********************************************************************\
09534 
09535   Routine: rpc_get_server_option
09536 
09537   Purpose: Get actual RPC option for server connection
09538 
09539   Input:
09540     INT  item               One of RPC_Oxxx
09541 
09542   Output:
09543     none
09544 
09545   Function value:
09546     INT                     Actual option
09547 
09548 \********************************************************************/
09549 {
09550    INT i;
09551 
09552    if (item == RPC_OSERVER_TYPE)
09553       return _server_type;
09554 
09555    if (item == RPC_OSERVER_NAME)
09556       return (POINTER_T) _server_name;
09557 
09558    /* return 0 for local calls */
09559    if (_server_type == ST_NONE)
09560       return 0;
09561 
09562    /* check which connections belongs to caller */
09563    if (_server_type == ST_MTHREAD) {
09564       for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++)
09565          if (_server_acception[i].tid == ss_gettid())
09566             break;
09567    } else if (_server_type == ST_SINGLE || _server_type == ST_REMOTE)
09568       i = MAX(0, _server_acception_index - 1);
09569    else
09570       i = 0;
09571 
09572    switch (item) {
09573    case RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS:
09574       return _server_acception[i].convert_flags;
09575    case RPC_ODB_HANDLE:
09576       return _server_acception[i].odb_handle;
09577    case RPC_CLIENT_HANDLE:
09578       return _server_acception[i].client_handle;
09579    case RPC_SEND_SOCK:
09580       return _server_acception[i].send_sock;
09581    case RPC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT:
09582       return _server_acception[i].watchdog_timeout;
09583    }
09584 
09585    return 0;
09586 }
09587 
09588 
09589 /********************************************************************/
09590 INT rpc_set_server_option(INT item, POINTER_T value)
09591 /********************************************************************\
09592 
09593   Routine: rpc_set_server_option
09594 
09595   Purpose: Set RPC option for server connection
09596 
09597   Input:
09598    INT  item               One of RPC_Oxxx
09599    INT  value              Value to set
09600 
09601   Output:
09602     none
09603 
09604   Function value:
09605     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
09606 
09607 \********************************************************************/
09608 {
09609    INT i;
09610 
09611    if (item == RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) {
09612       _server_type = value;
09613       return RPC_SUCCESS;
09614    }
09615    if (item == RPC_OSERVER_NAME) {
09616       strcpy(_server_name, (char *) value);
09617       return RPC_SUCCESS;
09618    }
09619 
09620    /* check which connections belongs to caller */
09621    if (_server_type == ST_MTHREAD) {
09622       for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++)
09623          if (_server_acception[i].tid == ss_gettid())
09624             break;
09625    } else if (_server_type == ST_SINGLE || _server_type == ST_REMOTE)
09626       i = MAX(0, _server_acception_index - 1);
09627    else
09628       i = 0;
09629 
09630    switch (item) {
09631    case RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS:
09632       _server_acception[i].convert_flags = value;
09633       break;
09634    case RPC_ODB_HANDLE:
09635       _server_acception[i].odb_handle = value;
09636       break;
09637    case RPC_CLIENT_HANDLE:
09638       _server_acception[i].client_handle = value;
09639       break;
09640    case RPC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT:
09641       _server_acception[i].watchdog_timeout = value;
09642       break;
09643    }
09644 
09645    return RPC_SUCCESS;
09646 }
09647 
09648 
09649 /********************************************************************/
09650 INT rpc_get_name(char *name)
09651 /********************************************************************\
09652 
09653   Routine: rpc_get_name
09654 
09655   Purpose: Get name set by rpc_set_name
09656 
09657   Input:
09658     none
09659 
09660   Output:
09661     char*  name             The location pointed by *name receives a
09662                             copy of the _prog_name
09663 
09664   Function value:
09665     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
09666 
09667 \********************************************************************/
09668 {
09669    strcpy(name, _client_name);
09670 
09671    return RPC_SUCCESS;
09672 }
09673 
09674 
09675 /********************************************************************/
09676 INT rpc_set_name(const char *name)
09677 /********************************************************************\
09678 
09679   Routine: rpc_set_name
09680 
09681   Purpose: Set name of actual program for further rpc connections
09682 
09683   Input:
09684    char *name               Program name, up to NAME_LENGTH chars,
09685                             no blanks
09686 
09687   Output:
09688     none
09689 
09690   Function value:
09691     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
09692 
09693 \********************************************************************/
09694 {
09695    strcpy(_client_name, name);
09696 
09697    return RPC_SUCCESS;
09698 }
09699 
09700 
09701 /********************************************************************/
09702 INT rpc_set_debug(void (*func) (char *), INT mode)
09703 /********************************************************************\
09704 
09705   Routine: rpc_set_debug
09706 
09707   Purpose: Set a function which is called on every RPC call to
09708            display the function name and parameters of the RPC
09709            call.
09710 
09711   Input:
09712    void *func(char*)        Pointer to function.
09713    INT  mode                Debug mode
09714 
09715   Output:
09716     none
09717 
09718   Function value:
09719     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
09720 
09721 \********************************************************************/
09722 {
09723    _debug_print = func;
09724    _debug_mode = mode;
09725    return RPC_SUCCESS;
09726 }
09727 
09728 /********************************************************************/
09729 void rpc_debug_printf(const char *format, ...)
09730 /********************************************************************\
09731 
09732   Routine: rpc_debug_print
09733 
09734   Purpose: Calls function set via rpc_set_debug to output a string.
09735 
09736   Input:
09737    char *str                Debug string
09738 
09739   Output:
09740     none
09741 
09742 \********************************************************************/
09743 {
09744    va_list argptr;
09745    char str[1000];
09746 
09747    if (_debug_mode) {
09748       va_start(argptr, format);
09749       vsprintf(str, (char *) format, argptr);
09750       va_end(argptr);
09751 
09752       if (_debug_print) {
09753          strcat(str, "\n");
09754          _debug_print(str);
09755       } else
09756          puts(str);
09757    }
09758 }
09759 
09760 /********************************************************************/
09761 void rpc_va_arg(va_list * arg_ptr, INT arg_type, void *arg)
09762 {
09763    switch (arg_type) {
09764       /* On the stack, the minimum parameter size is sizeof(int).
09765          To avoid problems on little endian systems, treat all
09766          smaller parameters as int's */
09767    case TID_BYTE:
09768    case TID_SBYTE:
09769    case TID_CHAR:
09770    case TID_WORD:
09771    case TID_SHORT:
09772       *((int *) arg) = va_arg(*arg_ptr, int);
09773       break;
09774 
09775    case TID_INT:
09776    case TID_BOOL:
09777       *((INT *) arg) = va_arg(*arg_ptr, INT);
09778       break;
09779 
09780    case TID_DWORD:
09781       *((DWORD *) arg) = va_arg(*arg_ptr, DWORD);
09782       break;
09783 
09784       /* float variables are passed as double by the compiler */
09785    case TID_FLOAT:
09786       *((float *) arg) = (float) va_arg(*arg_ptr, double);
09787       break;
09788 
09789    case TID_DOUBLE:
09790       *((double *) arg) = va_arg(*arg_ptr, double);
09791       break;
09792 
09793    case TID_ARRAY:
09794       *((char **) arg) = va_arg(*arg_ptr, char *);
09795       break;
09796    }
09797 }
09798 
09799 /********************************************************************/
09800 INT rpc_client_call(HNDLE hConn, const INT routine_id, ...)
09801 /********************************************************************\
09802 
09803   Routine: rpc_client_call
09804 
09805   Purpose: Call a function on a MIDAS client
09806 
09807   Input:
09808     INT  hConn              Client connection
09809     INT  routine_id         routine ID as defined in RPC.H (RPC_xxx)
09810 
09811     ...                     variable argument list
09812 
09813   Output:
09814     (depends on argument list)
09815 
09816   Function value:
09817     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
09818     RPC_NET_ERROR           Error in socket call
09819     RPC_NO_CONNECTION       No active connection
09820     RPC_TIMEOUT             Timeout in RPC call
09821     RPC_INVALID_ID          Invalid routine_id (not in rpc_list)
09822     RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER       Paramters don't fit in network buffer
09823 
09824 \********************************************************************/
09825 {
09826    va_list ap, aptmp;
09827    char arg[8], arg_tmp[8];
09828    INT arg_type, transport, rpc_timeout;
09829    INT i, idx, status, rpc_index;
09830    INT param_size, arg_size, send_size;
09831    INT tid, flags;
09832    fd_set readfds;
09833    struct timeval timeout;
09834    char *param_ptr, str[80];
09835    BOOL bpointer, bbig;
09836    NET_COMMAND *nc;
09837    int send_sock;
09838    time_t start_time;
09839 
09840    idx = hConn - 1;
09841 
09842    if (_client_connection[idx].send_sock == 0) {
09843       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_call", "no rpc connection");
09844       return RPC_NO_CONNECTION;
09845    }
09846 
09847    send_sock = _client_connection[idx].send_sock;
09848    rpc_timeout = _client_connection[idx].rpc_timeout;
09849    transport = _client_connection[idx].transport;
09850 
09851    status = resize_net_send_buffer("rpc_client_call", NET_BUFFER_SIZE);
09852    if (status != SUCCESS)
09853       return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
09854 
09855    nc = (NET_COMMAND *) _net_send_buffer;
09856    nc->header.routine_id = routine_id;
09857 
09858    if (transport == RPC_FTCP)
09859       nc->header.routine_id |= TCP_FAST;
09860 
09861    for (i = 0;; i++)
09862       if (rpc_list[i].id == routine_id || rpc_list[i].id == 0)
09863          break;
09864    rpc_index = i;
09865    if (rpc_list[i].id == 0) {
09866       sprintf(str, "invalid rpc ID (%d)", routine_id);
09867       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_call", str);
09868       return RPC_INVALID_ID;
09869    }
09870 
09871    /* examine variable argument list and convert it to parameter array */
09872    va_start(ap, routine_id);
09873 
09874    /* find out if we are on a big endian system */
09875    bbig = ((rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE) & DRI_BIG_ENDIAN) > 0);
09876 
09877    for (i = 0, param_ptr = nc->param; rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
09878       tid = rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].tid;
09879       flags = rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].flags;
09880 
09881       bpointer = (flags & RPC_POINTER) || (flags & RPC_OUT) ||
09882           (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY) || (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) ||
09883           tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_ARRAY || tid == TID_STRUCT || tid == TID_LINK;
09884 
09885       if (bpointer)
09886          arg_type = TID_ARRAY;
09887       else
09888          arg_type = tid;
09889 
09890       /* floats are passed as doubles, at least under NT */
09891       if (tid == TID_FLOAT && !bpointer)
09892          arg_type = TID_DOUBLE;
09893 
09894       /* get pointer to argument */
09895       rpc_va_arg(&ap, arg_type, arg);
09896 
09897       /* shift 1- and 2-byte parameters to the LSB on big endian systems */
09898       if (bbig) {
09899          if (tid == TID_BYTE || tid == TID_CHAR || tid == TID_SBYTE) {
09900             arg[0] = arg[3];
09901          }
09902          if (tid == TID_WORD || tid == TID_SHORT) {
09903             arg[0] = arg[2];
09904             arg[1] = arg[3];
09905          }
09906       }
09907 
09908       if (flags & RPC_IN) {
09909          if (bpointer)
09910             arg_size = tid_size[tid];
09911          else
09912             arg_size = tid_size[arg_type];
09913 
09914          /* for strings, the argument size depends on the string length */
09915          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
09916             arg_size = 1 + strlen((char *) *((char **) arg));
09917 
09918          /* for varibale length arrays, the size is given by
09919             the next parameter on the stack */
09920          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
09921             memcpy(&aptmp, &ap, sizeof(ap));
09922             rpc_va_arg(&aptmp, TID_ARRAY, arg_tmp);
09923 
09924             if (flags & RPC_OUT)
09925                arg_size = *((INT *) * ((void **) arg_tmp));
09926             else
09927                arg_size = *((INT *) arg_tmp);
09928 
09929             *((INT *) param_ptr) = ALIGN8(arg_size);
09930             param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
09931          }
09932 
09933          if (tid == TID_STRUCT || (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY))
09934             arg_size = rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].n;
09935 
09936          /* always align parameter size */
09937          param_size = ALIGN8(arg_size);
09938 
09939          if ((POINTER_T) param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc + param_size > _net_send_buffer_size) {
09940             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_call",
09941                    "parameters (%d) too large for network buffer (%d)",
09942                    (POINTER_T) param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc + param_size, _net_send_buffer_size);
09943             return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
09944          }
09945 
09946          if (bpointer)
09947             memcpy(param_ptr, (void *) *((void **) arg), arg_size);
09948          else {
09949             /* floats are passed as doubles on most systems */
09950             if (tid != TID_FLOAT)
09951                memcpy(param_ptr, arg, arg_size);
09952             else
09953                *((float *) param_ptr) = (float) *((double *) arg);
09954          }
09955 
09956          param_ptr += param_size;
09957 
09958       }
09959    }
09960 
09961    va_end(ap);
09962 
09963    nc->header.param_size = (POINTER_T) param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc->param;
09964 
09965    send_size = nc->header.param_size + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER);
09966 
09967    /* in FAST TCP mode, only send call and return immediately */
09968    if (transport == RPC_FTCP) {
09969       i = send_tcp(send_sock, (char *) nc, send_size, 0);
09970 
09971       if (i != send_size) {
09972          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_call", "send_tcp() failed");
09973          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09974       }
09975 
09976       return RPC_SUCCESS;
09977    }
09978 
09979    /* in TCP mode, send and wait for reply on send socket */
09980    i = send_tcp(send_sock, (char *) nc, send_size, 0);
09981    if (i != send_size) {
09982       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_call",
09983              "send_tcp() failed, routine = \"%s\", host = \"%s\"",
09984              rpc_list[rpc_index].name, _client_connection[idx].host_name);
09985       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09986    }
09987 
09988    /* make some timeout checking */
09989    if (rpc_timeout > 0) {
09990       start_time = ss_time();
09991 
09992       do {
09993          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
09994          FD_SET(send_sock, &readfds);
09995 
09996          timeout.tv_sec = 1;
09997          timeout.tv_usec = 0;
09998 
09999          status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
10000 
10001          if (status >= 0 && FD_ISSET(send_sock, &readfds))
10002             break;
10003 
10004          if (ss_time() - start_time > rpc_timeout / 1000)
10005             break;
10006 
10007       } while (status == -1 || status == 0);    /* continue again if signal was cought */
10008 
10009       if (!FD_ISSET(send_sock, &readfds)) {
10010          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_call",
10011                 "rpc timeout after %d sec, routine = \"%s\", host = \"%s\", connection closed",
10012                 (int) (ss_time() - start_time), rpc_list[rpc_index].name, _client_connection[idx].host_name);
10013 
10014          /* disconnect to avoid that the reply to this rpc_call comes at
10015             the next rpc_call */
10016          rpc_client_disconnect(hConn, FALSE);
10017 
10018          return RPC_TIMEOUT;
10019       }
10020    }
10021 
10022    /* receive result on send socket */
10023    i = recv_tcp(send_sock, _net_send_buffer, _net_send_buffer_size, 0);
10024 
10025    if (i <= 0) {
10026       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_client_call",
10027              "recv_tcp() failed, routine = \"%s\", host = \"%s\"",
10028              rpc_list[rpc_index].name, _client_connection[idx].host_name);
10029       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10030    }
10031 
10032    /* extract result variables and place it to argument list */
10033    status = nc->header.routine_id;
10034 
10035    va_start(ap, routine_id);
10036 
10037    for (i = 0, param_ptr = nc->param; rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
10038       tid = rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].tid;
10039       flags = rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].flags;
10040 
10041       bpointer = (flags & RPC_POINTER) || (flags & RPC_OUT) ||
10042           (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY) || (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) ||
10043           tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_ARRAY || tid == TID_STRUCT || tid == TID_LINK;
10044 
10045       if (bpointer)
10046          arg_type = TID_ARRAY;
10047       else
10048          arg_type = rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].tid;
10049 
10050       if (tid == TID_FLOAT && !bpointer)
10051          arg_type = TID_DOUBLE;
10052 
10053       rpc_va_arg(&ap, arg_type, arg);
10054 
10055       if (rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].flags & RPC_OUT) {
10056          tid = rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].tid;
10057          flags = rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].flags;
10058 
10059          arg_size = tid_size[tid];
10060 
10061          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
10062             arg_size = strlen((char *) (param_ptr)) + 1;
10063 
10064          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
10065             arg_size = *((INT *) param_ptr);
10066             param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
10067          }
10068 
10069          if (tid == TID_STRUCT || (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY))
10070             arg_size = rpc_list[rpc_index].param[i].n;
10071 
10072          /* return parameters are always pointers */
10073          if (*((char **) arg))
10074             memcpy((void *) *((char **) arg), param_ptr, arg_size);
10075 
10076          /* parameter size is always aligned */
10077          param_size = ALIGN8(arg_size);
10078 
10079          param_ptr += param_size;
10080       }
10081    }
10082 
10083    va_end(ap);
10084 
10085    return status;
10086 }
10087 
10088 /********************************************************************/
10089 INT rpc_call(const INT routine_id, ...)
10090 /********************************************************************\
10091 
10092   Routine: rpc_call
10093 
10094   Purpose: Call a function on a MIDAS server
10095 
10096   Input:
10097     INT  routine_id         routine ID as defined in RPC.H (RPC_xxx)
10098 
10099     ...                     variable argument list
10100 
10101   Output:
10102     (depends on argument list)
10103 
10104   Function value:
10105     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
10106     RPC_NET_ERROR           Error in socket call
10107     RPC_NO_CONNECTION       No active connection
10108     RPC_TIMEOUT             Timeout in RPC call
10109     RPC_INVALID_ID          Invalid routine_id (not in rpc_list)
10110     RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER       Paramters don't fit in network buffer
10111 
10112 \********************************************************************/
10113 {
10114    va_list ap, aptmp;
10115    char arg[8], arg_tmp[8];
10116    INT arg_type, transport, rpc_timeout;
10117    INT i, idx, status;
10118    INT param_size, arg_size, send_size;
10119    INT tid, flags;
10120    fd_set readfds;
10121    struct timeval timeout;
10122    char *param_ptr, str[80];
10123    BOOL bpointer, bbig;
10124    NET_COMMAND *nc;
10125    int send_sock;
10126    time_t start_time;
10127 
10128    send_sock = _server_connection.send_sock;
10129    transport = _server_connection.transport;
10130    rpc_timeout = _server_connection.rpc_timeout;
10131 
10132    /* init network buffer */
10133    if (_net_send_buffer_size == 0) {
10134       status = resize_net_send_buffer("rpc_call", NET_BUFFER_SIZE);
10135       if (status != SUCCESS)
10136          return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
10137 
10138       /* create a local mutex for multi-threaded applications */
10139       ss_mutex_create(&_mutex_rpc);
10140    }
10141 
10142    status = ss_mutex_wait_for(_mutex_rpc, 10000 + rpc_timeout);
10143    if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
10144       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", "Mutex timeout");
10145       return RPC_MUTEX_TIMEOUT;
10146    }
10147 
10148    nc = (NET_COMMAND *) _net_send_buffer;
10149    nc->header.routine_id = routine_id;
10150 
10151    if (transport == RPC_FTCP)
10152       nc->header.routine_id |= TCP_FAST;
10153 
10154    for (i = 0;; i++)
10155       if (rpc_list[i].id == routine_id || rpc_list[i].id == 0)
10156          break;
10157    idx = i;
10158    if (rpc_list[i].id == 0) {
10159       ss_mutex_release(_mutex_rpc);
10160       sprintf(str, "invalid rpc ID (%d)", routine_id);
10161       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", str);
10162       return RPC_INVALID_ID;
10163    }
10164 
10165    /* examine variable argument list and convert it to parameter array */
10166    va_start(ap, routine_id);
10167 
10168    /* find out if we are on a big endian system */
10169    bbig = ((rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE) & DRI_BIG_ENDIAN) > 0);
10170 
10171    for (i = 0, param_ptr = nc->param; rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
10172       tid = rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid;
10173       flags = rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags;
10174 
10175       bpointer = (flags & RPC_POINTER) || (flags & RPC_OUT) ||
10176           (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY) || (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) ||
10177           tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_ARRAY || tid == TID_STRUCT || tid == TID_LINK;
10178 
10179       if (bpointer)
10180          arg_type = TID_ARRAY;
10181       else
10182          arg_type = tid;
10183 
10184       /* floats are passed as doubles, at least under NT */
10185       if (tid == TID_FLOAT && !bpointer)
10186          arg_type = TID_DOUBLE;
10187 
10188       /* get pointer to argument */
10189       rpc_va_arg(&ap, arg_type, arg);
10190 
10191       /* shift 1- and 2-byte parameters to the LSB on big endian systems */
10192       if (bbig) {
10193          if (tid == TID_BYTE || tid == TID_CHAR || tid == TID_SBYTE) {
10194             arg[0] = arg[3];
10195          }
10196          if (tid == TID_WORD || tid == TID_SHORT) {
10197             arg[0] = arg[2];
10198             arg[1] = arg[3];
10199          }
10200       }
10201 
10202       if (flags & RPC_IN) {
10203          if (bpointer)
10204             arg_size = tid_size[tid];
10205          else
10206             arg_size = tid_size[arg_type];
10207 
10208          /* for strings, the argument size depends on the string length */
10209          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
10210             arg_size = 1 + strlen((char *) *((char **) arg));
10211 
10212          /* for varibale length arrays, the size is given by
10213             the next parameter on the stack */
10214          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
10215             memcpy(&aptmp, &ap, sizeof(ap));
10216             rpc_va_arg(&aptmp, TID_ARRAY, arg_tmp);
10217 
10218             if (flags & RPC_OUT)
10219                arg_size = *((INT *) * ((void **) arg_tmp));
10220             else
10221                arg_size = *((INT *) arg_tmp);
10222 
10223             *((INT *) param_ptr) = ALIGN8(arg_size);
10224             param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
10225          }
10226 
10227          if (tid == TID_STRUCT || (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY))
10228             arg_size = rpc_list[idx].param[i].n;
10229 
10230          /* always align parameter size */
10231          param_size = ALIGN8(arg_size);
10232 
10233          if ((POINTER_T) param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc + param_size > _net_send_buffer_size) {
10234             ss_mutex_release(_mutex_rpc);
10235             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call",
10236                    "parameters (%d) too large for network buffer (%d)",
10237                    (POINTER_T) param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc + param_size, _net_send_buffer_size);
10238             return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
10239          }
10240 
10241          if (bpointer)
10242             memcpy(param_ptr, (void *) *((void **) arg), arg_size);
10243          else {
10244             /* floats are passed as doubles on most systems */
10245             if (tid != TID_FLOAT)
10246                memcpy(param_ptr, arg, arg_size);
10247             else
10248                *((float *) param_ptr) = (float) *((double *) arg);
10249          }
10250 
10251          param_ptr += param_size;
10252 
10253       }
10254    }
10255 
10256    va_end(ap);
10257 
10258    nc->header.param_size = (POINTER_T) param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc->param;
10259 
10260    send_size = nc->header.param_size + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER);
10261 
10262    /* in FAST TCP mode, only send call and return immediately */
10263    if (transport == RPC_FTCP) {
10264       i = send_tcp(send_sock, (char *) nc, send_size, 0);
10265 
10266       if (i != send_size) {
10267          ss_mutex_release(_mutex_rpc);
10268          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", "send_tcp() failed");
10269          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10270       }
10271 
10272       ss_mutex_release(_mutex_rpc);
10273       return RPC_SUCCESS;
10274    }
10275 
10276    /* in TCP mode, send and wait for reply on send socket */
10277    i = send_tcp(send_sock, (char *) nc, send_size, 0);
10278    if (i != send_size) {
10279       ss_mutex_release(_mutex_rpc);
10280       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", "send_tcp() failed");
10281       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10282    }
10283 
10284    /* make some timeout checking */
10285    if (rpc_timeout > 0) {
10286       start_time = ss_time();
10287 
10288       do {
10289          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
10290          FD_SET(send_sock, &readfds);
10291 
10292          timeout.tv_sec = 1;
10293          timeout.tv_usec = 0;
10294 
10295          status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
10296 
10297          if (FD_ISSET(send_sock, &readfds))
10298             break;
10299 
10300          if (ss_time() - start_time > rpc_timeout / 1000)
10301             break;
10302 
10303       } while (status == -1 || status == 0);    /* continue again if signal was cought */
10304 
10305       if (!FD_ISSET(send_sock, &readfds)) {
10306          ss_mutex_release(_mutex_rpc);
10307          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", "rpc timeout after %d sec, routine = \"%s\", program abort",
10308                 (int) (ss_time() - start_time), rpc_list[idx].name);
10309          abort();
10310       }
10311    }
10312 
10313    /* receive result on send socket */
10314    i = recv_tcp(send_sock, _net_send_buffer, _net_send_buffer_size, 0);
10315 
10316    if (i <= 0) {
10317       ss_mutex_release(_mutex_rpc);
10318       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", "recv_tcp() failed, routine = \"%s\"", rpc_list[idx].name);
10319       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10320    }
10321 
10322    /* extract result variables and place it to argument list */
10323    status = nc->header.routine_id;
10324 
10325    va_start(ap, routine_id);
10326 
10327    for (i = 0, param_ptr = nc->param; rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
10328       tid = rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid;
10329       flags = rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags;
10330 
10331       bpointer = (flags & RPC_POINTER) || (flags & RPC_OUT) ||
10332           (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY) || (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) ||
10333           tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_ARRAY || tid == TID_STRUCT || tid == TID_LINK;
10334 
10335       if (bpointer)
10336          arg_type = TID_ARRAY;
10337       else
10338          arg_type = rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid;
10339 
10340       if (tid == TID_FLOAT && !bpointer)
10341          arg_type = TID_DOUBLE;
10342 
10343       rpc_va_arg(&ap, arg_type, arg);
10344 
10345       if (rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags & RPC_OUT) {
10346          tid = rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid;
10347          arg_size = tid_size[tid];
10348 
10349          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
10350             arg_size = strlen((char *) (param_ptr)) + 1;
10351 
10352          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
10353             arg_size = *((INT *) param_ptr);
10354             param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
10355          }
10356 
10357          if (tid == TID_STRUCT || (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY))
10358             arg_size = rpc_list[idx].param[i].n;
10359 
10360          /* return parameters are always pointers */
10361          if (*((char **) arg))
10362             memcpy((void *) *((char **) arg), param_ptr, arg_size);
10363 
10364          /* parameter size is always aligned */
10365          param_size = ALIGN8(arg_size);
10366 
10367          param_ptr += param_size;
10368       }
10369    }
10370 
10371    va_end(ap);
10372 
10373    ss_mutex_release(_mutex_rpc);
10374 
10375    return status;
10376 }
10377 
10378 
10379 /********************************************************************/
10380 INT rpc_set_opt_tcp_size(INT tcp_size)
10381 {
10382    INT old;
10383 
10384    old = _opt_tcp_size;
10385    _opt_tcp_size = tcp_size;
10386    return old;
10387 }
10388 
10389 INT rpc_get_opt_tcp_size()
10390 {
10391    return _opt_tcp_size;
10392 }
10393 
10394 /**dox***************************************************************/
10395 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
10396 
10397 /********************************************************************/
10398 /**
10399 Fast send_event routine which bypasses the RPC layer and
10400            sends the event directly at the TCP level.
10401 @param buffer_handle      Handle of the buffer to send the event to.
10402                           Must be obtained via bm_open_buffer.
10403 @param source             Address of the event to send. It must have
10404                           a proper event header.
10405 @param buf_size           Size of event in bytes with header.
10406 @param async_flag         SYNC / ASYNC flag. In ASYNC mode, the
10407                           function returns immediately if it cannot
10408                           send the event over the network. In SYNC
10409                           mode, it waits until the packet is sent
10410                           (blocking).
10411 @param mode               Determines in which mode the event is sent.
10412                           If zero, use RPC socket, if one, use special
10413                           event socket to bypass RPC layer on the
10414                           server side.
10415 
10416 @return BM_INVALID_PARAM, BM_ASYNC_RETURN, RPC_SUCCESS, RPC_NET_ERROR,
10417         RPC_NO_CONNECTION, RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER
10418 */
10419 INT rpc_send_event(INT buffer_handle, void *source, INT buf_size, INT async_flag, INT mode)
10420 {
10421    INT i;
10422    NET_COMMAND *nc;
10423    unsigned long flag;
10424    BOOL would_block = 0;
10425    DWORD aligned_buf_size;
10426 
10427    aligned_buf_size = ALIGN8(buf_size);
10428    _rpc_sock = mode == 0 ? _server_connection.send_sock : _server_connection.event_sock;
10429 
10430    if ((INT) aligned_buf_size != (INT) (ALIGN8(((EVENT_HEADER *) source)->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)))) {
10431       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_send_event", "event size mismatch");
10432       return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
10433    }
10434 
10435    if (!rpc_is_remote())
10436       return bm_send_event(buffer_handle, source, buf_size, async_flag);
10437 
10438    /* init network buffer */
10439    if (!_tcp_buffer)
10440       _tcp_buffer = (char *) M_MALLOC(NET_TCP_SIZE);
10441    if (!_tcp_buffer) {
10442       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_send_event", "not enough memory to allocate network buffer");
10443       return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
10444    }
10445 
10446    /* check if not enough space in TCP buffer */
10447    if (aligned_buf_size + 4 * 8 + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) >= (DWORD) (_opt_tcp_size - _tcp_wp)
10448        && _tcp_wp != _tcp_rp) {
10449       /* set socket to nonblocking IO */
10450       if (async_flag == ASYNC) {
10451          flag = 1;
10452 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
10453          ioctlsocket(_rpc_sock, FIONBIO, (int) &flag);
10454 #else
10455          ioctlsocket(_rpc_sock, FIONBIO, &flag);
10456 #endif
10457       }
10458 
10459       i = send_tcp(_rpc_sock, _tcp_buffer + _tcp_rp, _tcp_wp - _tcp_rp, 0);
10460 
10461       if (i < 0)
10462 #ifdef OS_WINNT
10463          would_block = (WSAGetLastError() == WSAEWOULDBLOCK);
10464 #else
10465          would_block = (errno == EWOULDBLOCK);
10466 #endif
10467 
10468       /* set socket back to blocking IO */
10469       if (async_flag == ASYNC) {
10470          flag = 0;
10471 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
10472          ioctlsocket(_rpc_sock, FIONBIO, (int) &flag);
10473 #else
10474          ioctlsocket(_rpc_sock, FIONBIO, &flag);
10475 #endif
10476       }
10477 
10478       /* increment read pointer */
10479       if (i > 0)
10480          _tcp_rp += i;
10481 
10482       /* check if whole buffer is sent */
10483       if (_tcp_rp == _tcp_wp)
10484          _tcp_rp = _tcp_wp = 0;
10485 
10486       if (i < 0 && !would_block) {
10487          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_send_event", "send_tcp() failed, return code = %d", i);
10488          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10489       }
10490 
10491       /* return if buffer is not emptied */
10492       if (_tcp_wp > 0)
10493          return BM_ASYNC_RETURN;
10494    }
10495 
10496    if (mode == 0) {
10497       nc = (NET_COMMAND *) (_tcp_buffer + _tcp_wp);
10498       nc->header.routine_id = RPC_BM_SEND_EVENT | TCP_FAST;
10499       nc->header.param_size = 4 * 8 + aligned_buf_size;
10500 
10501       /* assemble parameters manually */
10502       *((INT *) (&nc->param[0])) = buffer_handle;
10503       *((INT *) (&nc->param[8])) = buf_size;
10504 
10505       /* send events larger than optimal buffer size directly */
10506       if (aligned_buf_size + 4 * 8 + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) >= (DWORD) _opt_tcp_size) {
10507          /* send header */
10508          i = send_tcp(_rpc_sock, _tcp_buffer + _tcp_wp, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + 16, 0);
10509          if (i <= 0) {
10510             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_send_event", "send_tcp() failed, return code = %d", i);
10511             return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10512          }
10513 
10514          /* send data */
10515          i = send_tcp(_rpc_sock, (char *) source, aligned_buf_size, 0);
10516          if (i <= 0) {
10517             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_send_event", "send_tcp() failed, return code = %d", i);
10518             return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10519          }
10520 
10521          /* send last two parameters */
10522          *((INT *) (&nc->param[0])) = buf_size;
10523          *((INT *) (&nc->param[8])) = 0;
10524          i = send_tcp(_rpc_sock, &nc->param[0], 16, 0);
10525          if (i <= 0) {
10526             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_send_event", "send_tcp() failed, return code = %d", i);
10527             return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10528          }
10529       } else {
10530          /* copy event */
10531          memcpy(&nc->param[16], source, buf_size);
10532 
10533          /* last two parameters (buf_size and async_flag */
10534          *((INT *) (&nc->param[16 + aligned_buf_size])) = buf_size;
10535          *((INT *) (&nc->param[24 + aligned_buf_size])) = 0;
10536 
10537          _tcp_wp += nc->header.param_size + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER);
10538       }
10539 
10540    } else {
10541 
10542       /* send events larger than optimal buffer size directly */
10543       if (aligned_buf_size + 4 * 8 + sizeof(INT) >= (DWORD) _opt_tcp_size) {
10544          /* send buffer */
10545          i = send_tcp(_rpc_sock, (char *) &buffer_handle, sizeof(INT), 0);
10546          if (i <= 0) {
10547             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_send_event", "send_tcp() failed, return code = %d", i);
10548             return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10549          }
10550 
10551          /* send data */
10552          i = send_tcp(_rpc_sock, (char *) source, aligned_buf_size, 0);
10553          if (i <= 0) {
10554             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_send_event", "send_tcp() failed, return code = %d", i);
10555             return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10556          }
10557       } else {
10558          /* copy event */
10559          *((INT *) (_tcp_buffer + _tcp_wp)) = buffer_handle;
10560          _tcp_wp += sizeof(INT);
10561          memcpy(_tcp_buffer + _tcp_wp, source, buf_size);
10562 
10563          _tcp_wp += aligned_buf_size;
10564       }
10565    }
10566 
10567    return RPC_SUCCESS;
10568 }
10569 
10570 
10571 /**dox***************************************************************/
10572 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
10573 
10574 /********************************************************************/
10575 int rpc_get_send_sock()
10576 /********************************************************************\
10577 
10578   Routine: rpc_get_send_sock
10579 
10580   Purpose: Return send socket to MIDAS server. Used by MFE.C for
10581            optimized event sending.
10582 
10583   Input:
10584     none
10585 
10586   Output:
10587     none
10588 
10589   Function value:
10590     int    socket
10591 
10592 \********************************************************************/
10593 {
10594    return _server_connection.send_sock;
10595 }
10596 
10597 
10598 /********************************************************************/
10599 int rpc_get_event_sock()
10600 /********************************************************************\
10601 
10602   Routine: rpc_get_event_sock
10603 
10604   Purpose: Return event send socket to MIDAS server. Used by MFE.C for
10605            optimized event sending.
10606 
10607   Input:
10608     none
10609 
10610   Output:
10611     none
10612 
10613   Function value:
10614     int    socket
10615 
10616 \********************************************************************/
10617 {
10618    return _server_connection.event_sock;
10619 }
10620 
10621 /**dox***************************************************************/
10622 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
10623 
10624 /********************************************************************/
10625 /**
10626 Send event residing in the TCP cache buffer filled by
10627            rpc_send_event. This routine should be called when a
10628            run is stopped.
10629 
10630 @return RPC_SUCCESS, RPC_NET_ERROR
10631 */
10632 INT rpc_flush_event()
10633 {
10634    INT i;
10635 
10636    if (!rpc_is_remote())
10637       return RPC_SUCCESS;
10638 
10639    /* return if rpc_send_event was not called */
10640    if (!_tcp_buffer || _tcp_wp == 0)
10641       return RPC_SUCCESS;
10642 
10643    /* empty TCP buffer */
10644    if (_tcp_wp > 0) {
10645       i = send_tcp(_rpc_sock, _tcp_buffer + _tcp_rp, _tcp_wp - _tcp_rp, 0);
10646 
10647       if (i != _tcp_wp - _tcp_rp) {
10648          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_flush_event", "send_tcp() failed");
10649          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10650       }
10651    }
10652 
10653    _tcp_rp = _tcp_wp = 0;
10654 
10655    return RPC_SUCCESS;
10656 }
10657 
10658 /**dox***************************************************************/
10659 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
10660 
10661 /********************************************************************/
10662 
10663 typedef struct {
10664    int transition;
10665    int run_number;
10666    time_t trans_time;
10667    int sequence_number;
10668 } TR_FIFO;
10669 
10670 static TR_FIFO tr_fifo[10];
10671 static int trf_wp, trf_rp;
10672 
10673 static INT rpc_transition_dispatch(INT idx, void *prpc_param[])
10674 /********************************************************************\
10675 
10676   Routine: rpc_transition_dispatch
10677 
10678   Purpose: Gets called when a transition function was registered and
10679            a transition occured. Internal use only.
10680
