10681   Input:
10682     INT    idx              RPC function ID
10683     void   *prpc_param      RPC parameters
10684 
10685   Output:
10686     none
10687 
10688   Function value:
10689     INT    return value from called user routine
10690 
10691 \********************************************************************/
10692 {
10693    INT status, i;
10694 
10695    /* erase error string */
10696    *(CSTRING(2)) = 0;
10697 
10698    if (idx == RPC_RC_TRANSITION) {
10699       for (i = 0; i < MAX_TRANSITIONS; i++)
10700          if (_trans_table[i].transition == CINT(0) && _trans_table[i].sequence_number == CINT(4))
10701             break;
10702 
10703       /* call registerd function */
10704       if (i < MAX_TRANSITIONS) {
10705          if (_trans_table[i].func)
10706             /* execute callback if defined */
10707             status = _trans_table[i].func(CINT(1), CSTRING(2));
10708          else {
10709             /* store transition in FIFO */
10710             tr_fifo[trf_wp].transition = CINT(0);
10711             tr_fifo[trf_wp].run_number = CINT(1);
10712             tr_fifo[trf_wp].trans_time = time(NULL);
10713             tr_fifo[trf_wp].sequence_number = CINT(4);
10714             trf_wp = (trf_wp + 1) % 10;
10715             status = RPC_SUCCESS;
10716          }
10717       } else
10718          status = RPC_SUCCESS;
10719 
10720    } else {
10721       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_transition_dispatch", "received unrecognized command");
10722       status = RPC_INVALID_ID;
10723    }
10724 
10725    return status;
10726 }
10727 
10728 /********************************************************************/
10729 int cm_query_transition(int *transition, int *run_number, int *trans_time)
10730 /********************************************************************\
10731 
10732   Routine: cm_query_transition
10733 
10734   Purpose: Query system if transition has occured. Normally, one
10735            registers callbacks for transitions via
10736            cm_register_transition. In some environments however,
10737            callbacks are not possible. In that case one spciefies
10738            a NULL pointer as the callback routine and can query
10739            transitions "manually" by calling this functions. A small
10740            FIFO takes care that no transition is lost if this functions
10741            did not get called between some transitions.
10742 
10743   Output:
10744     INT   *transition        Type of transition, one of TR_xxx
10745     INT   *run_nuber         Run number for transition
10746     time_t *trans_time       Time (in UNIX time) of transition
10747 
10748   Function value:
10749     FALSE  No transition occured since last call
10750     TRUE   Transition occured
10751 
10752 \********************************************************************/
10753 {
10754 
10755    if (trf_wp == trf_rp)
10756       return FALSE;
10757 
10758    if (transition)
10759       *transition = tr_fifo[trf_rp].transition;
10760 
10761    if (run_number)
10762       *run_number = tr_fifo[trf_rp].run_number;
10763 
10764    if (trans_time)
10765       *trans_time = (int) tr_fifo[trf_rp].trans_time;
10766 
10767    trf_rp = (trf_rp + 1) % 10;
10768 
10769    return TRUE;
10770 }
10771 
10772 /********************************************************************\
10773 *                        server functions                            *
10774 \********************************************************************/
10775 
10776 #if 0
10777 void debug_dump(unsigned char *p, int size)
10778 {
10779    int i, j;
10780    unsigned char c;
10781 
10782    for (i = 0; i < (size - 1) / 16 + 1; i++) {
10783       printf("%p ", p + i * 16);
10784       for (j = 0; j < 16; j++)
10785          if (i * 16 + j < size)
10786             printf("%02X ", p[i * 16 + j]);
10787          else
10788             printf("   ");
10789       printf(" ");
10790 
10791       for (j = 0; j < 16; j++) {
10792          c = p[i * 16 + j];
10793          if (i * 16 + j < size)
10794             printf("%c", (c >= 32 && c < 128) ? p[i * 16 + j] : '.');
10795       }
10796       printf("\n");
10797    }
10798 
10799    printf("\n");
10800 }
10801 #endif
10802 
10803 /********************************************************************/
10804 INT recv_tcp_server(INT idx, char *buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT flags, INT * remaining)
10805 /********************************************************************\
10806 
10807   Routine: recv_tcp_server
10808 
10809   Purpose: TCP receive routine with local cache. To speed up network
10810            performance, a 64k buffer is read in at once and split into
10811            several RPC command on successive calls to recv_tcp_server.
10812            Therefore, the number of recv() calls is minimized.
10813 
10814            This routine is ment to be called by the server process.
10815            Clients should call recv_tcp instead.
10816 
10817   Input:
10818     INT   idx                Index of server connection
10819     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
10820     INT   flags              Flags passed to recv()
10821     INT   convert_flags      Convert flags needed for big/little
10822                              endian conversion
10823 
10824   Output:
10825     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
10826     INT   *remaining         Remaining data in cache
10827 
10828   Function value:
10829     INT                      Same as recv()
10830 
10831 \********************************************************************/
10832 {
10833    INT size, param_size;
10834    NET_COMMAND *nc;
10835    INT write_ptr, read_ptr, misalign;
10836    char *net_buffer;
10837    INT copied, status;
10838    INT sock;
10839 
10840    sock = _server_acception[idx].recv_sock;
10841 
10842    if (flags & MSG_PEEK) {
10843       status = recv(sock, buffer, buffer_size, flags);
10844       if (status == -1)
10845          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp_server",
10846                 "recv(%d,MSG_PEEK) returned %d, errno: %d (%s)", buffer_size, status, errno, strerror(errno));
10847       return status;
10848    }
10849 
10850    if (!_server_acception[idx].net_buffer) {
10851       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
10852          _server_acception[idx].net_buffer_size = NET_TCP_SIZE;
10853       else
10854          _server_acception[idx].net_buffer_size = NET_BUFFER_SIZE;
10855 
10856       _server_acception[idx].net_buffer = (char *) M_MALLOC(_server_acception[idx].net_buffer_size);
10857       _server_acception[idx].write_ptr = 0;
10858       _server_acception[idx].read_ptr = 0;
10859       _server_acception[idx].misalign = 0;
10860    }
10861    if (!_server_acception[idx].net_buffer) {
10862       cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp_server", "Cannot allocate %d bytes for network buffer",
10863              _server_acception[idx].net_buffer_size);
10864       return -1;
10865    }
10866 
10867    if (buffer_size < sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER)) {
10868       cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp_server", "parameters too large for network buffer");
10869       return -1;
10870    }
10871 
10872    copied = 0;
10873    param_size = -1;
10874 
10875    write_ptr = _server_acception[idx].write_ptr;
10876    read_ptr = _server_acception[idx].read_ptr;
10877    misalign = _server_acception[idx].misalign;
10878    net_buffer = _server_acception[idx].net_buffer;
10879 
10880    do {
10881       if (write_ptr - read_ptr >= (INT) sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) - copied) {
10882          if (param_size == -1) {
10883             if (copied > 0) {
10884                /* assemble split header */
10885                memcpy(buffer + copied, net_buffer + read_ptr, (INT) sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) - copied);
10886                nc = (NET_COMMAND *) (buffer);
10887             } else
10888                nc = (NET_COMMAND *) (net_buffer + read_ptr);
10889 
10890             param_size = (INT) nc->header.param_size;
10891 
10892             if (_server_acception[idx].convert_flags)
10893                rpc_convert_single(&param_size, TID_DWORD, 0, _server_acception[idx].convert_flags);
10894          }
10895 
10896          /* check if parameters fit in buffer */
10897          if (buffer_size < param_size + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER)) {
10898             cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp_server", "parameters too large for network buffer");
10899             _server_acception[idx].read_ptr = _server_acception[idx].write_ptr = 0;
10900             return -1;
10901          }
10902 
10903          /* check if we have all parameters in buffer */
10904          if (write_ptr - read_ptr >= param_size + (INT) sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) - copied)
10905             break;
10906       }
10907 
10908       /* not enough data, so copy partially and get new */
10909       size = write_ptr - read_ptr;
10910 
10911       if (size > 0) {
10912          memcpy(buffer + copied, net_buffer + read_ptr, size);
10913          copied += size;
10914          read_ptr = write_ptr;
10915       }
10916 #ifdef OS_UNIX
10917       do {
10918          write_ptr = recv(sock, net_buffer + misalign, _server_acception[idx].net_buffer_size - 8, flags);
10919 
10920          /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
10921       } while (write_ptr == -1 && errno == EINTR);
10922 #else
10923       write_ptr = recv(sock, net_buffer + misalign, _server_acception[idx].net_buffer_size - 8, flags);
10924 #endif
10925 
10926       /* abort if connection broken */
10927       if (write_ptr <= 0) {
10928          if (write_ptr == 0)
10929             cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp_server", "rpc connection from \'%s\' on \'%s\' unexpectedly closed",
10930                    _server_acception[idx].prog_name, _server_acception[idx].host_name);
10931          else
10932             cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp_server", "recv() returned %d, errno: %d (%s)", write_ptr, errno,
10933                    strerror(errno));
10934 
10935          if (remaining)
10936             *remaining = 0;
10937 
10938          return write_ptr;
10939       }
10940 
10941       read_ptr = misalign;
10942       write_ptr += misalign;
10943 
10944       misalign = write_ptr % 8;
10945    } while (TRUE);
10946 
10947    /* copy rest of parameters */
10948    size = param_size + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) - copied;
10949    memcpy(buffer + copied, net_buffer + read_ptr, size);
10950    read_ptr += size;
10951 
10952    if (remaining) {
10953       /* don't keep rpc_server_receive in an infinite loop */
10954       if (write_ptr - read_ptr < param_size)
10955          *remaining = 0;
10956       else
10957          *remaining = write_ptr - read_ptr;
10958    }
10959 
10960    _server_acception[idx].write_ptr = write_ptr;
10961    _server_acception[idx].read_ptr = read_ptr;
10962    _server_acception[idx].misalign = misalign;
10963 
10964    return size + copied;
10965 }
10966 
10967 
10968 /********************************************************************/
10969 INT recv_tcp_check(int sock)
10970 /********************************************************************\
10971 
10972   Routine: recv_tcp_check
10973 
10974   Purpose: Check if in TCP receive buffer associated with sock is
10975            some data. Called by ss_suspend.
10976 
10977   Input:
10978     INT   sock               TCP receive socket
10979 
10980   Output:
10981     none
10982 
10983   Function value:
10984     INT   count              Number of bytes remaining in TCP buffer
10985 
10986 \********************************************************************/
10987 {
10988    INT idx;
10989 
10990    /* figure out to which connection socket belongs */
10991    for (idx = 0; idx < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; idx++)
10992       if (_server_acception[idx].recv_sock == sock)
10993          break;
10994 
10995    return _server_acception[idx].write_ptr - _server_acception[idx].read_ptr;
10996 }
10997 
10998 
10999 /********************************************************************/
11000 INT recv_event_server(INT idx, char *buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT flags, INT * remaining)
11001 /********************************************************************\
11002 
11003   Routine: recv_event_server
11004 
11005   Purpose: TCP event receive routine with local cache. To speed up
11006            network performance, a 64k buffer is read in at once and
11007            split into several RPC command on successive calls to
11008            recv_event_server. Therefore, the number of recv() calls
11009            is minimized.
11010 
11011            This routine is ment to be called by the server process.
11012            Clients should call recv_tcp instead.
11013 
11014   Input:
11015     INT   idx                Index of server connection
11016     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
11017     INT   flags              Flags passed to recv()
11018     INT   convert_flags      Convert flags needed for big/little
11019                              endian conversion
11020 
11021   Output:
11022     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
11023     INT   *remaining         Remaining data in cache
11024 
11025   Function value:
11026     INT                      Same as recv()
11027 
11028 \********************************************************************/
11029 {
11030    INT size, event_size, aligned_event_size = 0, *pbh, header_size;
11031    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
11032    INT write_ptr, read_ptr, misalign;
11033    char *net_buffer;
11034    INT copied, status;
11035    INT sock;
11036    RPC_SERVER_ACCEPTION *psa;
11037 
11038    psa = &_server_acception[idx];
11039    sock = psa->event_sock;
11040 
11041    //printf("recv_event_server: idx %d, buffer %p, buffer_size %d\n", idx, buffer, buffer_size);
11042 
11043    if (flags & MSG_PEEK) {
11044       status = recv(sock, buffer, buffer_size, flags);
11045       if (status == -1)
11046          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_event_server",
11047                 "recv(%d,MSG_PEEK) returned %d, errno: %d (%s)", buffer_size, status, errno, strerror(errno));
11048       return status;
11049    }
11050 
11051    if (!psa->ev_net_buffer) {
11052       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
11053          psa->net_buffer_size = NET_TCP_SIZE;
11054       else
11055          psa->net_buffer_size = NET_BUFFER_SIZE;
11056 
11057       psa->ev_net_buffer = (char *) M_MALLOC(psa->net_buffer_size);
11058 
11059       //printf("allocate %p size %d\n", psa->ev_net_buffer, psa->net_buffer_size);
11060 
11061       psa->ev_write_ptr = 0;
11062       psa->ev_read_ptr = 0;
11063       psa->ev_misalign = 0;
11064    }
11065    if (!psa->ev_net_buffer) {
11066       cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_event_server", "Cannot allocate %d bytes for network buffer",
11067              psa->net_buffer_size);
11068       return -1;
11069    }
11070 
11071    header_size = (INT) (sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + sizeof(INT));
11072 
11073    if ((INT) buffer_size < header_size) {
11074       cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_event_server", "parameters too large for network buffer");
11075       return -1;
11076    }
11077 
11078    copied = 0;
11079    event_size = -1;
11080 
11081    write_ptr = psa->ev_write_ptr;
11082    read_ptr = psa->ev_read_ptr;
11083    misalign = psa->ev_misalign;
11084    net_buffer = psa->ev_net_buffer;
11085 
11086    do {
11087       if (write_ptr - read_ptr >= header_size - copied) {
11088          if (event_size == -1) {
11089             if (copied > 0) {
11090                /* assemble split header */
11091                memcpy(buffer + copied, net_buffer + read_ptr, header_size - copied);
11092                pbh = (INT *) buffer;
11093             } else
11094                pbh = (INT *) (net_buffer + read_ptr);
11095 
11096             pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pbh + 1);
11097 
11098             event_size = pevent->data_size;
11099             if (psa->convert_flags)
11100                rpc_convert_single(&event_size, TID_DWORD, 0, psa->convert_flags);
11101 
11102             aligned_event_size = ALIGN8(event_size);
11103          }
11104 
11105          /* check if data part fits in buffer */
11106          if ((INT) buffer_size < aligned_event_size + header_size) {
11107             cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_event_server", "event size %d too large for network buffer size %d", aligned_event_size + header_size, buffer_size);
11108             psa->ev_read_ptr = psa->ev_write_ptr = 0;
11109             return -1;
11110          }
11111 
11112          /* check if we have whole event in buffer */
11113          if (write_ptr - read_ptr >= aligned_event_size + header_size - copied)
11114             break;
11115       }
11116 
11117       /* not enough data, so copy partially and get new */
11118       size = write_ptr - read_ptr;
11119 
11120       if (size > 0) {
11121          memcpy(buffer + copied, net_buffer + read_ptr, size);
11122          copied += size;
11123          read_ptr = write_ptr;
11124       }
11125 #ifdef OS_UNIX
11126       do {
11127          write_ptr = recv(sock, net_buffer + misalign, psa->net_buffer_size - 8, flags);
11128 
11129          /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
11130       } while (write_ptr == -1 && errno == EINTR);
11131 #else
11132       write_ptr = recv(sock, net_buffer + misalign, psa->net_buffer_size - 8, flags);
11133 #endif
11134 
11135       /* abort if connection broken */
11136       if (write_ptr <= 0) {
11137          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_event_server", "recv() returned %d, errno: %d (%s)", write_ptr, errno,
11138                 strerror(errno));
11139 
11140          if (remaining)
11141             *remaining = 0;
11142 
11143          return write_ptr;
11144       }
11145 
11146       read_ptr = misalign;
11147       write_ptr += misalign;
11148 
11149       misalign = write_ptr % 8;
11150    } while (TRUE);
11151 
11152    /* copy rest of event */
11153    size = aligned_event_size + header_size - copied;
11154    if (size > 0) {
11155       memcpy(buffer + copied, net_buffer + read_ptr, size);
11156       read_ptr += size;
11157    }
11158 
11159    if (remaining)
11160       *remaining = write_ptr - read_ptr;
11161 
11162    psa->ev_write_ptr = write_ptr;
11163    psa->ev_read_ptr = read_ptr;
11164    psa->ev_misalign = misalign;
11165 
11166    /* convert header little endian/big endian */
11167    if (psa->convert_flags) {
11168       pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (((INT *) buffer) + 1);
11169 
11170       rpc_convert_single(buffer, TID_INT, 0, psa->convert_flags);
11171       rpc_convert_single(&pevent->event_id, TID_SHORT, 0, psa->convert_flags);
11172       rpc_convert_single(&pevent->trigger_mask, TID_SHORT, 0, psa->convert_flags);
11173       rpc_convert_single(&pevent->serial_number, TID_DWORD, 0, psa->convert_flags);
11174       rpc_convert_single(&pevent->time_stamp, TID_DWORD, 0, psa->convert_flags);
11175       rpc_convert_single(&pevent->data_size, TID_DWORD, 0, psa->convert_flags);
11176    }
11177 
11178    return header_size + event_size;
11179 }
11180 
11181 
11182 /********************************************************************/
11183 INT recv_event_check(int sock)
11184 /********************************************************************\
11185 
11186   Routine: recv_event_check
11187 
11188   Purpose: Check if in TCP event receive buffer associated with sock
11189            is some data. Called by ss_suspend.
11190 
11191   Input:
11192     INT   sock               TCP receive socket
11193 
11194   Output:
11195     none
11196 
11197   Function value:
11198     INT   count              Number of bytes remaining in TCP buffer
11199 
11200 \********************************************************************/
11201 {
11202    INT idx;
11203 
11204    /* figure out to which connection socket belongs */
11205    for (idx = 0; idx < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; idx++)
11206       if (_server_acception[idx].event_sock == sock)
11207          break;
11208 
11209    return _server_acception[idx].ev_write_ptr - _server_acception[idx].ev_read_ptr;
11210 }
11211 
11212 
11213 /********************************************************************/
11214 INT rpc_register_server(INT server_type, const char *name, INT * port, INT(*func) (INT, void **))
11215 /********************************************************************\
11216 
11217   Routine: rpc_register_server
11218 
11219   Purpose: Register the calling process as a MIDAS RPC server. Note
11220            that cm_connnect_experiment must be called prior to any call of
11221            rpc_register_server.
11222 
11223   Input:
11224     INT   server_type       One of the following constants:
11225                             ST_SINGLE: register a single process server
11226                             ST_MTHREAD: for each connection, start
11227                                         a new thread to serve it
11228                             ST_MPROCESS: for each connection, start
11229                                          a new process to server it
11230                             ST_SUBPROCESS: the routine was called from
11231                                            a multi process server
11232                             ST_REMOTE: register a client program server
11233                                        connected to the ODB
11234     char  *name             Name of .EXE file to start in MPROCESS mode
11235     INT   *port             TCP port for listen. NULL if listen as main
11236                             server (MIDAS_TCP_PORT is then used). If *port=0,
11237                             the OS chooses a free port and returns it. If
11238                             *port != 0, this port is used.
11239     INT   *func             Default dispatch function
11240 
11241   Output:
11242     INT   *port             Port under which server is listening.
11243 
11244   Function value:
11245     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
11246     RPC_NET_ERROR           Error in socket call
11247     RPC_NOT_REGISTERED      cm_connect_experiment was not called
11248 
11249 \********************************************************************/
11250 {
11251    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
11252    INT status, flag;
11253    unsigned int size;
11254 
11255 #ifdef OS_WINNT
11256    {
11257       WSADATA WSAData;
11258 
11259       /* Start windows sockets */
11260       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
11261          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
11262    }
11263 #endif
11264 
11265    rpc_set_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE, server_type);
11266 
11267    /* register system functions */
11268    rpc_register_functions(rpc_get_internal_list(0), func);
11269 
11270    if (name != NULL)
11271       rpc_set_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_NAME, (POINTER_T) name);
11272 
11273    /* in subprocess mode, don't start listener */
11274    if (server_type == ST_SUBPROCESS)
11275       return RPC_SUCCESS;
11276 
11277    /* create a socket for listening */
11278    _lsock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
11279    if (_lsock == -1) {
11280       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_register_server", "socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM) failed, errno %d (%s)", errno,
11281              strerror(errno));
11282       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
11283    }
11284 
11285    /* set close-on-exec flag to prevent child mserver processes from inheriting the listen socket */
11286 #if defined(F_SETFD) && defined(FD_CLOEXEC)
11287    status = fcntl(_lsock, F_SETFD, fcntl(_lsock, F_GETFD) | FD_CLOEXEC);
11288    if (status < 0) {
11289       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_register_server", "fcntl(F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC) failed, errno %d (%s)", errno,
11290              strerror(errno));
11291       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
11292    }
11293 #endif
11294 
11295    /* reuse address, needed if previous server stopped (30s timeout!) */
11296    flag = 1;
11297    status = setsockopt(_lsock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char *) &flag, sizeof(INT));
11298    if (status < 0) {
11299       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_register_server", "setsockopt(SO_REUSEADDR) failed, errno %d (%s)", errno,
11300              strerror(errno));
11301       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
11302    }
11303 
11304    /* bind local node name and port to socket */
11305    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
11306    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
11307    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
11308 
11309    if (!port)
11310       bind_addr.sin_port = htons(MIDAS_TCP_PORT);
11311    else
11312       bind_addr.sin_port = htons((short) (*port));
11313 
11314    status = bind(_lsock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
11315    if (status < 0) {
11316       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_register_server", "bind() failed, errno %d (%s)", errno, strerror(errno));
11317       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
11318    }
11319 
11320    /* listen for connection */
11321 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
11322    status = listen(_lsock, 1);
11323 #else
11324    status = listen(_lsock, SOMAXCONN);
11325 #endif
11326    if (status < 0) {
11327       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_register_server", "listen() failed, errno %d (%s)", errno, strerror(errno));
11328       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
11329    }
11330 
11331    /* return port wich OS has choosen */
11332    if (port && *port == 0) {
11333       size = sizeof(bind_addr);
11334 #ifdef OS_WINNT
11335       getsockname(_lsock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, (int *) &size);
11336 #else
11337       getsockname(_lsock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, &size);
11338 #endif
11339       *port = ntohs(bind_addr.sin_port);
11340    }
11341 
11342    /* define callbacks for ss_suspend */
11343    if (server_type == ST_REMOTE)
11344       ss_suspend_set_dispatch(CH_LISTEN, &_lsock, (int (*)(void)) rpc_client_accept);
11345    else
11346       ss_suspend_set_dispatch(CH_LISTEN, &_lsock, (int (*)(void)) rpc_server_accept);
11347 
11348    return RPC_SUCCESS;
11349 }
11350 
11351 typedef struct {
11352    int tid;
11353    int buffer_size;
11354    char *buffer;
11355 } TLS_POINTER;
11356 
11357 TLS_POINTER *tls_buffer = NULL;
11358 int tls_size = 0;
11359 
11360 /********************************************************************/
11361 INT rpc_execute(INT sock, char *buffer, INT convert_flags)
11362 /********************************************************************\
11363 
11364   Routine: rpc_execute
11365 
11366   Purpose: Execute a RPC command received over the network
11367 
11368   Input:
11369     INT  sock               TCP socket to which the result should be
11370                             send back
11371 
11372     char *buffer            Command buffer
11373     INT  convert_flags      Flags for data conversion
11374 
11375   Output:
11376     none
11377 
11378   Function value:
11379     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
11380     RPC_INVALID_ID          Invalid routine_id received
11381     RPC_NET_ERROR           Error in socket call
11382     RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER       Not enough memory for network buffer
11383     RPC_SHUTDOWN            Shutdown requested
11384     SS_ABORT                TCP connection broken
11385     SS_EXIT                 TCP connection closed
11386 
11387 \********************************************************************/
11388 {
11389    INT i, idx, routine_id, status;
11390    char *in_param_ptr, *out_param_ptr, *last_param_ptr;
11391    INT tid, flags;
11392    NET_COMMAND *nc_in, *nc_out;
11393    INT param_size, max_size;
11394    void *prpc_param[20];
11395    char str[1024], debug_line[1024], *return_buffer;
11396    int return_buffer_size;
11397    int return_buffer_tls;
11398 #ifdef FIXED_BUFFER
11399    int initial_buffer_size = NET_BUFFER_SIZE;
11400 #else
11401    int initial_buffer_size = 1024;
11402 #endif
11403 
11404    /* return buffer must must use thread local storage multi-thread servers */
11405    if (!tls_size) {
11406       tls_buffer = (TLS_POINTER *) malloc(sizeof(TLS_POINTER));
11407       tls_buffer[tls_size].tid = ss_gettid();
11408       tls_buffer[tls_size].buffer_size = initial_buffer_size;
11409       tls_buffer[tls_size].buffer = (char *) malloc(tls_buffer[tls_size].buffer_size);
11410       tls_size = 1;
11411    }
11412    for (i = 0; i < tls_size; i++)
11413       if (tls_buffer[i].tid == ss_gettid())
11414          break;
11415    if (i == tls_size) {
11416       /* new thread -> allocate new buffer */
11417       tls_buffer = (TLS_POINTER *) realloc(tls_buffer, (tls_size + 1) * sizeof(TLS_POINTER));
11418       tls_buffer[tls_size].tid = ss_gettid();
11419       tls_buffer[tls_size].buffer_size = initial_buffer_size;
11420       tls_buffer[tls_size].buffer = (char *) malloc(tls_buffer[tls_size].buffer_size);
11421       tls_size++;
11422    }
11423 
11424    return_buffer_tls = i;
11425    return_buffer_size = tls_buffer[i].buffer_size;
11426    return_buffer = tls_buffer[i].buffer;
11427    assert(return_buffer);
11428 
11429    /* extract pointer array to parameters */
11430    nc_in = (NET_COMMAND *) buffer;
11431 
11432    /* convert header format (byte swapping) */
11433    if (convert_flags) {
11434       rpc_convert_single(&nc_in->header.routine_id, TID_DWORD, 0, convert_flags);
11435       rpc_convert_single(&nc_in->header.param_size, TID_DWORD, 0, convert_flags);
11436    }
11437 
11438    /* no result return in FAST TCP mode */
11439    if (nc_in->header.routine_id & TCP_FAST)
11440       sock = 0;
11441 
11442    /* find entry in rpc_list */
11443    routine_id = nc_in->header.routine_id & ~TCP_FAST;
11444 
11445    assert(rpc_list != NULL);
11446 
11447    for (i = 0;; i++)
11448       if (rpc_list[i].id == 0 || rpc_list[i].id == routine_id)
11449          break;
11450    idx = i;
11451    if (rpc_list[i].id == 0) {
11452       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_execute", "Invalid rpc ID (%d)", routine_id);
11453       return RPC_INVALID_ID;
11454    }
11455 
11456  again:
11457 
11458    in_param_ptr = nc_in->param;
11459 
11460    nc_out = (NET_COMMAND *) return_buffer;
11461    out_param_ptr = nc_out->param;
11462 
11463    sprintf(debug_line, "%s(", rpc_list[idx].name);
11464 
11465    for (i = 0; rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
11466       tid = rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid;
11467       flags = rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags;
11468 
11469       if (flags & RPC_IN) {
11470          param_size = ALIGN8(tid_size[tid]);
11471 
11472          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
11473             param_size = ALIGN8(1 + strlen((char *) (in_param_ptr)));
11474 
11475          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
11476             /* for arrays, the size is stored as a INT in front of the array */
11477             param_size = *((INT *) in_param_ptr);
11478             if (convert_flags)
11479                rpc_convert_single(&param_size, TID_INT, 0, convert_flags);
11480             param_size = ALIGN8(param_size);
11481 
11482             in_param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
11483          }
11484 
11485          if (tid == TID_STRUCT)
11486             param_size = ALIGN8(rpc_list[idx].param[i].n);
11487 
11488          prpc_param[i] = in_param_ptr;
11489 
11490          /* convert data format */
11491          if (convert_flags) {
11492             if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY)
11493                rpc_convert_data(in_param_ptr, tid, flags, param_size, convert_flags);
11494             else
11495                rpc_convert_data(in_param_ptr, tid, flags, rpc_list[idx].param[i].n * tid_size[tid],
11496                                 convert_flags);
11497          }
11498 
11499          db_sprintf(str, in_param_ptr, param_size, 0, rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid);
11500          if (rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid == TID_STRING) {
11501             /* check for long strings (db_create_record...) */
11502             if (strlen(debug_line) + strlen(str) + 2 < sizeof(debug_line)) {
11503                strcat(debug_line, "\"");
11504                strcat(debug_line, str);
11505                strcat(debug_line, "\"");
11506             } else
11507                strcat(debug_line, "...");
11508          } else
11509             strcat(debug_line, str);
11510 
11511          in_param_ptr += param_size;
11512       }
11513 
11514       if (flags & RPC_OUT) {
11515          param_size = ALIGN8(tid_size[tid]);
11516 
11517          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY || tid == TID_STRING) {
11518 
11519             /* save maximum array length from the value of the next argument.
11520              * this means RPC_OUT arrays and strings should always be passed like this:
11521              * rpc_call(..., array_ptr, array_max_size, ...); */
11522 
11523             max_size = *((INT *) in_param_ptr);
11524 
11525             if (convert_flags)
11526                rpc_convert_single(&max_size, TID_INT, 0, convert_flags);
11527             max_size = ALIGN8(max_size);
11528 
11529             *((INT *) out_param_ptr) = max_size;
11530 
11531             /* save space for return array length */
11532             out_param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
11533 
11534             /* use maximum array length from input */
11535             param_size += max_size;
11536          }
11537 
11538          if (rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid == TID_STRUCT)
11539             param_size = ALIGN8(rpc_list[idx].param[i].n);
11540 
11541          if ((POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc_out + param_size > return_buffer_size) {
11542 #ifdef FIXED_BUFFER
11543             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_execute",
11544                    "return parameters (%d) too large for network buffer (%d)",
11545                    (POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc_out + param_size, return_buffer_size);
11546 
11547             return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
11548 #else
11549             int itls;
11550             int new_size = (POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc_out + param_size + 1024;
11551 
11552             if (0)
11553                cm_msg(MINFO, "rpc_execute",
11554                       "rpc_execute: return parameters (%d) too large for network buffer (%d), new buffer size (%d)",
11555                       (POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc_out + param_size, return_buffer_size, new_size);
11556 
11557             itls = return_buffer_tls;
11558 
11559             tls_buffer[itls].buffer_size = new_size;
11560             tls_buffer[itls].buffer = (char *) realloc(tls_buffer[itls].buffer, new_size);
11561 
11562             if (!tls_buffer[itls].buffer) {
11563                cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_execute", "Cannot allocate return buffer of size %d", new_size);
11564                return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
11565             }
11566 
11567             return_buffer_size = tls_buffer[itls].buffer_size;
11568             return_buffer = tls_buffer[itls].buffer;
11569             assert(return_buffer);
11570 
11571             goto again;
11572 #endif
11573          }
11574 
11575          /* if parameter goes both directions, copy input to output */
11576          if (rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags & RPC_IN)
11577             memcpy(out_param_ptr, prpc_param[i], param_size);
11578 
11579          if (_debug_print && !(flags & RPC_IN))
11580             strcat(debug_line, "-");
11581 
11582          prpc_param[i] = out_param_ptr;
11583          out_param_ptr += param_size;
11584       }
11585 
11586       if (rpc_list[idx].param[i + 1].tid)
11587          strcat(debug_line, ", ");
11588    }
11589 
11590    //printf("predicted return size %d\n", (POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc_out);
11591 
11592    strcat(debug_line, ")");
11593    rpc_debug_printf(debug_line);
11594 
11595    last_param_ptr = out_param_ptr;
11596 
11597   /*********************************\
11598   *   call dispatch function        *
11599   \*********************************/
11600    if (rpc_list[idx].dispatch)
11601       status = rpc_list[idx].dispatch(routine_id, prpc_param);
11602    else
11603       status = RPC_INVALID_ID;
11604 
11605    if (routine_id == RPC_ID_EXIT || routine_id == RPC_ID_SHUTDOWN || routine_id == RPC_ID_WATCHDOG)
11606       status = RPC_SUCCESS;
11607 
11608    /* return immediately for closed down client connections */
11609    if (!sock && routine_id == RPC_ID_EXIT)
11610       return SS_EXIT;
11611 
11612    if (!sock && routine_id == RPC_ID_SHUTDOWN)
11613       return RPC_SHUTDOWN;
11614 
11615    /* Return if TCP connection broken */
11616    if (status == SS_ABORT)
11617       return SS_ABORT;
11618 
11619    /* if sock == 0, we are in FTCP mode and may not sent results */
11620    if (!sock)
11621       return RPC_SUCCESS;
11622 
11623    /* compress variable length arrays */
11624    out_param_ptr = nc_out->param;
11625    for (i = 0; rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid != 0; i++)
11626       if (rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags & RPC_OUT) {
11627          tid = rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid;
11628          flags = rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags;
11629          param_size = ALIGN8(tid_size[tid]);
11630 
11631          if (tid == TID_STRING) {
11632             max_size = *((INT *) out_param_ptr);
11633             param_size = strlen((char *) prpc_param[i]) + 1;
11634             param_size = ALIGN8(param_size);
11635 
11636             /* move string ALIGN8(sizeof(INT)) left */
11637             memcpy(out_param_ptr, out_param_ptr + ALIGN8(sizeof(INT)), param_size);
11638 
11639             /* move remaining parameters to end of string */
11640             memcpy(out_param_ptr + param_size,
11641                    out_param_ptr + max_size + ALIGN8(sizeof(INT)),
11642                    (POINTER_T) last_param_ptr - ((POINTER_T) out_param_ptr + max_size + ALIGN8(sizeof(INT))));
11643          }
11644 
11645          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
11646             /* store array length at current out_param_ptr */
11647             max_size = *((INT *) out_param_ptr);
11648             param_size = *((INT *) prpc_param[i + 1]);
11649             *((INT *) out_param_ptr) = param_size;      // store new array size
11650             if (convert_flags)
11651                rpc_convert_single(out_param_ptr, TID_INT, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
11652 
11653             out_param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));       // step over array size
11654 
11655             param_size = ALIGN8(param_size);
11656 
11657             /* move remaining parameters to end of array */
11658             memcpy(out_param_ptr + param_size,
11659                    out_param_ptr + max_size,
11660                    (POINTER_T) last_param_ptr - ((POINTER_T) out_param_ptr + max_size));
11661          }
11662 
11663          if (tid == TID_STRUCT)
11664             param_size = ALIGN8(rpc_list[idx].param[i].n);
11665 
11666          /* convert data format */
11667          if (convert_flags) {
11668             if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY)
11669                rpc_convert_data(out_param_ptr, tid,
11670                                 rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags | RPC_OUTGOING, param_size, convert_flags);
11671             else
11672                rpc_convert_data(out_param_ptr, tid,
11673                                 rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags | RPC_OUTGOING,
11674                                 rpc_list[idx].param[i].n * tid_size[tid], convert_flags);
11675          }
11676 
11677          out_param_ptr += param_size;
11678       }
11679 
11680    /* send return parameters */
11681    param_size = (POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc_out->param;
11682    nc_out->header.routine_id = status;
11683    nc_out->header.param_size = param_size;
11684 
11685    //printf("actual return size %d, buffer used %d\n", (POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) nc_out, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + param_size);
11686 
11687    /* convert header format (byte swapping) if necessary */
11688    if (convert_flags) {
11689       rpc_convert_single(&nc_out->header.routine_id, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
11690       rpc_convert_single(&nc_out->header.param_size, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
11691    }
11692 
11693    status = send_tcp(sock, return_buffer, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + param_size, 0);
11694 
11695    if (status < 0) {
11696       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_execute", "send_tcp() failed");
11697       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
11698    }
11699 
11700    /* print return buffer */
11701 /*
11702   printf("Return buffer, ID %d:\n", routine_id);
11703   for (i=0; i<param_size ; i++)
11704     {
11705     status = (char) nc_out->param[i];
11706     printf("%02X ", status);
11707     if (i%8 == 7)
11708       printf("\n");
11709     }
11710 */
11711    /* return SS_EXIT if RPC_EXIT is called */
11712    if (routine_id == RPC_ID_EXIT)
11713       return SS_EXIT;
11714 
11715    /* return SS_SHUTDOWN if RPC_SHUTDOWN is called */
11716    if (routine_id == RPC_ID_SHUTDOWN)
11717       return RPC_SHUTDOWN;
11718 
11719    return RPC_SUCCESS;
11720 }
11721 
11722 
11723 /********************************************************************/
11724 INT rpc_execute_ascii(INT sock, char *buffer)
11725 /********************************************************************\
11726 
11727   Routine: rpc_execute_ascii
11728 
11729   Purpose: Execute a RPC command received over the network in ASCII
11730            mode
11731 
11732   Input:
11733     INT  sock               TCP socket to which the result should be
11734                             send back
11735 
11736     char *buffer            Command buffer
11737 
11738   Output:
11739     none
11740 
11741   Function value:
11742     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
11743     RPC_INVALID_ID          Invalid routine_id received
11744     RPC_NET_ERROR           Error in socket call
11745     RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER       Not enough memory for network buffer
11746     RPC_SHUTDOWN            Shutdown requested
11747     SS_ABORT                TCP connection broken
11748     SS_EXIT                 TCP connection closed
11749 
11750 \********************************************************************/
11751 {
11752 #define ASCII_BUFFER_SIZE 64500
11753 #define N_APARAM           1024
11754 
11755    INT i, j, idx, status, index_in;
11756    char *in_param_ptr, *out_param_ptr, *last_param_ptr;
11757    INT routine_id, tid, flags, array_tid, n_param;
11758    INT param_size, item_size, num_values;
11759    void *prpc_param[20];
11760    char *arpc_param[N_APARAM], *pc;
11761    char str[1024], debug_line[1024];
11762    char buffer1[ASCII_BUFFER_SIZE];     /* binary in */
11763    char buffer2[ASCII_BUFFER_SIZE];     /* binary out */
11764    char return_buffer[ASCII_BUFFER_SIZE];       /* ASCII out */
11765 
11766    /* parse arguments */
11767    arpc_param[0] = buffer;
11768    for (i = 1; i < N_APARAM; i++) {
11769       arpc_param[i] = strchr(arpc_param[i - 1], '&');
11770       if (arpc_param[i] == NULL)
11771          break;
11772       *arpc_param[i] = 0;
11773       arpc_param[i]++;
11774    }
11775 
11776    /* decode '%' */
11777    for (i = 0; i < N_APARAM && arpc_param[i]; i++)
11778       while ((pc = strchr(arpc_param[i], '%')) != NULL) {
11779          if (isxdigit(pc[1]) && isxdigit(pc[2])) {
11780             str[0] = pc[1];
11781             str[1] = pc[2];
11782             str[2] = 0;
11783             sscanf(str, "%02X", &i);
11784 
11785             *pc++ = i;
11786             while (pc[2]) {
11787                pc[0] = pc[2];
11788                pc++;
11789             }
11790          }
11791       }
11792 
11793    /* find entry in rpc_list */
11794    for (i = 0;; i++)
11795       if (rpc_list[i].id == 0 || strcmp(arpc_param[0], rpc_list[i].name) == 0)
11796          break;
11797    idx = i;
11798    routine_id = rpc_list[i].id;
11799    if (rpc_list[i].id == 0) {
11800       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_execute", "Invalid rpc name (%s)", arpc_param[0]);
11801       return RPC_INVALID_ID;
11802    }
11803 
11804    in_param_ptr = buffer1;
11805    out_param_ptr = buffer2;
11806    index_in = 1;
11807 
11808    sprintf(debug_line, "%s(", rpc_list[idx].name);
11809 
11810    for (i = 0; rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
11811       tid = rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid;
11812       flags = rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags;
11813 
11814       if (flags & RPC_IN) {
11815          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
11816             sscanf(arpc_param[index_in++], "%d %d", &n_param, &array_tid);
11817 
11818             prpc_param[i] = in_param_ptr;
11819             for (j = 0; j < n_param; j++) {
11820                db_sscanf(arpc_param[index_in++], in_param_ptr, &param_size, 0, array_tid);
11821                in_param_ptr += param_size;
11822             }
11823             in_param_ptr = (char *) ALIGN8(((POINTER_T) in_param_ptr));
11824 
11825             strcat(debug_line, "<array>");
11826          } else {
11827             db_sscanf(arpc_param[index_in++], in_param_ptr, &param_size, 0, tid);
11828             param_size = ALIGN8(param_size);
11829 
11830             if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
11831                param_size = ALIGN8(1 + strlen((char *) (in_param_ptr)));
11832 
11833             /*
11834                if (tid == TID_STRUCT)
11835                param_size = ALIGN8( rpc_list[idx].param[i].n );
11836              */
11837             prpc_param[i] = in_param_ptr;
11838 
11839             db_sprintf(str, in_param_ptr, param_size, 0, rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid);
11840             if (rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid == TID_STRING) {
11841                /* check for long strings (db_create_record...) */
11842                if (strlen(debug_line) + strlen(str) + 2 < sizeof(debug_line)) {
11843                   strcat(debug_line, "\"");
11844                   strcat(debug_line, str);
11845                   strcat(debug_line, "\"");
11846                } else
11847                   strcat(debug_line, "...");
11848             } else
11849                strcat(debug_line, str);
11850 
11851             in_param_ptr += param_size;
11852          }
11853 
11854          if ((POINTER_T) in_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) buffer1 > ASCII_BUFFER_SIZE) {
11855             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_ascii_execute",
11856                    "parameters (%d) too large for network buffer (%d)", param_size, ASCII_BUFFER_SIZE);
11857             return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
11858          }
11859 
11860       }
11861 
11862       if (flags & RPC_OUT) {
11863          param_size = ALIGN8(tid_size[tid]);
11864 
11865          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY || tid == TID_STRING) {
11866             /* reserve maximum array length */
11867             param_size = atoi(arpc_param[index_in]);
11868             param_size = ALIGN8(param_size);
11869          }
11870 
11871 /*
11872       if (rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid == TID_STRUCT)
11873         param_size = ALIGN8( rpc_list[idx].param[i].n );
11874 */
11875          if ((POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) buffer2 + param_size > ASCII_BUFFER_SIZE) {
11876             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_execute",
11877                    "return parameters (%d) too large for network buffer (%d)",
11878                    (POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) buffer2 + param_size, ASCII_BUFFER_SIZE);
11879             return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
11880          }
11881 
11882          /* if parameter goes both directions, copy input to output */
11883          if (rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags & RPC_IN)
11884             memcpy(out_param_ptr, prpc_param[i], param_size);
11885 
11886          if (!(flags & RPC_IN))
11887             strcat(debug_line, "-");
11888 
11889          prpc_param[i] = out_param_ptr;
11890          out_param_ptr += param_size;
11891       }
11892 
11893       if (rpc_list[idx].param[i + 1].tid)
11894          strcat(debug_line, ", ");
11895    }
11896 
11897    strcat(debug_line, ")");
11898    rpc_debug_printf(debug_line);
11899 
11900    last_param_ptr = out_param_ptr;
11901 
11902    /*********************************\
11903    *   call dispatch function        *
11904    \*********************************/
11905 
11906    if (rpc_list[idx].dispatch)
11907       status = rpc_list[idx].dispatch(routine_id, prpc_param);
11908    else
11909       status = RPC_INVALID_ID;
11910 
11911    if (routine_id == RPC_ID_EXIT || routine_id == RPC_ID_SHUTDOWN || routine_id == RPC_ID_WATCHDOG)
11912       status = RPC_SUCCESS;
11913 
11914    /* Return if TCP connection broken */
11915    if (status == SS_ABORT)
11916       return SS_ABORT;
11917 
11918    /* if sock == 0, we are in FTCP mode and may not sent results */
11919    if (!sock)
11920       return RPC_SUCCESS;
11921 
11922    /* send return status */
11923    out_param_ptr = return_buffer;
11924    sprintf(out_param_ptr, "%d", status);
11925    out_param_ptr += strlen(out_param_ptr);
11926 
11927    /* convert return parameters */
11928    for (i = 0; rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid != 0; i++)
11929       if (rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags & RPC_OUT) {
11930          *out_param_ptr++ = '&';
11931 
11932          tid = rpc_list[idx].param[i].tid;
11933          flags = rpc_list[idx].param[i].flags;
11934          param_size = ALIGN8(tid_size[tid]);
11935 
11936          if (tid == TID_STRING && !(flags & RPC_VARARRAY)) {
11937             strcpy(out_param_ptr, (char *) prpc_param[i]);
11938             param_size = strlen((char *) prpc_param[i]);
11939          }
11940 
11941          else if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
11942             if (rpc_list[idx].id == RPC_BM_RECEIVE_EVENT) {
11943                param_size = *((INT *) prpc_param[i + 1]);
11944                /* write number of bytes to output */
11945                sprintf(out_param_ptr, "%d", param_size);
11946                out_param_ptr += strlen(out_param_ptr) + 1;      /* '0' finishes param */
11947                memcpy(out_param_ptr, prpc_param[i], param_size);
11948                out_param_ptr += param_size;
11949                *out_param_ptr = 0;
11950             } else {
11951                if (rpc_list[idx].id == RPC_DB_GET_DATA1) {
11952                   param_size = *((INT *) prpc_param[i + 1]);
11953                   array_tid = *((INT *) prpc_param[i + 2]);
11954                   num_values = *((INT *) prpc_param[i + 3]);
11955                } else if (rpc_list[idx].id == RPC_DB_GET_DATA_INDEX) {
11956                   param_size = *((INT *) prpc_param[i + 1]);
11957                   array_tid = *((INT *) prpc_param[i + 3]);
11958                   num_values = 1;
11959                } else if (rpc_list[idx].id == RPC_HS_READ) {
11960                   param_size = *((INT *) prpc_param[i + 1]);
11961                   if (i == 6) {
11962                      array_tid = TID_DWORD;
11963                      num_values = param_size / sizeof(DWORD);
11964                   } else {
11965                      array_tid = *((INT *) prpc_param[10]);
11966                      num_values = *((INT *) prpc_param[11]);
11967                   }
11968                } else {         /* variable arrays of fixed type like hs_enum_events, hs_enum_vars */
11969 
11970                   param_size = *((INT *) prpc_param[i + 1]);
11971                   array_tid = tid;
11972                   if (tid == TID_STRING)
11973                      num_values = param_size / NAME_LENGTH;
11974                   else
11975                      num_values = param_size / tid_size[tid];
11976                }
11977 
11978                /* derive size of individual item */
11979                if (array_tid == TID_STRING)
11980                   item_size = param_size / num_values;
11981                else
11982                   item_size = tid_size[array_tid];
11983 
11984                /* write number of elements to output */
11985                sprintf(out_param_ptr, "%d", num_values);
11986                out_param_ptr += strlen(out_param_ptr);
11987 
11988                /* write array of values to output */
11989                for (j = 0; j < num_values; j++) {
11990                   *out_param_ptr++ = '&';
11991                   db_sprintf(out_param_ptr, prpc_param[i], item_size, j, array_tid);
11992                   out_param_ptr += strlen(out_param_ptr);
11993                }
11994             }
11995          }
11996 
11997 /*
11998       else if (tid == TID_STRUCT)
11999         param_size = ALIGN8( rpc_list[idx].param[i].n );
12000 */
12001          else
12002             db_sprintf(out_param_ptr, prpc_param[i], param_size, 0, tid);
12003 
12004          out_param_ptr += strlen(out_param_ptr);
12005 
12006          if ((POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) return_buffer > ASCII_BUFFER_SIZE) {
12007             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_execute",
12008                    "return parameter (%d) too large for network buffer (%d)", param_size, ASCII_BUFFER_SIZE);
12009             return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
12010          }
12011       }
12012 
12013    /* send return parameters */
12014    param_size = (POINTER_T) out_param_ptr - (POINTER_T) return_buffer + 1;
12015 
12016    status = send_tcp(sock, return_buffer, param_size, 0);
12017 
12018    if (status < 0) {
12019       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_execute", "send_tcp() failed");
12020       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12021    }
12022 
12023    /* print return buffer */
12024    if (strlen(return_buffer) > sizeof(debug_line)) {
12025       memcpy(debug_line, return_buffer, sizeof(debug_line) - 10);
12026       strcat(debug_line, "...");
12027    } else
12028       sprintf(debug_line, "-> %s", return_buffer);
12029    rpc_debug_printf(debug_line);
12030 
12031    /* return SS_EXIT if RPC_EXIT is called */
12032    if (routine_id == RPC_ID_EXIT)
12033       return SS_EXIT;
12034 
12035    /* return SS_SHUTDOWN if RPC_SHUTDOWN is called */
12036    if (routine_id == RPC_ID_SHUTDOWN)
12037       return RPC_SHUTDOWN;
12038 
12039    return RPC_SUCCESS;
12040 }
12041 
12042 #define MAX_N_ALLOWED_HOSTS 100
12043 static char allowed_host[MAX_N_ALLOWED_HOSTS][256];
12044 static int  n_allowed_hosts = 0;
12045 
12046 /********************************************************************/
12047 INT rpc_clear_allowed_hosts()
12048 /********************************************************************\
12049   Routine: rpc_clear_allowed_hosts
12050 
12051   Purpose: Clear list of allowed hosts and permit connections from anybody
12052 
12053   Input:
12054     none
12055 
12056   Output:
12057     none
12058 
12059   Function value:
12060     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
12061 
12062 \********************************************************************/
12063 {
12064    n_allowed_hosts = 0;
12065    return RPC_SUCCESS;
12066 }
12067 
12068 /********************************************************************/
12069 INT rpc_add_allowed_host(const char* hostname)
12070 /********************************************************************\
12071   Routine: rpc_add_allowed_host
12072 
12073   Purpose: Permit connections from listed hosts only
12074 
12075   Input:
12076     none
12077 
12078   Output:
12079     none
12080 
12081   Function value:
12082     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
12083     RPC_NO_MEMORY           Too many allowed hosts
12084 
12085 \********************************************************************/
12086 {
12087    if (n_allowed_hosts >= MAX_N_ALLOWED_HOSTS)
12088       return RPC_NO_MEMORY;
12089 
12090    strlcpy(allowed_host[n_allowed_hosts++], hostname, sizeof(allowed_host[0]));
12091    return RPC_SUCCESS;
12092 }
12093 
12094 /********************************************************************/
12095 INT rpc_server_accept(int lsock)
12096 /********************************************************************\
12097 
12098   Routine: rpc_server_accept
12099 
12100   Purpose: Accept new incoming connections
12101 
12102   Input:
12103     INT    lscok            Listen socket
12104 
12105   Output:
12106     none
12107 
12108   Function value:
12109     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
12110     RPC_NET_ERROR           Error in socket call
12111     RPC_CONNCLOSED          Connection was closed
12112     RPC_SHUTDOWN            Listener shutdown
12113     RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER       Not enough memory for network buffer
12114 
12115 \********************************************************************/
12116 {
12117    INT idx, i;
12118    unsigned int size;
12119    int status;
12120    char command;
12121    INT sock;
12122    char version[NAME_LENGTH], v1[32];
12123    char experiment[NAME_LENGTH];
12124    INT port1, port2, port3;
12125    char *ptr;
12126    struct sockaddr_in acc_addr;
12127    struct hostent *phe;
12128    char str[100];
12129    char host_port1_str[30], host_port2_str[30], host_port3_str[30];
12130    char debug_str[30];
12131    char *argv[10];
12132    char net_buffer[256];
12133    struct linger ling;
12134 
12135    static struct callback_addr callback;
12136 
12137    if (lsock > 0) {
12138       size = sizeof(acc_addr);
12139 #ifdef OS_WINNT
12140       sock = accept(lsock, (struct sockaddr *) &acc_addr, (int *) &size);
12141 #else
12142       sock = accept(lsock, (struct sockaddr *) &acc_addr, &size);
12143 #endif
12144 
12145       if (sock == -1)
12146          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12147    } else {
12148       /* lsock is stdin -> already connected from inetd */
12149 
12150       size = sizeof(acc_addr);
12151       sock = lsock;
12152 #ifdef OS_WINNT
12153       getpeername(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &acc_addr, (int *) &size);
12154 #else
12155       getpeername(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &acc_addr, &size);
12156 #endif
12157    }
12158 
12159    /* check access control list */
12160    if (n_allowed_hosts > 0) {
12161       int allowed = FALSE;
12162       struct hostent *remote_phe;
12163       char hname[256];
12164       struct in_addr remote_addr;
12165 
12166       /* save remote host address */
12167       memcpy(&remote_addr, &(acc_addr.sin_addr), sizeof(remote_addr));
12168 
12169       remote_phe = gethostbyaddr((char *) &remote_addr, 4, PF_INET);
12170 
12171       if (remote_phe == NULL) {
12172          /* use IP number instead */
12173          strlcpy(hname, (char *)inet_ntoa(remote_addr), sizeof(hname));
12174       } else
12175          strlcpy(hname, remote_phe->h_name, sizeof(hname));
12176 
12177       /* always permit localhost */
12178       if (strcmp(hname, "localhost.localdomain") == 0)
12179          allowed = TRUE;
12180       if (strcmp(hname, "localhost") == 0)
12181          allowed = TRUE;
12182 
12183       if (!allowed) {
12184          for (i=0 ; i<n_allowed_hosts ; i++)
12185             if (strcmp(hname, allowed_host[i]) == 0) {
12186                allowed = TRUE;
12187                break;
12188             }
12189       }
12190 
12191       if (!allowed) {
12192          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_accept", "rejecting connection from unallowed host \'%s\'", hname);
12193          closesocket(sock);
12194          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12195       }
12196    }
12197 
12198    /* receive string with timeout */
12199    i = recv_string(sock, net_buffer, 256, 10000);
12200    rpc_debug_printf("Received command: %s", net_buffer);
12201 
12202    if (i > 0) {
12203       command = (char) toupper(net_buffer[0]);
12204 
12205       switch (command) {
12206       case 'S':
12207 
12208          /*----------- shutdown listener ----------------------*/
12209          closesocket(sock);
12210          return RPC_SHUTDOWN;
12211 
12212       case 'I':
12213 
12214          /*----------- return available experiments -----------*/
12215          cm_scan_experiments();
12216          for (i = 0; i < MAX_EXPERIMENT && exptab[i].name[0]; i++) {
12217             rpc_debug_printf("Return experiment: %s", exptab[i].name);
12218             sprintf(str, "%s", exptab[i].name);
12219             send(sock, str, strlen(str) + 1, 0);
12220          }
12221          send(sock, "", 1, 0);
12222          closesocket(sock);
12223          break;
12224 
12225       case 'C':
12226 
12227          /*----------- connect to experiment -----------*/
12228 
12229          /* get callback information */
12230          callback.experiment[0] = 0;
12231          port1 = port2 = version[0] = 0;
12232 
12233          //printf("net buffer \'%s\'\n", net_buffer);
12234 
12235          /* parse string in format "C port1 port2 port3 version expt" */
12236          /* example: C 51046 45838 56832 2.0.0 alpha */
12237 
12238          port1 = strtoul(net_buffer + 2, &ptr, 0);
12239          port2 = strtoul(ptr, &ptr, 0);
12240          port3 = strtoul(ptr, &ptr, 0);
12241 
12242          while (*ptr == ' ')
12243             ptr++;
12244 
12245          i = 0;
12246          for (; *ptr != 0 && *ptr != ' ' && i < (int) sizeof(version) - 1;)
12247             version[i++] = *ptr++;
12248 
12249          // ensure that we do not overwrite buffer "version"
12250          assert(i < (int) sizeof(version));
12251          version[i] = 0;
12252 
12253          // skip wjatever is left from the "version" string
12254          for (; *ptr != 0 && *ptr != ' ';)
12255             ptr++;
12256 
12257          while (*ptr == ' ')
12258             ptr++;
12259 
12260          i = 0;
12261          for (; *ptr != 0 && *ptr != ' ' && *ptr != '\n' && *ptr != '\r' && i < (int) sizeof(experiment) - 1;)
12262             experiment[i++] = *ptr++;
12263 
12264          // ensure that we do not overwrite buffer "experiment"
12265          assert(i < (int) sizeof(experiment));
12266          experiment[i] = 0;
12267 
12268          strlcpy(callback.experiment, experiment, NAME_LENGTH);
12269 
12270          /* print warning if version patch level doesn't agree */
12271          strlcpy(v1, version, sizeof(v1));
12272          if (strchr(v1, '.'))
12273             if (strchr(strchr(v1, '.') + 1, '.'))
12274                *strchr(strchr(v1, '.') + 1, '.') = 0;
12275 
12276          strlcpy(str, cm_get_version(), sizeof(str));
12277          if (strchr(str, '.'))
12278             if (strchr(strchr(str, '.') + 1, '.'))
12279                *strchr(strchr(str, '.') + 1, '.') = 0;
12280 
12281          if (strcmp(v1, str) != 0) {
12282             sprintf(str, "client MIDAS version %s differs from local version %s", version, cm_get_version());
12283             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_accept", str);
12284 
12285             sprintf(str, "received string: %s", net_buffer + 2);
12286             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_accept", str);
12287          }
12288 
12289          callback.host_port1 = (short) port1;
12290          callback.host_port2 = (short) port2;
12291          callback.host_port3 = (short) port3;
12292          callback.debug = _debug_mode;
12293 
12294          /* get the name of the remote host */
12295 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
12296          {
12297             INT status;
12298             status = hostGetByAddr(acc_addr.sin_addr.s_addr, callback.host_name);
12299             if (status != 0) {
12300                cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_accept", "cannot get host name for IP address");
12301                break;
12302             }
12303          }
12304 #else
12305          phe = gethostbyaddr((char *) &acc_addr.sin_addr, 4, PF_INET);
12306          if (phe == NULL) {
12307             /* use IP number instead */
12308             strlcpy(callback.host_name, (char *) inet_ntoa(acc_addr.sin_addr), HOST_NAME_LENGTH);
12309          } else
12310             strlcpy(callback.host_name, phe->h_name, HOST_NAME_LENGTH);
12311 #endif
12312 
12313          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_MPROCESS) {
12314             /* update experiment definition */
12315             cm_scan_experiments();
12316 
12317             /* lookup experiment */
12318             if (equal_ustring(callback.experiment, "Default"))
12319                idx = 0;
12320             else
12321                for (idx = 0; idx < MAX_EXPERIMENT && exptab[idx].name[0]; idx++)
12322                   if (equal_ustring(callback.experiment, exptab[idx].name))
12323                      break;
12324 
12325             if (idx == MAX_EXPERIMENT || exptab[idx].name[0] == 0) {
12326                sprintf(str, "experiment \'%s\' not defined in exptab\r", callback.experiment);
12327                cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_accept", str);
12328 
12329                send(sock, "2", 2, 0);   /* 2 means exp. not found */
12330                closesocket(sock);
12331                break;
12332             }
12333 
12334             strlcpy(callback.directory, exptab[idx].directory, MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
12335             strlcpy(callback.user, exptab[idx].user, NAME_LENGTH);
12336 
12337             /* create a new process */
12338             sprintf(host_port1_str, "%d", callback.host_port1);
12339             sprintf(host_port2_str, "%d", callback.host_port2);
12340             sprintf(host_port3_str, "%d", callback.host_port3);
12341             sprintf(debug_str, "%d", callback.debug);
12342 
12343             argv[0] = (char *) rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_NAME);
12344             argv[1] = callback.host_name;
12345             argv[2] = host_port1_str;
12346             argv[3] = host_port2_str;
12347             argv[4] = host_port3_str;
12348             argv[5] = debug_str;
12349             argv[6] = callback.experiment;
12350             argv[7] = callback.directory;
12351             argv[8] = callback.user;
12352             argv[9] = NULL;
12353 
12354             rpc_debug_printf("Spawn: %s %s %s %s %s %s %s %s %s %s",
12355                              argv[0], argv[1], argv[2], argv[3], argv[4], argv[5], argv[6], argv[7], argv[8],
12356                              argv[9]);
12357 
12358             status = ss_spawnv(P_NOWAIT, (char *) rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_NAME), argv);
12359 
12360             if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
12361                rpc_debug_printf("Cannot spawn subprocess: %s\n", strerror(errno));
12362 
12363                sprintf(str, "3");       /* 3 means cannot spawn subprocess */
12364                send(sock, str, strlen(str) + 1, 0);
12365                closesocket(sock);
12366                break;
12367             }
12368 
12369             sprintf(str, "1 %s", cm_get_version());     /* 1 means ok */
12370             send(sock, str, strlen(str) + 1, 0);
12371             closesocket(sock);
12372          } else {
12373             sprintf(str, "1 %s", cm_get_version());     /* 1 means ok */
12374             send(sock, str, strlen(str) + 1, 0);
12375             closesocket(sock);
12376          }
12377 
12378          /* look for next free entry */
12379          for (idx = 0; idx < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; idx++)
12380             if (_server_acception[idx].recv_sock == 0)
12381                break;
12382          if (idx == MAX_RPC_CONNECTION)
12383             return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12384          callback.index = idx;
12385 
12386         /*----- multi thread server ------------------------*/
12387          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_MTHREAD)
12388             ss_thread_create(rpc_server_thread, (void *) (&callback));
12389 
12390         /*----- single thread server -----------------------*/
12391          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE ||
12392              rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_REMOTE)
12393             rpc_server_callback(&callback);
12394 
12395          break;
12396 
12397       default:
12398          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_accept", "received unknown command '%c' code %d", command, command);
12399          closesocket(sock);
12400          break;
12401 
12402       }
12403    } else {                     /* if i>0 */
12404 
12405       /* lingering needed for PCTCP */
12406       ling.l_onoff = 1;
12407       ling.l_linger = 0;
12408       setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER, (char *) &ling, sizeof(ling));
12409       closesocket(sock);
12410    }
12411 
12412    return RPC_SUCCESS;
12413 }
12414 
12415 /********************************************************************/
12416 INT rpc_client_accept(int lsock)
12417 /********************************************************************\
12418 
12419   Routine: rpc_client_accept
12420 
12421   Purpose: Accept new incoming connections as a client
12422 
12423   Input:
12424     INT    lsock            Listen socket
12425 
12426   Output:
12427     none
12428 
12429   Function value:
12430     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
12431     RPC_NET_ERROR           Error in socket call
12432     RPC_CONNCLOSED          Connection was closed
12433     RPC_SHUTDOWN            Listener shutdown
12434     RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER       Not enough memory for network buffer
12435 
12436 \********************************************************************/
12437 {
12438    INT idx, i, version, status;
12439    unsigned int size;
12440    int sock;
12441    struct sockaddr_in acc_addr;
12442    INT client_hw_type = 0, hw_type;
12443    char str[100], client_program[NAME_LENGTH];
12444    char host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
12445    INT convert_flags;
12446    char net_buffer[256], *p;
12447 
12448    size = sizeof(acc_addr);
12449 #ifdef OS_WINNT
12450    sock = accept(lsock, (struct sockaddr *) &acc_addr, (int *) &size);
12451 #else
12452    sock = accept(lsock, (struct sockaddr *) &acc_addr, &size);
12453 #endif
12454 
12455    if (sock == -1)
12456       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12457 
12458    /* get the name of the calling host */
12459 /* outcommented for speed reasons SR 7.10.98
12460 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
12461   {
12462   status = hostGetByAddr(acc_addr.sin_addr.s_addr, host_name);
12463   if (status != 0)
12464     strcpy(host_name, "unknown");
12465   }
12466 #else
12467   phe = gethostbyaddr((char *) &acc_addr.sin_addr, 4, PF_INET);
12468   if (phe == NULL)
12469     strcpy(host_name, "unknown");
12470   strcpy(host_name, phe->h_name);
12471 #endif
12472 */
12473    strcpy(host_name, "(unknown)");
12474 
12475    strcpy(client_program, "(unknown)");
12476 
12477    /* look for next free entry */
12478    for (idx = 0; idx < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; idx++)
12479       if (_server_acception[idx].recv_sock == 0)
12480          break;
12481    if (idx == MAX_RPC_CONNECTION) {
12482       closesocket(sock);
12483       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12484    }
12485 
12486    /* receive string with timeout */
12487    i = recv_string(sock, net_buffer, sizeof(net_buffer), 10000);
12488    if (i <= 0) {
12489       closesocket(sock);
12490       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12491    }
12492 
12493    /* get remote computer info */
12494    p = strtok(net_buffer, " ");
12495    if (p != NULL) {
12496       client_hw_type = atoi(p);
12497       p = strtok(NULL, " ");
12498    }
12499    if (p != NULL) {
12500       version = atoi(p);
12501       p = strtok(NULL, " ");
12502    }
12503    if (p != NULL) {
12504       strlcpy(client_program, p, sizeof(client_program));
12505       p = strtok(NULL, " ");
12506    }
12507    if (p != NULL) {
12508       strlcpy(host_name, p, sizeof(host_name));
12509       p = strtok(NULL, " ");
12510    }
12511 
12512    if (0)
12513       printf("rpc_client_accept: client_hw_type %d, version %d, client_name \'%s\', hostname \'%s\'\n",
12514              client_hw_type, version, client_program, host_name);
12515 
12516    /* save information in _server_acception structure */
12517    _server_acception[idx].recv_sock = sock;
12518    _server_acception[idx].send_sock = 0;
12519    _server_acception[idx].event_sock = 0;
12520    _server_acception[idx].remote_hw_type = client_hw_type;
12521    strcpy(_server_acception[idx].host_name, host_name);
12522    strcpy(_server_acception[idx].prog_name, client_program);
12523    _server_acception[idx].tid = ss_gettid();
12524    _server_acception[idx].last_activity = ss_millitime();
12525    _server_acception[idx].watchdog_timeout = 0;
12526 
12527    /* send my own computer id */
12528    hw_type = rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE);
12529    sprintf(str, "%d %s", hw_type, cm_get_version());
12530    status = send(sock, str, strlen(str) + 1, 0);
12531    if (status != (INT) strlen(str) + 1)
12532       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12533 
12534    rpc_set_server_acception(idx + 1);
12535    rpc_calc_convert_flags(hw_type, client_hw_type, &convert_flags);
12536    rpc_set_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS, convert_flags);
12537 
12538    /* set callback function for ss_suspend */
12539    ss_suspend_set_dispatch(CH_SERVER, _server_acception, (int (*)(void)) rpc_server_receive);
12540 
12541    return RPC_SUCCESS;
12542 }
12543 
12544 /********************************************************************/
12545 INT rpc_server_callback(struct callback_addr * pcallback)
12546 /********************************************************************\
12547 
12548   Routine: rpc_server_callback
12549 
12550   Purpose: Callback a remote client. Setup _server_acception entry
12551            with optional conversion flags and establish two-way
12552            TCP connection.
12553 
12554   Input:
12555     callback_addr pcallback Pointer to a callback structure
12556 
12557   Output:
12558     none
12559 
12560   Function value:
12561     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
12562 
12563 \********************************************************************/
12564 {
12565    INT idx, status;
12566    int recv_sock, send_sock, event_sock;
12567    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
12568    struct hostent *phe;
12569    char str[100], client_program[NAME_LENGTH];
12570    char host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
12571    INT client_hw_type, hw_type;
12572    INT convert_flags;
12573    char net_buffer[256];
12574    struct callback_addr callback;
12575    char *p;
12576    int flag;
12577 
12578    /* copy callback information */
12579    memcpy(&callback, pcallback, sizeof(callback));
12580    idx = callback.index;
12581 
12582    /* create new sockets for TCP */
12583    recv_sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
12584    send_sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
12585    event_sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
12586    if (event_sock == -1)
12587       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12588 
12589    /* callback to remote node */
12590    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
12591    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
12592    bind_addr.sin_port = htons(callback.host_port1);
12593 
12594 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
12595    {
12596       INT host_addr;
12597 
12598       host_addr = hostGetByName(callback.host_name);
12599       memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), &host_addr, 4);
12600    }
12601 #else
12602    phe = gethostbyname(callback.host_name);
12603    if (phe == NULL) {
12604       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_callback", "cannot lookup host name \'%s\'", callback.host_name);
12605       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12606    }
12607    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
12608 #endif
12609 
12610    /* connect receive socket */
12611 #ifdef OS_UNIX
12612    do {
12613       status = connect(recv_sock, (void *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
12614 
12615       /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
12616    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
12617 #else
12618    status = connect(recv_sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
12619 #endif
12620 
12621    if (status != 0) {
12622       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_callback", "cannot connect receive socket");
12623       goto error;
12624    }
12625 
12626    bind_addr.sin_port = htons(callback.host_port2);
12627 
12628    /* connect send socket */
12629 #ifdef OS_UNIX
12630    do {
12631       status = connect(send_sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
12632 
12633       /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
12634    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
12635 #else
12636    status = connect(send_sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
12637 #endif
12638 
12639    if (status != 0) {
12640       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_callback", "cannot connect send socket");
12641       goto error;
12642    }
12643 
12644    bind_addr.sin_port = htons(callback.host_port3);
12645 
12646    /* connect event socket */
12647 #ifdef OS_UNIX
12648    do {
12649       status = connect(event_sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
12650 
12651       /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
12652    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
12653 #else
12654    status = connect(event_sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
12655 #endif
12656 
12657    if (status != 0) {
12658       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_callback", "cannot connect event socket");
12659       goto error;
12660    }
12661 #ifndef OS_ULTRIX               /* crashes ULTRIX... */
12662    /* increase send buffer size to 2 Mbytes, on Linux also limited by sysctl net.ipv4.tcp_rmem and net.ipv4.tcp_wmem */
12663    flag = 2 * 1024 * 1024;
12664    status = setsockopt(event_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (char *) &flag, sizeof(INT));
12665    if (status != 0)
12666       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_callback", "cannot setsockopt(SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF), errno %d (%s)", errno,
12667              strerror(errno));
12668 #endif
12669 
12670    if (recv_string(recv_sock, net_buffer, 256, _rpc_connect_timeout) <= 0) {
12671       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_callback", "timeout on receive remote computer info");
12672       goto error;
12673    }
12674    //printf("rpc_server_callback: \'%s\'\n", net_buffer);
12675 
12676    /* get remote computer info */
12677    client_hw_type = strtoul(net_buffer, &p, 0);
12678 
12679    while (*p == ' ')
12680       p++;
12681 
12682    strlcpy(client_program, p, sizeof(client_program));
12683 
12684    //printf("hw type %d, name \'%s\'\n", client_hw_type, client_program);
12685 
12686    /* get the name of the remote host */
12687 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
12688    status = hostGetByAddr(bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr, host_name);
12689    if (status != 0)
12690       strcpy(host_name, "unknown");
12691 #else
12692    phe = gethostbyaddr((char *) &bind_addr.sin_addr, 4, PF_INET);
12693    if (phe == NULL)
12694       strcpy(host_name, "unknown");
12695    else
12696       strcpy(host_name, phe->h_name);
12697 #endif
12698 
12699    /* save information in _server_acception structure */
12700    _server_acception[idx].recv_sock = recv_sock;
12701    _server_acception[idx].send_sock = send_sock;
12702    _server_acception[idx].event_sock = event_sock;
12703    _server_acception[idx].remote_hw_type = client_hw_type;
12704    strcpy(_server_acception[idx].host_name, host_name);
12705    strcpy(_server_acception[idx].prog_name, client_program);
12706    _server_acception[idx].tid = ss_gettid();
12707    _server_acception[idx].last_activity = ss_millitime();
12708    _server_acception[idx].watchdog_timeout = 0;
12709 
12710    /* send my own computer id */
12711    hw_type = rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE);
12712    sprintf(str, "%d", hw_type);
12713    send(recv_sock, str, strlen(str) + 1, 0);
12714 
12715    rpc_set_server_acception(idx + 1);
12716    rpc_calc_convert_flags(hw_type, client_hw_type, &convert_flags);
12717    rpc_set_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS, convert_flags);
12718 
12719    /* set callback function for ss_suspend */
12720    ss_suspend_set_dispatch(CH_SERVER, _server_acception, (int (*)(void)) rpc_server_receive);
12721 
12722    if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
12723       rpc_debug_printf("Connection to %s:%s established\n",
12724                        _server_acception[idx].host_name, _server_acception[idx].prog_name);
12725 
12726    return RPC_SUCCESS;
12727 
12728  error:
12729 
12730    closesocket(recv_sock);
12731    closesocket(send_sock);
12732    closesocket(event_sock);
12733 
12734    return RPC_NET_ERROR;
12735 }
12736 
12737 
12738 /********************************************************************/
12739 INT rpc_server_thread(void *pointer)
12740 /********************************************************************\
12741 
12742   Routine: rpc_server_thread
12743 
12744   Purpose: New thread for a multi-threaded server. Callback to the
12745            client and process RPC requests.
12746 
12747   Input:
