12748     vcoid  pointer          pointer to callback_addr structure.
12749 
12750   Output:
12751     none
12752 
12753   Function value:
12754     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
12755 
12756 \********************************************************************/
12757 {
12758    struct callback_addr callback;
12759    int status, semaphore_alarm, semaphore_elog, semaphore_history, semaphore_msg;
12760    static DWORD last_checked = 0;
12761 
12762    memcpy(&callback, pointer, sizeof(callback));
12763 
12764    status = rpc_server_callback(&callback);
12765 
12766    if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
12767       return status;
12768 
12769    /* create alarm and elog semaphores */
12770    ss_semaphore_create("ALARM", &semaphore_alarm);
12771    ss_semaphore_create("ELOG", &semaphore_elog);
12772    ss_semaphore_create("HISTORY", &semaphore_history);
12773    ss_semaphore_create("MSG", &semaphore_msg);
12774    cm_set_experiment_semaphore(semaphore_alarm, semaphore_elog, semaphore_history, semaphore_msg);
12775 
12776    do {
12777       status = ss_suspend(5000, 0);
12778 
12779       if (rpc_check_channels() == RPC_NET_ERROR)
12780          break;
12781 
12782       /* check alarms every 10 seconds */
12783       if (!rpc_is_remote() && ss_time() - last_checked > 10) {
12784          al_check();
12785          last_checked = ss_time();
12786       }
12787 
12788       cm_msg_flush_buffer();
12789 
12790    } while (status != SS_ABORT && status != SS_EXIT);
12791 
12792    /* delete entry in suspend table for this thread */
12793    ss_suspend_exit();
12794 
12795    return RPC_SUCCESS;
12796 }
12797 
12798 
12799 /********************************************************************/
12800 INT rpc_server_receive(INT idx, int sock, BOOL check)
12801 /********************************************************************\
12802 
12803   Routine: rpc_server_receive
12804 
12805   Purpose: Receive rpc commands and execute them. Close the connection
12806            if client has broken TCP pipe.
12807 
12808   Input:
12809     INT    idx              Index to _server_acception structure in-
12810                             dicating which connection got data.
12811     int    sock             Socket which got data
12812     BOOL   check            If TRUE, only check if connection is
12813                             broken. This may be called via
12814                             bm_receive_event/ss_suspend(..,MSG_BM)
12815 
12816   Output:
12817     none
12818 
12819   Function value:
12820     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
12821     RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER       Not enough memeory to allocate buffer
12822     SS_EXIT                 Server connection was closed
12823     SS_ABORT                Server connection was broken
12824 
12825 \********************************************************************/
12826 {
12827    INT status, n_received;
12828    INT remaining, *pbh, start_time;
12829    char test_buffer[256], str[80];
12830    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
12831 
12832    /* init network buffer */
12833    if (_net_recv_buffer_size == 0) {
12834       int size = MAX_EVENT_SIZE + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + 1024;
12835       _net_recv_buffer = (char *) M_MALLOC(size);
12836       if (_net_recv_buffer == NULL) {
12837          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_receive", "Cannot allocate %d bytes for network buffer", size);
12838          return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
12839       }
12840       _net_recv_buffer_size = size;
12841       _net_recv_buffer_size_odb = 0;
12842       //printf("allocated _net_recv_buffer size %d\n", _net_recv_buffer_size);
12843    }
12844 
12845    /* init network buffer */
12846    if (_net_recv_buffer_size_odb == 0) {
12847       HNDLE hDB;
12848       int size;
12849       int max_event_size = MAX_EVENT_SIZE;
12850 
12851       /* get max event size from ODB */
12852       status = cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
12853       assert(status == CM_SUCCESS);
12854 
12855       if (hDB) {
12856          size = sizeof(INT);
12857          status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/MAX_EVENT_SIZE", &max_event_size, &size, TID_DWORD, TRUE);
12858 
12859          size = max_event_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + 1024;
12860 
12861          _net_recv_buffer_size_odb = size;
12862 
12863          if (size > _net_recv_buffer_size) {
12864             _net_recv_buffer = (char *) realloc(_net_recv_buffer, size);
12865             if (_net_recv_buffer == NULL) {
12866                cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_receive", "Cannot allocate %d bytes for network buffer", size);
12867                return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
12868             }
12869             _net_recv_buffer_size = size;
12870             //printf("allocated _net_recv_buffer size %d\n", _net_recv_buffer_size);
12871          }
12872       }
12873    }
12874 
12875    /* only check if TCP connection is broken */
12876    if (check) {
12877 #ifdef OS_WINNT
12878       n_received = recv(sock, test_buffer, sizeof(test_buffer), MSG_PEEK);
12879 #else
12880       n_received = recv(sock, test_buffer, sizeof(test_buffer), MSG_PEEK|MSG_DONTWAIT);
12881 
12882       /* check if we caught a signal */
12883       if ((n_received == -1) && (errno == EAGAIN))
12884          return SS_SUCCESS;
12885 #endif
12886 
12887       if (n_received == -1)
12888          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_receive",
12889                 "recv(%d,MSG_PEEK) returned %d, errno: %d (%s)", sizeof(test_buffer),
12890                 n_received, errno, strerror(errno));
12891 
12892       if (n_received <= 0)
12893          return SS_ABORT;
12894 
12895       return SS_SUCCESS;
12896    }
12897 
12898    remaining = 0;
12899 
12900    /* receive command */
12901    if (sock == _server_acception[idx].recv_sock) {
12902       do {
12903          if (_server_acception[idx].remote_hw_type == DR_ASCII)
12904             n_received =
12905                 recv_string(_server_acception[idx].recv_sock, _net_recv_buffer, _net_recv_buffer_size, 10000);
12906          else
12907             n_received = recv_tcp_server(idx, _net_recv_buffer, _net_recv_buffer_size, 0, &remaining);
12908 
12909          if (n_received <= 0) {
12910             status = SS_ABORT;
12911             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_receive", "recv_tcp_server() returned %d, abort", n_received);
12912             goto error;
12913          }
12914 
12915          rpc_set_server_acception(idx + 1);
12916 
12917          if (_server_acception[idx].remote_hw_type == DR_ASCII)
12918             status = rpc_execute_ascii(_server_acception[idx].recv_sock, _net_recv_buffer);
12919          else
12920             status = rpc_execute(_server_acception[idx].recv_sock,
12921                                  _net_recv_buffer, _server_acception[idx].convert_flags);
12922 
12923          if (status == SS_ABORT) {
12924             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_receive", "rpc_execute() returned %d, abort", status);
12925             goto error;
12926          }
12927 
12928          if (status == SS_EXIT || status == RPC_SHUTDOWN) {
12929             if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
12930                rpc_debug_printf("Connection to %s:%s closed\n",
12931                                 _server_acception[idx].host_name, _server_acception[idx].prog_name);
12932             goto exit;
12933          }
12934 
12935       } while (remaining);
12936    } else {
12937       /* receive event */
12938       if (sock == _server_acception[idx].event_sock) {
12939          start_time = ss_millitime();
12940 
12941          do {
12942             n_received = recv_event_server(idx, _net_recv_buffer, _net_recv_buffer_size, 0, &remaining);
12943 
12944             if (n_received <= 0) {
12945                status = SS_ABORT;
12946                cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_receive", "recv_event_server() returned %d, abort", n_received);
12947                goto error;
12948             }
12949 
12950             /* send event to buffer */
12951             pbh = (INT *) _net_recv_buffer;
12952             pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pbh + 1);
12953 
12954             status = bm_send_event(*pbh, pevent, pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
12955             if (status != BM_SUCCESS)
12956                cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_server_receive", "bm_send_event() returned %d", status);
12957 
12958             /* repeat for maximum 0.5 sec */
12959          } while (ss_millitime() - start_time < 500 && remaining);
12960       }
12961    }
12962 
12963    return RPC_SUCCESS;
12964 
12965  error:
12966 
12967    strlcpy(str, _server_acception[idx].host_name, sizeof(str));
12968    if (strchr(str, '.'))
12969       *strchr(str, '.') = 0;
12970    cm_msg(MTALK, "rpc_server_receive", "Program \'%s\' on host \'%s\' aborted",
12971           _server_acception[idx].prog_name, str);
12972 
12973  exit:
12974 
12975    /* disconnect from experiment as MIDAS server */
12976    if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE) {
12977       HNDLE hDB, hKey;
12978 
12979       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
12980 
12981       /* only disconnect from experiment if previously connected.
12982          Necessary for pure RPC servers (RPC_SRVR) */
12983       if (hDB) {
12984 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
12985          ss_alarm(0, cm_watchdog);
12986 #endif
12987 
12988          bm_close_all_buffers();
12989          cm_delete_client_info(hDB, 0);
12990          db_close_all_databases();
12991 
12992          rpc_deregister_functions();
12993 
12994          cm_set_experiment_database(0, 0);
12995 
12996          if (_msg_mutex)
12997             ss_mutex_delete(_msg_mutex);
12998          _msg_mutex = 0;
12999 
13000          if (_msg_rb)
13001             rb_delete(_msg_rb);
13002          _msg_rb = 0;
13003 
13004          _msg_buffer = 0;
13005       }
13006    }
13007 
13008    /* close server connection */
13009    if (_server_acception[idx].recv_sock)
13010       closesocket(_server_acception[idx].recv_sock);
13011    if (_server_acception[idx].send_sock)
13012       closesocket(_server_acception[idx].send_sock);
13013    if (_server_acception[idx].event_sock)
13014       closesocket(_server_acception[idx].event_sock);
13015 
13016    /* free TCP cache */
13017    M_FREE(_server_acception[idx].net_buffer);
13018    _server_acception[idx].net_buffer = NULL;
13019 
13020    /* mark this entry as invalid */
13021    memset(&_server_acception[idx], 0, sizeof(RPC_SERVER_ACCEPTION));
13022 
13023    /* signal caller a shutdonw */
13024    if (status == RPC_SHUTDOWN)
13025       return status;
13026 
13027    /* don't abort if other than main connection is broken */
13028    if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_REMOTE)
13029       return SS_SUCCESS;
13030 
13031    return status;
13032 }
13033 
13034 
13035 /********************************************************************/
13036 INT rpc_server_shutdown(void)
13037 /********************************************************************\
13038 
13039   Routine: rpc_server_shutdown
13040 
13041   Purpose: Shutdown RPC server, abort all connections
13042 
13043   Input:
13044     none
13045 
13046   Output:
13047     none
13048 
13049   Function value:
13050     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
13051 
13052 \********************************************************************/
13053 {
13054    INT i;
13055    struct linger ling;
13056 
13057    /* close all open connections */
13058    for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++)
13059       if (_server_acception[i].recv_sock != 0) {
13060          /* lingering needed for PCTCP */
13061          ling.l_onoff = 1;
13062          ling.l_linger = 0;
13063          setsockopt(_server_acception[i].recv_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER, (char *) &ling, sizeof(ling));
13064          closesocket(_server_acception[i].recv_sock);
13065 
13066          if (_server_acception[i].send_sock) {
13067             setsockopt(_server_acception[i].send_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER, (char *) &ling, sizeof(ling));
13068             closesocket(_server_acception[i].send_sock);
13069          }
13070 
13071          if (_server_acception[i].event_sock) {
13072             setsockopt(_server_acception[i].event_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER, (char *) &ling, sizeof(ling));
13073             closesocket(_server_acception[i].event_sock);
13074          }
13075 
13076          _server_acception[i].recv_sock = 0;
13077          _server_acception[i].send_sock = 0;
13078          _server_acception[i].event_sock = 0;
13079       }
13080 
13081    if (_lsock) {
13082       closesocket(_lsock);
13083       _lsock = 0;
13084       _server_registered = FALSE;
13085    }
13086 
13087    /* free suspend structures */
13088    ss_suspend_exit();
13089 
13090    return RPC_SUCCESS;
13091 }
13092 
13093 
13094 /********************************************************************/
13095 INT rpc_check_channels(void)
13096 /********************************************************************\
13097 
13098   Routine: rpc_check_channels
13099 
13100   Purpose: Check open rpc channels by sending watchdog messages
13101 
13102   Input:
13103     none
13104 
13105   Output:
13106     none
13107 
13108   Function value:
13109     RPC_SUCCESS             Channel is still alive
13110     RPC_NET_ERROR           Connection is broken
13111 
13112 \********************************************************************/
13113 {
13114    INT status, idx, i, convert_flags;
13115    NET_COMMAND nc;
13116    fd_set readfds;
13117    struct timeval timeout;
13118 
13119    for (idx = 0; idx < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; idx++) {
13120       if (_server_acception[idx].recv_sock &&
13121           _server_acception[idx].tid == ss_gettid() &&
13122           _server_acception[idx].watchdog_timeout &&
13123           (ss_millitime() - _server_acception[idx].last_activity >
13124            (DWORD) _server_acception[idx].watchdog_timeout)) {
13125 /* printf("Send watchdog message to %s on %s\n",
13126                 _server_acception[idx].prog_name,
13127                 _server_acception[idx].host_name); */
13128 
13129          /* send a watchdog message */
13130          nc.header.routine_id = MSG_WATCHDOG;
13131          nc.header.param_size = 0;
13132 
13133          convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
13134          if (convert_flags) {
13135             rpc_convert_single(&nc.header.routine_id, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
13136             rpc_convert_single(&nc.header.param_size, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
13137          }
13138 
13139          /* send the header to the client */
13140          i = send_tcp(_server_acception[idx].send_sock, (char *) &nc, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), 0);
13141 
13142          if (i < 0)
13143             goto exit;
13144 
13145          /* make some timeout checking */
13146          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
13147          FD_SET(_server_acception[idx].send_sock, &readfds);
13148          FD_SET(_server_acception[idx].recv_sock, &readfds);
13149 
13150          timeout.tv_sec = _server_acception[idx].watchdog_timeout / 1000;
13151          timeout.tv_usec = (_server_acception[idx].watchdog_timeout % 1000) * 1000;
13152 
13153          do {
13154             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
13155 
13156             /* if an alarm signal was cought, restart select with reduced timeout */
13157             if (status == -1 && timeout.tv_sec >= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000)
13158                timeout.tv_sec -= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000;
13159 
13160          } while (status == -1);        /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
13161 
13162          if (!FD_ISSET(_server_acception[idx].send_sock, &readfds) &&
13163              !FD_ISSET(_server_acception[idx].recv_sock, &readfds))
13164             goto exit;
13165 
13166          /* receive result on send socket */
13167          if (FD_ISSET(_server_acception[idx].send_sock, &readfds)) {
13168             i = recv_tcp(_server_acception[idx].send_sock, (char *) &nc, sizeof(nc), 0);
13169             if (i <= 0)
13170                goto exit;
13171          }
13172       }
13173    }
13174 
13175    return RPC_SUCCESS;
13176 
13177  exit:
13178 
13179    cm_msg(MINFO, "rpc_check_channels", "client [%s]%s failed watchdog test after %d sec",
13180           _server_acception[idx].host_name,
13181           _server_acception[idx].prog_name, _server_acception[idx].watchdog_timeout / 1000);
13182 
13183    /* disconnect from experiment */
13184    if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
13185       cm_disconnect_experiment();
13186 
13187    /* close server connection */
13188    if (_server_acception[idx].recv_sock)
13189       closesocket(_server_acception[idx].recv_sock);
13190    if (_server_acception[idx].send_sock)
13191       closesocket(_server_acception[idx].send_sock);
13192    if (_server_acception[idx].event_sock)
13193       closesocket(_server_acception[idx].event_sock);
13194 
13195    /* free TCP cache */
13196    M_FREE(_server_acception[idx].net_buffer);
13197    _server_acception[idx].net_buffer = NULL;
13198 
13199    /* mark this entry as invalid */
13200    memset(&_server_acception[idx], 0, sizeof(RPC_SERVER_ACCEPTION));
13201 
13202    return RPC_NET_ERROR;
13203 }
13204 
13205 /**dox***************************************************************/
13206 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
13207 
13208 /**dox***************************************************************/
13209                                                                                                                                /** @} *//* end of rpcfunctionc */
13210 
13211 /**dox***************************************************************/
13212 /** @addtogroup bkfunctionc
13213  *
13214  *  @{  */
13215 
13216 /********************************************************************\
13217 *                                                                    *
13218 *                 Bank functions                                     *
13219 *                                                                    *
13220 \********************************************************************/
13221 
13222 /********************************************************************/
13223 /**
13224 Initializes an event for Midas banks structure.
13225 Before banks can be created in an event, bk_init() has to be called first.
13226 @param event pointer to the area of event
13227 */
13228 void bk_init(void *event)
13229 {
13230    ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size = 0;
13231    ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->flags = BANK_FORMAT_VERSION;
13232 }
13233 
13234 /**dox***************************************************************/
13235 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
13236 
13237 /********************************************************************/
13238 BOOL bk_is32(void *event)
13239 /********************************************************************\
13240 
13241   Routine: bk_is32
13242 
13243   Purpose: Return true if banks inside event are 32-bit banks
13244 
13245   Input:
13246     void   *event           pointer to the event
13247 
13248   Output:
13249     none
13250 
13251   Function value:
13252     none
13253 
13254 \********************************************************************/
13255 {
13256    return ((((BANK_HEADER *) event)->flags & BANK_FORMAT_32BIT) > 0);
13257 }
13258 
13259 /**dox***************************************************************/
13260 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
13261 
13262 /********************************************************************/
13263 /**
13264 Initializes an event for Midas banks structure for large bank size (> 32KBytes)
13265 Before banks can be created in an event, bk_init32() has to be called first.
13266 @param event pointer to the area of event
13267 @return void
13268 */
13269 void bk_init32(void *event)
13270 {
13271    ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size = 0;
13272    ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->flags = BANK_FORMAT_VERSION | BANK_FORMAT_32BIT;
13273 }
13274 
13275 /********************************************************************/
13276 /**
13277 Returns the size of an event containing banks.
13278 The total size of an event is the value returned by bk_size() plus the size
13279 of the event header (sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)).
13280 @param event pointer to the area of event
13281 @return number of bytes contained in data area of event
13282 */
13283 INT bk_size(void *event)
13284 {
13285    return ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size + sizeof(BANK_HEADER);
13286 }
13287 
13288 /********************************************************************/
13289 /**
13290 Create a Midas bank.
13291 The data pointer pdata must be used as an address to fill a
13292 bank. It is incremented with every value written to the bank and finally points
13293 to a location just after the last byte of the bank. It is then passed to
13294 the function bk_close() to finish the bank creation.
13295 \code
13296 INT *pdata;
13297 bk_init(pevent);
13298 bk_create(pevent, "ADC0", TID_INT, &pdata);
13299 *pdata++ = 123
13300 *pdata++ = 456
13301 bk_close(pevent, pdata);
13302 \endcode
13303 @param event pointer to the data area
13304 @param name of the bank, must be exactly 4 charaters
13305 @param type type of bank, one of the @ref Midas_Data_Types values defined in
13306 midas.h
13307 @param pdata pointer to the data area of the newly created bank
13308 @return void
13309 */
13310 void bk_create(void *event, const char *name, WORD type, void *pdata)
13311 {
13312    if (((BANK_HEADER *) event)->flags & BANK_FORMAT_32BIT) {
13313       BANK32 *pbk32;
13314 
13315       pbk32 = (BANK32 *) ((char *) (((BANK_HEADER *) event) + 1) + ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size);
13316       strncpy(pbk32->name, name, 4);
13317       pbk32->type = type;
13318       pbk32->data_size = 0;
13319       *((void **) pdata) = pbk32 + 1;
13320    } else {
13321       BANK *pbk;
13322 
13323       pbk = (BANK *) ((char *) (((BANK_HEADER *) event) + 1) + ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size);
13324       strncpy(pbk->name, name, 4);
13325       pbk->type = type;
13326       pbk->data_size = 0;
13327       *((void **) pdata) = pbk + 1;
13328    }
13329 }
13330 
13331 
13332 
13333 /**dox***************************************************************/
13334 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
13335 
13336 /********************************************************************/
13337 /**
13338 Copy a bank given by name if found from a buffer source to a destination buffer.
13339 @param * pevent pointing after the EVENT_HEADER (as in FE)
13340 @param * psrce  pointing to EVENT_HEADER in this case (for ebch[i].pfragment)
13341 @param bkname  Bank to be found and copied from psrce to pevent
13342 @return EB_SUCCESS if bank found, 0 if not found (pdest untouched)
13343 */
13344 INT bk_copy(char * pevent, char * psrce, const char * bkname) {
13345 
13346   INT status;
13347   DWORD bklen, bktype, bksze;
13348   BANK_HEADER * psBkh;
13349   BANK * psbkh;
13350   BANK32 *psbkh32;
13351   char * pdest;
13352   void * psdata;
13353 
13354   // source pointing on the BANKxx
13355   psBkh = (BANK_HEADER *) ((EVENT_HEADER *)psrce+1);
13356   // Find requested bank
13357   status = bk_find(psBkh, bkname, &bklen, &bktype, &psdata);
13358   // Return 0 if not found
13359   if (status != SUCCESS) return 0;
13360 
13361   // Check bank type...
13362   // You cannot mix BANK and BANK32 so make sure all the FE use either
13363   // bk_init(pevent) or bk_init32(pevent).
13364   if (bk_is32(psBkh)) {
13365 
13366     // pointer to the source bank header
13367     psbkh32 = ((BANK32 *)psdata -1);
13368     // Data size in the bank
13369     bksze = psbkh32->data_size;
13370 
13371     // Get to the end of the event
13372     pdest = (char *)(((BANK_HEADER *) pevent) + 1) + ((BANK_HEADER *)pevent)->data_size;
13373     // Copy from BANK32 to end of Data
13374     memcpy(pdest, (char *)psbkh32, ALIGN8(bksze) + sizeof(BANK32));
13375     // Bring pointer to the next free location
13376     pdest += ALIGN8(bksze) + sizeof(BANK32);
13377 
13378   } else {
13379 
13380     // pointer to the source bank header
13381     psbkh = ((BANK *)psdata -1);
13382     // Data size in the bank
13383     bksze = psbkh->data_size;
13384 
13385     // Get to the end of the event
13386     pdest = (char *)(((BANK_HEADER *) pevent) + 1) + ((BANK_HEADER *)pevent)->data_size;
13387     // Copy from BANK to end of Data
13388     memcpy(pdest, (char *)psbkh, ALIGN8(bksze) + sizeof(BANK));
13389     // Bring pointer to the next free location
13390     pdest += ALIGN8(bksze) + sizeof(BANK);
13391   }
13392 
13393   // Close bank (adjust BANK_HEADER size)
13394   bk_close(pevent, pdest);
13395   // Adjust EVENT_HEADER size
13396   ((EVENT_HEADER *)pevent-1)->data_size = ((BANK_HEADER *) pevent)->data_size + sizeof(BANK_HEADER);
13397   return SUCCESS;
13398 }
13399 
13400 /********************************************************************/
13401 int bk_delete(void *event, const char *name)
13402 /********************************************************************\
13403 
13404   Routine: bk_delete
13405 
13406   Purpose: Delete a MIDAS bank inside an event
13407 
13408   Input:
13409     void   *event           pointer to the event
13410     char   *name            Name of bank (exactly four letters)
13411 
13412   Function value:
13413     CM_SUCCESS              Bank has been deleted
13414     0                       Bank has not been found
13415 
13416 \********************************************************************/
13417 {
13418    BANK *pbk;
13419    BANK32 *pbk32;
13420    DWORD dname;
13421    int remaining;
13422 
13423    if (((BANK_HEADER *) event)->flags & BANK_FORMAT_32BIT) {
13424       /* locate bank */
13425       pbk32 = (BANK32 *) (((BANK_HEADER *) event) + 1);
13426       strncpy((char *) &dname, name, 4);
13427       do {
13428          if (*((DWORD *) pbk32->name) == dname) {
13429             /* bank found, delete it */
13430             remaining = ((char *) event + ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size +
13431                          sizeof(BANK_HEADER)) - ((char *) (pbk32 + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk32->data_size));
13432 
13433             /* reduce total event size */
13434             ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size -= sizeof(BANK32) + ALIGN8(pbk32->data_size);
13435 
13436             /* copy remaining bytes */
13437             if (remaining > 0)
13438                memcpy(pbk32, (char *) (pbk32 + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk32->data_size), remaining);
13439             return CM_SUCCESS;
13440          }
13441 
13442          pbk32 = (BANK32 *) ((char *) (pbk32 + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk32->data_size));
13443       } while ((DWORD) ((char *) pbk32 - (char *) event) <
13444                ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size + sizeof(BANK_HEADER));
13445    } else {
13446       /* locate bank */
13447       pbk = (BANK *) (((BANK_HEADER *) event) + 1);
13448       strncpy((char *) &dname, name, 4);
13449       do {
13450          if (*((DWORD *) pbk->name) == dname) {
13451             /* bank found, delete it */
13452             remaining = ((char *) event + ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size +
13453                          sizeof(BANK_HEADER)) - ((char *) (pbk + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk->data_size));
13454 
13455             /* reduce total event size */
13456             ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size -= sizeof(BANK) + ALIGN8(pbk->data_size);
13457 
13458             /* copy remaining bytes */
13459             if (remaining > 0)
13460                memcpy(pbk, (char *) (pbk + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk->data_size), remaining);
13461             return CM_SUCCESS;
13462          }
13463 
13464          pbk = (BANK *) ((char *) (pbk + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk->data_size));
13465       } while ((DWORD) ((char *) pbk - (char *) event) <
13466                ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size + sizeof(BANK_HEADER));
13467    }
13468 
13469    return 0;
13470 }
13471 
13472 /**dox***************************************************************/
13473 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
13474 
13475 /********************************************************************/
13476 /**
13477 Close the Midas bank priviously created by bk_create().
13478 The data pointer pdata must be obtained by bk_create() and
13479 used as an address to fill a bank. It is incremented with every value written
13480 to the bank and finally points to a location just after the last byte of the
13481 bank. It is then passed to bk_close() to finish the bank creation
13482 @param event pointer to current composed event
13483 @param pdata  pointer to the data
13484 @return number of bytes contained in bank
13485 */
13486 INT bk_close(void *event, void *pdata)
13487 {
13488    if (((BANK_HEADER *) event)->flags & BANK_FORMAT_32BIT) {
13489       BANK32 *pbk32;
13490 
13491       pbk32 = (BANK32 *) ((char *) (((BANK_HEADER *) event) + 1) + ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size);
13492       pbk32->data_size = (DWORD) ((char *) pdata - (char *) (pbk32 + 1));
13493       if (pbk32->type == TID_STRUCT && pbk32->data_size == 0)
13494          printf("Warning: bank %c%c%c%c has zero size\n",
13495                 pbk32->name[0], pbk32->name[1], pbk32->name[2], pbk32->name[3]);
13496       ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size += sizeof(BANK32) + ALIGN8(pbk32->data_size);
13497       return pbk32->data_size;
13498    } else {
13499       BANK *pbk;
13500 
13501       pbk = (BANK *) ((char *) (((BANK_HEADER *) event) + 1) + ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size);
13502       pbk->data_size = (WORD) ((char *) pdata - (char *) (pbk + 1));
13503       if (pbk->type == TID_STRUCT && pbk->data_size == 0)
13504          printf("Warning: bank %c%c%c%c has zero size\n", pbk->name[0], pbk->name[1], pbk->name[2],
13505                 pbk->name[3]);
13506       ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size += sizeof(BANK) + ALIGN8(pbk->data_size);
13507       return pbk->data_size;
13508    }
13509 }
13510 
13511 /********************************************************************/
13512 /**
13513 Extract the MIDAS bank name listing of an event.
13514 The bklist should be dimensioned with STRING_BANKLIST_MAX
13515 which corresponds to a max of BANKLIST_MAX banks (midas.h: 32 banks max).
13516 \code
13517 INT adc_calib(EVENT_HEADER *pheader, void *pevent)
13518 {
13519   INT    n_adc, nbanks;
13520   WORD   *pdata;
13521   char   banklist[STRING_BANKLIST_MAX];
13522 
13523   // Display # of banks and list of banks in the event
13524   nbanks = bk_list(pevent, banklist);
13525   printf("#banks:%d List:%s\n", nbanks, banklist);
13526 
13527   // look for ADC0 bank, return if not present
13528   n_adc = bk_locate(pevent, "ADC0", &pdata);
13529   ...
13530 }
13531 \endcode
13532 @param event pointer to current composed event
13533 @param bklist returned ASCII string, has to be booked with STRING_BANKLIST_MAX.
13534 @return number of bank found in this event.
13535 */
13536 INT bk_list(void *event, char *bklist)
13537 {                               /* Full event */
13538    INT nbk, size;
13539    BANK *pmbk = NULL;
13540    BANK32 *pmbk32 = NULL;
13541    char *pdata;
13542 
13543    /* compose bank list */
13544    bklist[0] = 0;
13545    nbk = 0;
13546    do {
13547       /* scan all banks for bank name only */
13548       if (bk_is32(event)) {
13549          size = bk_iterate32(event, &pmbk32, &pdata);
13550          if (pmbk32 == NULL)
13551             break;
13552       } else {
13553          size = bk_iterate(event, &pmbk, &pdata);
13554          if (pmbk == NULL)
13555             break;
13556       }
13557       nbk++;
13558 
13559       if (nbk > BANKLIST_MAX) {
13560          cm_msg(MINFO, "bk_list", "over %i banks -> truncated", BANKLIST_MAX);
13561          return (nbk - 1);
13562       }
13563       if (bk_is32(event))
13564          strncat(bklist, (char *) pmbk32->name, 4);
13565       else
13566          strncat(bklist, (char *) pmbk->name, 4);
13567    }
13568    while (1);
13569    return (nbk);
13570 }
13571 
13572 /********************************************************************/
13573 /**
13574 Locates a MIDAS bank of given name inside an event.
13575 @param event pointer to current composed event
13576 @param name bank name to look for
13577 @param pdata pointer to data area of bank, NULL if bank not found
13578 @return number of values inside the bank
13579 */
13580 INT bk_locate(void *event, const char *name, void *pdata)
13581 {
13582    BANK *pbk;
13583    BANK32 *pbk32;
13584    DWORD dname;
13585 
13586    if (bk_is32(event)) {
13587       pbk32 = (BANK32 *) (((BANK_HEADER *) event) + 1);
13588       strncpy((char *) &dname, name, 4);
13589       while ((DWORD) ((char *) pbk32 - (char *) event) <
13590              ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size + sizeof(BANK_HEADER)) {
13591          if (*((DWORD *) pbk32->name) == dname) {
13592             *((void **) pdata) = pbk32 + 1;
13593             if (tid_size[pbk32->type & 0xFF] == 0)
13594                return pbk32->data_size;
13595             return pbk32->data_size / tid_size[pbk32->type & 0xFF];
13596          }
13597          pbk32 = (BANK32 *) ((char *) (pbk32 + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk32->data_size));
13598       }
13599    } else {
13600       pbk = (BANK *) (((BANK_HEADER *) event) + 1);
13601       strncpy((char *) &dname, name, 4);
13602       while ((DWORD) ((char *) pbk - (char *) event) <
13603              ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size + sizeof(BANK_HEADER)) {
13604          if (*((DWORD *) pbk->name) == dname) {
13605             *((void **) pdata) = pbk + 1;
13606             if (tid_size[pbk->type & 0xFF] == 0)
13607                return pbk->data_size;
13608             return pbk->data_size / tid_size[pbk->type & 0xFF];
13609          }
13610          pbk = (BANK *) ((char *) (pbk + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk->data_size));
13611       }
13612 
13613    }
13614 
13615    /* bank not found */
13616    *((void **) pdata) = NULL;
13617    return 0;
13618 }
13619 
13620 /********************************************************************/
13621 /**
13622 Finds a MIDAS bank of given name inside an event.
13623 @param pbkh pointer to current composed event
13624 @param name bank name to look for
13625 @param bklen number of elemtents in bank
13626 @param bktype bank type, one of TID_xxx
13627 @param pdata pointer to data area of bank, NULL if bank not found
13628 @return 1 if bank found, 0 otherwise
13629 */
13630 INT bk_find(BANK_HEADER * pbkh, const char *name, DWORD * bklen, DWORD * bktype, void **pdata)
13631 {
13632    BANK *pbk;
13633    BANK32 *pbk32;
13634    DWORD dname;
13635 
13636    if (bk_is32(pbkh)) {
13637       pbk32 = (BANK32 *) (pbkh + 1);
13638       strncpy((char *) &dname, name, 4);
13639       do {
13640          if (*((DWORD *) pbk32->name) == dname) {
13641             *((void **) pdata) = pbk32 + 1;
13642             if (tid_size[pbk32->type & 0xFF] == 0)
13643                *bklen = pbk32->data_size;
13644             else
13645                *bklen = pbk32->data_size / tid_size[pbk32->type & 0xFF];
13646 
13647             *bktype = pbk32->type;
13648             return 1;
13649          }
13650          pbk32 = (BANK32 *) ((char *) (pbk32 + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk32->data_size));
13651       } while ((DWORD) ((char *) pbk32 - (char *) pbkh) < pbkh->data_size + sizeof(BANK_HEADER));
13652    } else {
13653       pbk = (BANK *) (pbkh + 1);
13654       strncpy((char *) &dname, name, 4);
13655       do {
13656          if (*((DWORD *) pbk->name) == dname) {
13657             *((void **) pdata) = pbk + 1;
13658             if (tid_size[pbk->type & 0xFF] == 0)
13659                *bklen = pbk->data_size;
13660             else
13661                *bklen = pbk->data_size / tid_size[pbk->type & 0xFF];
13662 
13663             *bktype = pbk->type;
13664             return 1;
13665          }
13666          pbk = (BANK *) ((char *) (pbk + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk->data_size));
13667       } while ((DWORD) ((char *) pbk - (char *) pbkh) < pbkh->data_size + sizeof(BANK_HEADER));
13668    }
13669 
13670    /* bank not found */
13671    *((void **) pdata) = NULL;
13672    return 0;
13673 }
13674 
13675 /********************************************************************/
13676 /**
13677 Iterates through banks inside an event.
13678 The function can be used to enumerate all banks of an event.
13679 The returned pointer to the bank header has following structure:
13680 \code
13681 typedef struct {
13682 char   name[4];
13683 WORD   type;
13684 WORD   data_size;
13685 } BANK;
13686 \endcode
13687 where type is a TID_xxx value and data_size the size of the bank in bytes.
13688 \code
13689 BANK *pbk;
13690 INT  size;
13691 void *pdata;
13692 char name[5];
13693 pbk = NULL;
13694 do
13695 {
13696  size = bk_iterate(event, &pbk, &pdata);
13697  if (pbk == NULL)
13698   break;
13699  *((DWORD *)name) = *((DWORD *)(pbk)->name);
13700  name[4] = 0;
13701  printf("bank %s found\n", name);
13702 } while(TRUE);
13703 \endcode
13704 @param event Pointer to data area of event.
13705 @param pbk pointer to the bank header, must be NULL for the first call to
13706 this function.
13707 @param pdata Pointer to the bank header, must be NULL for the first
13708 call to this function
13709 @return Size of bank in bytes
13710 */
13711 INT bk_iterate(void *event, BANK ** pbk, void *pdata)
13712 {
13713    if (*pbk == NULL)
13714       *pbk = (BANK *) (((BANK_HEADER *) event) + 1);
13715    else
13716       *pbk = (BANK *) ((char *) (*pbk + 1) + ALIGN8((*pbk)->data_size));
13717 
13718    *((void **) pdata) = (*pbk) + 1;
13719 
13720    if ((DWORD) ((char *) *pbk - (char *) event) >= ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size + sizeof(BANK_HEADER)) {
13721       *pbk = *((BANK **) pdata) = NULL;
13722       return 0;
13723    }
13724 
13725    return (*pbk)->data_size;
13726 }
13727 
13728 
13729 /**dox***************************************************************/
13730 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
13731 
13732 /********************************************************************/
13733 INT bk_iterate32(void *event, BANK32 ** pbk, void *pdata)
13734 /********************************************************************\
13735 
13736   Routine: bk_iterate
13737 
13738   Purpose: Iterate through 32 bit MIDAS banks inside an event
13739 
13740   Input:
13741     void   *event           pointer to the event
13742     BANK   **pbk32          must be NULL for the first call to bk_iterate
13743 
13744   Output:
13745     BANK   **pbk            pointer to the bank header
13746     void   *pdata           pointer to data area of the bank
13747 
13748   Function value:
13749     INT    size of the bank in bytes
13750 
13751 \********************************************************************/
13752 {
13753    if (*pbk == NULL)
13754       *pbk = (BANK32 *) (((BANK_HEADER *) event) + 1);
13755    else
13756       *pbk = (BANK32 *) ((char *) (*pbk + 1) + ALIGN8((*pbk)->data_size));
13757 
13758    *((void **) pdata) = (*pbk) + 1;
13759 
13760    if ((DWORD) ((char *) *pbk - (char *) event) >= ((BANK_HEADER *) event)->data_size + sizeof(BANK_HEADER)) {
13761       *pbk = *((BANK32 **) pdata) = NULL;
13762       return 0;
13763    }
13764 
13765    return (*pbk)->data_size;
13766 }
13767 
13768 /**dox***************************************************************/
13769 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
13770 
13771 /********************************************************************/
13772 /**
13773 Swaps bytes from little endian to big endian or vice versa for a whole event.
13774 
13775 An event contains a flag which is set by bk_init() to identify
13776 the endian format of an event. If force is FALSE, this flag is evaluated and
13777 the event is only swapped if it is in the "wrong" format for this system.
13778 An event can be swapped to the "wrong" format on purpose for example by a
13779 front-end which wants to produce events in a "right" format for a back-end
13780 analyzer which has different byte ordering.
13781 @param event pointer to data area of event
13782 @param force If TRUE, the event is always swapped, if FALSE, the event
13783 is only swapped if it is in the wrong format.
13784 @return 1==event has been swap, 0==event has not been swapped.
13785 */
13786 INT bk_swap(void *event, BOOL force)
13787 {
13788    BANK_HEADER *pbh;
13789    BANK *pbk;
13790    BANK32 *pbk32;
13791    void *pdata;
13792    WORD type;
13793    BOOL b32;
13794 
13795    pbh = (BANK_HEADER *) event;
13796 
13797    /* only swap if flags in high 16-bit */
13798    if (pbh->flags < 0x10000 && !force)
13799       return 0;
13800 
13801    /* swap bank header */
13802    DWORD_SWAP(&pbh->data_size);
13803    DWORD_SWAP(&pbh->flags);
13804 
13805    /* check for 32bit banks */
13806    b32 = ((pbh->flags & BANK_FORMAT_32BIT) > 0);
13807 
13808    pbk = (BANK *) (pbh + 1);
13809    pbk32 = (BANK32 *) pbk;
13810 
13811    /* scan event */
13812    while ((char *) pbk - (char *) pbh < (INT) pbh->data_size + (INT) sizeof(BANK_HEADER)) {
13813       /* swap bank header */
13814       if (b32) {
13815          DWORD_SWAP(&pbk32->type);
13816          DWORD_SWAP(&pbk32->data_size);
13817          pdata = pbk32 + 1;
13818          type = (WORD) pbk32->type;
13819       } else {
13820          WORD_SWAP(&pbk->type);
13821          WORD_SWAP(&pbk->data_size);
13822          pdata = pbk + 1;
13823          type = pbk->type;
13824       }
13825 
13826       /* pbk points to next bank */
13827       if (b32) {
13828          pbk32 = (BANK32 *) ((char *) (pbk32 + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk32->data_size));
13829          pbk = (BANK *) pbk32;
13830       } else {
13831          pbk = (BANK *) ((char *) (pbk + 1) + ALIGN8(pbk->data_size));
13832          pbk32 = (BANK32 *) pbk;
13833       }
13834 
13835       switch (type) {
13836       case TID_WORD:
13837       case TID_SHORT:
13838          while ((char *) pdata < (char *) pbk) {
13839             WORD_SWAP(pdata);
13840             pdata = (void *) (((WORD *) pdata) + 1);
13841          }
13842          break;
13843 
13844       case TID_DWORD:
13845       case TID_INT:
13846       case TID_BOOL:
13847       case TID_FLOAT:
13848          while ((char *) pdata < (char *) pbk) {
13849             DWORD_SWAP(pdata);
13850             pdata = (void *) (((DWORD *) pdata) + 1);
13851          }
13852          break;
13853 
13854       case TID_DOUBLE:
13855          while ((char *) pdata < (char *) pbk) {
13856             QWORD_SWAP(pdata);
13857             pdata = (void *) (((double *) pdata) + 1);
13858          }
13859          break;
13860       }
13861    }
13862 
13863    return CM_SUCCESS;
13864 }
13865 
13866 /**dox***************************************************************/
13867 
13868 /** @} *//* end of bkfunctionc */
13869 
13870 
13871 /**dox***************************************************************/
13872 /** @addtogroup rbfunctionc
13873  *
13874  *  @{  */
13875 
13876 /**dox***************************************************************/
13877 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
13878 /********************************************************************/
13879 
13880 /********************************************************************\
13881 *                                                                    *
13882 *                 Ring buffer functions                              *
13883 *                                                                    *
13884 * Provide an inter-thread buffer scheme for handling front-end       *
13885 * events. This code allows concurrent data acquisition, calibration  *
13886 * and network transfer on a multi-CPU machine. One thread reads      *
13887 * out the data, passes it vis the ring buffer functions              *
13888 * to another thread running on the other CPU, which can then         *
13889 * calibrate and/or send the data over the network.                   *
13890 *                                                                    *
13891 \********************************************************************/
13892 
13893 typedef struct {
13894    unsigned char *buffer;
13895    unsigned int size;
13896    unsigned int max_event_size;
13897    unsigned char *rp;
13898    unsigned char *wp;
13899    unsigned char *ep;
13900 } RING_BUFFER;
13901 
13902 #define MAX_RING_BUFFER 100
13903 
13904 RING_BUFFER rb[MAX_RING_BUFFER];
13905 
13906 volatile int _rb_nonblocking = 0;
13907 
13908 /**dox***************************************************************/
13909 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
13910 
13911 /********************************************************************/
13912 /**
13913 Set all rb_get_xx to nonblocking. Needed in multi-thread
13914 environments for stopping all theads without deadlock
13915 @return DB_SUCCESS
13916 */
13917 int rb_set_nonblocking()
13918 /********************************************************************\
13919 
13920   Routine: rb_set_nonblocking
13921 
13922   Purpose: Set all rb_get_xx to nonblocking. Needed in multi-thread
13923            environments for stopping all theads without deadlock
13924 
13925   Input:
13926     NONE
13927 
13928   Output:
13929     NONE
13930 
13931   Function value:
13932     DB_SUCCESS       Successful completion
13933 
13934 \********************************************************************/
13935 {
13936    _rb_nonblocking = 1;
13937 
13938    return DB_SUCCESS;
13939 }
13940 
13941 /********************************************************************/
13942 /**
13943 Create a ring buffer with a given size
13944 
13945 Provide an inter-thread buffer scheme for handling front-end
13946 events. This code allows concurrent data acquisition, calibration
13947 and network transfer on a multi-CPU machine. One thread reads
13948 out the data, passes it via the ring buffer functions
13949 to another thread running on the other CPU, which can then
13950 calibrate and/or send the data over the network.
13951 
13952 @param size             Size of ring buffer, must be larger than
13953                          2*max_event_size
13954 @param max_event_size   Maximum event size to be placed into
13955 @param *handle          Handle to ring buffer
13956 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_NO_MEMORY, DB_INVALID_PARAM
13957 */
13958 int rb_create(int size, int max_event_size, int *handle)
13959 /********************************************************************\
13960 
13961   Routine: rb_create
13962 
13963   Purpose: Create a ring buffer with a given size
13964 
13965   Input:
13966     int size             Size of ring buffer, must be larger than
13967                          2*max_event_size
13968     int max_event_size   Maximum event size to be placed into
13969                          ring buffer
13970   Output:
13971     int *handle          Handle to ring buffer
13972 
13973   Function value:
13974     DB_SUCCESS           Successful completion
13975     DB_NO_MEMORY         Maximum number of ring buffers exceeded
13976     DB_INVALID_PARAM     Invalid event size specified
13977 
13978 \********************************************************************/
13979 {
13980    int i;
13981 
13982    for (i = 0; i < MAX_RING_BUFFER; i++)
13983       if (rb[i].buffer == NULL)
13984          break;
13985 
13986    if (i == MAX_RING_BUFFER)
13987       return DB_NO_MEMORY;
13988 
13989    if (size < max_event_size * 2)
13990       return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
13991 
13992    memset(&rb[i], 0, sizeof(RING_BUFFER));
13993    rb[i].buffer = (unsigned char *) M_MALLOC(size);
13994    assert(rb[i].buffer);
13995    rb[i].size = size;
13996    rb[i].max_event_size = max_event_size;
13997    rb[i].rp = rb[i].buffer;
13998    rb[i].wp = rb[i].buffer;
13999    rb[i].ep = rb[i].buffer;
14000 
14001    *handle = i + 1;
14002 
14003    return DB_SUCCESS;
14004 }
14005 
14006 /********************************************************************/
14007 /**
14008 Delete a ring buffer
14009 @param handle  Handle of the ring buffer
14010 @return  DB_SUCCESS
14011 */
14012 int rb_delete(int handle)
14013 /********************************************************************\
14014 
14015   Routine: rb_delete
14016 
14017   Purpose: Delete a ring buffer
14018 
14019   Input:
14020     none
14021   Output:
14022     int handle       Handle to ring buffer
14023 
14024   Function value:
14025     DB_SUCCESS       Successful completion
14026 
14027 \********************************************************************/
14028 {
14029    if (handle < 0 || handle >= MAX_RING_BUFFER || rb[handle - 1].buffer == NULL)
14030       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
14031 
14032    M_FREE(rb[handle - 1].buffer);
14033    memset(&rb[handle - 1], 0, sizeof(RING_BUFFER));
14034 
14035    return DB_SUCCESS;
14036 }
14037 
14038 /********************************************************************/
14039 /**
14040 Retrieve write pointer where new data can be written
14041 @param handle               Ring buffer handle
14042 @param millisec             Optional timeout in milliseconds if
14043                               buffer is full. Zero to not wait at
14044                               all (non-blocking)
14045 @param  **p                  Write pointer
14046 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_TIMEOUT, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
14047 */
14048 int rb_get_wp(int handle, void **p, int millisec)
14049 /********************************************************************\
14050 
14051 Routine: rb_get_wp
14052 
14053   Purpose: Retrieve write pointer where new data can be written
14054 
14055   Input:
14056      int handle               Ring buffer handle
14057      int millisec             Optional timeout in milliseconds if
14058                               buffer is full. Zero to not wait at
14059                               all (non-blocking)
14060 
14061   Output:
14062     char **p                  Write pointer
14063 
14064   Function value:
14065     DB_SUCCESS       Successful completion
14066 
14067 \********************************************************************/
14068 {
14069    int h, i;
14070    unsigned char *rp;
14071 
14072    if (handle < 1 || handle > MAX_RING_BUFFER || rb[handle - 1].buffer == NULL)
14073       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
14074 
14075    h = handle - 1;
14076 
14077    for (i = 0; i <= millisec / 10; i++) {
14078 
14079       rp = rb[h].rp;            // keep local copy, rb[h].rp might be changed by other thread
14080 
14081       /* check if enough size for wp >= rp without wrap-around */
14082       if (rb[h].wp >= rp
14083           && rb[h].wp + rb[h].max_event_size <= rb[h].buffer + rb[h].size - rb[h].max_event_size) {
14084          *p = rb[h].wp;
14085          return DB_SUCCESS;
14086       }
14087 
14088       /* check if enough size for wp >= rp with wrap-around */
14089       if (rb[h].wp >= rp && rb[h].wp + rb[h].max_event_size > rb[h].buffer + rb[h].size - rb[h].max_event_size && rb[h].rp > rb[h].buffer) {    // next increment of wp wraps around, so need space at beginning
14090          *p = rb[h].wp;
14091          return DB_SUCCESS;
14092       }
14093 
14094       /* check if enough size for wp < rp */
14095       if (rb[h].wp < rp && rb[h].wp + rb[h].max_event_size < rp) {
14096          *p = rb[h].wp;
14097          return DB_SUCCESS;
14098       }
14099 
14100       if (millisec == 0)
14101          return DB_TIMEOUT;
14102 
14103       if (_rb_nonblocking)
14104          return DB_TIMEOUT;
14105 
14106       /* wait one time slice */
14107       ss_sleep(10);
14108    }
14109 
14110    return DB_TIMEOUT;
14111 }
14112 
14113 /********************************************************************/
14114 /** rb_increment_wp
14115 
14116 Increment current write pointer, making the data at
14117 the write pointer available to the receiving thread
14118 @param handle               Ring buffer handle
14119 @param size                 Number of bytes placed at the WP
14120 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_PARAM, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
14121 */
14122 int rb_increment_wp(int handle, int size)
14123 /********************************************************************\
14124 
14125   Routine: rb_increment_wp
14126 
14127   Purpose: Increment current write pointer, making the data at
14128            the write pointer available to the receiving thread
14129 
14130   Input:
14131      int handle               Ring buffer handle
14132      int size                 Number of bytes placed at the WP
14133 
14134   Output:
14135     NONE
14136 
14137   Function value:
14138     DB_SUCCESS                Successful completion
14139     DB_INVALID_PARAM          Event size too large or invalid handle
14140 \********************************************************************/
14141 {
14142    int h;
14143    unsigned char *old_wp, *new_wp;
14144 
14145    if (handle < 1 || handle > MAX_RING_BUFFER || rb[handle - 1].buffer == NULL)
14146       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
14147 
14148    h = handle - 1;
14149 
14150    if ((DWORD) size > rb[h].max_event_size)
14151       return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
14152 
14153    old_wp = rb[h].wp;
14154    new_wp = rb[h].wp + size;
14155 
14156    /* wrap around wp if not enough space */
14157    if (new_wp > rb[h].buffer + rb[h].size - rb[h].max_event_size) {
14158       rb[h].ep = new_wp;
14159       new_wp = rb[h].buffer;
14160       assert(rb[h].rp != rb[h].buffer);
14161    }
14162 
14163    rb[h].wp = new_wp;
14164 
14165    return DB_SUCCESS;
14166 }
14167 
14168 /********************************************************************/
14169 /**
14170 Obtain the current read pointer at which new data is
14171 available with optional timeout
14172 
14173 @param  handle               Ring buffer handle
14174 @param  millisec             Optional timeout in milliseconds if
14175                              buffer is full. Zero to not wait at
14176                              all (non-blocking)
14177 
14178 @param **p                 Address of pointer pointing to newly
14179                              available data. If p == NULL, only
14180                              return status.
14181 @return  DB_SUCCESS, DB_TIEMOUT, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
14182 
14183 */
14184 int rb_get_rp(int handle, void **p, int millisec)
14185 /********************************************************************\
14186 
14187   Routine: rb_get_rp
14188 
14189   Purpose: Obtain the current read pointer at which new data is
14190            available with optional timeout
14191 
14192   Input:
14193     int handle               Ring buffer handle
14194     int millisec             Optional timeout in milliseconds if
14195                              buffer is full. Zero to not wait at
14196                              all (non-blocking)
14197 
14198   Output:
14199     char **p                 Address of pointer pointing to newly
14200                              available data. If p == NULL, only
14201                              return status.
14202 
14203   Function value:
14204     DB_SUCCESS       Successful completion
14205 
14206 \********************************************************************/
14207 {
14208    int i, h;
14209 
14210    if (handle < 1 || handle > MAX_RING_BUFFER || rb[handle - 1].buffer == NULL)
14211       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
14212 
14213    h = handle - 1;
14214 
14215    for (i = 0; i <= millisec / 10; i++) {
14216 
14217       if (rb[h].wp != rb[h].rp) {
14218          if (p != NULL)
14219             *p = rb[handle - 1].rp;
14220          return DB_SUCCESS;
14221       }
14222 
14223       if (millisec == 0)
14224          return DB_TIMEOUT;
14225 
14226       if (_rb_nonblocking)
14227          return DB_TIMEOUT;
14228 
14229       /* wait one time slice */
14230       ss_sleep(10);
14231    }
14232 
14233    return DB_TIMEOUT;
14234 }
14235 
14236 /********************************************************************/
14237 /**
14238 Increment current read pointer, freeing up space for the writing thread.
14239 
14240 @param handle               Ring buffer handle
14241 @param size                 Number of bytes to free up at current
14242                               read pointer
14243 @return  DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_PARAM
14244 
14245 */
14246 int rb_increment_rp(int handle, int size)
14247 /********************************************************************\
14248 
14249   Routine: rb_increment_rp
14250 
14251   Purpose: Increment current read pointer, freeing up space for
14252            the writing thread.
14253 
14254   Input:
14255      int handle               Ring buffer handle
14256      int size                 Number of bytes to free up at current
14257                               read pointer
14258 
14259   Output:
14260     NONE
14261 
14262   Function value:
14263     DB_SUCCESS                Successful completion
14264     DB_INVALID_PARAM          Event size too large or invalid handle
14265 
14266 \********************************************************************/
14267 {
14268    int h;
14269 
14270    unsigned char *new_rp, *old_rp;
14271 
14272    if (handle < 1 || handle > MAX_RING_BUFFER || rb[handle - 1].buffer == NULL)
14273       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
14274 
14275    h = handle - 1;
14276 
14277    if ((DWORD) size > rb[h].max_event_size)
14278       return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
14279 
14280    old_rp = rb[h].rp;
14281    new_rp = rb[h].rp + size;
14282 
14283    /* wrap around if not enough space left */
14284    if (new_rp + rb[h].max_event_size > rb[h].buffer + rb[h].size)
14285       new_rp = rb[h].buffer;
14286 
14287    rb[handle - 1].rp = new_rp;
14288 
14289    return DB_SUCCESS;
14290 }
14291 
14292 /********************************************************************/
14293 /**
14294 Return number of bytes in a ring buffer
14295 
14296 @param handle              Handle of the buffer to get the info
14297 @param *n_bytes            Number of bytes in buffer
14298 @return DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE
14299 */
14300 int rb_get_buffer_level(int handle, int *n_bytes)
14301 /********************************************************************\
14302 
14303   Routine: rb_get_buffer_level
14304 
14305   Purpose: Return number of bytes in a ring buffer
14306 
14307   Input:
14308     int handle              Handle of the buffer to get the info
14309 
14310   Output:
14311     int *n_bytes            Number of bytes in buffer
14312 
14313   Function value:
14314     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
14315     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Buffer handle is invalid
14316 
14317 \********************************************************************/
14318 {
14319    int h;
14320 
14321    if (handle < 1 || handle > MAX_RING_BUFFER || rb[handle - 1].buffer == NULL)
14322       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
14323 
14324    h = handle - 1;
14325 
14326    if (rb[h].wp >= rb[h].rp)
14327       *n_bytes = (POINTER_T) rb[h].wp - (POINTER_T) rb[h].rp;
14328    else
14329       *n_bytes =
14330           (POINTER_T) rb[h].ep - (POINTER_T) rb[h].rp + (POINTER_T) rb[h].wp - (POINTER_T) rb[h].buffer;
14331 
14332    return DB_SUCCESS;
14333 }
14334 
14335 /**dox***************************************************************/
14336                   /** @} *//* end of rbfunctionc */
14337 
14338 /**dox***************************************************************/
14339                   /** @} *//* end of midasincludecode */
